bvp-CP5K5wS5WS-kHx2OaA.text: I had been wanting to try this place for some time, after reading a magazine article on it. When I arrived, there was a line, but it moved pretty quickly.  I ordered the Fairfax sandwich, with added bacon. Boy was it delicious! The eggs were perfectly done, and the Sriracha aoli was on point! I also had one of their famous chocolate chunk cookies with grey salt. Talk about amazing! I would highly recommend this place. One side note - seating is limited. Luckily for me, a table opened up, just after I ordered.

NJwnZ6ZV-gWXQwVt5Tewgg.text: Offers a creamy sous vide breakfast in jar deconstructed egg sandwich. Inventive and fun! Also much more affordable than the $$$ buffets in the hotels nearby.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg sandwich with Spicy mayo, gentle cooked eggs, fluffy bun.
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saus vide egg in a jar on top of a potato purée. You dip the toast in the jar and it coats it with egg and potato.

q9JAEk2g7-RtZmOZEI9Iog.text: Let me start off by saying that the food here is EXCELLENT! My girlfriend and I came here and we both got their most popular sandwich which is the Fairfax(eggs,chives, onions,cheddar cheese and Siracha Mayo) I added sausage to mine and my girlfriend added Avocado to hers. Both sandwiches were really good BUT our total for both sandwiches and two 8 ounce OJ came out to $34 and some change. That's really pricey for what you're getting. Overrated! Do your self a favor and go to "The egg and I" where you can sit down, have a great meal, take your time and your bill will be $10 less than here.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax (add Turkey Sausage)

JZdOSL9lz4Iur6g3HDM1_w.text: By far my favorite breakfast in Vegas. Try the Gaucho sandwich... steak, egg... wow! Had one this morning

HcPCQvAmLsFhc_Fg-uuHGw.text: I would have loved to tried this place.  Unfortunately, the line was always long and always extremely slow.  For having a very limited menu, why are your workers so slow.  I stood there watching just the workers and they were just taking their sweet time.    When the line gets long, they should have a person taking orders in the line so that the cooking staff can make orders in bulk.  Your making eggs only 3 ways, scrambled, poached, and over medium.   Look a chipotle and five guys (Virginia firm), the lines are long there too but it moves.  I get they have a captive audience but no egg sandwich is worth waiting 45+ mins for.  Very disappointed.

8aJpJ_7oz1iJ3Xk21FaJrA.text: Very disappointed.  I got the Gaucho sandwich.  It was mostly arugula.  The tri tip was cold and flavorless.  The egg did absolutely nothing for the sandwich.  The biscuit was dry and cold.  Do yourself favor and never eat at eggslut.

QgoKm3zCRUK_Gj7dJvZnWA.text: This place was recommended by a Las Vegas regular and it was Fantastic! Great price for a delicious and flavorful breakfast sandwich in a fancy hotel and casino.   I got the bacon, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich and the chipotle ketchup gave it that extra kick that separates it from your everyday breakfast sandwich.   If you can get over the ridiculously long line (waited almost 40 minutes to order and another 10-15mins for my order) it's worth it.  Not a lot of seating because it more of a carry-out style place and the line is in the hallway next to the ordering counter and was rather hot for some reason, making it a less than an enjoyable wait.   I only gave it 4 starts because of the wait time but it is extremely popular so to be expected. Can't wait to return to Eggslut my next visit to Vegas!

_RXS7THnYa5XHYLcfM4GOw.text: The line is super long so get ready to wait. The menu is very millennial people oriented. BOMB ^___^ I treied the slut (was expecting bigger portions which disappointed me but the bread is really fresh and flavorful and super creative to add the mashed potatoes in to dip the  bread in )

iGdGP-VJp6eJu0elyhFpWQ.text: The line was long but if you can go early with their crazy hours it's worth the wait. Got a biscuit and a slut and they were delicious

1-JmFGMDEdENxj1uO1dJqw.text: When you arrive you will notice a waiting line that goes down a hallway. Do not turn away, it moves fast. The food was very good. You will not be disappointed.

1rJ0BG87Kdl5sxsVD8qAdQ.text: Ok so I wasn't expecting the most delicious egg ever but... THATS EXACTLY WHAT I GOT.  A little pricey, but the "Slut" special is so delicious and unique. I didn't know you could transform an egg so much. Simple, fast, easy, and not too bad for you. Highly recommend especially if you're staying at the Cosmo

2nCdX7kT5lpV77il4FBKmQ.text: Very, very delicious breakfast foods and a variety of options. Some reviewers have cited the lines, but I'm not going to deduct stars for the lines, that is indicative of a good product for me.   We went twice and the first time they were out of the signature dish, the Slut. We both got breakfast sandwiches (Fairfax and Sausage Egg & Cheese) and both were out of this world delicious.  All sandwiches made with brioche buns which are critical to flavor delivery and summarily fantastic.  On second visit, wait was longer, 45 minutes until order, but we lucked out and got Sluts! (It's hit or miss on the sluts, they are cooked sous vide and apparently become available in batches)  The Slut however was worthy of the flagship dish and delivered and made the wait worthwhile.    Also worth trying is the house made biscuit, we also got a side salad on second visit. Both tasty side dishes.  This place is great and worth the wait.

foRxXU8kWJuPfQpaA3VYsA.text: Right in the cosmopolitan, this eggslut is open morning to night.  Don't get me wrong, this place is busy morning to night.   The menu is simple, basically an assortment of egg sandwiches with a brioche bun and some other options.   The egg sandwiches are always great, this time I opted for the egg salad sandwich, which was very filling. The brioche bun and sauce they add is what makes these egg sandwiches bomb.   Another must try dish is the slut. It is a mushed up potato and poached egg sauce in a bottle. You use toast to dip it in this awesome sauce!   The lines are super long so either come early or come at an off time!

fKFMwdYul1PZz20BNfxIvQ.text: I will admit Eggslut pulled me in with the name. Luckily the name was not the only good things about the experience. My husband and I went on a Sunday morning and the line was long. It took about an hour to get to the counter. But we went and got snacks at Momofuku Milk Bar so it was all good.  We ordered a slut and the bacon egg sandwich. The sandwich was good - bacon was ample, bread was soft. But the real star of the show was the slut. So simple yet so good. A coddled egg over mashed potatoes with chives, served with a side of bread.  It was salty, soft delicious awesomeness. The bread could have used more butter but the egg was so good that it kinda didn't matter. My new mission in life is to figure out how to recreate this dish at home since there is no Eggslut in Phoenix.   Get in line. Get a slut. Get happy.

mrep4LIc7SiCVxyrwVG9Vg.text: Oh wow.. I got the bacon egg and cheese ! The sauce makes the entire sandwich. Don't let the line fool you , it moves super fast! Wish we had one out in CA. Dying for one again! Super yummy

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i6N_HaGl70nN6inK9Ns4vw.text: Ridiculously long lines even early in the morning, but worth the wait. His favorite spot out of Los Angeles has an equally large cult following in Vegas. It's a fairly limited menu but as long as you're there for eggs you'll find something you enjoy. We did have one small issue with a special request to leave sauce off of a sandwich being messed up. But the kitchen was quick to resolve the issue and give us a new sandwich as ordered. My favorite item is a soft scrambled sandwich with the addition of bacon. Note it was about an hour overall on a weekday around 9 AM to get food.

R5FVSopqUGnwGVvyuQ-rkA.text: Not a sit down restaurant. Line is usually wrapped around the place but it goes quick. Prepare to wait a little bit. There is open seating all around. Not the friendliest cashier but who cares. I got the sausage, egg, & cheese sandwich. Turkey sausage with medium egg and cheddar cheese on a brioche bun with honey mustard aioli sauce. It was sooooo good.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bmauDmW-Sg8dRqeIJQ6Dzg.text: The Fairfax with turkey sausage is the best egg sandwich I've ever had. The wait is worth it (and I rarely say that) and getting The Slut is a must.

aLRq0LVS15CazwjMpxXVZw.text: Best breakfast E V E R. Bacon, egg, & cheese scrambled with avocado & fresh orange juice. The line was outrageously long, but only took 20 minutes!

ecwlNPQ073FY2HSQS0N4mw.text: This place gets a solid 3 stars from me, maybe even 3.5.  Marketing is key - so I think this place gets a good portion of it's hype from having 'slut' in the name. People line up to eat here, and maybe because the menu prices are low for breakfast on The Strip.  I had the bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich with a scrambled egg. The bacon was delicious, the soft scrambled eggs were definitely cooked soft, and the cheese was good. The chipotle ketchup they put on there is just OK - it tastes out of place on that sandwich. The bun is also a bit much - I'd prefer it on something else. However, I would eat this sandwich again.  My wife got the signature item, the Slut. It's essentially a poached egg on top of "potato puree" that's sou-vided in a baby food jar with a few chives sprinkled on top. I saw them running the sou-vide cookers at 142, so, there's the big secret. It's served with some toast, and I guess the way to eat it is to smear some of the egg/potato concoction on top of the toast and chow down. Runny eggs aren't my thing, but for $10.50, this seemed way overhyped and way overpriced.  We also got a biscuit, cold brew coffee and a coke, each of these items were $5. All of this was $41 after a 15% tip. The biscuit was good, but not $5 good.   I am glad I came here as I've been recommended here, but I'd come back and just get a sandwich - the other items are well overpriced. I also wouldn't wait more than 10 minutes or so in line.

4fvIniGbQ8IQiewyh7V_DQ.text: Eggslut oh how I love you so! The line may seem intimidating but it is always worth the wait! We got there ten minutes before opening and only had to wait 30isb minutes. The bacon, egg, and cheese is delicious! My favorite breakfast in Vegas!

GDIaT6Y7Zssqz2tYqaNruQ.text: As with all things trendy in Vegas, it's pricey, but tasty & just thing for rehabilitating a hangover.   Vegetarian options (no vegan) with beer, coffee, juice, and coffee.   It'll cure what ails you & set you back about $20 per person.

0RRWJEG1wa50WjxbQpEMmA.text: Awesome breakfast food, insane line. The line was at least 30-45min the first time I tired to go. Would recommend going early or late to get some delicious breakfast food without waiting a ton of time.  I got the bacon sandwich. Was phenomenal. Lots of meat, plenty of eggs, tons of flavor. These are snacks, not full meals (or maybe I just eat too much). I'd recommend getting a sandwich here and 1-2 sides to really fill up. You won't regret getting something here, though- great for a snack before going out!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j6akKeCGYmjAgrrzHNWMSw.text: We came on a weekday around 11am and there was maybe 5 people in line. Around 11:30 the line was about 30 deep. There are more seats/tables than I thought, most people seem to eat and leave to keep the flow.  We got a bunch of different sandwiches, I must say it does taste better after each bite. The first bite was meh, and then it was really really good especially with the bacon. If you're near the hotel, I would swing by if you can. Definitely good food!

MyesGvcApC0-s5jL20u9uQ.text: A lot of hype in my opinion. Waited in line 30 minutes and was super excited to try the gaucho sandwich. Unfortunately it lacked in flavor and the tri tip was tough. It was just "ok". For $16 I think you should save your money and time. Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing, but I don't think I will be giving this place a second chance anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gaucho = meh just &#34;ok&#34;

VkIlaSFmDCPqK-hByQHY0Q.text: Located on the second floor of The Cosmopolitan, across from Marquee Nightclub, Eggslut apparently always has a wait during its operating hours. We arrived within five minutes of its opening time, and the line was already wrapped around the hallway. The line does move fast and we were in line for 20-30 minutes. Since we were staying at the Cosmo and on vacation, we really didn't mind the wait as it's only an elevator ride away. (I'd presume if I were staying at another hotel or a Vegas local, the inconvenience may make Eggslut less desirable). This is our first visit and since we weren't planning to come back to Vegas any time soon, the two of us ordered a variety to try out its menu. We ordered the Gaucho (Wagyu tri-tip with over medium egg), Fairfax (scrambled with caramelized onions), Sausage Egg and Cheese added extra bacon (self-explanatory), the Slut (poached egg sitting atop a potato puree), a cookie and orange juice.   The tri-tip wagyu steak on the gaucho was tasty, but an egg-centered sandwich is more suited at Eggslut. I would probably pass in the future especially given its price point.  The Fairfax was the most flavorful and my favorite by far (coming from someone who feels uneasy without meat in a sandwich and hate onions). I would definitely order this again on our next visit.  The sausage egg and cheese was fine, but didn't stand out in any way.   The Slut had a creamy and unique texture (that's what HE said), perfectly blending the poached egg and potato puree with each bite.  The cookie greatly balanced sweet and savory as the sea salt sprinkled over the chocolate chip cookie really brings out another dimension to the flavor profile.  Orange juice is orange juice. No matter how exquisite they make it sound, it's probably not worth $4-5 a cup.  Overall, the line moved fast, food was fantastic, and we enjoyed our meal on the balcony of our hotel room - a very relaxing and delicious start to our morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qwq7VVDo7KVH2YunW5Kh4A.text: There was already a big line at 8:30 but we were able to get to the front to order in less than five minutes! The cashier was very kind and our food came out right away. I had the Fairfax sandwich and it's one of the best breakfast sandwiches and by far the best egg and cheese sandwich I've ever consumed. I will definitely be coming back to try more of their options!

SsG00ht9AIFaS_G4eeh97Q.text: I understand your skepticism. I too was skeptical, because ultimately, there are only so many ways to put egg on bread. The bacon egg and cheese was kind of along those expected lines. Fried egg on a spectacular bioche with piles of perfectly crispy bacon and some spicy ketchup stuff: Among the best BEC I have ever had, but still just an egg sandwich.   However, the Fairfax is the one that changed my life forever. I am a different person than I was before that sandwich and I can never go back! It's the most masterfully scrambled egg I have ever experienced and far beyond what I could imagine. It was like air. Or silk. Airy silk? Creamy airy silk. With amazon seasoning and herbs and chives and chipotle aoili or something, and all on that baller brioche. A truly mind blowing eggsperience and worth the 20 minute wait in line!  PS: that fresh orange juice is no joke, you've already waited for infinity to experience peak breakfast perfection, so spring the extra five bucks to wash it down with straight luxury.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FQgYfpZZ1hp6DT_aUlWbQA.text: The line moved fairly quickly and the food is cheap for Vegas. I was disappointed the signature Eggslut dish was going to be a 45 minute wait, so I just got an egg sandwich instead. It was a good egg sandwich, but nothing above the ordinary. The bread was better than what I use at home, but that's about it

vEdktiumPjnwNYLxrR_w6w.text: I wish I could have more sluts in my life... that potato puree topped off with egg and chives . I waited maybe 25 minutes in line.. But I have no regrets for waiting. Once I ordered, I got my food within 10 minutes. It was so fast compared to the amount of people there. They have a small menu.  We had the biscuit, slut, the fairfax, and the gaucho. Every single bite I had here was delicious. I also ordered the cold brew and it was awesome!  I wish I could have this everyday.. can't wait for my next trip to Vegas just to come back here!

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Gaucho

mPWsMxOGQ-6LlY7Edl54Bg.text: New location - still the same yummy goodness. I really love their egg salad sandwich and my husband favors the Fairfax. This location still has the really long line like the downtown LA original. I thought 8 am on a Saturday would be dead in Vegas but I was way wrong.... usually 20-30min wait at least.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg salad sandwich

Fzt41hMwi2G0OCJDLKY2bw.text: I'm a huge fan of eggs and breakfast so this is my kind of place.  I got there around 7:30am and it was quite busy already. They have a super limited but well detailed menu, which I always appreciate. Ended up getting a bacon sandwich, sausage sandwich and the famous speciality "the slut". The thing about breakfast sandwiches, usually either the meat or the bun isn't warm but everything was all warm and super tasty and juicy! You could really tell they use good quality homemade ingredients. The "slut", oh my goodness. The combination of the smooth potato puree and the perfectly coddled egg smeared over slices of baguette.. It was heavenly! Eggslut is easily one of the best breakfasts I've ever had! Can't wait to stop by again!   : 1. SAUSAGE, EGG & CHEESE: house-made turkey sausage, cage-free over medium egg, cheddar cheese and honey mustard aioli in a warm brioche bun  2. BACON, EGG & CHEESE: hardwood smoked bacon, cage-free over medium egg, cheddar cheese and chipotle ketchup in a warm brioche bun  3. SLUT: cage-free coddled egg on top of a smooth potato puree, poached in a glass jar, topped with gray salt and chives, served with slices of baguette

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. www.instagram.com/foodieappetite The &#34;Sausage, Egg and Cheese Sandwich&#34;, The &#34;Bacon, Egg and Cheese Sandwich&#34; &amp; The &#34;Slut&#34;.

Bgenb-MiQQG-yZxC_muDXA.text: The food was good but I wasn't very impressed with the 2 breakfast sandwiches we ordered. Staff is very nice and attentive even late at night. I would like to try some more things on the menu. I did like that everything is cooked perfectly, eggs were soft scrambled and delicious on mine. But I wouldn't go out of my way to come back. I'll have to try again next time I pass through.

CW6tyTf_xLIKfFihvSu6nA.text: This is the breakfast spot all the cool kids are talking about so I had to check it out.  It's definitely popular. I stopped by just after 11:00 am on a Saturday morning and a line snaked around the corner and down a connecting a hallway. After about 45 minutes I found myself at the cash register placing my order.  I went with a bacon, egg and cheese sandwich and a Coke, which ended up being about $11. The sandwich was good, but I wouldn't say it knocked my socks off and I don't think it lived up to the hype.   Just FYI, seating is quite limited. During peak times, which is when I visited, you might not be able to find a table or a place to sit. I ended up walking down the hall a bit until I found a lobby with a table and chairs so I could sit and eat my meal.  In closing, I did enjoy my breakfast, but I don't think I'll stand in line for 45 minutes to not be able to find a place to sit again.  Enjoy at your own risk.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XZpv43LLAjAEVy3KTyELWQ.text: Egg slug is sincerely worth the wait in the incredibly long line in the GCM location, I will wait in it time and time again especially if I'm traveling with people who have never been. I love the bacon egg sandwich, the egg and sausage sandwich, my best friend who is a vegetarian RAVES about the Fairfax whixh is the scrambled egg and cheese sandwich, and the sluts are the best part! Absolutely get one to share if it's your first time. There's nothing better than a soft coddled egg beneath potato puree & pink Himalayan sea salt with chives, seriously, I dream about them! A superb hangover cure, or good for any old day!

201_D44aiPJORgXe3jvWAQ.text: We love it.  Especially in the mornings when all the people out all night come waltzing in for food.  Can be very entertaining.  The food is good.  The staff is great and service is quick.  And how can you wrong with a place named Eggslut.

aru-R-U_8SVo_oYVZFzOJw.text: The wait isn't really that bad even if the line looks intimidating. They've got their process down pact, so your food comes out super fast and fresh. We ordered the bacon egg and cheese, the fairfax, and the slut. The bacon egg and cheese wasn't bad but it's also not super memorable. Hands down, get the fairfax and the slut.

U6wlxeKnxs5FM0MyTO8YGg.text: I ordered the slut which is a mashed potatoes puree topped with pan over easy egg.  You mix them together and either eat it or dip the toasted baguette slices that are provided.  Overall very good, interesting play on words..etc.  They should have a dirty slut, which is the same as above but with bacon or sausage bits included.  A bit pricey for the serving size,  though very well executed.

pWndUT_rnV9OsLGIuT98hA.text: I've taken my friends on multiple occasions to Eggslut and have only received positive responses about the food. I love the variety in the different egg sandwiches they serve here! The only downfall is that everyone else seems to know this place is a hit as well because the lines are typically pretty long but I've never had to wait more than 20 minutes from standing in line to receiving my food so it goes by fairly quick. The wait is completely worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage egg sandwich

8dGIMlbWC3_Va071kzILbA.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE  You have to try the "Slut". One of the most delicious, different, well textured things I have ever had the pleasure of eating. I have had or at least tried everything on the menu and it's all phenomenal. I am all about food splurges and this is a "treat yourself" situation. Fresh orange juice goes well will the meal. I hoped this location would taste the exact same as the O.G. location in Downtown LA (or others in SoCal) and it does.   Again...  LOVE LOVE LOVE  Tip: Take someone that conversation effortless, because they do get a line (like all locations). Goes fast if you're entertained. Goes slow if you are drunk or hungover.

ab2W2wfx6wQg-pqnsMHugA.text: Wah!  Wah!  Wah!  I have heard such amazing things about the Eggslut in LA & when I heard there was one in Vegas, I was like "I must go!"  But...  it was meh, average.  Located in The Cosmopolitan, near Marquee.  The line was long & we waited about 30 minutes on a Friday afternoon.  Not too many places to dine but their food is quick to eat that seats opened up quickly.  Bacon, Egg, & Cheese:  Okay.  I did enjoy that the bacon was extra crispy.  Served on a brioche bun.  The differences between this & the Sausage, besides the meat, are the sauces which were okay too. Sausage, Egg, & Cheese:  Okay. Buttermilk Biscuit:  I did enjoy this!  Fluffy, moist, buttery.

VasK8862nuPEKP4A4y9AuQ.text: Awesome! I kept having the Sausage, Egg, and Cheese sandwich because it was so good! Perfectly cooked and full of flavor.

Cay0_139TFwqd1U8x0WRzg.text: Yes, there's a long line, and yes, it's worth it! Don't worry - the line moves fast.  I'd been on a past trip and made a point to go again. Their namesake item - the Eggslut - is truly delicious. Obviously, eggs and potatoes go well together, but a coddled egg with super rich mashed potatoes? Genius combo.  I went twice this trip to expand my horizons, although I almost got Eggsluts both times. The second time I tried the Fairfax sandwich, and that was fantastic as well.  Just go...

i1t_q2aj8XPVroOrgTyIUg.text: What an egg-citing spot to get egg-cellent breakfast sandwiches! Ok I'll stop with the puns. This eatery located on the second floor of the Cosmo is a perfect addition to the casino's collection of hip and trendy places to nosh. They open really late at night and close up in the afternoon. My friends and I ate here twice on our last visit to Vegas. The first was a late night stop to try the Slut, which is like a poached egg on top of pureed potato in a glass jar. You mix it up and put the resulting spread on slices of toasted baguette. It is heavenly.   On our next visit, which was Sunday morning - the line was hella long. We probably waited in line to order for thirty minutes and then another 15 or so to get our food. I ordered the Fairfax sandwich, which is perfectly cooked scrambled egg and caramelized onions and cheddar cheese with sriracha mayo on a brioche bun. You can add a turkey sausage or avocado for an eggs-tra charge (sorry! Couldn't help it!) I added an avocado. The sandwich was so delicious!!! My friend ordered the egg salad sandwich and that was also super yummy! You can't go wrong with the choices here. They are eggs-perts at what they do (last pun, I promise!). I can't wait to come back to eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax with avocado, fairfax, egg salad sandwich, and the slut
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fairfax

KuL_mm5WWo-pNl-iY23sBQ.text: Probably one of the better breakfast sandwiches I've ever had. The items are affordable as long as you don't order drinks. A paper cup of coffee (maybe 10 oz?) Is $4.50.

mJ8surPcd_XrWyS6areXJA.text: The food was tasty. Everything was very expensive. I did not get the small coffee because it was $5, but that's just Vegas!  The menu was small but we got the egg sandwich that was yummy but too much bread and not enough filling. We also got the namesake menu item, the "Eggslut" which i thought was going to be something grand and amazing, but was just a cup of mashed potatoes with a poached egg on top. The food tasted good, I was just expecting something overwhelmingly creative and delicious because of all of the things I've heard about it, and due to the price and it being in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

35IUIw9MrYRDMsSisXW_KQ.text: Great place for breakfast. We went on a Saturday morning around 8:45 AM. and there was a line around the corner down the hallway. Around 20 people waiting to get served. Took us about 20 minutes to get the counter which wasn't bad. They take your order quickly and the production staff are busy and they really know how to get the food out to you fast. There is counter seating and plenty of seats out in the mall area. Turnover is quick and you should find a place to sit down somewhere. Food was excellent, hot and delicious. It's not overly priced for Las Vegas and close to the Aria and actually it's in the Cosmopolitan Hotel. A go to place in Las Vegas.

OpYqN_YJYIGMbGawCwsEzA.text: The hype for Eggslut is well well deserved. I will admit that I used to get super annoyed when I would see my IG feed filled with these random ass egg sandwiches and even more annoyed when people would talk about their hour plus waits. Eggslut lovers I was wrong wrong wrong! Yes it's worth the hours wait, yes their eggs and sandwiches live up to the hype, yes to all.   Being in Vegas, you can always expect crowds everywhere and anywhere no matter which weekend you go - this was especially True on the weekend I went which was that of the Billboard Music Awards. Regardless we knew we were going to have to wait to eat, so why not try Eggslut - just to say that we have.   Be forewarned, Eggslut is a tiny establishment. They have very limited seating and even the area to stand in line is quite random - flowing down a dark hallway toward the bathrooms. But again, they serve egg sandwiches so people generally don't take too long to finish their meals and free up seats.   Over the course of two days, I went back three times. No shame, the cashier remembered my name, I'm a bit proud of that. The first time we went was around 11 on Saturday morning and it was quite busy. We waited about 45 minutes in total. When it's crowded, you will be standing in two lines, the first to place your order and the second to pick up your food.   The second two times however, we went after visiting Wicked Spoon at about 2 on a Sunday (no shame here either) and there was absolutely no line. Wait or none, it's worth it.   Everything on their menu (if you couldn't figure out by the name) is centered around eggs. There are various types of sandwiches to choose from but the gist of it - some sort of protein (sausage, turkey sausage or bacon), eggs (over medium or scrambled) with the option of cheese or avocado add on a soft brioche bun.   I was super bummed during my first visit that their special the slut was unavailable so I went with the classic egg sausage and cheese sandwich. Again - I was not expecting much when my order arrived - it looked like a plain ol egg sandwich. I was wrong. The egg was perfectly cooked, with the yolk still running when I bit into the sandwich. The sausage was savory and perfectly seasoned and the brioche was soft. It's sad but I was astounded by how real the food tasted, no fillers no rubberiness.    My second and third visit here they had sluts available and my stomach still smiles when I think about this. The slut is their signature egg dish served in a glass jar. A coddled egg atop the creamiest mashed potatoes you will ever taste with a touch of chives and perfect amount of salt atop.   I can't even begin to explain how freaking amazing it is spread atop of the buttered baguette. The creamy egg and creamy mashed potatoes are delicately flavored with the yolk and salt. Everything just melts in your mouth.   It was pretty cool watching the chefs prepare all of the sandwiches since they have an open kitchen/bar design. You get a front row seat watching them crack and whisk eggs, fry up the bacon and sausages and assemble everything. Guys, they're using real food here and it's sad that it's a big deal when restaurants use real ingredients but that's another story.   On my third visit we had the privilege to chat with the chef and he gave us the 411 on Eggslut. We were super curious about how many eggs they actually go through a day and he said he orders anywhere between 1500 and 1800 a day from a farm in California!! As we gushed about how much we loved the slut he explained how it was made, the mashed potatoes at the bottom are actually the exact recipe as the mashed potatoes at Robuchon. And it is topped with a coddled egg - what is a coddled egg? Well it's quite similar to a poached egg but it never comes into contact with any water, it's cracked on top the potatoes and essentially boiled at a controlled temperature for an hour.   A few things to note: - You want to cut down on carbs, you can substitute the bread for a salad. - If you order the slut to go you get to keep the glass jar!

ORWshV4SZDnSaDL57PiqCg.text: This place was me and my girlfriend's first stop after checking into our hotel. My first impressions about this place is that it must be very good because the line was really long.   I got the cheese, egg, & sausage sandwich while my girlfriend ordered the fairfax sandwich & a slut. My sandwich came out delicious. My girlfriend's fairfax sandwich was perfection, the egg was very fluffy & melted in my mouth. The slut was interesting, egg on the top & mashed potatoes in the bottom, which includes slices of bread.  Overall, I enjoyed my breakfast here, I don't mind coming back here whenever I'm in Vegas

J20hNeh73eGCqbpblyYRsQ.text: Quick and easy. Great if you've been out the night before or coming in from a late night out. Only downfall is the long lines and wait times once you order. Food is excellent. Price is reasonable for Vegas.

gw72srCeTbKolRQp_MouJw.text: My two favourite places in Vegas sound like some weird stripclubs. Milk and Eggslut. But trust that the name shouldn't deter you from trying this place!  I like eggslut, it's a reliable breakfast, affordable enough and fast service.  There is *always* a ridiculous lineup, but trust that it's not as long as most, these guys are slinging eggs and bacon and that doesn't take much time at all. The sandwiches are a bit more expensive ($6-7 each) than going to McDonalds or something, but you're getting a much more quality meal out of it, and you've probably drank and eaten more than enough in Vegas so far :P. Not to mention this will absolutely be cheaper than room service. Last visit I had a sausage egg and cheese, my husband had a buttermilk biscuit and we shared a coldbrew.  The sausage was savoury, spiced but not overwhelming, often in my experience you get a breakfast sausage patty from most places that is overwhelmingly fennel seed. On a soft, fresh brioche bun with a beautifully cooked, runny yolked egg. Pretty much heaven for me, I'm not that fancy.  Husband enjoyed his biscuit, it was flakey, tender and came with a lot more syrup and butter than you'd want. The cold brew was SO good but OH so small, and very expensive for what it was. Smooth and zero bitterness, but I'd skip this next time and just grab something a little more substantial for my morning java.  The only thing I'd ever want is for them to start serving some form of triangle hashbrown deal, then it'd be perfect!

p5JBiHmBgW3-JUQ2x1vfTQ.text: So really wondered what the hype was about for a breakfast place that does eggs and after waiting in a reasonably sized line for breakfast I get it and I agree that this place is delicious. Got the egg slut, fairfax, and the basic egg bacon sandwich to share. The slut was delicous combo of mashed potato and egg on the crostini. The fairfax had really well cooked scrambled eggs on the bun. The sandwich for the price was really good. For a solid breakfast in las vegas that wont cost too much this place is worth a visit.

Q-XFXXwfkF8NSHSIr0Sp5A.text: Aiiiiiiiiu, if one must go eggstatic over a sandwich, Eggslut is the place to gooooo.  Located right on the 2nd floor of the Cosmo, this place is pretty easy to see due to the long long line of hungry people.  Made a quick stop here with my mom and we left feeling satisfied. For food, we ordered the Fairfax sandwich (which was a glorified scrambled egg sandwich with onions/chives/siracha sauce), fresh OJ and the dark chocolate cookie.   OJ = fresh and .....orange :)  Cookie = KICK ASS COOKIEEEEEEE. You should try this if it's in stock since they do run out from time to time. Plus, your cookie gets heated up, so the melty chocolate is worth it.  Fairfax Sandwich = yummmmy. Eggs were so fluffy and light as a feather. In terms of taste, it was pretty good, especially the bread. Perfect for sharing if you're not too hungry.   Pricing = priceyyy. It's Vegas....so $20 bucks for a meal wasn't too bad.   Overall, this was a solid stop for breakfast/snack. If you don't see any seats at the nearby counter, don't fret! Just wander around and sit in the comfy lounge seats :D

KEN20UAJOby0P_iw42e9kQ.text: I loveeee eggs! However, eggslut was so overrated and overpriced. The first time I came, there was basically no wait. Ordered the fairfax, the gaucho, and the slut. Everything was literally only ok. The gaucho was probably the best one out of the three. So against my initial thoughts about the place, I decided to try it again the next time I was in Vegas. This time, the line was about 1.5 hrs long and once again, the food was a disappointment. The bread wasn't warmed up all the way and you can tell because the bread is soft and fluffy around the outside but as it gets towards the middle it was more dry and crumbly. I probably won't be back again.

VOF7E34T5PeAleL7ZG2j8g.text: Mmmm this place is a must for breakfast!!! The line can get long but it moves pretty quickly! And the food doesn't take very long either. The only issue you'll encounter here is finding a place to sit! So, you can't be a shy person, you'll probably end up right next to somebody, and yes they will be hearing your conversation.   I had the sausage egg and cheese slut! I didn't realize the egg was going to pop as I took a bite so the yolk oozed onto my hands and legs! Lol be warned people! Sounds gross but it was amazing! The sandwich looks so simple and pretty but the flavor will literally burst in your mouth! I guess that's why this place is called eggslut... I wonder how many people's mouth they burst into everyday!! Hahahha let me stop! Just go try it already!

_Q1Rfi2zoasEV0_83h5dyA.text: Go figure - We are from Los Angeles, where three+ EggSlut locations stand, yet we have never visited an EggSlut until now in Vegas. But hey -  a first for anything and damn, these are amazing sandwiches!  We ordered two sandwiches:  Fairfax: fluffy delicious scrambled eggs, chives and caramelized onions, with thick slice of ooey gooey cheddar, lathered with sriracha mayo all packed between toasted, soft, amazing brioche buns! Delicious sandwich, we just wish there were more onions!   Sausage, Egg, and Cheese: surprisingly delicious turkey sausage, nicely seared, great seasoning and spice of flavor, soft meat, on top of an over-medium egg which EXPLODED with yolk all over my hands and plate (I LOVE that) oh so sexual I know, a thick slice of cheddar, with honey mustard aioli in that amazingly delicious brioche bun! I should have ordered a biscuit to scoop up the yolk!  Both of these sandwiches were absolutely amazing! Delicious bun, perfectly cooked eggs in each, delicious sausage, lovely sauces to accompany the sandwiches, and overall just a great breakfast!

V2cyrHzAuLRjjrmQJ12FwQ.text: The breakfast sandwiches are pretty good here,  but be careful of the day and time you visit.  I came here on a Saturday morning and the wait was almost 45 minutes in line to order.  It was also super hard to find a place to sit and we ended up taking it back to our hotel room.

S1Fgz2StzPUF8V1HNEsh-Q.text: This was my second visit here and I think I have a pretty accurate view of how this place is now.   So on my first visit, there wasn't a line at all because we came around 3pm I wanna say. This time, it was Sunday noonish and the line wrapped around the corner and down the hall.   I tried the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich on my first visit. They put this chipotle ketchup on it which really made the sandwich excellent. And I can't say that they weren't generous with the bacon. (5/5)  On my second visit, I tried the turkey sausage, egg and cheese sandwich and this was not nearly as good as the bacon one. The flavors weren't really there for me. The turkey sausage was a lot better than I anticipated but I just had high expectations after having the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich. (3/5)  My friend order the slut because it seemed to be popular and one of their specialties. I have to say we were really disappointed. I was underwhelmed with my initial bite. First of all, it is overpriced ($10) for a little jar and a few pieces of toast. It basically tasted like watered down mashed potatoes. Not worth the money. It isn't that great in my opinion.   Drinks here are incredibly expensive too (probably to pay for the rent since it's inside the Cosmo) so BYOB... A small bottle of Smartwater here is $4.

MOEsglSj2a0C9Kcjtwa2NQ.text: Delicous!! Everything was made to order and still the orders came out quickly. The egg was cooked perfectly with a dark golden yolk. The line moved fast and the staff was super friendly.  So worth it!

r4-kQgUJT50dwmGOGH3DVQ.text: If the name doesn't spark your interest, the food should!  I'm down to have breakfast anytime of day and the sandwiches here are filling and delicious. The Fairfax is my favorite and the warm brioche bun is filled with soft scrambled eggs and chives, cheddar cheese, caramelized onions and sriracha mayo. I've also tried the bacon, egg & cheese sandwich which comes with chipotle ketchup. My man loved his sausage, egg & cheese sandwich and let's not forget about the most interesting item on the menu, the slut. A coddled egg on top of a smooth potato puree, poached in a glass jar, topped with gray salt and chives, served with baguette slices. Talk about making breakfast extra sexy!  If you love eggs this place is for you as the star ingredient is the egg. This place isn't cheap but once you taste it you'll understand why.   Things to consider ~  This place is popular so sometimes the wait can be long. Not a lot of seating so don't be surprised if you can't find a spot by the time your meal is made (easy solution - keep walking & you'll find plenty of open seating all around the Cosmo where you can sit down and enjoy your food).

wHvPLCyKUmETCnCpaOg-iA.text: Yum! Yum!  I was hesitant after seeing the line around the corner. As I waited, I was told by multiple people the wait was with it!  It was!!!!  I had the Bacon/egg/cheese and it was amazing!!! So much flavor!

tTJoFO64YMqUD0DWmiFhnw.text: It's okay.  I got the Slut and my husband got the cheeseburger and a biscuit.  The Slut was pretty good.  I've never had eggs and mashed potatoes together before, so it was nice to try something different and I ate every bite.  I had a bite of my husband's cheeseburger and it was honestly nothing to call home about.  It was just... okay. The burger party was pre-molded and probably came from a freezer. The biscuit was possibly the driest biscuit I've ever had in my life, and the "cold brew" was just iced coffee and it wasn't good at all.  I was disappointed at how expensive 8 oz of terrible iced coffee was, but everything here is overpriced, so... Overall, the food was good, but not great.  Would I stand in line to get it again? Absolutely not.

W5sGxYDxcYE5kC8WP0N1RA.text: Not as good as the one in LA. Not sure why... but the Sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich didn't give me the mouthgasm I was expecting when I first tried it at the LA location.  I also got the slut, a coddled egg with mashed potatoes on the bottom and served with 3 slices of bread. This was good but not as creamy as I remembered.. maybe my taste buds were off from a night of drinking? Who knows, but I'd still recommend trying this place out when you're Vegas.    Definitely a plus that the food came out fast and the lines were moving not to slow.

APDi5ArP4T-tpVQ_1hw2NQ.text: EGGSLUT, VEGAS, The Cosmo, 2nd floor - Here's the deal, Tennille. If you like eggs and there is a line, DO NOT get out of line. Call your Ma, post last night's shananigans on Instagram or check your bank account but do not get out of line. You'll thank me later.   As a native NYer who has consumed more egg sandwiches than I can count (It's a NY state food group. LOL.), Eggslut's Bacon, Egg and Cheese on brioche is the BEST egg sandwich I've ever had! No joke. Lots of quality well-cooked bacon. No mushy, fatty bacon here!   My hubs and I wish we ordered 2 egg sandwiches each. Hint. Hint. You'll thank me later. Remember, you don't want to get back in line. Quality coffee. Staff was in great spirits and is a well oiled machine. Good price point for high quality casual dining on the strip.  You're on vacation, right?  We've been to this  glorious city 20 times. Yes, 20 times. We know- we're nuts.  This is one of our new faves!

I have the option of posting the comment as a tip instead.  Here is a tip yelp, let me write a short comment about this place having a long line that moved quickly so that people will not avoid this place when they see it always has a long line of people waiting.

Xnol3uzdQo7DE-kBnQSj_g.text: The slut: creamy mashed potatoes and sous vide egg cooked in a mason jar topped with fresh chives and grey salt. Simple, but it was so delicious! The toasted baguette it came with for dipping through the egg was brushed with a very fragrant olive oil. The whole thing was simply perfection. Of course I wish the line was not so long and the self seating area is definitely lacking. But the wait is definitely worth it for that slut!

QFPp7Kx8yXtVyAGDVdWdDQ.text: be prepared to wait in a very very long line. However, its worth it. The bread is delicious and the sandwiches are unique and so flavorful. If you're a breakfast sandwich fan this place is worth a visit

L9rA8j3G4ptVJ8g3VjTB-g.text: I had a great experience at eggslut, for it being my first time. I'm from LA so my only reference of the restaurant was the Grand Central Market location, and I always avoid it because the line is long.   The line was long here too, but it seemed to go by pretty quickly. I also ordered the Fairfax burger but I legit ate it so quickly that I couldn't even snap a picture! It was honestly so good. It was perfect the way you imagine the perfect boy. It checked off all the requirements. It was soft and juicy and cheesy and the eggs . It was amazing. I want another.   Again, I ate that burger so quick, I didn't even give myself a chance to post it on any social media platforms. It didn't make it to snapchat, it didn't make it to Instagram stories. It made it straight to my mouth. Go to eggslut, every chance you can.

r5eCpNPNGnfKGgO_Nz8agA.text: Price is high for breakfast drinks 5 dollars for any kind line is long to wait to get your food  food taste isn't bad presentation of the food is ok, would recommend it to anyone just go early before it gets crowded

aqSCdMxbP3JiSZma2Vy1BA.text: The service was very fast and the Slut was delicious.  It's a little bland flavor wise, but the texture of the poached egg and potato puree was great and I enjoyed the baguette slices. Good seating for a quick bite, though their cookie was a tad bland. Still, I would love to come back and try out more items

-W2WYE-EZ9lDN1VVSvzD8A.text: Located at the Cosmopolitan Hotel and Casino and on the 2nd floor, Eggslut is the place to try if you like fried eggs in your sandwiches.   I got the bacon, fried egg and cheese sandwich. The bun wasn't as good as I hoped for as it was a little dry. I think if they put it on sourdough bread I would have liked it more. The menu is quite small but there's other sandwiches such as an egg salad sandwich, sausage and egg, or burger. My mom had the burger and said it was good but she agreed that the bread wasn't that great.   You'll surely make a mess when eating this sandwich because the egg is quite runny. Be careful not to spill yolk on your clothes! Lol. There's some seating located in the restaurant but not much. Glad I tried this place but not 100% sure I'd crave it enough to go back.

I only wish the orange juice was a bit better and larger for the price. But overall, a great breakfast place if you get there at the right time to avoid long lines.

9I-5ODbQFBtcclMkw_ZlCg.text: Oh Eggslut! How I love thee! I guess I've gotten lucky since I always go at odd times, but, I never encountered a wait. I'm not a morning person so breakfast hours were out for me. I usually go after prime breakfast time.  I love the fairfax. The eggs are soft scrambled so I'm sure not everyone will like that, but I think it's delicious. The brioche bun is always fresh, the onions perfectly carmelized. I usually forgo the sriracha mayo, but still find the sandwich quite tasty.  It's the strip, and it's Cosmo. So it's not gonna be cheap. But, the quality is definitely worth the price.

4q8emYQb6iL8AoqammGM3g.text: Mediocre at best. I had really high expectations due to its popularity. I wish it had lived up to it's name, but sadly it did not. Open kitchen style restaurant were you walk up to the counter, place your order and wait to have your name called. Minimal seating inside the restaurant but plenty of places to sit outside the restaurant.   Food wise everything tasted mediocre. Food temp was "warm" at best. Ordered the biscuit and the outside was luke warm but the center was cold. Everything else was an okay temp. I'm one to not care if my food isn't piping hot, but you literally see them cooking it in front of you so i don't understand why the sandwiches still came out just luke warm. Overall experience was underwhelming. Probably won't go back to this location but would try their LA location out.

F_hh-B3WVvHq8PciS77Dug.text: The lines were really long when I got there but the lines moved pretty fast. The sandwich was delish , the price was a little high but ur in Las Vegas. Live a little. It won't break the bank. It's worth it if ur on vacation.

9pUcKefERcxxO0WuHtLlvg.text: There's a continuous line at Eggslut. I came early just minutes after opening and shortly after the line began to wrap around into the hallway.  I ordered the Slut, coddled egg with potato puree and bread. The soft egg and potato is really smooth together and blends upon scooping. I could've used another egg! I liked this dish for breakfast. Light and still savory. The slices of accompanying bread was too soft though. A little more crunch would've been better with the puree. Otherwise, a solid choice for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut

ROa5o9gOdGm2gc1c7V7SNw.text: I came here twice in a week, and the food is good, but I'm not sure it's worth the wait. If you go here anytime between 7:30 AM and 11 AM, there will be a line. Lin typically will run anywhere between 30 and 45 minutes. I ordered the Fairfax and the egg slut. I actually liked the Fairfax better. The egg slut is a soft boiled egg on top of potatoes in a glass jar with several slices of bread. For $10.50, it definitely is very overpriced for what you get. The Fairfax was $8.50, and came on a brioche bun with egg and cheese, with the option to add bacon or avocado for a few dollars more.   And if you don't want to wait, right next door you can get an awesome biscuit sandwich with cheese and egg and bacon (which I liked better than eggslut) all for for six dollars and ZERO wait at District.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HjOwV8FxPvWK4EL7Co_8fA.text: For as long as I could remember, I've had Eggslut bookmarked at the top of my "must-try" eateries. Just seeing pictures of fried eggs oozing out yolk made me salivate with longing and desire. But because I lived five hours away in the Bay Area, I hadn't had a chance to visit their Los Angeles location.  But recently, during a quick trip to Vegas with my girlfriend, I FINALLY checked this off my bucket list. We made sure to visit Eggslut, rain or shine. It was inside the Cosmopolitan Hotel, one of the classiest casinos on the strip, and we stopped by during the second day of our adventure.   It seemed like the hype truly found its way to Sin City because we found ourselves stuck behind a HUGE LINE. And this was at like 10am mind you. Luckily, it probably only took about a half hour for us to reach the front.   True to the name, Eggslut is all about the eggs. Here, they served six different kinds of delectable sandwiches along with two special items and sides. The really cool thing about this place was that each of their items were very unique. For example, they had a wagyu burger! In terms of cost, most options were a shade under $10 - kinda pricey considering a breakfast sandwich but as I'll describe below, it was SO WORTH!  We ended up sharing their Bacon, Egg, and Cheese Sandwich. After eagerly waiting about 15 or so more minutes for our food to come out, we finally dug in. Omg, maybe I should've drove to SoCal just for this because the sandwich was AMAZEBALLS! Portion size was decent, cheese was plentiful, and bacon was VERY crunchy! I thought the brioche was a good choice for bread, and the chipotle ketchup sauce made it all come together. Of course, the egg was cooked perfectly - a little runny yet fried well - but I did wish that they gave us more. I felt like the egg was an afterthought whereas the bacon was the star. It should've been the other way around! Overall, definitely 9/10.   As an additional note, probably one of the other highlights of our visit was the genuine professionalism. All the staff members, despite the rush, were so amicable. They made sure every customer was taken care of equally.   Only a few things can make me dirty and Eggslut was one of them. I loved their sandwich and totally didn't regret waiting a long time in line for this experience. I can't wait to check out their LA locations. I give Eggslut an "Omg, I'd travel 2 hours for this" rating.  Eat well and prosper,

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What a nice slut (sandwich)
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WDDh_ekk9khta8Jb60lqSg.text: First time at the LV location -- same deal as everyone else: you will see the long line, you will contemplate going anywhere else, you will still wait because line moves quickly, and you will not be disappointed: the breakfast sandwiches are BOMB.   Buttery but light. Savory but not heavy. I think the prices are on the steeper side for natural squeezed juices (upwards $5 for a small glass of OJ?) but I realize I'm in the heart of the Cosmopolitan.   Just do it!

FSU3ucv-AtfZXtJEtgJlbw.text: Loved the Fairfax! The flavor was incredible. It's an egg sandwich with soft scrambled eggs with chives, cheese and a sriracha mayo served on a brioche bun. I added bacon to my sandwich.   My only complaint of the food was the brioche bun. It was tasty but would be more appropriate for a burger. For this sandwich I felt it needed something more hearty, like maybe a baguette or toasted sourdough, as all my innards fell out of the soft bun and I had to eat it with a fork.   I also got the fresh squeezed OJ which was amazing but a little pricey at $5 for a small glass. My boyfriend ordered the bacon egg and cheese sandwich and said it was good but wasn't a fan of the ketchup that came on it.  Our wait wasn't terrible and the line, although long, moved quickly.  The only reason I didn't give five stars was for the portions. It was a smaller sandwich that didn't come with any sides and my boyfriend and I were both hungry again about an hour later. For over $30 for breakfast for two that consisted of 2 sandwiches and one OJ I would have hoped to be full for a good long while.  TL:DR amazing food but small portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fairfax with bacon added.

YVKiopwKeW5xM8QTpmlEKQ.text: Such slutty goodness!  Not gonna lie the line was a bit scary, I thought it was going to take forever but it moved so quickly I was shocked and might I add , SO worth the wait! Seating could be a pain as there isn't much room for seats. There is counter seating available along the storefront where you can watch the action in the kitchen. Luckily it's a fast paced breakfast place that people are constantly getting up and leaving just have to be on the lookout for a table/ empty chair. I highly recommend getting the orange juice! So fresh and so yummy!  Their pricing is actually decent, between $6-10 for a delicious breakfast sandwich

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

upDPV7TEgYk0wiyASk3YtQ.text: Excellent breakfast sandwiches made with fresh wholesome ingredients. Definitely recommend the classic Bacon Egg and Cheese and the Slut. Also, the Cold Brew Coffee is perfect, not overly acidic or watery.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese and Cheeseburger
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Orange Juice and Cold Brew Coffee

vklFNzIu4Kps6SAg9ifrCg.text: besides the fact that this is not NYC where people stand in lines to stand in lines, I was like why must there be a line in the Cosmo for an egg sandwich. Granted not just your regular old egg sandwich, but still c'mon folks.   Sometimes these foodie trends make me giggle, and nonetheless, I find myself entertaining to them as well. Because I did stand in line and I ordered my sandwich and I very much enjoyed it! Its always crazy busy guys so just accept that you'll have a line to wait in, so don't come "hangry" or "shit-faced" cause you won't like the wait.   So ES itself bomb, 8/10 would recommend and that's a generous compliment. It was a bunch of us so we ordered a variety of different things on the menu. The slut seemed to be a popular favorite, and I must say I tried some and having potato puree in a jar is just not my jam. I wouldn't even do potato puree on a regular breakfast day soooooo...to each their own. The Fairfax and the Egg Salad though, yes please all day every day. I mean no, I wouldn't go out of my way for ES every time but it was bomb I can't deny that.  Here's my thing, I do love Eggslut and I do enjoy their menu but I just feel like I've made better and had better breakfast sandwiches in my life for a lot cheaper so here we are in this hype ass world where everything is just based on how popular it is and I'm like meeehh it was okay.

hwgj5T2FhqKYHGdoU61Afw.text: I was surprised to see a pretty moderate line when we arrived. My friend went for the bacon, egg, and cheese. The sandwich was barely warm and the cheese didn't even look melted. I went for the Slut since it's something unique to this place. There was way too much salt on the top layer. I didn't even finish it. I've had friends rave about this spot and my buddy said it use to be way better. Not sure what happened but I won't be going out of my way to try it again.

9-mX0HXkEI3fLPI2f9kQmA.text: After 2 days of neglecting a ridiculous wrap around line to this infamous establishment.. Eggslut in Las Vegas was not as delicious as anticipated.   I was extremely let down by the runny consistency of my sandwich. The buns were extremely lite and fluffy, and they could have added more consistency to the runny sandwich, but it didn't.   Overall: 3/10. Very disappointing, hyped up, and over priced. ($50 for 2 people!) I'd suggest checking out the Lardo grill in the cosmo or finding another brunch spot that doesn't come with all the drama and fake hype :)

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It didn&#39;t taste the best but it sure was photographic! #eggslut

TXoMLepkrsQ0LviFDeNT7g.text: So yes, this place is worth it.  We luckily didn't have to wait in line too long.  Everything is so flavorful!  We had heard a lot about this place and we knew we had to try it! I ordered a fairfax sandwich and went all out adding bacon and avocado! Creamiest scrambled eggs ever!!!! My husband ordered an egg salad sandwich, the flavor was amazing.  The orange juice is so fresh.  If you are in Vegas you have to stop here!  7-8 seems like the best time with hardly any wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sitting area
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax with bacon and avocado
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax and Egg Salad

DEmBgAhevOe9qrf1OdaHNw.text: I did enjoy Eggslut.   We ordered the egg sandwich with bacon. The bun was super soft that you can sink your teeth into, but it was overly buttered. I could do without the slather of the butter on top of the bun because it's literally on every square inch of the bun from inside and out.  So the sandwich is greasy and delicious at the same time.   A small freshly squeezed orange juice is $5.   I wish they had late night hours, but they close around 7pm I think.  Location: 2nd floor of Cosmopolitan

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XYjl4zJ6TlunNCoUxf62WA.text: Pretty much the same thing as the original in LA, which until this point was the only location I had tried. If you like a modern and updated spin on breakfast staples, this is the place for you. Unlike multiple visits to the DTLA locale, I did not have to wait for an hour for food and the line moves very quickly between the hours of 7-9 am (stood there 15 mins maybe? food came out in 5). Much easier to try this popular chain at the Cosmo compared to LA.   The slut is arguably the most popular dish, and while I do like it, my favorite is the fairfax sandwich (add avocado and bacon of course). The light whipped texure of the egg is divine, I have not been able to replicate this at home. The brioche is nice and soft, and fresh squeezed orange juice is a nice addition to the meal.   Come at the right time to avoid a wait and you'll be happy with your meal. It's not the holy grail of breakfast but it's very good for what it is. Worth trying for sure, worth the hype up to a certain extent.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fairfax

XNpiXX_lVUfqF1RWS4N4fw.text: I read all the reviews that this place isn't worth the wait. I'd have to disagree unless you were running late for the airport. Make the time to stop here if you want a delicious breakfast sandwich. I got the bacon egg and NO cheese. The bacon was thick and crispy. I would have preferred to have one more slice of bacon. The egg was cooked just right! Just enough that the yolk wasn't all the way cooked but didn't make a big mess when I took my first bite. The sandwich comes in a nice paper wrap so your hands don't get dirty if you need to eat on the go. They gave me napkins in my to go bag. I'd say I  waited about twenty minutes all and all. Not bad!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ya0-zUaSQkq6O-7AmxuimA.text: Solid food and friendly staff but a questionable use of time and money. My group arrived about five minutes before opening on a weekday morning, and there were already 20 people in line. Ordered two Gauchos, a bacon egg & cheese, a beer, and an orange juice. Total before tax and tip $55. The Gaucho alone is $15.65. For a wagyu tri tip sandwich, the Gaucho experience was underwhelming. If I had a do over, I'd get the basic egg sandwich. And I can't see waiting in line 45 minutes. Eggslut is very trendy (like a fashion accessory). Go once to say you've been. Otherwise there are better values inside the Cosmo.

mhaYItk1vGner7H0-FzkeQ.text: This is my third time Eggslut in general, and this location is by far the best!   I've tried the Downtown LA, Venice Beach, and lastly, this location (Las Vegas). Downtown LA location had a long wait, but was still delicious. Because of this, I had the same expectations for the Venice Beach location. However, that one was a huge letdown (yolk was already popped before it got served to me and meat wasn't seasoned).    But when I found out my hotel (The Cosmopolitan) has an Eggslut, I wanted to give them another chance. Needless to say, this was the best one by far!   My girlfriend and I ordered two cheeseburgers and a slut (first time trying and definitely won't be the last!)    Meat was seasoned well, the brioche buns were just crispy enough to have a slight crunch, but the insides were warm and soft. Cheese was melted just right, and the egg was perfectly cooked (popped right in the middle of the burger. So delicious).   Slut was warm and poached well, and the mashed potato under was seasoned nicely and soft.   Line wasn't long, but I think it's because I came here during off-season on a Tuesday. But workers were very efficient, so that was nice to see!   And lastly, the location. It was downstairs of my room (got off the elevator, turned right, and it was right there) which was super convenient.   Overall, this was the best Eggslut experience for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_miEXa3bUaIOsOgMnQgKGg.text: Funny name for business but don't get the name fools you, they do serious business over here. There are plenty of choices on the menu and it tastes great.  Good place for breakfast and I will be back

fXYQ1tkYl98iW4mLEXXdnA.text: Their "slut" is literally heaven in your mouth.  The egg and mash mix is so flavorful and fluffy and the bread has an amazing crunch that compliments so well.  All the sandwiches are 10/10 amazing.  Long lines but worth the wait.

2oCt2RC4EB653SdjqUViag.text: Tasty, but a pricey breakfast.  Came at 2pm on a Tuesday afternoon and although there was no line to place an order, there was a 25 minute wait for the food.... I noticed that some people got their orders as soon as they showed up so I highly recommend ordering ahead by phone if thats possible.  The Gaucho Sandwich $15 was amazzzing with its wagyu tri tip steak and chimichuri sauce.  I would definitely order this again even though it's crazy expensive for just a sandwich.    The Slut $10.50 on the other hand tasted like mash potatoes .  I did not care for this at all.   For 2 sandwiches and a slut, I paid $37.  Pretty expensive but worth trying if you have not had it before AND if there is no wait.  Otherwise save the experience for another day.

z1SDAaif52DTibjGdAUwkQ.text: While we were in Venice Beach, we figured we give this place a fry!   No regrets!  Perfectly fried egg, with the right amount of cheese & oh let's not forget the turkey sausage!    We ended up splurging on the biscuit!  We were so full, that we forced ourselves to walk back to the hotel in Santa Monica!  Tip, grab a seating area, place has limited seats

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fXYqbYh5W1gbUWcX84s8Fg.text: Long line which is a good sign I guess. The bacon egg and cheese sandwich was worth the wait.  The biscuit was dry and needed every drop of the honey butter. Overall a decent dining experience but a little hard on the wallet.

zyi-jwBP2lZrpI4M_x7oiA.text: Holy Moses and blessings to the hens on the Ark.  This is a must try breakfast spot.  It will cure any ya giver (I do not drink... anymore).  However, this is proper Vegas partying/recovery breakfast food. I hope they bring one to the Bay Area.  We are totally Eggslut worthy.

gcAbFBh1-xuINeDfSxO7hA.text: I don't get all the hype for this place. Yes it's good food of course, but at the end of the day is an egg sandwich really worth that long of a wait? I will still drop my four star review and it's definitely one of the cheaper options in the Cosmo, but when I went it was only about a 10 minute wait (2 AM). If you wait an hour like some people on here do, you aren't valuing your time in vegas enough!!!!

b-ydOhI1wxY1kpUuGe3fEA.text: Nothing amazingly special. The line was extremely long so I thought it would be delicious. I was sadly disappointed. If you are looking for something quick don't go here. If you want to say you are at eggslut, then go. There are definitely better places to get breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg and cheese sandwich

ohvj6RAV1v6sMxtqsW84zg.text: Eggslut lets me be proud of my inner dirty slut at brunch time and for that, bravo.  I'm unwilling to say this will be the best breakfast sandwich you will ever have in your life. I am willing to say it's a good one on the Vegas strip. I'm also willing to say you will wait in line for it. I got the sausage (subbed in the siricha mayo). It's drippy, meaty, saucy goodness. I'd ask for extra mayo because that's the only way to live your best life.  I'm shocked to say this, but I'd actually recommend the Slut which is a coddled egg (BTW, I have no slutty idea what a coddled egg is but I'm fairly certain the dude I met last night wanted to try that move on me). Break the yolk, mix, and lather on bread. It's buttery, rich, and delicious.  Ps, went with two friends/coworkers who wanted a shout out. Hi Matt and Scott.

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage, Egg &amp; Cheese
