NSNFpKaYG2e85R4C0bjeGQ.text: I wish I could had Fairfex + bacon + avo for my breakfast everyday till the end of the world.  Sooo goooood, lightly grilled brioche bun, fluffy egg, add crispy bacon, all together such a happy start of a day. (Besides the long line.....)

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfex

Ypza5BWWvvyK9NVqfLiy1Q.text: My husband and I had our first meal in Las Vegas at the Eggslut, as we're staying at The Cosmopolitan for the next few days, and I must admit to being disappointed by their breakfast. We ordered two egg sandwiches (the Fairfax and the Egg Salad) and while both were good, they weren't worth the high prices or the 30 minutes we had to wait at 8:30 in the morning. If you need to wait that long for a couple of sandwiches, they should be exceptional -- and the sandwiches at Eggslut just don't hit the mark for me. The food is good but nothing different from what you could get at a decent neighborhood joint in New York (or, I'm assuming, Las Vegas).  The brioche buns in particular were kind of greasy and overly large. I wish they gave us the option of getting our food on a croissant instead -- I think it would have paired better with the egg, which was well cooked. I would have also liked a more melted slice of cheese -- ours was not all that hot or gooey, even fresh off the grill. I know the kitchen staff was incredibly busy servicing the many people who showed up... but I felt as though the sandwiches just didn't add in the right finishing touches to make them incredible. A competent home chef could have done a better job with the ingredients they had.  The salted chocolate chip cookie was, however, extremely delicious -- freshly baked and oozing with warm chocolate chips. I'm not sure if they'd still be as good later in the day but I suggest you get one early in the morning.   Service was also fast and friendly -- no complaints there. But keep in mind that they automatically add 15% gratuity when they charge you so if you don't want to pay so much for tip, you'll need to lower that tab yourself! (I paid $2 in gratuity myself. The staff seemed great but I don't see why I need to pay 15% in tip when I'm basically just ordering and then taking food to go).

eMxAzbTA1cQ7AiUI3RUbPg.text: After reading that this place gets busy and the lines are long we decided to get here early around 7:15 Am there was still a small line but not bad at all because as soon as we paid for our food it started to  build up quick. By 7:30 there was a decent wrapped around line. Food was served pretty fast I grabbed the Fairfax with bacon.  My husband grabbed a simple bacon egg and cheese. Both were sooooo good , the sauces had a nice kick.  Definitely recommend stopping in!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon egg &amp; cheese , Fairfax with Bacon

rtlv_sURCd0TF9FXe1KKZA.text: Definitely lives up to its reputation but I wouldn't want to wait in this line each time. Luckily, one of my colleagues had gotten there earlier and reserved some spots in line so I only had to wait less than 10 minutes to get my order in. I decided to go with the slut due to the namesake of this restaurant and I was not disappointed. The potato puree with the coddled egg on top made for the perfect combo, especially when paired with the crostinis on the side. It had just the right amount of carbs to get your day started off right without loading you down. There isn't a ton of seating but people tend to eat and go so everything clears up pretty quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut!

kBkjgGKPwucMdlroraRfjA.text: I'm just gonna say it, even though I know it's the unpopular opinion -- runny egg yolk porn just isn't as sexy as fluffy, jiggly soft-scrambled eggs. Eggspecially eggcellent is Eggslut's Fairfax sandwich's impossibly light, cloud-like scrambled eggs speckled with chives, caramelized onions, cheddar, & what I wish there was more of -- sriracha mayo -- on a buttery brioche bun. Add bacon (like I did) or turkey sausage for a couple bucks.   My companions also enjoyed their sandwiches. The patty in his Cheeseburger was thin but big on beef flavor. Thumbs up for her Gaucho Sandwich, made with wagyu tri tip & chimichurri.   The original Los Angeles location has caused quite a buzz & amassed a hell of a following, which explains why the line at Eggslut in the Cosmopolitan hotel was longer than the line for their trendy dayclub, Marquee.

The scrambled eggs on top were a bit wet still and without the bacon the sandwich would have eaten overall wet since the bun is soft.   It's not a bad sandwich by any stretch of the imagination but for the hype I was a little let down.

z_3XVX0i585m5p7LVzxIKg.text: I gave this place another chance because I happened to walk by when there was only 2 other people in line.  I still don't think it's anything special, but it's mediocre if you don't have to wait 45 minutes for it.  The cashier was not very nice, and no other staff person was anything great either.  I ordered the egg salad sandwich and biscuit.  The biscuit was better this time than it was the first time I went there.  The honey butter was a lot better.  It still wasn't a nice flaky biscuit though.  It was kind of more like a bagel.  The egg salad sandwich was fine, but nothing special.    If there was no wait, I'd possibly go here again.  If the line is longer than 5 minutes, it's really not worth your time.  With all the other quick service restaurants in Cosmopolitan right now, there might be a better choice, but this is good for something that isn't fried or a dessert.

CWsj3JbqJSlmewlGV6Lyiw.text: I'm not sure how I honestly feel about eggsslut. I came here with high expectations and intentions of ordering their egg sandwich but as I kept looking at the menu, I decided to order the wagyu sandwich. I'm a bit disappointed that I did change my order. The wait to order was LONG... if you're determined to try eggsslut, and the wait doesn't bother you then go for it.   I wasn't too impressed with the sandwich and the biscuit was very disappointing. I assumed that they bake fresh biscuits, but I saw they had them sitting out and popped it back in the oven to re heat it..... I ate half of it and threw it away. As for the sandwich, it was a bit plain.. I needed some tripe of condiment to add some type of flavor. Nevertheless, I still finished the sandwich. I ended up paying about $20 for both the two items.  My friend ordered a burger and she was not impressed, and didn't bother finishing it.   I would only come back to actually try their egg sand which.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cwtDaCfmkiWmeEvvZ1EB4w.text: HAHAHA!  BE WARNED!  If you just willy nilly bite into the bacon, egg and cheese on brioche (or any of the sandwiches with the fried egg) you will be squirted with egg yolk.  Now, this isn't exactly a bad thing but when you're not prepared bad things can happen.  I wish someone had warned me.  Other than that, the sandwich was very good.  Nice flavors and perfectly cooked egg.    What you need to order is the SLUT.  Yep, even if you read the description and are like "hmmm coddled egg?  Let me just get a sandwich..." do it.  Seriously.  Probably the best thing I've eaten for breakfast in ages.  Perfect texture to go with the crispy baguette.  Luscious and smooth.  Rich in flavor with just the PERFECT amount of saltiness.    And you're going to have to wait in line.  Every time I come by this place there is a long line that curves around down the hallway to the bathrooms.  That's what prevented me from going because who wants to wait in a line like that?  Luckily for me, I went in the afternoon and there was no line at all.  However, I now know that I would wait in that line.  For that slut.

t8ovSc6fSADniSSmRcwk0w.text: I LOVE my breakfast food, so I was extremely excited when I heard that I was going to get some grub at Eggslut! 5HzaXwMUpQ993oS0N07kUw.text: The breakfast sandwiches tasted exceptional! Wow! It makes other breakfast sandwiches at other restaurants taste flat.   Came here on 4/27 Saturday morning which was my last day in Vegas before my flight back home to SFO Airport. (Bay Area represent!)  Ordered the Egg, Cheese and Sausage Sandwich & Fairfax. Both were very tasty! The Fairfax was a little spicier though.   While I'm rating 5 stars for the food, I'm rating 3.5 stars on the customer service. We asked her to cut the sandwiches in half. She apologized and said she couldn't. I mean why? We paid over $10 each. It only takes 10 seconds to cut it with a big knife. I was splitting it with 2 people. Another customer requested his to be cut too. We ended up cutting it ourselves with a plastic knife.   Other than that minor con I'll still return.

Minus 1 star for the $4 puny buscuit we got.

BWRMG5wARbg6JVhN_eFNNw.text: I have waited for this day since I was a wee lad! My fiance said this was the best food in Vegas she has had! The sluttiest place on the strip is between two buns!! Eggslut for the win!

DaseKWuenrysE43Tvj6ZRw.text: It's all in the name. Very hip place. Food was good. Slightly on the pricier side. However service was prompt They have a lot of selections to choose from. The ambience here is phenomenal as it takes you back to the roots. Would definitely come back if there was more availability of their lunch menu into their dinner menu. Staff was very pleasant to deal with and they even remembered us from last time which is great knowing you are being acknowledged

AQxGOCdM0F6WGtoZ3f7Guw.text: I really wanted to like this place but the wait was super long. Not fun if you're hungover. I think we waited like 30 min to order and then you have to wait for your food after which was like another 20 min. The sandwiches were alright. I got the bacon, cheddar, egg sandwich. Lots of bacon and not enough egg in my opinion. I'm all about having the right proportions haha. They also add ketchup to the san which which I think was too much. The Fairfax sandwich my boyfriend ordered was a lot better. It had very fluffy eggs and the spicy mayo added lots of flavor. Next time, I'll get this for sure.

bLn8YYkzWEJIYwIZzAjJMQ.text: Very good breakfast sandwich.  There was about a forty minute line to get my food.  I'm glad I waited because the sandwich (sausage) was very good.  I would not wait that long again though now that I've tried it.

5yrsMVUKlGvIICnjLlxM7A.text: A lot of hype for this place and decided to try it out. I love the eggs; just cooked enough to have a little yolk in the middle. Super yummy egg but the sandwich was an average cheeseburger. The OJ didn't seem to be freshly squeezed and it wasn't that cold

WBZMe8_46DOFMiWCnevlQQ.text: Not worth the long line. The egg sandwiches are mundane at best. I didn't try the biscuit, or cookies.

FrlTriaj0sxB6q5HkVN_fA.text: There is usually a line but it moves steadily and it's worth the wait if you are an egg/breakfast sandwich connoisseur. If you just need to stuff your gullet with some eggs on toast, White Castle does breakfast sliders (no shade, sometimes that's what u need).   Eggslut has mastered their eggs. I got the cheeseburger and they even accomodated my gluten-allergic ass by putting it on mixed greens, word. It was really filling and gave me energy til the evening. Bf got a breakfast sandwich and still talks about it.  Anyway, this is some fine handling of eggs. An eggslut egg is made in a pan but it doesn't get brown on the bottom and yet the white is COOKED PERFECTLY!!!!   The result is an egg that is soft and yielding, not rubbery, with a silky yolk  and no sliminess; like a poached egg but firmer.   It's simple and done well.   Eggslut has bar seating (cramped) and some cushy and adorable egg-shaped seating outside of the shop. It's not a place where you really want to have a sit-down meal, more of a quick bite kind of stop.

Cch4g_fo909uBSjuJD-rBA.text: The Goods 1. It is good, egg slut is a mashed potato and poached egg dip for the pieces of toast, it is pretty yummy  2. I love the bacon and egg sandwich !  The bread is so soft and chewy, the egg and cheese and bacon is juicy and delicious!  3. Coffees and juices are standard...  The ambiance  1. Limited seating 2. Mainly you will be sitting with others on a long bench table unless you take it to go.  Recommend trying to snag a seat/cushy couch associated with Cosmo somewhere nearby for more privacy 3. Cosmopolitan hotel is just one of the most dazzling and Gorgeous hotels/casino.  You'll get plenty of that   Service  1. Sadly never been good.  I wish it could so I could give 4/5 stars.  Lady at the counter looks upset and never smiles or even greets  2. Guys prepping food are not that helpful either , they just gesture to other people down the line if you need something, I guess they are too busy to help.  3. Napkins are sometimes out and the tables unclean.    MoJo 1. If you're just prepared for "Serve yourself" vibe, you'll be rewarded with delicious bacon and egg sandwiches! Most people get addicted to the "egg slut" dish it is named after I believe. Worth trying

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That long bench to get cozy with strangers
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice!!!  I didn&#39;t take a pic of the disgruntled prep cooks tho
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My fav!  I get the chipotle ketchup on the side

nOXo3WDHY_DvYGocWhnuRA.text: Been here twice in 2 separate trips to Vegas and I say it is good, not great.  The Slut is unique and a must try.  I had their egg sausage sandwich twice and thought it was okay..messy but good.  Maybe they need spinach or arugula or something to give it another texture or taste to it.    There is always a line but goes fast.  Very limited seating.  They make it fresh which is a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DGBZPdUtPWpL2d6cEB57Pw.text: The best breakfast sandwich I have ever had!  This gourmet breakfast sandwich takes comfort food to another level.  All of their ingredients are made from scratch and the bread is made locally.  You can taste the freshness.  The sandwich I recommend is the GAUCHO.  The Gaucho is seared wagyu tri-tip steak, cage-free over medium egg, chimichurri, red onions and dressed arugula in a warm brioche bun.  The tri-tip was cooked medium and to perfectoin then you get the run of the egg yolk with the chimichurri on the back end then the nice chew of the brioche bun.  Nothing but spectacular.   The next sandwich I recommend is I went basic and did the SAUSAGE, EGG & CHEESE.  The sandwich consists of house-made turkey sausage, cage-free over medium egg, cheddar cheese and honey mustard aioli in a warm brioche bun.  This sandwich was simple and all the ingredients complemented each other nicely.  Keep it simple stupid!  The only negative was that there was not to many places to sit since this place is always busy but for good reason they make amazing from scratch food.  They are also a little pricey for just breakfast sandwiches but they are worth the try for sure.  So, if you are in Vegas next time and you walk but the SLUT go over and buy one!  Haha!  BrandonFitFoodie

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. GAUCHO - seared wagyu tri-tip steak, cage-free over medium egg, chimichurri, red onions and dressed arugula in a warm brioche bun

DlKvpGRHkORo7DeDQpQZKA.text: Eggslut is an addiction! There is always a huge line for this placed! Would recommend coming before they open to wait ahead. Their sandwich is so delicious! What's unique about eggslut is their signature 'slut' which is caged free bird poached in a jar. It's seriously a different concept and I've never seen or taste anything like it.   For their 'sluts' in the jar you have to mix it up well and then you dip the bread into the jar. It taste like potatoes, but very delicious.

QSqjxE6I132TXlBFdgAHGA.text: Meh. Not worth a line around the corner that's for sure. It was things that I didn't like but ate it since I spent the money anyway.  You know... One of those meals not worth spitting out kind of bad but God you wish you spent your money and time elsewhere.

W3OKTEkjD4ml857EEX44cA.text: Delicious, I liked the food better than the LA location. My food was piping hot but the line was So. DAMN LONG!!!!! I'm sure there's a place on the strip with a more reasonable wait time. Good place if you're not starving

SeKIbSMthE-gRCzq3xmceA.text: Probably some of the best eggs I have had in a while! The Namesake "eggslut" is basically a poached egg on top of creamy mashed potatoes served with toasted baguette slices and when you dip them into the egg, the yolk oozes and forms a sublime curry like mixture. I got a side salad of arugula with red wine balsamic dressing and manchego cheese which I felt went very well with the Eggslut. My husband got the Fairfax Sandwich with turkey sausage which was also really really good. The scrambled eggs in the sandwich were ooey-gooey and seasoned to perfection.  Breakfast of champions!!

HnPwutBl6aOkcACR_a0jLw.text: My favorite go to when I need my egg fill! I never cook breakfast but when I'm craving it badly I just go to Eggslut.   I love the atmosphere and the people are great !

1xgRzmtnB9LrZVO4q0eEQg.text: Had breakfast here while I was in town from jersey and it was sooo delicious I got my breakfast sandwich accompanied by a salad and everything was super fresh ... which they had more locations YUM

MnnVuH6k62QywOhHRJ8uow.text: It was pretty good, but the biscuits were dry. Loved the honey butter for them though. The bread for the breakfast sandwiches was also unimpressive, I felt like it would have been amazing with a different bread

lO-nxMPg3b_DFKcsyETADA.text: Stopped in on an early weekday morning recently. Very short line, I was pleasantly surprised! I've seen how the line at the LA location gets and I was fully expecting to wait. Sure glad that wasn't the case!   I ordered the slut, some fresh oj, and some water. I forgot about requesting extra bread like someone had suggested but that was okay! Delicious! I love potatoes so I knew we were going to get along just fine. I would have liked a bit more chives but I'm probably in the minority. I did feel like I could have easily asked for chives and been accommodated.  Choice of music blasting here was nice and all throwbacks when I went which I really enjoyed.   It was fun to sit and eat and people watch. Because it was a weekday morning, there was a good mix of locals who worked nearby, business people, and tourists. I will stop by again next time to try a sandwich!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The slut
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The slut and some fresh oj
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Counter space/vibes. Laid back, fabulous 90s LA feel from the music to the service.

4Wn4JE1S0gXY6ZUVDL_wiA.text: Great concept. Just some small issues with execution.  The idea behind this place is amazing, and I'm surprised it didn't happen sooner on the strip. Tons of drunk, high, hungover people wandering around. FINALLY a place to satisfy their cravings, give them what they need, what they desire. Eggy, cheesy, gluttonous magic on a buttery hunk of bread. MMMMMMM.  The food itself is amazing and the menu very customizable. There is something for everyone, well, everyone who loved eggs, OBV. My one issue is that, in an effort to make this place a little more to-go, there is a lack of seating. Therefore, the problem arises where people who haven't gotten their food yet, scoop up seats and those who have just gotten their food are left holding their plate and deciding, okay I guess I HAVE to take this to-go. Another thing I noticed is that they can get pretty backed up with orders and you can wait a WHILE for your egg sandwich.   Honestly, it's so good it's worth the wait and battle for a seat, in my opinion. However, I think the the less chill tourist might be deterred just looking at the place. Just saying. Obviously I give them 4 stars, because it's just that good.

QzLjjM2vR_CqMhbUTXaOqQ.text: Gonna keep this review short & straight to the point. Eggslut is located inside the Cosmopolitan Casino on the second floor. Take this review with a grain of salt as I don't eat eggs. I did however eat a really tasty biscuit & a burger sans the egg.   Be prepared to wait upwards of 30-45 minutes standing in line. The good news is there is a bathroom right next to the hallway where the line forms. Seating will come at a premium also as there aren't many chairs. As you get to order, if you're with someone, have them go grab seats so you can grub when your food is ready. Enjoy!

l9WKaPY0HVpEWRnxNyKGFw.text: I killed a tall can and a half during the wait idk if that says more about the length of the line or my alcoholism. Anyways the sandwiches are pretty good not a whole lot to them which is what I like but it's just one of those things that doesn't seem like that line should be that long for egg bacon and cheese on a bun. It always seems to be like that though. I'd wait again though tall cans in hand.

VhFCv8oZH9JiEvsOMM01Mw.text: Probably my favorite breakfast spot we ate at in Vegas. Be prepared for a line anywhere from 8am-noon. After that, you may walk by and think that they're on their way out of business it's so deserted- don't let that fool you! It's a bit pricey, but everything in Vegas is. Service was quick considering the length of the line (we waited maybe 20 min, and the line was backed up to the bathrooms in the hallway) and they were friendly. Egg was cooked perfect. The sausage was probably not my favorite, but it was still good.

q2EjzKMvso3rrDUI2eALEQ.text: Was so looking forward to this! It was not at all what I expected. It's not a sit down restaurant with servers, you wait in line to order at a counter and then have to hunt for a table. They only have a counter and maybe 2 tables but the Cosmo has a dining area right next to it with more tables and benches. We arrived around 1pm on a Monday and had to wait in line about 20 minutes. I ordered the slut which was tasty but very small for the price. I would def opt for a breakfast sandwich next time for cheaper. It was a much larger person, my friend loved hers. The orange juice was also nice and fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U5Y0xn0qpcrhOVNWK0shwg.text: My husband and I have been wanting to try this place for a long time. On New Year's Day, this is the first meal that we had for 2018- Slut and Gaucho! Both items were delicious and did not disappoint!  PRO: -the slut and the gaucho were busting with great flavors. The wagyu was tender and complimented the chimchurri sauce. How do they do the slut???  CON: -a little bit pricey for what you get. Bottled water, coffee, and canned soda's priced at $5.00! I'm sure the space is expensive at the a Cosmopolitan, so I get it.   All In all, the food was enjoyable and the egg chair was picture worthy!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TH5Ku2Xf9ZtURdzChmnFfA.text: On our first day in Vegas, we found out that they had Eggslut located in the Cosmopolitan which is right across from where we were staying.  Sooo happy because I've been wanting to try this place.  I knew they had one in LA but no idea there was one in Vegas.    Upon arriving, there was a pretty long line going down the hallway where the bathrooms are.  The line almost made me want to go somewhere else but what the heck. We're in Vegas and I wanted to see what the hype was all about.  So we probably waited about 15-20 min in line.  Wasn't too bad. But then again, we are waiting for a sandwich. Although it's not just any sandwich.. it's an Eggslut sandwich and I can definitely say I am one.  I love eggs period.  Runny, boiled, poached, scrambled.. I like it all.  Anyways, when we finally got to order, I found out the turkey sausage was out.  So I opted for my second choice which was The Fairfax sandwich.  Our order came out pretty quick.  The problem was not enough tables but we luckily snagged a spot.  We came in a big group so our other friends sat a few tables down from us.  Now for the sandwich.. the brioche bun was definitely the perfect bun to use for an egg sandwich.  My scrambled eggs were a little bit on the runnier/softer side which made it a little hard to eat but still very delicious.  I could taste the sriracha mayo in the sauce but I feel like it was still missing something.  Maybe a little more flavor.  But it was still good nonetheless and surprisingly very filing.   Overall I'm glad I got to try the place.  I wasn't blown away but it satisfied my cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fairfax

75p_eJRxAXtzh_Fng_ZOHA.text: 3.5 stars. I loooove anything breakfast so I had to try this place out when I was in Vegas. Overall, it was a solid delicious sandwich but it was over priced, the line was long, and there were only a few seats that my friends and I had to eye and grab before anyone else took them.  I tried: The fairfax sandwich ($8) with added bacon ($4). So $12 for scrambled eggs with chives, caramelized onions, cheddar cheese, and sriracha mayo.  I loved it, but I wouldn't wait that long for a pricey breakfast sandwich with no guaranteed seating. I tried my friends' bacon egg and cheese sandwich and sausage egg and cheese sandwich, and they all actually liked mine best. Their sandwiches were pretty messy to eat too.

2y9tZ--WWb_LGHEwE7iMHA.text: The name is super funky but the food is fantastic. My boyfriend and I came here for breakfast one of the mornings while we were staying in planet Hollywood in Vegas which is literally a 5 minute walk from the hotel we stayed in. I've seen so many reviews and heard so many things about this place that when I found out that the hotel I was staying at was in walking distance I had to go! My boyfriend got the Gaucho breakfast sandwich that had wagyu steak which was SO good, and I got the bacon, egg, and cheese and we both shared the slut. The food literally had me drooling because it was so good. If I could go back to Vegas again, I would for sure come back to egg slut. Just be sure to come right in the morning because it does get extremely busy.

It's pretty pricey for the size though. he size isn't that big which is sad, so it wasn't filling with just one. Got the cheeseburger and it was incredibly juicy and the egg paired well with it. Worth trying!

ZkVXCc8FcLAZpuTONyIbFg.text: This place is located inside of the Cosmopolitan. I got the Fairfax sandwich, which was a sandwich stuffed with scrambled eggs. At first the first couple of bites were delicious, but after I kept eating it I started to get really sick of it. It was too greasy and cheesy. Also I felt like there was too much bread for the amount of eggs inside my sandwich. I also got the slut, which came in a cute glass container with potato puree and eggs on tops. There were also slices of bread for you to dip the eggs and potatoes. This was okay, but I don't know if it's worth it. Also, it kind of sucked that the seating was limited. There were no seats, so we had to find a table in Cosmo hotel. However the workers here were very polite and diligent, which I appreciated.  All in all, this place was somewhere I always wanted to try for a long time, but it did not live up to my expectations.

0VQi_iF8ZixlyXunYJoHgw.text: One of LA's greatest spots! So happy they opened one here in Vegas but wish it wasn't on the strip. Aside from that, these breakfast sandwiches are finger licking good

jOG03J0y3RPIjrwBYFn3LQ.text: Wow! Usually not a fan of strip food AT ALL. But eggslut blows it out of the water with their service and food!   Put an egg on anything and I'm game!!! The brioche bun is the perfect consistency! I love the thickness, to die for.   We also tried the biscuit and the salted chocolate cookie' sooooooooooooooooo goood!!!!   So flakey and buttery! Better than KFC and childhood nostalgia!   I've heard great Things about the eggslut in California, but have yet to be able to try it!   For sure to be coming back to this place over secret pizza any new day! Plus it's open late nights! Perfect drunk food!!!

o7a_5mroiCgDDcdduKuRpw.text: Don't wait in line for cold eggs  We waited for 20 minutes to order greasy egg sandwiches. Then 10 minutes more to get our food which we could see was just sitting under a heat lamp. When I asked an employee who literally did nothing while we sat and waited why they didn't open the 2nd register when there was a line, she said the line wasn't long enough to justify it.   If there is any line- it should be all hands on deck to take care of customers.   To add insult to injury, by the time we got our food, it was cold. Waste of a restaurant.

6f-2AhZk6jFTH4UC4oERFA.text: I was recommended to go here but my chiropractor. The prices are reasonable and I had to try their wagyu speacilaity since it isn't at their other locations. The egg was dripping yolk and the deliciousness just melted in my mouth. It was perfectly just oozing yolk with the soft and tender wagyu beef. The line was long but their system works. You follow the chicken feet on the ground after you order your item. The girl at the register was super friendly and the cooks behind the line did exactly what they were told. Amazing!!!

0cp48yaaX8cpb3P-eRHLyA.text: We waited in line about an hour at 11 am. The line seemed to move pretty slowly but it could have just been me being hangry LOL.  I ordered the sausage and egg sandwich (they use turkey sausage which is nice) and a coffee. The sandwich was very good, but not sure if it was worth the hour wait. The coffee was AWFUL though. It almost wasn't even warm enough to be lukewarm and it just tasted bad...for $5, I would really like a coffee that didn't taste like 7/11 $1 coffee.   They also missed my friend's order, but were quick to remedy it even when it was busy so +1 for that.   I have heard so many good things about Eggslut but from my experience, it was overrated and just okay for the price and wait time.

gUmaO6Nb4M7cb-IJssKtkQ.text: During EDC week, I came twice. Not sure what the wait is usually, but the two times, I waited about 20-30 minutes.   THE WAIT WAS WORTH IT.  I had the Slut both times. Mashed potatoes and egg.... Then dipping it with bread. O M G.   I'm stoked to come back when I'm here again!!

gEdKdKOQp3sYRhEdl90DnQ.text: Expect a super long wait because it is a new addition in Vegas, but I would say it's pretty worth. That day I ordered the sausage egg and cheese and they told me that they ran out of sausage, which was superrrrrrrrrrr depressing. So I substituted it with bacon instead and it was still amazing. Bacon was a bit salty though. Overall the hype was somewhat worth it! Just prepare waiting in line for awhile.   If you like eggs, this is your place!

-vnx1FtARBBVpI29a-BbBQ.text: We tried the Gaucho & Fairfax. Fairfax is alright, Gaucho is sub-par, the beef was dry and tough. The bun are OILY!  With all the burger joints we have in New York, i'll just rate the sandwiches average. Sure, i'll go again if im up for a quite bite and if there were no line.

dcnY8Cq7EVY0T_nb6SgG8A.text: Just arrived at Vegas and heard this place has really good food. We walked about 20 mins and arrived at eggslut which is located in the Cosmopolitan.This place is really easy to find once you walk in.  We lined up for about 10 to 15 mins, as there is only 1 cashier and not alot of seats- so you pretty much have to eat quickly and leave.  This place offers you to substitute bread with salad with no extra charge and the salad is very good. We ordered the gaucho sandwich - tri-tip wagyu steak - and changed it to the salad. And of course - had to order their specialty "the slut".  Overall i would say this place is worth the wait.  The steak was soft and juicy and the slut is really unique and tastey.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gaucho sandwich subbed with salad and the Slut

VTYhlhM8dz-W2px6-Xixnw.text: I decided to try this place my last morning in Vegas. The location was pretty easy to find and the menu was simple to understand. The line stretching around the corner and down the hall was extreme and had me second guessing my decision. The end of the line to the counter to place my order took about ten minutes and the staff was friendly. After placing my order (2 sandwiches) it took another ten minutes to receive my order. The food was hot as everything is cooked by order and the taste was what I expected, but the portion was smaller than I thought. I left not hungry but not fully satisfied. The long line and the price I paid didn't equal to the end result in my opinion.

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

73ZBzzzg-br2Oj8Z_diXfw.text: Love this place! Other than the long wait everything else is perfect. It looks like they took the skirt beef sandwich off the menu...that's literally the best

CMscf8rwpDSkufEU3VLewA.text: Delicious food! I ordered a Fairfax with avocado, and the eggs were cooked and seasoned exactly how I like them. The other components of the sandwich worked together well with the eggs. I would have liked a little more heat from the Sriracha mayonnaise and a softer texture for the brioche bun, but those technicalities were overshadowed by the overall flavor of the sandwich.   In terms of environment, this location is small, with limited seating. There was also a pretty long line when we arrived at about 8:30 in the morning. Service is typical counter service.  Although the food is great, it's also very overpriced for the portion you get. $12 for a breakfast sandwich the size of my fist? While the price would prevent me from visiting often, I think every now and then, when I'm feeling rich, I'd like to stop by for a delicious egg creation.

EeBiszMMkztMikhTwerMog.text: We heard the hype about Eggslut so we were excited to try it. We came by around 8am and line wrapped around the corner. So we came back around 2pm and the line was fairly short. We got the Egg salad sandwich, Fairfax Sandwich, and Cheeseburger w/ Avocado. The Fairfax was okay. It tasted like really peppery. The Cheeseburger tasted better than the Fairfax, but my brother found a hair in it. It was good, but nothing memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Found a hair on the pickle
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger w/ avocado

pN2QZ05ijE4L18lHdosBmQ.text: Great breakfast/brunch place on the Strip! The line looks long but at 11 on a Sunday morning we ordered, got our food, and finished at 11:30. The line moves quick and the food is great. The fairfax is a sure bet. Little bit of heat and chives: perfection. I'm not even a huge fan of eggs let alone soft scramble but it was dang good. It's not the most expensive but it's Vegas so it's obviously a little overpriced. It's expected but it's very good. Worth any sort of little wait time.

DfWL2CRWFoBGO-24rU9t9Q.text: Crazy good egg, sausage and cheese breakfast sandwich! Messy in the best way where you need a couple napkins to clean up after you're done.  And I gotta say, the line is very short at 5:30 on Sunday mornings. Will definitely return on my next visit.

Lp6bcsP5Nejf_qQ0RzhLMg.text: OMG! I would give up my first born for the sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich! It was so freaking great! And everyone said there's a wait but I went at 3:30 pm and no wait at all. Plus the sandwich is freshly made so it comes out piping hot. I plan on going back every day for the next couple of days!

vvL8kYJQa02ZjfVsvW8dtw.text: For all the social media hype and long line, I was expecting a little more flavorful meal. After waiting in line for a good 20 min or so, I ordered their sausage, egg and cheese sandwich on a gluten-free bun. The turkey sausage was decent and the size was alright, but I think maybe the gluten-free bun killed it. I should've just stuck with the original brioche bun, dang it.

JIUZUvVBjyCAMmF-WRq8OA.text: I've always wanted to go to the one in LA, since I got to taste a sandwich from them at Feast Portland last September. I had no idea they were here, so I was happy to find they'd opened this location! It's just a little counter, limited seating. They know how to make an egg, that's for sure! My only real criticism (not that they asked me) is that the brioche buns they use are too big. I have had better/fresher brioche. I ended up pulling the top off mine. And: this is an 87 napkin experience. I just think they should splash out for better napkins, instead of the thin thin thin ones. Good cold brew coffee. Worth going!

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger

gpqrt1wis_n_lB6X4kV4iw.text: Delicious!!!! Waited maybe 30 min on a Thursday around 9am. I got the fair fax with avocado and my husband got the bacon egg and cheese. Nothing to complain about! We inhaled it!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NFfp2YLSOICR9wOi5--UFQ.text: Super yummy!!! Great experience. I wouldnt eat there regulalry if I lived here as it is pricey but still some great food!!

LWUuA-_svTMC_56HfwHPYg.text: Since I was staying at the Cosmopolitan, it made sense for me to grab breakfast here on my first morning (and mama was starving since I had gotten in late the night before and immediately went out without eating).   At 8:30 a.m. on a Saturday, the line was about 12 people deep, but it moved fairly quickly. Order at the counter and wait for your food.   I got 3 different sammys: sausage, bacon and egg salad. The sandwiches were all solid and I like the arugula to give it some veg action.  Overall, nothing special -- stuff I can easily make at home. But it's one of the cheaper options inside Cosmo. Or, you can cross the street and go to McD's for a sausage egg mcmuffin -- that would satisfy a similar craving.

nR6CpL9_hMMAppL8Lafp5A.text: need a simple breakfast after a night of going hard AF? here is your place.  i had a hard time saying what i wanted to order, after awkwardly whispering it to the cashier i was given a number and sat down.   SLUT* - poached egg on top of a potato mousse - creamy, light, you get your protein and carbs in and it's nicely savory and topped with some chives.  goes great alone or on top of the bread they give you - sliced baguette bread with a fragrant olive oil  needless to say that it was as simple and good as i hoped for.  definitely on my radar for a simple eat that won't upset my stomach

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut*

ywn3F8OmaNYyoDvuza8WtA.text: EGGSLUT IS THE BOMB. No joke dude.   The line was super long but moved fast, it only took about 15 minutes to get to the front. I ordered the Fairfax sandwich which is scrambled eggs, cheddar cheese, sriracha mayo, chives, and caramelized onion on a brioche bun. HOLY MOLY this has to be the best thing I've ever eaten. I devoured this thing so fast, I realized after that I didn't even get a picture    I've been craving it ever since. PLEASE COME TO SAN DIEGO

BuIEv2tl4Z2GB54vNRI-hQ.text: While I thought the name was a little weird. Amazing and quick! Loved it! Ate here almost every morning on our trip!

fC57mwlaByaP_i39XmG6VQ.text: We went at noon and only waited 10 minutes for our order. There was room at the high tops so we were able to sit and enjoy the sandwiches. Their buns are really good, the eggs were perfectly cooked on the Fairfax we ordered. Pepsi from Mexico was a great add.

XLlKGkKFedV2R9TMCOJ-Uw.text: Eggslut was amazing! Be prepared for a lengthy wait but I promise the wait is totally worth it. They offer signature breakfast and brunch sandwiches. The environment is fun and friendly as it is located within the Cosmopolitan.

TXsaK0IsFiSL_AYgVVl4JQ.text: Not gonna lie, the line sucks! But the food was good. The iced coffee was ehh... Let's just say I didn't even finish it and for me to not finish coffee is rare.

NCw5SafGvt25VUX_mGTbQQ.text: This was perfect. The service was great! The food was excellent. The line was a little long but it went pretty quickly. I will be going back tomorrow with my husband.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ex2oxcXnTu4Xbh5q2wLIJg.text: Lucky for me I came here during off-peak hours and only had to wait in line for about 5 min before ordering. I got the sausage egg and cheese sandwich and really enjoyed it. The staff is really friendly and the sandwich is a really interesting mix between a gourmet restaurant breakfast sandwich and an egg mcmuffin from starbucks...its definitely somewhere in the middle in a good way. I enjoyed eating this for breakfast, but there is no way in hell I would ever wait an hour...or even 30 min in line for this.

0i2H9bV8tTCv73o0d_TPWw.text: YUM! The line is worth the wait! The people here are friendly and helpful and went over a large order before handing it off to make sure they got it right. The wait actually isn't very long once you actually order. I'm actually not the biggest fan of eggs, but the way they incorporated the eggs into their burgers and other sandwiches were really good. All of the flavors worked really well together and were simply delicious! We came here on a random day of the week and there was still a line. There weren't that many areas to actually sit down and eat so we took our order to go.

QgdHbrOTrJZB_ZfzEraTEQ.text: Honestly, every time I visit eggslut I will eat here. However, it is as always overpriced on the strip. I like the slut and the sandwich here. The bun is buttery and the egg is soft and flavors. The slut is okay; sometimes the bread is wet and not crispy. Overall, it lived up to the hype; but if I am paying 40 dollars for my breakfast, I am hoping at least my bread could be warm and crispy

5QQga93VVj5ngXsxgtgRyA.text: We tried the sluts and they were amazing. But most important their service was excellent. We had a mix up in our order and they went out of their way to make it right. Customer service A+ and food as well. Just be prepared to wait a long time.

Lb9xiqC4ACT6Gkxonhj-Jw.text: Eggs are normally not my thing, but Eggslut is   egg-cellent.   Yes, the line is as lengthy as one you'd encounter at a popular nightclub. I think the wait is a part of the experience. Plus, it's always a good sign when you see a long line at a restaurant.  My friend and I ordered the Fairfax with Sausage ($11) and the Sausage Egg & Cheese ($8). The homemade turkey sausage was simply divine - savory with just a little heat. The brioche buns are nice and buttery too. Our breakfast sandwiches were so filling that we both skipped lunch.  Note: Use self parking near the east elevators. Eggslut is conveniently located on the 2nd floor as soon as you exit the elevator.

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fairfax
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked goods

f-UEHF1kgcQraQT0eFtbnQ.text: If you can stand the wait, you won't be disappointed. My fiance and I shared 3 items to make the most of our first visit, two sandwiches and I got the "Slut."  The sandwiches were delicious but I have to say that the simplicity and overall deliciousness of the "slut" was worth the wait. Creamy potatoes with a gentle coddled egg with a sprinkle of chives and sea salt... talk about comfort food-- and excellent for a hangover lol!

5tmxjjB4tM6JPW5vkC9OQw.text: When I found out there was an egg slut in Vegas, I was out of this world excited. I had an amazing experience with the egg slut in LA, so I thought I would be going to egg slut every day I was in Vegas! However, although my sausage, egg and cheese sandwich was good, it didn't live up to my expectations and experience from LA. It was the same sandwich I had but it just wasn't as great. The sausage didn't have as much flavor. The egg was a little over. The bread was a bit stale. I don't know, it just didn't live up to the standards I had expected from LA. Don't get me wrong, it was still a good breakfast sandwich but it wasn't all that I remembered it to be.   I also tried the slut this time around and I'm not sure I get the appeal. It didn't taste anything special to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage egg cheese
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut

H7QoCxtDi41Cn3G2qNRbIA.text: Great breakfast sandwiches on the second floor of Cosmopolitan. The egg was cooked perfectly and the yolk oozed out upon my first bite! Really like all the other restaurants that they added around Eggslut!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage, Egg &amp; Cheese

Eo9kqTi7z9WMEyRFqalAKQ.text: I've wanted to go to Eggslut when it was just a Los Angeles thing but Alvin Cailan opened one in Las Vegas so I had to make my first visit to LV a good one. Outside of walking a long way in The Cosmpolitan hotel to find it, it was found and I ordered a Fairfax. I had wanted an Eggslut T-shirt but the one I wanted was unavailable due to a lawsuit, meaning it was the Nirvana homage and while Lisa Orth designed the Nirvana shirt, perhaps Sub Pop didn't want a sandwich spot to steal her idea, even if there are countless parodies of the shirt. Nonetheless, the eggs were nice and clean and having it on a brioche was great. I'd come back here again.

xCampWRSZ0LJsAFL1dzZlQ.text: A lot of places in Vegas are strictly busy due to hype for a name.  This place is exactly that. It was very okay.  As a traveler, try Fried Egg I'm in Love in Portland, Oregon. Will smash this place.  Service was good and fast though!

rATXzam0_xYR3Qvlhrj51Q.text: Gaucho Sandwich.  So delicious I couldn't even taste the arugula.  Seared Snake River Farms Wagyu Tri-Tip Steak, cage-free over medium egg, chimichurri, arugula, brioche bun.  And I'm done son!  Everything that I have ordered here is D-licious!   Except the arugula salad, no one likes that, take it away.   I ordered it to be more healthy, but I believe that, that is the only salad option. Somehow this eggslut is easier to access than the one in DTLA, and I live in LA.  I love coming here when in Vegas.   I still have yet to try that egg thingy in a jar.   Until next time, SYOY!  @roxthehungryfox

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gaucho sandwich
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lit menu

TUX96C34zFdgdVNg-Kezrw.text: Omg I love sluts. And porn. To clarify: Eggslut and food porn.  Only in Vegas is this punniness so fitting and appropriately inappropriate ^^;  Seeing the long line wrap around the corner, I thought Eggslut would be over-hyped, with most customers comprised of either hipster wannabes with an obsessive love for glass jars, or those in need of brunchy hangover therapy. (On weekends, it even opens at midnight so you can get gourmet breakfast for drunchies!)  Despite the potential for an inflated hype factor, the concept of craft eggs still piqued my curiosity and I decided to check it out... and ended up coming here 2 days in a row.  The Slut ($10.82 - a coddled egg on top of smooth potato puree, cooked in a glass jar topped with gray salt and chives, served with slices of baguette): Their signature. Simple in concept as egg and potatoes in a jar with some bread on the side for good measure; complex in reality with the simplicity of homemade mashed potatoes contrasting the orgasmic runny yolk with a sprinkle of earthy chives. Even the baguette is top-notch, tasting like the crostini of high-end restaurants and drizzled with a dash of olive oil. You're supposed to mix the egg/potatoes jar and spread it on the baguette, but I also enjoyed eating part of it separately and less mixed to bring out different flavors. It could do with less salt, but it was otherwise layery goodness.  The Gaucho ($16.22 - seared wagyu tri-tip steak, chimichurri, red onions and seasoned arugula topped with an over-medium egg): The heartiest menu item. The steak is a bit too salty and may be dry with respect to hard-core steak standards, but for slices in my breakfast it was definitely quality. The combination of tri-tip, chimichurri, and red onions rendered a piquant Argentinian flavor profile, and the egg was more of an afterthought. I suggest getting the salad version because the steak pairs well with the nutty arugula dressed in a tangy, citrusy sauce and a sprinkle of shaved parmesan.  *Note that you can substitute the brioche bun with arugula salad for any of their breakfast sandwiches.   Service is efficient and friendly, though workers do seem to get chatty amongst themselves. Both times, I waited momentarily in anticipation for my order to be called, after I already saw the food prepared.   I applaud Eggslut's conscientiousness to sustainability (much needed, especially in light of the new climate-change-denying presidential administration... eww). All boxes and utensils are compostable, and Slut glasses are recycled. Slut glasses? Pun not intended :3  The verdict? Eggcellent! Not your cheapest breakfast, but good value in comparison to the $12 bottled juice and $14 smoothies at Juice Standard next door.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggslut
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak in the Gaucho
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Gaucho, $16.22 - seared wagyu tri-tip steak, chimichurri, red onions and seasoned arugula topped with an over-medium egg

Zl5UdCjEz56grMztep-LXg.text: Wow! We stood in line for a good 20 min. And it was all worth it! I wasn't able to take a picture of one of their specialties called the "slut" which is basically a coddled egg on top of a potato puree, poached in a glass jar, topped with gray salt and chives, served with slices of baguette. We ate it too fast because of how good it was lol but I was able to capture a picture of the sandwich I got as well. I forgot the name of the sandwich but it had bacon egg and cheese. Delicious! I would stand in line again to enjoy another food item from here. Definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1QeHR7iTCxBfTB4zMUIjXg.text: Worth the 40 minute wait, however, I do feel that there could have been additional cashiers!

-h84hYH14IE5PN0v5JyUkA.text: Long lines, great sandwiches. We waited about 45 minutes at 10am on a Saturday and ordered a bunch of different sandwiches.  The eggslut which is a soft boiled egg on top of pureed potatoes is delicious! The potatoes are really good and with the runny yolk it's a great combo.  Their actual sandwiches are made on fresh bread and the egg itself is perfectly cooked! The one with bacon (they give you a lot of bacon) is pretty good, and their hamburger is just OK.

0JhnkBgizmGulE0MT3KQGw.text: Very good egg sandwich, tasty and with a bunch of options. A bit more greasy than I would have liked it, but the buns are definitely a hit. On the negative sides: this restaurant is located inside a very crowded mall, and it's loud and they have very little seating. The lines to order food are also insanely long.

sKDfF9p3gTJFrI3CVXBknA.text: Overall: Eggslut is good, but it's not wait-in-a-looooooong-line-to-pay-too-much-for-eggs good. I'll just stay at home and whip up my own, thank you very much.  Food: 3  We got the Bacon, Egg, & Cheese and Sausage, Egg, & Cheese. They tasted as expected. I do appreciate that their egg was well cooked and that their buns weren't soggy. However, I think the price is astronomical for something that can easily be made at home. Trust me, I've paid far more for far less without a peep because it's creativity warranted it.  Service: 3  As a casual eatery, you order at the counter and pick up your order to eat when your name is called. The line was long, but it wasn't more than a 20-25 minute wait when I stopped by on a Saturday morning. The staff keeps everything moving pretty fast.  Ambiance: 3  It's a cute store in the Cosmo, but seating is very limited. I guess they assumed people might walk and eat or sit somewhere else in the Cosmo? But the sandwiches can get super messy when you eat them, so more seating would be nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg, and Cheese

Lq6zgYjoNSV4yxy7PvQM0g.text: Once the plane touches the ground we are going to get slutty at Egg Slut!  Long lines, few tables, no napkins in the napkin dispenser.. Oh well.. Great customer service and amazing food that just orgasm in your mouth made up for it!  We ordered the sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich! So good!! Very flavorful I must say and the sausage I got was huge! I mean HUGE!!   We also got the slut!! Thick puree potatoes with a runny warm egg yolk on top of slices of baguettes. Omg!! I'm just sad there were only 3 baguettes! Maybe I'm just being greedy!  They don't have regular tap water. You have to buy the bottled water which was $4.50. I thought it was a ripoff!   I would definitely come back for their food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The slut!

TuxNtFg_Z0eZlvXzO_yS6g.text: This is a great convenient place for on the go breakfast sandwiches. Only downside is there's a lonnng wait line especially in the mornings. It is a small little space so there's not alot of room to sit down to enjoy your meal. However the lounging area in the cosmo on that floor have alot of couches and seats. I got the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich, but took out the cheese. It was good, but there was nothing "wow" about it. It tasted like my bacon and egg sandwich with ketchup at home lol. But yes, if you don't have time for a sit-down meal, Eggslut is the way to go.
