Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

iyJJ6fs9EnXSl4FHfbgv-A.text: Finally got to try Eggslut on a trip to Vegas. I had the Slut which is a soft boiled/coddled egg in potato puree with chives and salt.  Simple yet delicious. The staff were super friendly and it was only about a 5-10 minute wait from getting in line to getting my food.   Sad I probably won't be able to enjoy again for a while so I need to figure out how to make them at home.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YBAQjXJck-yMaPugr--xDQ.text: I loved the name, so i had to make a trip to become part of the "Eggslut" team. When arriving the line was around the corner so I knew it had to be good. We waited for amount 20 minutes in line just to give an order.. everything is fresh and made to order, took another 10 minutes to get the food. A little on the expensive side $5- for a small fresh orange juice and $11- for my sandwich. I decided to get the Fairfax and add bacon. The food was decent but not for the price though. I love lots of flavor and the sauce on the sandwich didn't do much for me. But overall it seemed more of a healthier breakfast choice. I love that you were able to watch the cooks work their magic right in front of you.. more of an assembly line 1 man cooking the eggs, another cooking the bacon, 1 man getting the wraps opened and ready for finished sandwiches and another putting the breakfast together. Not much to sit since it is a very small area and lots of traffic of everyone becoming an Eggslut... but seating is available across from the place if you don't mind sharing a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ywR16GHOdoppjM4EU-UsKw.text: So many missed opportunities to try this place and I finally got to try it last month. ABOUT. FREAKING. TIME. It's funny because as hyped as it was, I was still skeptical..like how good could this egg sandwich be really? There had to be a reason why the lines were always hella long both at this location and in LA, right?   After a good 30 or so minutes in line, I understood just what everyone was raving about. After much deliberation, I chose the Fairfax with bacon over the Eggslut but only because the bacon and egg sandwich looked more filling than the piece of bread and the sous vide egg/gravy combo. I'm sure it was still delicious though. The Fairfax was amazing and very well worth the wait. At $11.50 or $8.50, sans bacon, it's not the cheapest sandwich but it's still cheap for a Vegas meal. I was okay with just the one Fairfax, but definitely could've eaten a second one if I felt like blowing more $$$.   Only part that sucks about this is that I have to wait until I'm back in Vegas or LA to enjoy. PLZ BRING ONE TO THE BAY SOON!

0R0y4qrfzqzS1IATS6J8Vg.text: Eggslut- you're easy like Sunday morning, which just happens to be today. The staff are friendly, the food is great, but if you're on a time schedule, expect a wait. The line was worth it though, great brioche and flavorful cheddar and chives. I would definitely return. It's located on the 2nd floor of the Cosmo, just up the escalators. There was a great reggae vibe, and no one seemed to mind the wait. Keep up the good work guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Line cook

sTMbQlmlzskvKN8imQcV-Q.text: I've been to Vegas many times and finally had the chance to check it out. I heard about this place and thought it was overrated. I stood in the long line. The good thing is that it moves at a decent pace. I ordered a breakfast sandwich with bacon and a breakfast sandwich with turkey sausage. The wait wasn't too bad for the food after ordering. Maybe 8-10 minutes. Service was ok. I was planning to bring it to my room and eat it there, but couldn't wait. I found a spot to sit and ate the breakfast sandwich with bacon. My first bite was, it wasn't that bad. Second & third bite was, hey, it's pretty good. I got more bite of the bacon and sauce. The egg yolk squirted and dripped down onto my legs. No warning. I didn't think the egg yolk would do that. Finished it and walk back to the room. I gave the turkey breakfast sandwich to my husband and he said it was very good. He likes it. Again no warning, the egg yolk squirted all over his black shirt LOL. I did prewarn him but he didn't listened. Overall, it was good. We would definitely stop by again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fVkWm5A5Z6ty0ymnlJTInQ.text: Great breakfast! I had the egg slut with baguettes - loved putting the egg and mashed potatoes on them. My husband had the egg sandwich, you'll need lots of napkins with oozing eggs. We were told after we ate that they have the "best" chocolate chip cookies - we will be back to try the cookies.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RAqujhWyBIBhQuSougdhtQ.text: Very tasty.... love the buns they use! Quick service and clean kitchen! Plenty of seating space out in the mall area!

KspmfG-6__XgCo0BvHstbQ.text: Expensive but you know that going into this. Don't go when you are starving and there is a long line. Go when you are hungry but the line is short. The honey butter biscuits sell out by like 11am.   They have a lot of choices but I went with The Fairfax and added avocado. I didn't want to add bacon, didn't want to feel overly full. They make it for you on the spot. Sriracha sauce thing they have in the sandwich is great. I thought I wasn't going to like the caramelized onions but I was wrong. It is a filling sandwich. The eggs are fluffy and salted. Really good egg. It is on a brioche bun, which is not my favorite, but the bread held up well and didn't fall apart.   They have fresh squeezed oj but it was too expensive for me ($5+). It looked really good though.   The communal table was dirty bc people are slobs.   Friendly service.

c8HNOcSSYvpKD-5TFWIDpg.text: EGGSLUT ! While very delicious i can never return. A couple hours after eating the best breakfast sandwich i've ever had, the duration of my vegas trip was absolutely ruined. I spent the next 2 days held up in my hotel restroom suffering from the worst food poisoning i've ever had. Diners beware :x

7I8Zr84MHCmGzeuPB7XGVA.text: Came here around 10am and the line was around the corner!  It is more of a good quality fast food place with bar seating around the perimeter and other seating across the way.  The food was delicious!  We shared the egg slut and also a breakfast sandwich.  The egg slut is a coddled egg services over the creamiest mashed potato topped with salt and chives.  The sandwich already had ketchup on the brioche bun which was so soft and made the sandwich almost melt in your mouth.  The food was reasonably priced for being in a hotel.  My one complaint would be that I asked for a glass of water and was told they only sold it by the bottle which I paid almost $5 for.  I would have thought that tap water should always be available for free!  Anyway except for the water issue, would highly recommend coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TWoq2nrFnYgOm1hcsVnm0g.text: Everything was delicious! Love the fact that they even offered gluten-free options. I got the fairfax with arugula salad instead of the brioche buns. The eggs were sooo soft and creamy. It was perfectly seasoned. The acidity from the red wine vinaigrette really balanced out the creamy eggs. This was seriously the best scrambled eggs I've ever had.   We also got the cheeseburger, bacon egg & cheese, as well as the sausage egg & cheese. The winner was the cheeseburger! Looking back, we should've just ordered 3 of the cheeseburger.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese, Cheeseburger, and Sausage, Egg &amp; Cheese

sFCEJMTRj-VcW1AgAWLlLg.text: This is a little over priced but not bad. We got the cheeseburger. The cheeseburger was good, it tastes a little sweet than what cheeseburgers usually taste like but it was still good. The pickles added a good flavor to it to.  We also got the slut. I would recommend getting extra bread, it's free! It was good and had the good amount of salty. Make sure to mix it up good!  The orange juice is freshly squeezed and yummy! But get it only if you don't mind paying $5

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The slut
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TxqrT7WUn29bpHBQXKQvww.text: You just left Marquee, pizza is unappealing for some odd reason and you're still totally drunk. Come to Eggslut.  I didn't know egg can taste so good but it can and it did. Ofc it will be overpriced but it's Vegas. You already spent 120% more on that drink you ordered at the bar which is mainly ice so why weigh your options?  I ordered myself a Fairfax with Avocado because I needed to let everyone know I'm from California. What I got was soft, Golden scrambled eggs with melted cheddar cheese tucked inside a glistening Brioche bun. For the kick, the Sriracha Mayo does it's job well.   Just writing this review got me hungry.  A little warning though, IT IS MESSY. When you put scrambled anything, especially perfectly cooked scrambled eggs, everything falls apart very quickly. My advice is to use the paper wrapping to catch any egg and use a fork to just eat it normally after you devour your sandwich.   Oh...their Wagyu burger is good but honestly, go for the eggs. They're named Eggslut for a reason.

mXfEBtlH8WsuU2Zq7UHWtQ.text: Been wanting to try this place for years. Finally! I've been to the Los Angeles location and never got to try it because the line was so long. When I visited Las Vegas though the line was decent and moving by quickly. I ordered the slut, the fair fax and the bacon and egg. Boy oh boy!! It was out of this world. Service was great also! Wish there was one in Orange County

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1z6atae-DowhI4-4aWdeEw.text: Eggslut is dope. We've been in LA, but were elated to find one in the Cosmo and to get the chance to have it again!  The line is long. Get over it, it's an awesome breakfast and the line moves relatively fast - don't let it intimidate you because the food is worth it!  I've had the egg sandwiches before, but my wife convinced me to go for the "Slut". A little awkward to order ("I'd like a slut"), but so delicious that it made up for it. Perfectly coddled egg sitting on delicious potatoes to spread on perfectly toasted baguettes... just do it.  I also got a cold brew here ($5), but it's a better deal if you drink it and get one to go (free refills!).

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut

1b4PZCSzPJarc9pD1_iF1Q.text: RUN HERE. DON'T WALK. DO NOT PASS GO.   This. Place. Is. So. Good. I'm adding to the hype. I can't help it. It lives up to it. Order two sandwiches. Not because you need two - but because you'll want them.   5 stars on the Fairfax sandwich. I added Italian sausage which turned out to be an incredible decision. The fluffy eggs, the chives, the aioli, the herbed sausage with a slight touch of heat, the grilled brioche bun, the cheese.... It's all enough to make you want to dig for the little bits of egg that escape the sandwich and land in the bag. No shame. It's that good. This is the stuff of your egg sandwich dreams. Dreams you didn't even know you had.  BRAVE THE LINE. Trust me. I almost waited in line again for a second sandwich and I started out partially annoyed of the 20 minute line. After my first sandwich, I almost voluntarily jumped back in line and would have if we didn't have plans.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax with added Italian sausage. 5 stars!!

m6fgBzvMIlYy3_9QCFi1lw.text: I feel like eggslut is one of the few decent places on the strip. The line can get long but it does move at a decent pace. You wait in line to order and then the line pretty much continues for you to pick up. The seating is limited but the Cosmo has an Alice in Wonderland themed lounge area right besides the restaurant for you to eat if you don't want to-go. I think the highlight of the sandwiches is actually the bread which is really soft and helps add to the sandwich as a whole. My friend and I also shared the slut which is like a potato-y mix with egg. Pretty tasty and reminded us of a warm potato salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tOCD-OQ2Yu0EwB_WIwz6vg.text: After a way too long night, then having to pack everything up in the morning, I was dying for some food. I had heard lots on how good Eggslut is from the social medias, and while I have fallen out of love with eggs as I've gotten older, it sounded like it would hit the spot.  Was a bit disappointed to not find any Filipino food on the menu, but that was just me setting up my own expectations. The wait wasn't long, and the prices were fine (except for $5 for a pop).  I decided on the Fairfax, their only sandwich with soft scrambled eggs on it, and added turkey sausage.  Wow, what a bomb of flavor. It was a tad on the salty side, but the creamy eggs and big soft brioche buns was an amazing combination. It wasn't greasy or heavy at all, despite the amount of eggs, cheese and meat involved. Almost of all of us devoured our sandwiches. One of our crew said they preferred McDonald's to this, but I think that guy just hated eggs more than me.  In fact, I think this made me kind of like eggs again.  Is this the ultimate breakfast sandwich spot? With the amount of care put into the bread and eggs, which are really the stars here, it's hard to argue.

8Kg-NYLHUqAak9mI5ROIGQ.text: The Slut is delicious! I'm so glad I arrived early (645am), the line gets long quick. The eggs are cooked perfectly and the chives in the slut really enhances the flavor. Not really sure what's going on with the crusty little breadsticks they serve with the slut but I wasn't a fan of them. However, everything else about the dish was awesome! My sandwich was really good also

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon egg and cheese
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DIelLgSzRG6QRxicgFlEkA.text: Greasy satisfying hangover type breakfast food that is a must have if staying at the cosmo! The breakfast hit the spot

FZhcggTNTi_rtf8D-UB9DQ.text: Wow wow wow okay Eggslut we came today 7/21/19 and I must say this was absolutely amazing and worth the wait!  Between standing in line ordering and waiting for the food it was a good 45 mins but I would have waited even longer! This was my first time! I ordered the Fairfax on a gluten free bun and also Goucho so good! The eggs were so fluffy and full of so much flavor! I will deff be back! Thank you Eggslut for the awesome experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gaucho
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yUZ1q-wxfuM1Nfn3X1Q5Lg.text: I once again made the trek to Eggslut with my family and drew many of the same conclusions I made when dining here at Christmas.   But I've downgraded them because of the unsanitary conditions they expect people to dine at. While the food was good / fresh, the tables and chairs were filthy. During the 45 minutes or so it took to order and get food, not once were the tables or counters cleaned / wiped down. We managed to find a small table, but it had dried egg yolk smeared all over the tables and chairs. Trash was left sitting on tables.   The Cosmo is supposed to be high class. Sadly, this is anything but. I noted the cleanliness last time and they responded - but clearly they were just trying to appease a criticism on yelp.   Original Review: Is the food good? Yes. Is it worth waiting in a 45 minute line? Probably not. Eggslut is a trendy place that's worth visiting at least once. But you're probably better off going at an "off time" to avoid the long lines.   For the price paid per sandwich, you could get a complete breakfast at most other places. You're really paying a premium for its trendiness.   I went with my family and waited close to an hour. While the food was ultimately fine, none of the tables had been cleaned, despite numerous people having dined on them previously. It really cheapened the experience for everyone.   Conclusion: Come to say you had it. Don't come with your family thinking you'll be sitting down for a quiet breakfast.

1qe3dl5OmpuFv4fDWKLL_g.text: Not bad, not amazing. The name is fun, the line often wraps down the hall. We got there right when they opened so only had a short 5 minute wait. The eating area has a fun Alice in Wonderland theme. We both had the sausage, egg and cheese sandwich. The bun is really good, the sandwich is a good size and it tasted good overall, nothing spectacular. We also ordered a side of biscuits. They were a little harder than expected, so was the butter. But the honey butter was delicious...could have eaten it by itself  I'd go again if there wasn't a long line.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LwetwKsPF84NF37xzxD64Q.text: Super popular spot. Line can take upwards of 45min on a busy weekend. Have tried another location for their classic breakfast sandwich (sausage, egg, cheese) which I didn't think was worth the upcharge ($7.50).  Today we were no fools and decided to try the FAIRFAX and the Eggslut. Fairfax fluffy scrambled eggs was totally worth a try with a bit of kick from sriracha mayo topping. Price of $7.50 felt more worth it for the uniqueness of the cook. Eggslut surprised us as you get a real explosion of salt once you hit the potato puree. Still a bit pricey for the quantity at $9.  Worth a visit if you haven't tried but not sure I'd wait 45min again especially when there is tons to eat in The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas. Recommend waiting for a counter seat to watch the cooking magic happen.

aamjVUYwTdbQIj_w4blAYA.text: I LOVE Eggslut. I always make sure to grab a quick bite here whenever I'm in town. It's fast-casual so you get your food in little plates and then find seating around the area.   Over time I've found my favorite things on the menu:  -The "Slut" with extra baguette (you get 5 pieces instead of 3 so you can dip more!) -Homemade buttermilk biscuit with honey butter (sooo good) -The house salad (I'm not a salad person but I really enjoyed having this on the side to balance the meal out)  Ive tried the sandwiches and they're just not very impressive. Honestly would rather get a breakfast sandwich from mcds over these lol. But try the Slut and you won't regret it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut &amp; Buttermilk Biscuit

78xJEEjIdbIbFWQdYoM6yQ.text: Hubby and I checked this out because a friend swore by it. It was good, but I didn't really feel it was with the line. I had the slut. It was okay. I got it because it sounded a little unusual. It was, but not necessarily in a good way. Sort of seemed like a poached egg with mashed potatoes. Hubby had the burger. It was pretty tasty.

lKdeg3fZxFUOhq4iijpePw.text: I really really really wanted to like this place but sadly I dont think I would come back. Its just WAY too overpriced for something you can make at home. My boyfriend got the burger and I got the fairfax with bacon ($14 for a breakfast sandwich)   Anyways, my sandwich was not hot and the eggs didnt taste fresh. There was also waaaay too much sauce in the sandwich that all I tastes was the sauce. I also didnt like the bread, it also did not taste fresh. My boyfriends burger was better than mine, but it was really small. I swear he ate it in like two bites. Idk maybe i went on a bad day?

gMH8ucnIHfzpiymQR62doQ.text: Just what you want in the early morning hours! I've had better biscuits, and the "Slut" isn't for me (for taste or name), but that Fairfax Sandwich- omg, dreamy!! Warm brioche bun with sriracha mayo, soft scrambled eggs, onion, cheese. Still thinking about it a week later.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax Sandwich
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buttermilk Biscuit

ab3ZvYU0nRGmY-7deEUHGg.text: Fast service once you order, line can be long depending on the time of day. It would have been 4 stars but the Buttermilk Biscuit was cold, didn't even feint at fully heating it up. If you aren't getting a fresh biscuit (which I assume is in the morning rush) then skip it. Selected the Egg Salad Sandwich as my main entree since it is one of the healthier options (the Fairfax looked good too but not as much greens). Bun was toasted nice and a nice contrast to the cold egg salad sandwich. The flavor was robust without coming across as heavy. The mustard was light, and would be appealing to even those who don't care for mustard.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Salad Sandwich and Buttermilk Biscuit

CB1TgouwJylrXObcrTC9TA.text: I was actually craving this, so didn't mind standing in the long line since this location is actually more convenient than the Grand Central Market location for me.  Although quite tasty, I would have to say that it's no big deal.  The brioche is key as good bread makes any sandwich better.  The Bacon, Egg, and Cheese was just okay.  The star of this sandwich is the bread.  The cheeseburger was disappointing now that gourmet burgers are easy to find, especially with Shake Shacks all over the West Coast now.  The meat was unremarkable, and my egg wasn't medium as advertised, so the yolk didn't run.  It made for a pretty dry burger.  The Fairfax was probably the best sandwich of the day since the soft scrambled egg was smooth and creamy.    Overall it's just not worth the wait and price.  Serving sizes are just too small for the price, and it's not like they have many options on the menu to fill up on fries and sides.  My 4 year old daughter was able to finish her sandwich without any trouble.  That shouldn't be enough food for any adult, no matter how light an eater you are.

YPdSdYvWGUfSuFloBrPJHg.text: Meh. I don't understand the hype for this place. We lined up pretty early on a Sunday morning, so we didn't have to wait long. Otherwise, I would have been really annoyed because the food was so-so. I had the bacon, egg & cheese sandwich. The bacon is nice and thick and the brioche bread is buttery. Maybe I just didn't order the right thing, but I was really underwhelmed. If you see a long line at this place and are debating whether to stand in line for 30+ minutes, don't feel back if you decide to skip it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, egg &amp; cheese

nFkF_T8s_dg0B7-zjCm7mA.text: Long line, decent prices by LV standards, good sandwich, fast service. Check it out if you want a hearty handheld breakfast.

bby5T5PD82T5NXynkEJXvQ.text: Don't let their straightforward concept fool you. Just because they serve mainly eggs doesn't mean it's not worth the try.  I got the fair fax and it was divine! Sure the eggs could Use more seasoning but the buns just melted in my mouth. Their concept is genius! Breakfast all day! Who cares when you're in Vegas anyways.

P5pKNvpFgc-HQSnNZ2eurg.text: Judging by the lines, this place really doesn't need any more reviews. I just want to put in a plug for their fresh squeeze OJ which was the best part of my meal. The least impressive item on the menu was the slut - bread was hard but not crunchy at the same time and the potato egg puree was a weird consistency. Can't go wrong with any of the breakfast sandwiches. Stick with those.

1EEsRSomUTr1_KEvmkoE1w.text: The best egg sandwich I have ever had! I would highly recommend the slut. There is always a wait but it is worth it.

efERmbhoaA9eh361fwCleA.text: You know, because the eggs are over easy. Get it? I just did.  Memorable name aside, oh my goodness, the food speaks for itself! If you LOVE eggs, you MUST go. If you kinda like eggs, you must go. If you hate eggs? Enh, I'm going to go out on a limb and say you will should go. My husband hates eggs with any kind of runny yolk, and even he loves the food.  Why? Because everything is SO GOOD! I tend to get the Eggslut (coddled on top fo mashed potatoes in a jar, comes with oval toast slices). Sometimes I dip the toast straight in, sometimes I mix it up and then dip the toast, it's yummy either way.  The bacon and egg sandwich is also heavenly.  I would just suggest getting there when they open if it's Friday-Sunday, otherwise you will wait a long time. Weekdays is no line morning, afternoon, or evening, but that's just my experience.

bd60u2IXtv8YdbPHFC2DJg.text: February 25, 2019 Monday - 10:15 AM for breakfast 4 Adults   Atmosphere - 4 stars Food - 5 stars Service - 5 stars  Background - I have been wanting to go to this place for a very long time.  Atmosphere - Very basic.  A long line to get to the register.  Then a wait for them to call you name.  Some seating in the place and additional in the common area.  We got lucky and were able to sit together.  Food   Drink - Modelo Especial Chelada, a very large can.  First time having a chelada, it was like having a beer version of a bloody Mary.  I loved it!    Food - Of course I had to have the slut.  A coddled egg on top of a potato puree served in a narrow mason jar with three slices of toasted baguettes.  Using the baguettes to dip into the yoke and potatoes was s heavenly. Ten plus dollars makes for a special treat.  Our cashier told us they were small so I order the biscuit too.  The honey butter was not to sweet but made the biscuit so special.  Service - With four people ordering and not sure what everyone ordered we paid our bill.  After our name was called we determined we missed a slut, but the food matched the receipt.  Thankfully we did not have to get back in line.  Our cashier used the second register to get us the third slut and quickly the food came out.  Future - I hope so.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. whisk chandelier
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chairs setup for the evening
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. logo

a6Lpl0UHOq4bCm1mvmtPdg.text: I loved egg slut.  The name is catchy, the open kitchen, and counter service vibe is cool.  The menu is small but has some creative options.  We saw the long lines the day before so we headed there the next day early around 8 am.  The line was manageable and moved fast.  Unfortunately they were sold out of the steak sandwich which was odd because it was only 8am but they must have sold so many the day before.  I went for the fairfrax: cage-free soft scrambled eggs, chives, caramelized onions, cheddar cheese, sriracha mayo in a warm brioche bun. Added bacon and avocado.  It was everything I wanted it to be.  Soft scrambled eggs make all the difference.  Sriracha mayo tops it off, onions kinda lost...   Not 5 stars because 2 sandwiches without a side was pricey.  Added an OJ and a $10 canned spiked coffee, and breakfast was $50.

b-zdfQqzxXcoStBelWLdHw.text: I honestly don't see what all the hype is about.  The bun and meat to egg ratio just didn't do it for me. The Long line that moves faster than it takes for your order to be ready was surprising. All the napkin holders were empty. And  tables not wiped down. If you want to eat here it's very tricky to get a table. It doesn't help when people insist on using the hot commodity of chairs for their laptop bag and aren't interested in giving it up. The price wasn't too bad for what you get. I guess if you need something to fill your belly till lunch and don't want to go to a sit-down table service place and pay a lot, then I guess this is a good option. We arrived on a Monday around 10 am.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and egg and sausage and egg. $28.00

T0wPpON-GkWsQ6RaLjtwVA.text: I'd heard about this chain a couple years ago and figured if I ever got near one I wanted to try it. While I was in town I was going through my feed and noticed there was this one at the Cosmopolitan. I got up a little early the next morning on a weekday and walked down the strip about 8:30 or so to check it out.  Line didn't look bad, oh, there's a few more people right around the wall from the entrance, okay no big deal, is that a hallway behind the wall, oh crap are there going to be a million people in line down that hallway, yikes! Eh, it wasn't bad, the line was about halfway down the hallway behind the place, and I wanted to try it, so I got in line. If it didn't move, I could always bail. It moved slowly for the first few minutes, but picked up steam. I think the whole thing from line to finish eating was a little more than 30 minutes.  I got one of the biscuits, and the egg, bacon, and cheese sandwich, hold the chipotle ketchup or whatever because I ain't one of those weirdo's that eat ketchup on my eggs. I was concerned the sandwich might be dry, but the medium egg had enough yoke to make it a non issue. Short wait for food. I thought the sandwich was really good, everything seemed really fresh, the bacon and egg itself tasted the best. The biscuit with the honey butter was good to, but I wouldn't spend the $4 to get one again. I thought the prices were okay (we're in Vegas people, nothing is cheap, quit bitching about food prices) and was glad I made the effort. Next time I find myself in Vegas, if the opportunity is there, I would eat here again.

XBCrMb901Vp6CWx5PyxwwQ.text: I love their Fairfax sandwich. It's filled with so much goodness: eggs, sriracha mayo, chives, and caramelized onions. So delicious!! I wish Eggslut were open later so I could go there for a late night snack or dinner. I guess the only bad part is that the food falls out of the sandwich. But, it falls out because there are so many good ingredients in the sandwich - so the con definitely outweighs the pro for me!  Affordable prices. Sometimes, there's a long line. I only waited 5 minutes to get served. The service has always been very friendly.  There are tables to sit at or you can take it to go. I wish I could make an egg sandwich like this! I can't wait to go back and eat another Fairfax.

uQBYR4FxfhNOOao_8S-6aA.text: It's set up as an order counter and you pick up your food and grab a table or head out. We ordered the slut and the sausage egg and cheese- both were delicious but I'd say the slut was the clear winner! Very friendly staff- quick- pretty inexpensive for the strip- and very yummy food! Must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TFqmGuTkqF3IxHaNfaWETw.text: Soooooo freakin delicious!!!! I was too scared to try out the signature slut but the fairfax sandwich add bacon and avacado was one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've had.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax sandwich add bacon and avacado

tARB-l8Lsyu7Tdn-mFCzzw.text: I have been dying to try this place and finally got the opportunity while in Vegas. This location is inside the Cosmopolitan Hotel. The line was pretty long on a Tuesday afternoon but moved fairly quickly. I ordered a sausage, egg & cheese sandwich which comes on a brioche bun with a freshly squeezed orange juice. It was absolutely amazing! I cannot wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing!

l4PcJpWubsNWJRBkqwSwhw.text: We decided to wait in line which took forever! The cashier was chatting it up with the group in front of us even though the line was insane. The food was good though. I got the slut...it was salty but I like salty. They definitely need to give you more baguette slices. I would totally visit again but only if the line is short.

ZYOaiYFaRM7-r4HGRqMZdg.text: Eggslut actually changed how we cook at home. We were told to go and try and eggslut and discovered that amazing world of sous vide cooking. I was skeptical that a runny egg with mashed potatoes could be this good and was so pleasantly impressed that we bought a sous vide to use at home to make the dish in our kitchen. The line can be intimidating at this small spot but don't let that deter you from getting your very own eggslut. The breakfast sandwiches are excellent as well but be brave and get the eggslut even if you don't think you'd like it, you'll be happy you did.

c6xDWPkuWbAgQmFMbzHrCg.text: Super wanted to love everything. I got the fairfax sooo tasty soft scramble eggs on point and the turkey sausage was really flavorful. Brioche tasted old maybe it was because it was 11 am? Spouse got the slut -- idk what the fanfare is about it tasted like baby food (would give it a 3/10). Poor guy was so hungry because the portion was so tiny. He was planning his next meal as soon as he saw the portion. Will try the LA location for sure just will not order the slut.

9mGtgB-rURpgUKmJbx5vQA.text: I've heard of this place before back in the Bay Area, California but never tried it. Luckily, Eggslut was less than a mile away from where we were staying at the Aria hotel. It's located inside the Cosmopolitan and there's always a line wrapped around the restaurant. But don't be too discouraged! The line moves quick and you'll be able to place your order in no time. Best part, you don't have to wait too long for the food as well!  I ordered the Fairfax sandwich (it comes with scrambled eggs, chives, grilled onions and a Siracha mayo) and my boyfriend ordered the cheeseburger with a fried egg. Both were absolutely delicious! The eggs in the Fairfax sandwich was super fluffy and you can add bacon/turkey sausage/avocado for an additional cost. For me, the sandwich was very flavorful and adding bacon or sausage would be too salty for me. We also ordered the freshly squeezed orange juice ($5) Fresh and creamy!   It is a little overpriced for the orange juice and sandwiches (we paid a little over $30 for two sandwiches, one orange juice and one bottled water) but it's super worth it. It's a good portion and it fills up your stomach!

2_2AuV4D_2_Qc8VUgxfTaQ.text: My first time at Eggslut was in LA! When I found out Eggslut was in Las Vegas Cosmo I was ready to come here and eat! I must say its a unique breakfast place with sandwiches. It's a very small menu so do not expect to look at a variety of breakfast items. I always order the first breakfast item on their menu. $8 for sandwich $5 for orange juice. The line can be very long but I came in around brunch time. The service is great, location is easy to find, and your sandwich is fresh!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange juice
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Busy Afternoon!!!

L918kQesGBPseOo4k4V2HQ.text: The food is delicious and the long line went quickly.  However..... no excuse for poor treatment.  We went to the EggSlut in Vegas at The Cosmopolitian.  Most of the seating is far from where the food comes out.  You have to listen for your name.  When our order came up (signature slut) my name was called but the other half of meal was not ready.  They wanted me to take what was ready and keep coming back to check on rest of order.    I explained I would just wait for both food items so we could eat together.  Weird.... I guess I was considered a problem person for ask for this because others got their bacon sandwiches before me!  I waited patiently 5 min to get 2 items so my husband and I could eat TOGETHER.  :(

mT9IAGLcE7C2UZ29szJ4vg.text: We didn't know where to go for breakfast on our first morning in Vegas and we were not disappointed in our choice to eat here. It was a Saturday morning and the line was around the corner but we decided to wait anyway. The line moved fairly fast and it was only about 20-30 minutes.  The people were very friendly and the chef was trying to pose in the background while we were taking pictures. We enjoyed watching them prepare the food and they joked around a lot with us.   The main critique would be a lack of places to sit when you get your food. It's a fairly small place with only 20 seats or so. When we found a new place outside to sit, the food was worth it. We got the fairfax, the slut, and a biscuit along with some coffee. The fairfax was very good. The bread was fresh and light and the eggs were very well prepared. The Sriracha mayo was concerning at first but subtle and well done. The slut came with instructions but with the bread was very good. It was a combination of mashed potato and smooth cream egg. I know, it doesn't sound good but it was great. The biscuit was also very good and I'd recommend it but when I saw it cost $5, I assumed it would be at least two biscuits and not just one. Coffee was also just ok. Not great but I didn't expect it to be.  Overall, I would rate Eggslut very highly. The food was fantastic and that's the most important part. I would definitely eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hb5DfAwdiCcqQwDFm00-LA.text: Had the slut and the burger with bacon. $30 in total. Burger and slut was good but not so amazing where I would come back.

wFLDgoQZp9VILRh7amyhhA.text: My husband loved his omelet but the only thing I tried was the chocolate chip cookie. It was one of the best cookies I'd ever tried. It SHOULD be for $4.50. Happily it was worth every penny.

ScAuP2vZHb7r4Q9BtpkNvg.text: It was good but I'm only gonna give it 3 stars for the following reasons- It's frikkin expensive even for Vegas. $4.50 for an 8-oz coffee was ridonkulous. The slut's egg yolk was nearly hard, which didn't much mix well with the potato.  If you're gonna charge that much for it, the eggs better be perfect, and it was far from that. So yeah, not bad but not great.

PLNrbzyQs9Esv1NpGa5TGQ.text: Meh. While their goods are high quality. It remains a bit to be desired.   We were able to try their famous eggslut, the cookie, and 2 of their sandwiches: sausage egg and cheese + egg salad sandwich. Flavors were good but nothing to be excited about. Nothing too extravagant and something you can make at home more less than a quarter of the price.   I suppose the hype was how simple it was. However an $8 breakfast sandwich? No thanks. I will say the Eggslut was a nice take on the poached side of the egg. Cooked sous vide, it was delicate and fresh. But again, for $10? No thanks.   The wait times for our food remained long. However, it is understandable since they cook every one to order. Still, nearly 20 minutes for a few orders is really pushing it.   Overall just ok, but go elsewhere if you're looking for a cheap and quick breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our orders after a nearly 20 minute wait. Just ok. Very expensive for what they are serving.

hfRQaF7WcYIFLv1ClVKCeA.text: Decent but I'm not sure if the food is necessarily worth the hype and wait time. 4 stars for food, but that combined with the wait time pushes it lower to 3 for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KFGEIFGtrWhnEGBojd0FNQ.text: Swung by here while waiting for my room to be ready. Even at 1:30 there were about a dozen people in line ahead of me.   Ordered the cheeseburger with the egg over hard though the menu said over medium. Runny eggs - not my thing. Anyhow, good juicy burger. Messy so grab some napkins. It's a hangover cure for sure. I suspect it's been ordered before with that in mind.   Took about 15 minutes to get my burger. Got my warm salted chocolate chip cookie first. Maybe the over hard make it take longer. Couple of people after me received their order first. No matter! We're in Vegas so we have until the wee hours to hit the town.   Burger was $10 plus $2 for avocado - my choice for the avo. Burger came alone. No fries, chips, etc. Yet a decent deal especially for Vegas.

i_Fq72K7QrXuZ9i7i82arw.text: We had the slut, fairfax, biscuit and lastly the bacon, egg and cheese. It was good, but the slut was salty. The eggslut is in the cosmopolitan and if you park more than 1 hour then you have to pay for parking. All of the casinos are making you pay for parking now!!  Agh!  Also, it was $35.  Kind of expensive for egg sandwiches. Otherwise, staff was friendly and fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty biscuit, but it was$5.  Wow!  Expensive. For this price, the biscuit needs to be made out of gold.
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The slut, egg cooked perfectly but was salty.
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Typical, egg, bacon and cheese sandwich.

JpKXgy5UCLhm7gy4nLdNVg.text: Eggslut is by far one of my favorite breakfast places. First of all, the name is amazing. As someone who loves eggs, I can relate. The menu is very simple with limited choices, so it makes it easy to decide. All of the meals are delicious so you really sang go wrong. The sandwiches can be gooey and messy, so be warned. But it's worth it.   Yeah, there's long lines. Yeah, there might not be a lot of seats available. But again, worth it.

ToEe_uUhFtAQVjIj0jzKBw.text: So amazingly yummy, I can't even describe my happiness after eating this. The Slut is to die for. I need another. Probably the best hang over food ever!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lovTcivzwkMJKVKvZcWm8g.text: My husband and I have been dying to get back to the Cosmpolitan for Eggslut! We absolutely loved it before and I am not even a huge egg fan. Our favorite is the sausage/egg/cheese. Unfortunately, we had it yesterday and today and both times it was not what we remembered. The bread was cold and not fresh-textured. The sausage was lukewarm and the egg wasn't hot enough to melt the cheese. There seemed to be an odd ratio of sauce as well, which is also cold. The whole sandwich feels like separate components brought together, rather than a cohesive unit. It was extremely disappointing because the price is high so the previous quality made up for that. This time I could only stand half the sandwich which wasn't a terrific value by any means. I understand any restaurant having an off day. That's why we went back today. Sad to say, I'm not sure I have it in me to be disappointed again. I hate that a former favorite has to be eliminated from my list of must-haves.

MKyNgcTw9ZEjHI-5OQPBcA.text: This place is now a must stop every time we are in Vegas. The line is usually pretty long so expect a minimum of at least a 15 minute wait. The food is defiantly worth it. They could have more seating available.

J6f_oymeqYKHiEgBeLWU3Q.text: Quick and easy spot to grab a breakfast bite. Got the fairfax sammy + bacon, and it was mmm mmm goood. Pillowy eggs on a soft brioche bun, a lil cheddar and chives, plus that crispy bacon and boom... I was back!  Just don't go during peak breakfast hour or the line will be noodling throughout the hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FZvl_ztVWg1RCfpB9313Iw.text: Delish & fast. Line looked long but went super smoothly. The sauce on the breakfast sandwiches is magical

TRDys5LTX1hKP4tnyVReSg.text: Got the Egg Slut and the Fairfax.   The Egg Slut was basically an egg over potato puree, with three thin slices of baguette. Not flavorful and not filling. Not recommended.  The Fairfax was good - the eggs were very creamy and buttery, the brioche bun was decent if a tad dry.  They didn't have tap water available, for that you have to walk 30 feet to a nearby bar, which I thought was odd.

ez64o4ZetZzSTAfu26EDCw.text: I have been wanting to try this place for a long time! Nothing says delicious breakfast like a perfectly made egg sandwich. The place is a bit small with limited seating area, I believe that's why the lines are unnecessarily long most of the time, but it is definitely a popular place despite the small size.  I ordered an eggsalad sandwich, for a quick pick me up before heading out for meetings. I had a hard finding an empty seat for just myself , waited for a few minutes for someone else to finish up first.  The egg salad was creamy , almost melts in my mouth with every bite! Worth every dollar! The pretzel bread adds a bit of a special taste to the sandwich ! Definitely a must try place for the food, and even more so just to try it because why wouldn't you want to try a restaurant named "eggslut"

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggsalad sandwich mmmm

74b9fxUxvAcM8MCma08fTQ.text: Eggslut...you had me eating every last crumb! This is located inside the Cosmopolitan. We came here for breakfast and waited in a pretty long line. They have the menu in a couple spots so you can already start drooling over what you want. My husband has had Eggslut before, but for me this was a first.   I ordered the Bacon, egg, and cheese. It was literally the best breakfast sandwich I have had. Whatever sauce they used is what made the sandwich. The bacon was crisp and the bun was fluffy yet firm. My husband ordered the Gaucho sandwich which he says they don't have over where we live. He loved it as well and said it beats out all the other stuff he has tried.  They were quick with orders and also serve beer! Which is a good tip since your in Vegas and I am sure you might want one in the morning. The water is also a little cheaper than the surrounding vendors.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese

idL8m6P2Y2p9GlUp0zjB1Q.text: I was really excited to try Eggslut for the first time because I always see people post pictures of the food on social media and rave about it. At around 8 in the morning there was already a line, but we still got our order in fast. I ordered the Slut and my husband got the Fairfax with turkey sausage. I would say everything was.. descent. I mean it was pretty good but I felt like I was overhyped, the slut is like a poached egg over a sort of a potato puree which was good but probably not something I'd eat again. My husband's sandwich was okay too, the eggs were well made for scrambled but we both didn't care much for the sausage of the brioche buns. Aesthetically, the presentation of the food and restaurant is nice, great music, and the line moves fast but overall wasn't as impressed as I'd hope to be.. especially since for everything plus two coffees was around 35-40 bucks. Would still be willing to try something else and give it a second try though.

k4bX8-1sehlspdRJ37Q1KQ.text: As good as the last time I went (LA location at the Grand Central Market). This time I heeded my own advice and ordered the same sandwich (Fairfax) but added bacon and avocado because the brioche bun literally melts in your mouth (as well as the perfectly scrambled eggs!). So glad I did and it is possibly the most delicious breakfast sandwich in the world.  I came here on a weekday (Tues) around 10am and waited about 15 minutes. The cashier is the bottleneck (they only have one) as the kitchen turned around my order very quickly. I didn't have to wait more than two minutes for them to call my name.  I'm definitely coming back tomorrow!

tuqYKamL4DslJKDbCi2FqQ.text: Absolute perfect place to begin the morning after an evening of gambling and debauchery... Egg sandwich perfection within walking distance from more gambling and alcohol--the perfect fuel for the day. LOL.  *There almost always seems to be a line, but it moves fairly quickly and it is well worth it. That brioche bun, those chives, those damn eggs.... OMG.   I'll be back...

xv9I8Yhrvtm8CgX_gQPotA.text: Love the branding. I tried the slut and while very unique I found it so salty!!  Line usually wraps around the corner and down the hall.  The guy taking orders kept the line moving and then it really stalled out waiting for our food. Turns out our ticket got skipped.   While not the best experience I'd probably still recommend it and maybe try a sandwich next time.

XRpkB4ujZ2yChE7viUwWfQ.text: Sausage egg and cheese sandwich ($8.50)  * house made turkey sausage, over medium egg, cheddar and honey mustard aioli on a brioche bun  Slut ($10.50) * coddled egg on top of potato puree, cooked in a glass jar topped with grey salt and chives served with toasted baguette.   - So, so good. There was a long line-up but it was worth the wait. The sandwich was tasty. I like the seasoning on the house made turkey sausage and the aioli. The must order is the Slut - the egg was perfectly cooked in sous vide which kept the yolk in a custard texture. The grey salt and chives finishes it well. Mix it all together and top it on the baguette and you'll have a perfect bite

Nidyf_mbNRdSer0EC2lUXA.text: I loooove Eggslut! It's located on the second floor of The Cosmopolitan and it seems like there's always a line, but the food really is worth standing in line for! Plus the line moves pretty fast anyways. My girlfriend and I shared the Fairfax sandwich (with avocado and bacon added) and a "slut", and this was enough to fill both of us up! Both were so yummy that we came back and ordered the same exact thing the next day! :)  The Fairfax is honestly the best breakfast sandwich I have ever had! It's scrambled eggs and chives, cheddar cheese, caramelized onions, and sriracha mayo all on a brioche bun. & The avocado and bacon made for a delicious addition to it!  The Slut is a coddled egg (similar to a poached egg) on top of what I would call a mashed potato puree. It's served in a glass jar and you mix it all up and spread it on the baguettes it's served with. Different, but good! You can ask for extra baguettes when ordering and it's no charge.   The drinks (coffee and oj) are definitely overpriced, but good. The orange juice was obviously fresh and tasted just like an orange. You can also ask for a refill of your coffee, and it's free!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fairfax + avocado and bacon! Yum!

hA6pHp9SkhRUxQrbuuSVGA.text: "E" heard about this place somewhere and wanted to try it for breakfast. Turns out that we were in the neighborhood at lunchtime and decided "why not?". The line was long and down a dim hallway that was 10 to 15 degrees above room temperature; we removed many layers while we waited. We all ordered Fairfax Sandwiches + turkey sausage and got an arugula salad to share. Seating was a bit of an issue, but we did find a spot.  The salad was simple and very good. The sandwiches were awesome! Be sure to get two napkins.

UARK2diJCeuEnslHFTvxJg.text: Decided To Grab A Quick Breakfast.  This Restaurant Was Walking Distance From Where I Was Staying.  The Lines Are Pretty Long.   The Cheeseburger Could Of Used More Flavor.  I Also Think They Use Frozen Patties.   I'm Not Much Of A Fan.   Wouldn't Patronize Again.  On To The Next.

4wgBpICyeKu2APhou8QtRg.text: Giving 4 stars for the slut!  Everything else was standard (breakfast sandwiches).  Don't get the biscuit  I might try the burger next time and slather the slut all over it since they don't give u enough bread to eat the coddled egg/potato mashup  Lines are long. Come early.

4r2g6jLN6BLTSM_FWbo4dg.text: Wow oh wow! Went here this morning and had the best breakfast! Get the "slut", I was a little iffy to try it but I was very impressed! So delicious! I wish they had one of these in California because I would be there everyday!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage egg and cheese sandwich. The &#34;slut&#34;. And a mimosa! On top of that I love the view!

beHTOk6k3owRu-4cOsLy6Q.text: Eggslut!!  The original's from LA,  That's where they got their fame. Their specialty is obvious, It's in their name.   They're in the Cosmo, Right off the strip. Their meals are so good, And worth the trip.  The lines are long, But goes pretty quick.  Is it the Slut or sandwiches? Just take your pick.  The Slut is coddled egg, On a potato puree.  Not my favorite, had a taste, And gave it away.  I like the Fairfax, It's scrambled with cheese. The burger is awesome, Make it a double, please.  The bacon and cheese is simple, And taste pretty good. Egg lovers unite! Come here, you should.  They're closed at night, And that's my tip. They also have delicious cookie, Made with chocolate chip.    I'll be back for more,  It's a matter of time. I'm a fan of Eggslut,  Now that's the bottom line.

4e9xg6g399lkweDhPplQSA.text: Don't be afraid of the consistently long lines.. During my Stay at the Cosmo I walked pass this place a couple times. I finally dove in before my departure and OMG I was so happy for myself. I had the most amazing breakfast sandwich I've ever put in my mouth!   If you're in Vegas near the strip, Eggslut is a must..

7XMoHFf_yN2_0yVDI2GRyg.text: Good food. Different style on the egg sandwich. Long lines. On the expensive side for a breakfast sandwich. Nothing really spectacular for the price. They don't even have ice water. You have to purchase a $5 bottled water.

731lpJbq_Slq5Gbg7ahxyA.text: This has good food but I think it's a bit overrated. If you are going to stand in line for 20 to 30 minutes I suggest ordering the slut. It is their specialty. The biscuit is mediocre. I am sure there are better places to eat in Las Vegas. This is not a bad place I just think it's overrated and overpriced  for the long line and minimal seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the menu

0J5IMuaJtCa44Zb725EnOQ.text: I've been dying to try Eggslut in LA, but have been super turned off by the lines. So, while in Vegas, decided to give it a try. It was everything I was hoping it would be- a messy, flavorful, taste of heaven. I had the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich (without the chipotle ketchup). It was filling and absolutely worth trying.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4ZZXEPigEICYO6IqJmI2rw.text: Lives up to the hype. I've tried the Fairfax, Egg Salad and the Slut. When I order again I'd go for the Fairfax and Slut any day. The line is always wrapped around the corner. Just depends on the time of day when you arrive. The wait time for your order isn't as bad as the line. They've got options for meat eaters and vegetarians so it's all good :)

CFY5saBE-MA7WtJ4terHwg.text: Long wait but line goes by fast. I had the bacon egg croissant and couldn't be more delicious. Would def wait in line for this again.

DMpmxwpAdOY-jbDqZaPVFw.text: i think this place is overhyped. The slut tasted great but nothing i would be dying to eat each time I see Eggslut. It was more of a try it once to know thing. I also had the gaucho that was delicious but again, nothing i would be dying to eat again.

mv5HWtgLAAqOfJ_qbIXyTg.text: Waited in this long line up for the slut and let me tell you it was worth it. By far the best egg experience I had.

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RD-0SdLYxphid61PGQyVQQ.text: ** THIS IS MY ORIGINAL REVIEW OF EGGSLUT IN L.A. EVERYTHING APPLIES TO THE VEGAS LOCATION AS WELL = DAMN GOOD**  I just came back from my trip to L.A and I can honestly say I can see myself being a California gal. The weather, foodie scene & a few hilarious Uber drivers would all be worth it. Being the major foodie that I am, I had a list of restaurants that I knew I had to eat at. One being EGGSLUT *heart eyes emoji*. It was so exciting to learn that I only had to walk about 6 minutes to the Grand Central Market, which is where ES is located, from my DTLA hotel. Trust me, I was fan girlin' all over the place.      The Ambiance   Eggslut is located inside of the Grand Central Market in Downtown LA.(VEGAS location is inside of 'The Cosmopolitan' Hotel) The market is bustling with locals and tourists alike who have a serious appetite. There's seriously everything kind of cuisine you could imagine. Eggslut in particular has a cult following of sluts who are serious about their breakfast. ES is more like a stand-alone store within the market. As we inched closer and closer to the cashier and kitchen, our heads began bobbing. They were playing the best old school 90's music. I'm sure it was nostalgic for all the millennials in line, too. Overall, the experience was very laid-back and cool. Very much like what I expected just from their Instagram feed.   The Service  To be straight-up and frank about it all, we waited in line for about 1.5 hours. (VEGAS wait was about 25 mins) BUT, I PROMISE IT WAS WORTH THE HYPE & WAIT. Nevertheless, the food will make up for it. There was so much going on in the market that we were able to keep ourselves entertained. We even met a friend in line (Hey Winne!) She gave us the scoop on L.A.'s best food. All of the Eggslut team was friendly, nice and they moved so fast. We might've waited an hour to order, but it was ten minutes--tops-- for our food. The guy behind the counter calls you by name and repeats your order. Kind of rare these days--adds a nice touch.   The Food  THEY HAD SRIRCHA. Seriously, that will always be enough for me. I ordered the 'Bacon Egg & Cheese' + added avocado. Delicious. It was nice and hot--no cold food at ES. The bacon was hardwood smoked bacon, super thick-cut. Over-medium egg and velvety cheddar cheese. HELLO. All of their sandwiches are served on a warmed brioche bun, which adds a nice softness. Most of us ordered a sandwich, but my BFF, Teyana, wanted to be adventurous. She went all the way slutty & ordered the SLUT,  "a coddled egg on top of a smooth potato puree, poached in a glass jar and served with a demi baguette." (Thanks EGGSLUT) Pretty much, it was hella good. It's a great option for those who don't want a bun!  Ordered 'THE FAIRFAX' in Vegas and added bacon + avo. BOMB

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They&#39;ve got options !!

eYuybzfpI9Ygs6beLgQd-A.text: Yummmmyyyyyyy first of all!!!!  Fats clean.  Would definitely hit this spot when I'm in Vegas again. So good for after pool party.

_q5Pz7CYn85p8uEUIcKTGQ.text: This place is really good. Everything is made to order and it is very quick once your order is placed. It's not very big so there is usually a line, but it's usually no longer than 10 to 15 minute wait, and definitely worth it. It's definitely a plus that they have cold brew coffee.

mOimutiom2xScPtzadfIVw.text: I love a burger with an over easy egg but this places burger was nasty. The meat was raw and the cheeseburger has no flavor. The slut was okay.

JWGBFed40qxq-QNvsvp9ng.text: Fairfax sandwich, just like was promoted on the hotel in room channel on the tv. Got mine with turkey sausage and avocado. It was a PERFECT egg sandwich! The eggs were creamy, so tasty! Highly recommend! Got there at 6:50 am, they open at 7, and there was already a line 10 deep. Worth the wait, I will be back tomorrow!

WkJnlj-3n29uY0L9Rmjt3g.text: Got here at 6:55am on Monday and there was already 7 people in line (opens at 7am), but the wait wasn't bad - the kitchen was all ready to go.  They offer a gluten free bun now for an extra $1.    Got the Fairfax with avocado and bacon (avocado wasn't quite ripe yet) without a bun (they substituted with a salad) - it was decent, nothing that special - kind of like any breakfast sandwich.  However, the Slut was really different and delicious - never had anything quite like this.  The soft egg on top of the pureed potatoes was smooth and yummy.  Good prices for a decent breakfast - rare for Vegas.

kgeknMhvKd_dEJvZmXqGpQ.text: Good and tasty, but the portion size is small and the queue can take 30 minutes during lunch time

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

la_Uw9kpS3mVzOfEanR4tQ.text: There's usually a line for a reason - I got the sausage/egg/cheese sandwich and it was unreal. Their cold brew is also great. I wasn't crazy about the biscuit, so I'd probably skip it next time. My friend got the Slut and was very impressed with it, but I didn't try it myself.

x4W6FOaefCy3EvJEU2GzTA.text: Went for breakfast. Line was long but moved fast. Everything we ordered came out fast and was fresh. Ask for extra baguette with the slut. They don't have complementary waters just over priced bottled water, coffee and juice so pick something up to drink from the news stores before ordering. Seating area is mostly stools and 2 people tables. It was a fun stop food was buttery.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UU9r81bp0tNUKh2xst4VwA.text: I love a good breakfast sandwich and this place delivers!  I had the Fairfax +Bacon, was a little heavy on the mayo but still great, next time I would order mayo on the side.    Should you wait in line or make a special trip to come here...no But if you are staying at the Cosmo ifs definitely worth stoppying by when it's slow.  I'm surprised by some of the negative reviews, this place pumps out fresh, made to order, tasty food in a cute atmosphere.  It's relatively fast when there isn't a line and you can watch them cooking while you wait.  They have quite a system & really rock it out so it's A-OK in my book!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorry this was all that remained.  I was too excited to take a picture pre-grub...oopsies haha!

Gz0AA8UQC63tKxvEUEYyNg.text: The prior reviews say it all. This place makes one hell of a breakfast sandwich. The bacon was perfectly crispy and the croissant was just right. One of the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had.

29ZDS4WJQuoYMsWL_QubnA.text: A couple of friends suggested I stop here at some point during our Vegas weekend. Since egg is in the name we decided to come here for breakfast on Saturday. Initially walking up to the restaurant the line is deceiving. It appears to be a small wait until you see the line turn the corner. We waited about 35 minutes to order at the counter and then another 10 minutes to receive our order. Then you just hope to get lucky finding a seat somewhere.  The eggslut is a good interesting flavor, not too flavorful but still very comforting. Like the tips suggest I would ask for an extra piece of bread.  The Fairfax sandwich is very filling with perfectly cooked scrambled eggs, melted cheese, and bacon (extra charge).  The cheeseburger was in the top ten cheeseburgers I've ever had. Despite being known for the "eggslut" they do have a knack for cooking meat pretty well. I do recommend Eggslut but I just wish it had a shorter line or faster service but you can't rush the quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decent prices
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggslut

_1EGUbd0cC8mfIJoV6R_iA.text: It was on our top "MUST TRY FOOD" list, and the sandwich did not disappoint! The wait was long of course, and I personally did not like the SLUT all that much, it just tasted like mashed potatoes with chives, wasn't a huge fan, but the fairfax was the BOMB!!!!!!! But overall I thought the place is overrated, I've had better brunch sandwiches in NYC. Worth trying but would I come back if I visit Vegas again? Prob not.
