Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax with bacon!

4uHodovEz7ucRdtmnr4OWA.text: Well, it lived up to the hype. Awesome egg sandwich. I had the bacon Jaime had the turkey sausage. Both were so good.  The food was so flavorful and fresh  It's just the right amount for lunch. The Cosmo is right next door to the Bellagio. Stop in.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_WdDBVzrPIlqRuJygIctow.text: 1000% a must... one of the best in Vegas, from their burgers to egg sandwiches, they are phenomenal. There is a line even at 3-4 am, but it's so worth it, you won't be disappointed. Recommended this place to 6 people so far and they all thanked me.

gQyRFwKyVzo2M4-F3TJuQw.text: This is my second time trying this place and I am still debating if I should give it a three stars or four stars.  First of all,the line is crazy so I recommend you to go as soon as they open or later on the day.  This place isn't cheap because of course is Vegas and second it's just breakfast sandwiches and egg products they serve. Don't get me wrong I love the concept and they have lots of products but when it comes to expectation of flavor I really expected a little bit more.  I had the sausage, egg and cheese and I just wasn't impressed of the flavor of the sausage.  My husband had the bacon, cheese and egg and he liked it.  The staff is very friendly and patient so props on that because mostly of the places I went to Vegas the staff was rude.  If you want to try it for the first time why not? Go for it! For the experience It's just not something I'll have next time I'll go.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XXuvmxnd0_uS8ZVi5HkA_g.text: So I'm including two pictures: one of the food, and one of the line. What, don't notice a line? BINGO!  Go to this place in LA and try getting out of there in under 30 minutes (looking at you Grand Central Market)...just try. Given that I only wait in line 30+ minutes for very few things in life -- and egg sandwiches are not one of them -- I'd never had one of these heavenly hyped sandos despite being in their orbit many times. That is until I happened across a line-less storefront at 330pm (30 min before closing on weekdays) the day after Christmas!   Look, these things are good. Really good, in fact. I had the Fairfax and Gaucho. Stick with the Fairfax. Wagyu hoity toity whatever Gaucho is fine, even good, but not what I was expecting, as it was basically overcooked meat (probably a requirement) with a token, overdone fried egg with some chimichurri sauce. If you just want a meat injection, Gaucho is for you; if you'd prefer to appreciate the subtleties of a good breakfast sando, go Fairfax (eggs, chives, cheddar, caramelized onions, spicy mayo). Anyone can mask goodness with a ton of ingredients (think: pizza), but to really tell quality, you need to get down to basics (think: margherita pizza), and that is exactly what the Fairfax is -- basic, fundamental goodness.   Thanks to the short line, I went back for round 2.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax and Gaucho
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No line!!!

UYVFiI3ORB_sSkIe1mMh8A.text: Since watching the videos of the owner making the Eggslut sandwich maybe four years ago, I've always had this as one of my must-try.   The long lines every morning is evident of just how good this place is. We came at 9:10 in the morning and left an hour after that. I must give props to all the cooking staff at the back as the guy is managing maybe six different pans all at once cooking eggs.   The food is simply put, super simple but executed in the best way possible. I ordered the Fairfax with bacon which had the soft scrambled eggs with chives and a sriracha mayo. Eggs were delicious and texture was perfectly soft. I also ordered the Slut which is a jar with potato puree with an egg on top. Stir the jar up and slap it on the toast for a good time.   If you don't want to wait, come back around lunch time to avoid the morning rush. So worth it and so glad I checked this one off the list.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JaSRIqZIQwVczLccahHrOw.text: One of my favorite meals is a bacon , egg and cheddar on bagel.  Walked by Eggslut and saw a line so was drawn in.  What a fantastic sandwich.  It comes on a brioche bun which seems to be the rage these days and I do see why.  Came out warm and fast.  Also had the side salad which was very simple and greens were excellent.   Service was good and a great stop if you want good , fast food in diner style type setting.  Yum

i3enps1vTgEJxSAMP9mCyA.text: Alright, finally tried this place due to the hype! Lines were loooong! Like wrapped around the corner long! I timed it and for a sunday around brunch, it was a 30 minute wait which apparently is not bad because I heard it can go for over 1+ hour.  Opted for the bacon egg and cheese sandwich (2) and the fresh OJ for $5. Honestly, for $5, it should be a large size and not medium, just saying. It was good though, but not enough lol. The sandwich was good but apparently it already has ketchup in it.. alotttt of ketchup which I thought was weird lol. Don't get me wrong.. I love ketchup but I'm more of a 'dipper' than having it already in my sandwich lol. Usually a breakfast sandwich would be plain or with mayonnaise but that's just my opinion. The brioche bun was soft and tasty and you can tell the workers are super busy but very efficient with each order. I was still hungry after though..   Would I come back? Maybe, but not waiting for over 30 minutes. I rather have a bacon egg and cheese waffle sandwich at Bruxie's (NYNY) which was way more fulfilling.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese Sandwich
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese x 2 &amp; fresh OJ

ynEFilRZfLdRinYsOtH1Rg.text: Obsessed. I want this everyday!  The line seems long but it really does move :) the egg to potato to baguette ratio was perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

49DULu-B7uoWt4ufBcmFtg.text: I think this place is overhyped.  It was good but not worth the price you're paying for it. I was so excited to try the place but really disappointed when I took my first bite. I've definitely had better egg sandwiches before.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8eHP9wCvhr1dd3YNhGTs8g.text: I got the Bacon, Egg, and Cheese sandwich and assumed this would be a normal breakfast sandwich. I was very wrong, it was amazing.   I have tried it with both the over medium egg and soft scramble and prefer it soft scrambled. I would wait in this line forever if I needed to....it's that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h2QMtGyzA2OuXFyD010ogw.text: Befitting for Vegas, Eggslut is a very popular breakfast/brunch spot within the Cosmopolitan. We checked it out for late lunch because noon hour was very busy; the line wrapped around all the way to the back.  I gotta say, I'm not that into Sluts (pun intended?, lol jk). So we got the Slut, basically egg mashed potato served in a little mason jar. It was alright, definitely not worth the hype nor the price ($11). We also got the biscuit, which is OK with the added sauce. The orange juice is definitely not worth it (the Mom Ami Gabi across the street has it for $4.5)

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. so eggslutty
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut, biscuit, and orange juice

4QLV-1N0SH00oaWweqTx4A.text: Hadn't seen my cousin in years. Schedule just never seemed to link up. Well out the blue I decide to call her while walking around Vegas.   Me: So what are doing today? Her: For now enjoying Eggslut.  Me: ...Is that code for something.  Her: ((giggles (She's a tough bad *ss that works with a lot of tough guys but she doesn't laugh like a normal adult. She giggles like someone with ribbons in their hair.)) I'm eating at Eggsluts... Me: (walks up to her, SCREAMS, and giggle along with her. )  We live 500 miles away from each other. But end up meeting up over 2000 miles away from our home location.   This chick is a major foodie. So if she's here I know it's been on her bookmarks for awhile. Though this place is just a walk up the line along tells you that it's pretty worth a wait. I do a quick scroll over the small menu and then wait on others. You really have to love eggs to come here. Skip the carbs and turn sandwiches into salads and it's all golden.   Eggslut is great before or after a hangover.

YyvQSHoWVc5iBaxczrN-FA.text: Overall: Must try breakfast/brunch if you're in Vegas!  Ambience: Expect - long line that moves fast and delicious food. Don't expect - Large portions or drinks.  Service: You order at the counter, and take a seat if one is open. The staff is nice and will help you in picking depending on your taste (sweet, savory, spicy).  Menu: It's not extensive like a Cheese Cake Factory but you won't come here if you're into that. With all the all you can eat craze at Vegas, some how this been inside the Cosmopolitan still survives. We liked what we ordered here and we ordered for three because the portions are small.   Price: For a restaurant inside the Cosmopolitan, it is cheap! The food is delicious and it will hit the spot. Order a bit more if you don't want to stand in the line again!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

clxjmwc5deaQ3cFoD0Hblw.text: Decent spot for a quick bite. One of the better egg salad sandwiches I have had in a while. Service is slow and lacking. Line is absurdly long during peak hours. Consider getting there exactly when they open at 7am for the best experience possible.

8_CxO-hY-zHKdy1IWmgtUA.text: Tried this place in LA, but they did not have the Gaucho at that location. They have it here, for  $15. Since I'm here, I got the items I already liked, the Slut and the Fairfax. The Fairfax is a soft scramble egg sandwich with a tiny zing from the spiced mayo. The slut was delicious, even though I don't think it was worth $10.50. The Gaucho was meaty and the chimichurri sauce definitely elevated an ordinary sandwich. They have overpriced basic items that taste really good. It is worth trying.   People were envious of my breakfast at the airport! They asked where I got it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax and gaucho
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W8wmEm3S_ESaJ9h9BFWVjg.text: Must try breakfast stop located at the Cosmopolitan when in Vegas. It's right by the Boulevard tower elevator on the second floor. I love the simplicity, the bacon egg sandwich and the location. Cosmo has some of the best dining options all wrapped up in a one great hotel.   If you have the spare time to wait in line, wait! You won't be disappointed. Food comes out very fast. I add avocado to anything I order and also request scrambled eggs. If you are anywhere near here, give it a try!

FyN7dSZC8VT1NHb3RGUXVg.text: Pretty darn good. There was a line but it went fast. My sandwich had 6 slices of bacon, 1 egg and some cheese. Very tasty and fresh. The biscuit was more like a corn bread, which I wasn't expecting. Bottom line it was a good and easy choice. Nice way to avoid the buffets.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Da5V6KFSacoA92pwQP4GeQ.text: Eggslut feels like LA: it is trendy, pricey, but still enjoyable. I had the Fairfax, which is a tasty egg sandwich at $8.50. But it is also a very tasty egg sandwich, with some nice flavored mayo and caramelized onions enhancing the experience.  If you go, be ready for a long line--there is another LA comparison, lots of people. Lots. As in, 20 to 30 minute wait, line wrapped around. But I think it is a worthwhile experience, so I'll give it a thumbs up.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jDcVwCfn4bB7xMLUdUB0tA.text: I was really exited to eat here. I was looking to improve my egg-cooking skills one day and came across a video on YouTube by the owner of Eggslut. He taught how he makes the Fairfax, and I make it all of the time now at home. But of course I wanted to try the real thing!  When we got there I was surprised to see that the line was HUGE! We waited for about 15 minutes maybe, so not too bad, but the length of the line is interesting. I guess there's a lot of hype about this place.  My girlfriend and I shared a fairfax and a slut. The fairfax is a sandwich with scrambled eggs, cheddar cheese, caramelized onions, and sriracha mayo. I thought it was really good! But... just not quite knock your socks off good, which is what I was sort of expecting. It was really well done, but I think it could use some more flavor. The caramelized onions and sriracha mayo didn't really come through too much for me. I would have liked those flavors to come through a little more. And I love to use sour cream or creme fraiche, the cold is such a nice contrast to the warm eggs.  The slut is a poached egg on top of potato puree. It was listed as one of their two specialities, so I ordered it. I wasn't disappointed. The combination of the egg with the smooth pureed potato was really really awesome. I enjoyed the novelty. Props to them for the combo. However, I also think it could have used more flavor. The flavor was basically just fat and salt, it wasn't balanced by any spice or acid.  It's also worth noting that sizes were definitely small. Growing up in New York, I recall the gigantic bacon egg and cheese sandwiches I'd get at the bagel store. They were probably three times the size of Eggsluts sandwiches. My girlfriend and I were both slightly hungry afterwards, which is always disappointing. But I'm still glad we went.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax

TWcTuTnOozkB3K8wcVLyFw.text: Nommmm! Eggslut was definitely worth the hype! Going to Vegas, I knew I had to try this breakfast spot out. It's located on the second floor of the Cosmopolitan hotel. I heard so many stories about the long lines, so I was ready to wait in this massive line for this so called amazing breakfast sandwich. When I got to the restaurant there were only about 5-6 people in line. PERFECT.   I ordered the sausage egg and cheese sandwich (sausage is turkey sausage), Fairfax sandwich, and the egg salad sandwich. My family and I instantly inhaled our food. IT WAS SO GOOD. The bread was perfectly soft coated with a little butter and then TOASTED, the egg was perfectly cooked with cheese, and the turkey sausage was so juicy and flavorful. I was so satisfied! We all loved the sandwiches we got. I love how they have so many veg options, and they also let you replace the buns in your breakfast sandwich for lettuce for a healthier option!! How cool. I wish Houston had an Eggslut because it is that good!!   The only thing I wish was that they had more open seating for their restaurant. They only had around 4-5 tables with chairs in that designated area. There was a bar located right across the corridor, and they did not allow us to sit there. So finding a clean space to eat was a tad bit annoying.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fairfax sandwhich (left), egg salad sandwhich (middle), turkey sausage egg and cheese (right)

MLQrNtwpygXuZxB5WBMvkA.text: Waiting 45 minutes to order a sandwich that could have been whipped together in 60 seconds. The hype surrounding this place is insane. While the quality of the food is pretty good, the kitchen staff clearly were able to whip these breakfast sandwiches out much quicker than the cashiers could take the orders. After waiting and waiting to pay way too much for a tiny orange juice and sandwich I sat there thinking maybe I should have ordered a second sandwich. Too late! The sandwich was "okay" but the kitchen staff had piled up stacks of eggs, bacon, buns, etc. so what you're getting is not truly fresh. If I'm going to wait in line for that long I want it to be made to order, not pile ordered.

T9w1im0-dxda3Dzo5ADwwg.text: Egg sandwiches were good. I'd say average. The burger was about the same. The prices were reasonable, especially for Las Vegas. It was good for a day that we weren't there all day to take part in the buffet pass.

FERZiReIkLYVFUva1LYyoQ.text: Dam that slut was good. Had this delivered to me by a friend in the morning and it was so good. I had the egg salad sandwich and it was tasty. It was just the perfect size for me. I heard from my friends that their sausage sandwich was good too. Definitely would come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg salad, Slut, and Sausage egg and cheese sandwich

yErJ3rLA2h_SgxNzHyuARQ.text: We've ordered the "Slut" and the "bacon, eggs and cheese Sandwich" and salted chocolate chip cookies. All were very good just like the original one in LA!! My craving satisfied and crushed. Food never disappoint every time. Everyone must try at least once!! You will not be disappoint.

CtLkQL8WkzzFl4wf-dl6qA.text: We decided to try Eggslut while visiting Las Vegas. It is located in the Cosmopolitan Hotel. We arrived around 9 am and the line was already pretty long. Thankfully, the line moved quick. There is a menu on the side of the wall which the line forms so you can read that as you wait in line and pass by to get closer to the restaurant. We parked in the Cosmo hotel parking lot with has free 50 minute parking and made it back just in time! We ordered the slut and the egg salad sandwich. Both were delicious. We did get it to-go due to lack of seating in the restaurant and it held up pretty well in the packaging. Pricing is a bit on the higher side but I felt it was worth it for the quality (cage- free eggs). The staff were nice and helpful with questions. I'll definitely be back again!

ZNpk7Mnusha-U-Drknuu2g.text: Very solid breakfast/brunch egg sandwich restaurant in the Cosmo. The value for Eggslut is poor ($8-9 per sandwich) but it's to be expected in Vegas. The overall turkey sausage flavor was very good and I heavily enjoyed the brioche as well. I enjoyed my experience at Eggslut but not sure if I would wait in the line again (expect to wait 20-30 minutes minimum on a weekend morning).

WHEqvk08CWmoFSmLPRc0Rw.text: Will I ever find an egg sandwich that's better than Eggslut? Who knows! But until then, I'll keep coming back here in every city that has one. My second time at Eggslut but first time at this location. I came at 9am on a Monday and the line was LONG, but it moved quickly. We waited about 30 minutes in total. I ordered the Fairfax Sandwich and I knew I wouldn't be disappointed. First, they give a generous amount of scrambled eggs which I really appreciate. The Sriracha mayo and caramelized onions go so well with this sandwich. It's so simple yet so complex. The bun has to be one of the best sandwich buns I've ever had. It's flaky, warm, buttery, and soft. I really wonder how they make it so delicious. You can't go wrong with the Fairfax sandwich and I highly recommend stopping by if you have a chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax sandwich (~$9).

yDBW3p-6ONyr4j2JFu-NWA.text: Wait time from 2nd poster to the cashier = 25 minutes. Wait time from ordering to receiving food = 8 minutes!!  VERDICT? Worth the wait AND lives up to the hype!   As a local, my reasons to come to the Strip are limited to work, a special event or visiting friends and family. Since the Cosmo now charges an unavoidable parking fee, this once favorite casino of mine sees a lot less of my patronage. But, when I was scheduled to work PAINWeek 2017 here, I made a point to build in some extra time to check out the hype.   I showed up at about 9:10am on a Friday and the line was wrapped around and down the hallway. But they've got a giant menu posted on that same wall, so be polite and decide what you'll order early!  I opted for The Slut (because, why wouldn't you?) which came in an adorably tiny glass mason jar. I appreciated that it came lidded, making it easy to take to-go. I also appreciated that they "Recycle their Sluts" (aka the jars,) although I kept mine!   I'd never had eggs prepared this way. It's a consistency similar to poached but fluffier, because they're cooked inside the glass jars in hot water. The woman who served it to me was awesome in asking if I'd had The Slut before and instructed me to "mix the slut well...otherwise you'll just get salt and chives." ...good advice! The egg turns into a whipped butter consistency that you spread on your bread like butter (or dip, your preference!) and even though I ran out of bread, I ate the rest by the spoonful right out of the jar!   Honestly, the wait isn't any longer than at a sit-down restaurant. At one point, a single cashier was manning BOTH registers. Taking new orders on one while processing payment from the previous order on the other.   There's plenty of table/high-top seating if you choose to stay, but the food is just as easy to grab and go, if you don't! You can also rep an official "Eggslut" T-Shirt in Men's or fitted women's.   If you're not a morning person, find a friend who is and have them order for the crew. It's a breakfast worth waking (or staying) up for!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Represent your slutty self
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uc2DjnylR3o559m29fvkiQ.text: I was super excited to try out this spot, after seeing their delicious posts on Instagram. It's located upstairs in the Cosmopolitan, as a tiny store front with enough seating for maybe 15 people. It was jam packed the morning we went, luckily we were staying in an adjoining hotel, so we took our sandwiches back to our room to eat. We had the bacon, egg and cheese and Gaucho. Sadly, we were pretty disappointed. These sandwiches were no better than any other breakfast sandwich we have had. Nothing special, a little dry, and frankly a bit boring. Definitely not worth the wait or the cost. Not likely that we will go back.

1oo6aXYpOgttax_vJhndDA.text: The slut was amazing! The texture was made perfectly and the baguette was very crunchy. Wish they gave more pieces of baguette though. I should have asked. My boyfriend had the Bacon egg sandwich and he enjoyed it.

bV1yIcMU8h0G80KdGXP7WA.text: Holy sh*****t! Great spot to hit up for breakfast or brunch! Long line but it is totally worth it. Tables and sitting situation needs to be a bit better, but service was great

atg0hc8GhCwFAfJt4J95yw.text: More like 3.5 stars.  Eggslut's original location is in Los Angeles. I was intrigued when I saw Alvin Cailan on YouTube create a scrumptious looking breakfast sandwich featuring King's Hawaiian Bread, grilled Spam, egg and chives. It looked amazing!  Fast forward a year later, I heard that he opened another Eggslut in the Cosmopolitan, Las Vegas. I specifically came here for "The Slut": an ingenious twist on a coddled egg, served over mashed potatoes, sprinkled with gray salt and chives. It's served up with a few thinly sliced baguette slices and is presented in a mini mason-esque jar. I loved this but the portion is ridiculously tiny! Regardless, I enjoyed it but for $10 for a teeny portion, I was expecting a bit more. Next time I will try one of the breakfast sandwiches as they looked a bit more substantial.  Overall, I was a bit underwhelmed, which bummed me out because I wanted to love this place.   I shall give the LA location another try...we'll see what happens!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Slut: coddles egg over mashed potatoes and topped with chives and gray salt. Served with baguette

5dehl1U1U7Xg9VUF41Qjhw.text: So let's be clear that this is NOT A RESTAURANT. It is more like back in your school days when you stood in line telling your lunch lady if you wanted the Jamaican patty or pizza. Not many options , $5 for a cold biscuit (reading the menu I thought it was a warm delicious biscuit), small coffee is another $5 orange juice $5, water $4. Came on a Monday and it's 30 min in line to order then another 25 min for then to prep your food. They yell out your name when its ready and you stand there shoulder to shoulder with other people waiting(after standing in line just to order ). I guess you can say I felt like a hen in a chicken coop.    On a better note right out side of the chicken coop they have nice art work, unique chairs and table sitting, good music playing, and the huge chandelier great for a few pictures. The $9 egg cheese bacon sandwich was good but again small if you have a big appetite.  Way to be happier about being here is that if your in a group have one or two people in the Starbucks line getting better coffee and a side like banana bread and have someone else in the line at egg slut.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wMP9o0MIvOyurn6CB1s9HQ.text: At 3 AM.... what's better than a perfectly cooked cheeseburger with an egg on it?  Come on!  Eggslut is amazing!  The best food ever.  It's right outside of Marque in the Cosmopolitan so when you come out of the club.... your egg awaits you.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nXHT0VqQ337whCxSCpJ6YA.text: I finally got a chance to try this place while on the strip this past weekend. We arrived at the restaurant around 10 am, and not surprisingly, there was a line that wrapped around the hallway towards the restrooms. It was a quick 20 min wait until it was our turn to order. We ordered the highly recommended bacon egg and cheese sandwich and the slut. 10 minutes later and our food was ready for pickup. The first bites of the slut toasted egg/potato dip and bacon egg and cheese sandwich were mesmerizing. If you haven't tried this place yet, definitely check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

664TZo3DRBG3sglopZkjpw.text: This is my first disappointment at theCosmopolitan. I had the Fairfax with bacon (about $13 with tax). First it was shockingly small (close to the size o sliders at White Castle). Second, the brioche bun was soft and doughy; it could have been better on a quality biscuit or croissant. Third, the cheese was not melted on the sandwich, but may have been cheddar, although taste and texture-wise, it may as well have been Kraft American cheese. And fourth, the one thing that could have distinguished it from my normal home-cooked fare, the advertised Aieoli sauce, was virtually absent. I finally got a small taste with my last bite. It was promising. Judging by other reviews, perhaps they just screwed my sandwich up with extreme haste to produce volume. Burger Kings are busy, but produce a better product for under $3.

SwPBrA7SA3ExyVl8NbUR1w.text: Finally had a chance to try it out in Vegas since I haven't had a chance to try the LA locations.  The line was around the corner but moved at a good pace.  The sandwich was good and our party tried all sorts but I was a bit underwhelmed.  Maybe because I'd heard so much hype.  Don't get me wrong, It's good and simple if you aren't that hungry but a bit over priced for a breakfast sandwich.

NyTajthrlwGuyTLNCxO91A.text: Definitely give this place a try. Food is good but overpriced. This place always seemed to be busy. When we got in line there was maybe 2-3 people ahead of us and it took about 10 minutes for one sandwich. Not terrible, and the food was worth it!

wxXFbvrjVkFXx2_h0MK3vQ.text: What's not to love about a slutty egg sandwich after a night out partying in Vegas?  Nothing! Minus the fact that they up-charge like crazy for these sandwiches compared to their LA location, but I digress.  What really matters here is the accessibility of this Eggslut on the Strip. It's opened very early in the morning and is more affordable than a lot of other brunch spots in these mega hotels. You and your friends will truly see the late nighters coming out for a breakfast sandwich as the line wraps around at all hours of the day.  The sandwich is great for what it is. You got bacon, egg, and cheese all baked between two brioche buns. It got the job done really well and it didn't take long for us to get our food after we ordered.  So is it a welcome addition to the Vegas community? Absolutely, but don't expect it to be mind blowing either. Enjoy it for what its worth- a decent but delicious, slutty sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nXsy_E_F4U6SBwUgYuNgIQ.text: I'm ashamed to say although I consider myself a foodie, I've never even heard of this place until it was time for one last meal in Vegas before heading home! I guess it's probably because I can make a pretty mean breakfast on my own at home already, so I tend not to eat our for breakfast or brunch as much.  Anyway, we made our way upstairs only to find a long line wrapping around the wall. Let me tell you people, the wait IS SO WORTH IT. I had the fairfax + avo + arugula with chimichuri on the side (so good!). It was a 45 min wait from the moment we went in line until the moment I heard the staff's voices call out my name that our order was finally ready! Seriously good breakfast sandwich. I think the soft and crispy brioche bread just makes it. I was told they have a location in Venice in LA also by our neighbors on the communal table.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax sandwich + Avo + arugula &amp; side of chimichuri

SLgbB1h158NGSonUtvy9eA.text: The wait is about 10-15 minutes but it is worth the wait.  Loved this place.  I had a fairfax sandwich and it was amazing and I added bacon to it which made even better.  The service was really good too.  Definitely would recommend this place to everyone.

w6AFb2MHmqB9QZHcdOeI8w.text: We decided to try egg slut for breakfast around 10am. Wow, we regretted not coming earlier. It was off the hook busy!!! The line was ridiculously long! We almost left but decided to wait it out. Glad we did because it was bomb! My hubs declared it was the best! It was pretty damn good! $8.50 for a egg, sausage & cheese, $8.50 bacon, egg & cheese sandwich, and $10.50 for a slut! Okay, the slut was sooo good my daughter polished it off & wanted more bread to dip in. You have to mix the egg & potato goodness before dipping. The sandwiches were delish as well. I liked the sausage better but both were yum. How yum?!  We went back later for more! Yup, dinner at egg slut and no line! Must try, it's delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (2) Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese (1) sausage, egg &amp; cheese  $8.50 each
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The slut $10.50, so good!
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front of Egg Slut

MADB47xSZ3FkK5DyULKrig.text: Overrated, overpriced. It's nothing special. Sandwich variety is extremely limited and they're not even yummy, let alone delicious. You're better off going to the Linq or Cromwell for a breakfast sandwich that is twice as big and tasty, and will cost only $9.

5JPIXmgNzbWhIEEFiuhjIg.text: After getting pizza from Secret Pizza, my friend and I spotted the golden goose egg that was eggslut. No, our glutton-ness shame of just eating pizza did not deter us from getting in line. We've never tried Eggslut before and we're curious on how good the egg sandwich could be.  We ordered the classic, The Fairfax, and the Gaucho sandwich.  I'll start with the Gaucho. I thought this sandwich was alright. My friend and I thought there was too much arugula, very "aruguly" and the beef was nothing I'd write home about.  The Fairfax though, that was delicious. The eggs were creamy, the aioli was savory, the cheese was that dirty American cheese that you always want. The chives added a brightness and the caramelized onions were so dank. No other way to describe it than dank. Then the brioche bun holds all of it together in its warm embrace.  We also traded a slice of pizza for a bottle of water, I'd say they won that trade off but still gave off some good vibes.  I'd recommend the Fairfax to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left: Fairfax Right: Gaucho

ziTNJYhGtTql3I6MABT6JQ.text: You might wonder, "How good could an eggs sandwich be?" That's what I've wondered, every time I walk past and see the long line.  I finally decided to try it, and I'm glad I did.  The brioche roll was soft, warm, and slightly sweet. I got the scrambled egg sandwich with avocado, and a chocolate chip cookie. Both were delicious. My husband got an egg sandwich with sausage, and also a hamburger and juice. Both sandwiches were great and the juice was freshly squeezed.  Don't be fooled by the long line. From the time we got in line, until our first bite, it only took twenty minutes. Well worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CSC9IG2RlZq9WEeiSSJ9-A.text: Yes, you are going to wait in line forever to order a sandwich. Yes, you are going to wait forever to get your food. But Eggslut is worth it. I'm not a big breakfast person and I absolutely loved my breakfast sandwich (the fairfax sandwich). The bread was soft and the egg was cooked to perfection. Prepare yourself mentally and emotionally for a 20-30 minute wait but you won't regret doing it.

cGDMfiokFhXgn_IOr-Skog.text: The Slut... THE SLUT!!! I don't even like eggs. But substituted the bread of the salad for the Fairfax and the eggs.. it's so fluffy!!! Amazing food. The biscuit is delicious as well, but get the Slut. So so delicious. Got it two mornings in a row and most likely gonna go again tomorrow. Also their OJ is bomb.com but the coffee is meh.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-Lu5lRaLTpF9roZz1cE7ow.text: There is always a long line at Eggslut in LA, so it was so nice to run into this place a few minutes before it closed--no line!  I got the sausage, egg, and cheese and it was egg-cellent! I firmly believe that all burgers and sandwiches are infinitely better with a broiche bun and the one I got was egg-ceptional. I always wondered how an egg sandwich got be so hyped, but I have to say it's pretty egg-traordinary.  Looking for a tasty, quick bite? Eggslut is egg-actly what you need.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage egg and cheeeeese

sVh2aLhNe8zn3RvfqvHq1w.text: The only slut I'll ever approve of. Eggslut. Arriving in Vegas at 7 am and being too early to check in the hotel, breakfast was the next best thing besides a bed.  I've seen that lines can be all the way around the corner if you come around lunch time. Since we were early, it wasn't that bad. Yet.  Choosing off reviews and pictures, I got the Slut and the sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich. The Slut is probably the most popular, but for the price, I don't think I'd get it again. The egg itself was really good and I would have never thought about adding a potato puree. The downside was that it came with three little pieces of toasted baguette. You'll definitely still feel hungry if that's all your getting. Luckily, I also had the sandwich. Nothing too fancy from your typical breakfast sandwich. I'm more satisfied with a McGriddle from Mickey D's. Meh.  It's something that you should check out if you've never had it, but it isn't something I'd wait 40 minutes for. It's a one time thing for me. Didn't hate it, but didn't love it either.

PxxXVZ7BUKL3UyERYanfMw.text: Got the Fairfax. Good but not great. Maybe some do the best scrambled eggs I ever had. Super soft and fluffy. But the rest of the sandwich was a bit on the lukewarm side? Maybe it was the fact that I got there close to closing time. Not sure.  The other problem is that since it's loose-scrambled eggs and not omelette style, they keep falling out of the sandwich.  For these prices don't want any weak links on the chain, or the sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LSp_vgWDKWY6LkNAIlSaow.text: Long line but moved at a steady pace. Good sandwich! Really liked the Sriracha mayo on the Fairfax, I also added bacon. Very filling too!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Vn8OJ4jeGeM84G2V13DMyQ.text: If you aren't there right away at opening you will be in a huge line, but fear not hungry stomachs long lines here disappear fast and you won't be disappointed. Food is delicious, decently priced, and service fast and friendly. I just wish there was one closer to home. 50th birthday in 5 years will take us back to Vegas for more fun, food, and foolishness!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buttermilk biscuit because the person in line in front of us said they were amazing and there was only one left...lucky us as it was amazing
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage, egg, and cheese on a brioche bun

YTHoXma9YG3cWvg3kLIafA.text: The quality control of Eggslut in Las Vegas is abysmal. I ordered 2 Fairfax and a slut, and both sandwiches barely have any caramelized onions (barely a tablespoon), one has way too much mayo I couldn't taste the egg anymore, and the other barely has any mayo.  The Slut was way too saltier it's almost inedible, and the yolk is hard but the egg white barely solidified, I don't even know how the hell they achieved to screw that up during the water bath.  The quality is gross compared to what I'm used to LA. I feel bad for people who wasted time lining up only to be served with a shitty version of food that is good at the original branches.  If you're in Vegas, skip this sorry husk of the real thing and find food somewhere else.  Eggslut, please make sure you keep quality consistent in all your branches because this Vegas branch is incredibly disgusting

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2nd sandwich has very little mayo and STILL have an absolute joke when it came to the amount of caramelized onions

x4nBop2fQVVpNktPjOjyuw.text: Such a great breakfast spot - not your traditional brunch place and menu has limited options but everything we ordered tasted great. You can't go wrong with the slut - the egg is cooked to perfection. The fairfax sandwich was delicious too, the sriracha on it is a pleasant surprise and paired perfectly with the egg and cheese. I wish it had more of that caramelized onion goodness inside. Long lines but it moved fast and we didn't have to wait more than 15 mins.

mqjIAJ_HciqMIFbd1NbvqA.text: If you like long lines, rap music and eggs you can't taste, the experience here is worthy of it's namesake. Recommend skipping the slut. Potatoes are fine, but completely hide the taste of the egg (yeah, just one). For over $17 (I got orange juice) you can do better.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Receipt

sw8kCvlLYyjpbxbnblcl7Q.text: A catchy name and good breakfast food, count me in. Be warned it was pricey, but worth the money to try. The menu is right by the register and is simple enough for you to know exactly what you want. Atmosphere is modern and clean. The line was quick, however the time waiting for the food was a little slower than I'd expect. I ordered everything as takeout as well, but you can totally enjoy the meal at all the seating area near the restaurant. Ordered the cheeseburger ($10.50). Was expecting a little more wow factor, or maybe I had higher expectations, but overall it was average. Did hit the spot as I was quite hungry. Maybe I should've ordered something else. Will try again next time I am on vacation.

FuqCg5YLGmIyi07sX1Dj0g.text: This is really good especially if you are on the go. They turn out sandwiches pretty quickly. I thought mine was good - nothing earth shattering but it gave me the option to take it on the go or grab a quick seat before heading off. I will say the coffee is a stinker especially for $5. However, if they had better coffee then maybe the lines would be even longer (note: come during off hours unless you want to wait!).

ZRVp7GpI53rQpHrRMeNWDQ.text: Expect a line when you go here but it's worth the wait!  I have never had a bad experience at eggslut; from LA to this location in Vegas the quality and taste remains consistent and delicious. Highly recommend if you can get past the line - get the biscuit too if they have them!

rniuyQ3Uk9d8zrrdimqxHg.text: Great tasty food. Like the hip menu and it is always busy. Their system for getting the orders out can be a bit of a disaster at times.

Oy3GwgGNKE04uUngAe0foA.text: Loved it! Worth the wait! Brioche bun was so good and soft. Everything is super fresh. The thick sliced bacon on my bacon, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich was excellent.

1UNOx5sT6Ri7MS4oXTWeaA.text: Ate here  after a night of partying til almost 5:00am. We didn't wait in line cause obviously who is in line at that hour lol. The next day the line was super long. I'm glad I had the opportunity to try it. It was very good!

F_MOE9Gnu-sJWkNLXfXNZQ.text: I'm an Eggslut. Loved it. Spent several days at the Cosmo and tried three different sandwiches each day. Long lines but efficient service. Friendly ordering lady. Like a food truck parked and adhered to the space. Hip, quick and tasty. Thank you Eggslut.

XCOUqifomoaUgJmM5xWd9g.text: Saw all the rave reviews for both locations and had to check out Eggslut at the Cosmopolitan.   I had an overall average experience. Food was okay and the cost was expected so I was able to focus on the quality of my sandwich.  Arrived around 10 am and the line was ridiculously long so I decided to come back later around 2 pm after some shopping and there was no line!   Ordered The Fairfax with sausage and bacon.   The eggs were way too wet for a breakfast sandwich resulting in all the contents slithering out from between the brioche buns and making a huge gooey, greasy, cheesy mess. Brioche was too thick but flavorful and lightly sweetened. The bacon was decent and had a little fat to it. The hand pressed turkey sausage breakfast patty had a nice kick to it. I would stick to either bacon or sausage next time, not both, and make sure to get extra napkins. There is also a fancy sauce they put on that has a little punch to it as well. It is a big sandwich. You could definitely split one.   Coming back to try the Slut and possibly another sandwich to see if it's worthy of another star.  What I really like about Eggslut is the short menu. There are limited choices but I would order any of the sandwiches.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No line at 2 pm on Friday 7/29
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggslut Menu

z3XzrAGZWnkqd_YPXiUxaw.text: Got to say I saw the line and was about to walk away ! But when I say I thanked god for me waiting man it was soooo good ! I got the signature slut and it was a mashed puree with a egg that cane with fresh toast ! Service was amazing.... but they need to expand in Arizona !

m346FB1LfzAojYPcYLLUXw.text: I have to say I wasn't pleased when I was starving after a grooming workout and saw that long line, but it was so worth the wait. Fresh squeezed orange juice, the creamiest eggs ever with sriracha and a perfect piece of bread...I ATE the bread and I never eat the bread! So good

-jYb1LpIUYLX3XJXpdt-nw.text: Very disapointed. Dry, nothing special, not worth the wait. One single egg, bacon, cheese on a roll wuth chipotle ketchup.  When you walk by, look how most people don't finish the food. Sorry guys, not for me

mFvtDbL-5yHKW-tvDkfhhQ.text: This spot is an oasis among mediocre and high priced spots on the strip. It can be hard to find a good breakfast at a good price without having to buffet yourself to death. Perfect place to rejuvenate and refuel in the morning after a long day and evening in the heat. Really good breakfast sandwiches and fresh squeezed orange juice at a reasonable price. We passed this place so many times only wishing we had discovered it sooner. If you're staying at Bellagio or Aria it's still worth going into the Cosmopolitan to get your breakfast fix here before starting your day. Come before 11:30am as line can get long but it moves pretty fast with the assembly line style of making the ultimate breakfast sandwiches with a fried egg, cheese, bacon or sausage on a fresh bun of bread with house ketchup. Yup yum.

i-3GeWdd-XBTmO9Vx6-SaQ.text: I was surprised how crowded it was on a random Thursday. There were maybe 10 people in line ahead of us. Fortunately, the line moves fairly quickly. The chooses are a few egg sandwiches and their signature offering, the eggslut. I opted for the egg, cheddar and bacon sandwich on their brioche bun. There were almost as many workers as diners, which was impressive. With that many people, one might reasonably expect that the sandwich would arrive hot, but sadly this was not the case. A cold egg bacon and cheese thing is not to be envied. I'm not really sure how that even happens, considering how many folks were there and how fast they were serving the food. On top of that, it featured a chipotle ketchup, a thing I found neither necessary, nor a value add. I enjoyed he experience, but would not rush back. Oh, the freshly squeezed OJ was wonderful.

KNt1Nuf-7gsuytkDB4illw.text: The Four Stars = to  how expensive this place is.  I only saw two dollar signs for this place, but it should be four dollar signs.  I don't remember what I ordered but it all came to $75.00 ( 2 ) bacon egg sandwiches  ( 2 ) other breakfast sandwiches ( 2 ) breakfast desserts ( 2 ) juices or water I'm pretty sure this was all I ordered.  It tasted good because at 2:30am we were all hungry.  I ordered to go since the place was packed from all the clubbers and hotel guests that was here.  I remember that I didn't have to wait very long after placing my order.  I remember that we all scarfed it down in matter of a minute.  I vaguely remember crawling into bed soon after.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Early Morning Chef At Action

Y_tc8WSiNrpaGArHKPVCAA.text: Love this place! Went there a couple of times for breakfast. You can't go wrong! I'm not a huge breakfast eater, and their breakfast sandwiches were perfect! My go to is the bacon egg and cheese, my husband tried their sausage bacon & cheese and the tri tip. Said they were both good!  Don't let the line turn you away, it moves fast, and the wait for your food doesn't take long.

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uplxubuNnScqlYGEES9pEw.text: I love this place!   The eggslut makes amazing breakfast sandwiches. Their bacon is Crispy and a great cut! They give you plenty in your sandwich so you don't feel cheated!   We got: - Bacon, egg and cheese sandwich- their egg is very gooy so you get the runny yolk in your sandwich and it's delicious  -Slut- I love saying it! Lol! It's mash potatoes in a jar with poached egg with Crispy baguette pieces that you dip into the jar. How can you do wrong with this yummy madness!!   - sausage, egg, and cheese is just as yummy as the bacon!   - biscuit was delicious! Baked Crispy and soft.

nUpaRvtO-4mm0vLV3xjW0w.text: Not for me. Sorry but I wasn't wowed by the sandwich after the hype and long line. My sandwich had a super spicy overpowering thousand island type of sauce and that was all I tasted. Egg was ok again not worth all the hype people.

oJ554vUptwY0_CS1I2Ph-w.text: A visit to Eggslut while in Vegas (or at any of their locations, really) is a must! The Fairfax sandwich + bacon + avo - grilled onions is my go-to, with a Slut on the side. Yes, it might seem overwhelming at first, but just believe me that you cannot leave without trying the Slut. Stir everything up and eat it by itself, or with the baguette, or smother it all over your Fairfax. You simply can't go wrong -- unless you don't order it at all, and that's just plain preposterous!  Some tips: - The line can get long, but that's with any place in Vegas. Go a little early, like around 8AM, to catch breakfast and the line won't be wrapped around the corner and back up again. - Seating is limited. Go with a party of 4 or less, unless you don't mind not being seated together. There are also Cosmo couches, but I would recommend sitting at a table to scarf everything down. - Skip on the OJ; it's not worth $5 imo. - You also cannot get a cup of water here, so bring your own bottle. I carried around a bottle of ice water to stay hydrated in the 100+ degree weather anyway, so that didn't bother me. - After enjoying your Slut, remember to return the glass jar on the wall by the pick-up area!

Aa2p6KMcCrI4polZflhBxA.text: This place was recommended to me by a coworker and boy it has not disappointed. They've got something for everyone here. The flavors are spot on! It's now a place I need to visit every time I'm here in Vegas. The lines are long but they move fast. Trust me...The line is worth the wait!! I recommend their Slut item. By far the best Item on the menu. Ask for extra baguette and add a side of bacon if you need a meat item.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut: egg on top of housemade potato purée. Cooked in a glass jar topped w/gray salt &amp; chives served with slices of baguette add on bacon

q7X-7YCUw350kTE-uawVkg.text: I was really excited to see eggslut in LV after trying the one in LA.  The line wasn't too bad compared to the one in Grand Central Market.  After about 20 mins, we got to the front.  Tried the sausage sandwich, which was somewhat disappointing.  I was expecting a fluffy egg like prior but it was just a regular sunny side egg.  The bread was good as usual.  Next time, i'll stick to the Fairfax.  There was also quite a wait after ordering to receive your food, which was not unexpected as they are made fresh and to order.  Seating is hard to find so you'll probably end up sitting near the bar/common seating area or getting it to go.

EoX0eSvZCjP71qO5nKZOpw.text: Amazing food but the cashier was snobby and talked down to us. As we were paying, we asked for water cups and she rolled her eyes. Tip: you can only buy bottled water...  I had the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich and I loved it. The bread was delicious and the egg was perfect.

c43MTfXsUM4Cf3w8eF4nDA.text: Yum! Worth the wait in line, if you're debating if you should stand in it just do it! Have a drink in your hand and it will go by fast. Waited 24 minutes for the slut, bacon egg and cheese and sausage egg and cheese and the sausage was by far the best! Cold brew coffee was great too!

JRvIMhEXpmjEnkAWtiK33w.text: Worth the hype and worth a wait. Line wasn't too bad at 1pm, but they were cooking more sluts. Told it was about a 30 minute wait. So figured it was a good time to head to the chandelier bar for a drink. About 15 minutes later, Marlon came over to the bar to tell us our food was ready. It's great customer service that warms my heart. The egg slut was tasty, but the biscuit with honey butter was out of this world. Thanks eggslut, and thank you Marlon.

No idea how this place stays in business, though I suspect even a horrible restaurant can survive with a lot of Casino foot traffic.   The eggs are so greasy from them cooking them in way to much oil, and they don't taste good at all. I'm from NY and l love a good fried egg sandwich. Of course, if that's what you're looking for, stay clear of hear. Gave two stars because I like the restaurant name...ya

Z04U6F_g9gyj11Hobzdh6A.text: Worth the visit to the Cosmopolitan!  The sausage sandwich was soooooooo good making the late night munchies go away. There is always a line but they filter through it pretty quick.  BRING ONE TO THE BAY AREA!!!

They offer a few breakfast sandwiches either on bread or greens. Everything is fresh and tasty. Price is pretty reasonable as well. rAugbxn4KPQL-n7TV6656g.text: Perfect breakfast sandy (got the fairfax with sausage). The scrambled eggs are very smooth and creamy along with the bun and cheese.. everything comes together in a perfect breakfast sandwich. It has left an impression on me.. The next time I crush my normal Starbucks sausage breakfast sandwich.. I'll be entered into a dream like state of how I long for a Eggslut sandy..

iB9aUcGceHB3OUcQoAlUMg.text: Amazing! Staff was friendly and fast. The eggslut is amazing!! We also got the fairfax sandwich and it wasn't too spicy, just enough.

ZbqHRZV_jTNMM16ByQoucw.text: I wanted to check this place out the moment I heard of it. So, after we woke up we walked down to get us some egg sandwiches. There was a line already and I quickly noticed there was not enough seating except a counter like fixture along the edge of the store. We ordered the egg sandwiches which is what you would expect. They were good but honestly I did not see anything exceptional here. I actually turned my sandwich into a salad which the portion of lettuce was very small. They also serve your food like a fast food joint shouting your order number. I would probably recommend this place if you are on the run and need something to go like a fast food joint, but don't expect to sit or have an experience. Look for other options in the Cosmo for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YCSfPb5acBeR3CTMtD5fhQ.text: Very efficient operation working quickly even with a long line. Only issue was we ordered without the sauce and both sandwiches came coated with sauce on both sides. Very gracious about quickly preparing new ones. Limited seating so might want to get to go. Go next door to MILK to get your drink. Many more choices and cheaper

tBzw15JaxslLkR-l5dqPsw.text: Good food, but not much food for the price. I got the biscuit and honey butter. My husband got a hamburger. It was good, but I expected more.

M3Xj-ywIwrSco7QLoGQ8tQ.text: I finally got to try this place.  The fairfax was the bomb. Make sure you add a side of bacon in it. It was so fluffy and moist-everything you want in a perfect scramble egg.  The egg and bacon was good, however it cannot top the fairfax.  Cookie- decent  Just get the fairfax with bacon and you'll be pretty happy. A great place to go after the club. The lines can get pretty crazy around 4am though.

KpdwXSbVDmNCIeBBu4l59g.text: I got the Fairfax with turkey sausage.  It was pretty good, and I love that they use a brioche bun instead of a regular biscuit that would just fall apart.  Service was excellent as well.  This gets a 4 Star only because it was quite as AMAZING as people make it out to be, the food was good but average good.

SZCwrTGa_DjlxVGnmNP_gw.text: Yea.. I mean its a 30 min wait for an egg sandwich...  Nothing impressive. Heard people raving about this place so had to give it a try. Great hangover food, decently filling egg sandwich.. but at the end of the day it is nothing impressive. Be aware limited seating on busy mornings. Not great food to eat and walk around, kind of messy. Worth a try for a quick breakfast if you are staying at the cosmo, but if your gonna commute to this place, I wouldn't recommend it.

5-lL7lHIz_M32gquB4vsHw.text: Basic at best. Definitely the most expensive breakfast sandwich I've paid for. I had the bacon egg and cheese sandwich. Restaurant was nice but this isn't something I'll come back for.

OW5J7GE4HQFwBquH_DW2qA.text: Omg, it doesn't looked like it would be this good, my mouth is melting!! Great stop!! The slut is fabulous and so is the other sandwich, delish to its finest and I'm picky..

5gIiIMMu2vMfhU4hQnmfEA.text: This is the worst eggslut I've ever had... the yolk was over cooked and the mashed potato was way too salty. For $10.50 a jar this was a complete waste of my money!! If you want to try this place please go to LA or Glendale as this location is not living up to their hype!

Hy98iEQY3F0Y59EISwHgSA.text: So good! Great place for breakfast. There was a line but it moved very quickly. The staff seems to be pretty efficient in the back to make order completed quickly! Definitely recommend!
