Oj1nZkNN1xlVRO9GlTmjIg.text: The hype over this place is silly, the sandwich i got wasn't anything to write home about or fan over. I'm not a fan of this place, it's over overpriced even for Vegas and not really any better then Jack n box breakfast sandwich that you can get for under $5! Don't get me wrong its not horrible but i just didn't leave going wow this is amazing. The size of the sandwich left me hungry. The line was ridiculous long 15-20 min wrapping around corner probably more cause of the hype. Plus the wait varied all 3 of us ordered 1 after other and there was a 5-7 min difference in order being ready. The kitchen appears to be efficient but its not. Skip it save yourself $10 and go to Jack n Box off strip. But if you want to improve reduce the cost of the sandwich a buck or two or offer a side of hash browns and work on the efficiency of the kitchen, you have eggs, bacon, sausage ready i saw them. Work on getting the orders out faster and the line moving quicker.

y_0fQZTNYRGjk-7bIYZjrw.text: Over priced for what u get, but it is good. The drinks are very overpriced. Great place to sit, eat, and hang out.

rbfDpgrhWbH492FoFIkVdw.text: Quite simply... Eggslut keeps breakfast sexy at any time of the day. Long wait or not, these guys can take my money without any resistance from me :) The new Vegas location delivered with zero disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing at any time of the day

o03YnadD8WLJByKaE28UWg.text: Bomb.com!! Definitely need to try it! Bacon egg and cheese was an A+ & sausage egg and cheese was an A also!! "This was bomb, as a breakfast sand which"- friend said, def a good place to go to

WPbytXrHv52AmOB1NLHQ4w.text: Amazing egg sandwiches! They are open late on the weekends as well. Expect long lines but friendly service.

DVtJyJF0P1W0t6tPc-Z-qQ.text: Bacon, Egg, Cheese sandwich was delicious...what made it so good was the brioche bun. Bacon in slightly crispy, siracha ketchup has just enough flavor to bring it all together. Biscuit was fine with honey butter. Would have much preferred it to be warm. Worth the wait in line? You wait for everything else in Vegas...what's another 30 m

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese Buttermilk Biscuit

5WbZN4a15yg4RIIx1TEE5g.text: I've only been to Eggslut in LA once so when I went to Vegas and learned that they had one in the Cosmo, I was totally down. It gets busy in the morning and probably after clubbing since it is right across from Marquee but I went at an odd hour and was 3rd in line. I ordered the Slut, which like the other locations, is whipped potatoes topped with a soft boiled egg with a side of toast. I felt that the Slut was better than the one I had in LA. The potato to egg ratio felt right and you can taste the richness of the egg more in this version. I downed the dish in amount 5 minutes and although pricey, it's a meal to treat yourself with in the morning. I would definitely not suggest this particular dish for an after-clubbing meal. You need more sustenance than this... Go for the sandwiches after the club. I was very happy with my meal and I would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pTbYAj9X9Z1JUwviuCBSXA.text: I can't believe I spent that much on breakfast. And that I walked over a mile to get there. Worth it for a splurge when on vacation. I'd go back. Line gets long - overall took us about 35 minutes from lineup to food served.

-SrmxKP9Ff_koMZP9-73XQ.text: Looks can be deceiving! I'm from New York so I been eating BACON, EGG AND CHEESE most of my life and there's nothing like a corner store bacon egg and cheese. They add ketchup to there B.E.C which I didn't like. I was expecting for it to blow my mind but it didn't. The food isn't bad but honestly my 3 dollar B.E.C from Any Brooklyn corner store is better then there B.E.C. The line was super long, we waited about 30 mins just to order. If your staying on the strip and your a fan of breakfast sandwiches then you should definitely try it and see for yourself but to me it wasn't to my liking....   3.5 Stars for the Music #SuperLitPlaylist  1 star for my B.E.C (the buns/bread)

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yZELqDPtCTmDTjvCGXzlzw.text: It was a really long line- like really long and really really slow.  I didn't know it would be more like a "drunk food" bad for you sandwich until I got it and by then the 1/2 hour wait got me too tired to try to find an alternative.  I think I was just expecting a lighter version for morning. My impression of the food court is it is for drinking comfort food- not sure if there are hidden healthy options but I stopped looking.  Bar seating at a nicer place was faster and better.

E3afkoU3MGGe08uPpQNVyg.text: **$5 Coffee ***  Soooo ... yea .... I bought s breakfast sandwich and coffee which totaled $18. I'm not pleased with myself but what can I say... I crave breakfast and eggs all day. I made my peace by reminding myself the price is similar to SF or Oakland.   The sandwich was amazing ... savory with a scallion taste. It was quite filling ! Now the coffee ... geesh, can't believe I paid $5 for a 12 oz brew of regularness but when in Vegas ....  All in all it was tasty but I also could've save around $10 and ventured off the strip for an equally tasty croissant sandwich or something :/)

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu.
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes ... I paid $5 for a 12oz coffee and and like $12 for a breakfast Sammy
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fair fax sandwich with crispy bacon added . That brioche bun &amp;  chives taste were everything :-)

thf1k0v3bFiB1GkkRVTOLg.text: This is the place to go for breakfast on the LV strip! We had the sandwiches since we couldn't take out the original "slut". They were delicious. The downside to this place is that is so small that I had to wait in line for 55 minutes. It is a must try at least once but not somewhere I'd keep going during my full stay.

hSl15fm1RNssu-0imKm__A.text: Was the last of my crew to leave Vegas and I could not resist trying Eggslut. I have been trying to eat at the one in Grand Central Market, but the line is always INSANE! This was just my speed, a nice 20 min or so wait for some deliciousness!! I got the Figueroa and added the sausage and avocado...it definitely hit the spot and the coffee was good, very good flavor and I felt it about 30 min after drinking it.  I also had to get the fresh baked cookie, that was heaven in my mouth. I loved the sweet with the salty, perfect combo.  I'm definitely getting the slut next time!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My breakfast for one...I had to give it a try. DELISH!

qukQK4BGO61aJ-aokKOwPQ.text: My daughter and I went to Eggslut and we were glad we did. I got the sandwich with Bacon and I would call it more of a bacon sandwich with egg. It was delicious! The service was a little slow but it was quite busy so it was worth the wait. I will be going back here next time I am in Vegas.

8Ek7AmePQJ9cceDkJj-9wQ.text: Wow the wait for this place is crazy!  I've tried the one in LA and most recently this location, and wow.. it's like an hour wait for a breakfast sandwich!  Anyways, the first time I ate it was in LA and I tried the Fairfax sandwich, which was a soft scrambled egg, chives, cheddar cheese, caramelized onions, sriracha mayo in a warm brioche bun.  This was very delicious and the texture of the egg was just so velvety.  I would pay $8.50 for this.  I also tried the infamous "Slut" which was a coddled egg over a buttery potato puree, served with bread.  Yes, this was good... BUT, how can you go wrong with buttery mashed potatoes and en egg on top though?  I wouldn't pay for this ($10.50?!)  In Vegas, I tried the Gaucho, and OMG, my opinion about this place completely changed.  It was basically seared wagyu tri-tip steak, over medium egg, chimichurri, red onions and dressed arugula in a warm brioche bun.  This is definitely a must try!!!  It was just so damn good.  It is expensive though at $15... but so worth it.  I don't know if I would wait in a hour+ line for breakfast sandwiches... but maybe next time I'll just ask some randoms at the front of the line to buy the sandwich for me and tip them... haha

x7MXi-YdsQTmG6dVf0j8LQ.text: The food was AMAZING! the line to order was very long but service seemed quick to it didn't take as long As I thought it would. This place deserves 5 stars! Pricey but hey you pay for quality.

7T1Tpk8Zjfj4VHcvnoRP0g.text: Wow.  Honestly it is not that often that places you hear about on foodnetwork are as good as they say, but eggslut was AMAZING.  I had the housemade turkey sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich.  The egg was perfectly cooked and the sausage was phenominal.  If I hadn't already blew my diet in Vegas I probably would have gotten a second and an eggslut.  It was soooooooo good.

sEQCoG_8mn5OKgUae22irA.text: Eggslut is definitely a place you need to eat at when visiting Las Vegas. I heard about this place on the Food Network and made it a mission to give it a try. Sad to say when I got there at 7 in the morning I had a massive line ahead of me. After waiting for about 20-25 minutes it was my turn to order. I just went with a simple egg, bacon, and cheese sandwich with a biscuit on the side. The sandwich was wonderful, but the biscuit was a bit dry for my taste. The seating arrangement is similar to a food court, so open seating wherever you can find a spot. It was an overall great experience and I definitely will go back once I make my way to Vegas again..

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg,Bacon and cheese sandwich
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuit with butter
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg,Bacon and cheese sandwich

MtQZ5b7XZ9fIj6gXOgHNmg.text: If you're willing to wait 20-30 minutes for your food, this place is delicious! We got in line around 8 AM for breakfast on a Friday and the line was already wrapped around the building. But I've always wanted to try this place in LA so I was willing to wait. It was definitely worth it.  My husband and I both got egg, bacon, and cheese sandwiches. The buns are perfectly crunchy and buttered and the chipotle ketchup adds so much to what would've been just a plain ol' breakfast sandwich. We got a ton of questions about where we got our food as we carried it back up to our room (at that hour there was no seating available at the restaurant). We would definitely eat here again!

I_noGOOHOM84-8NUGQ6CAQ.text: Always a spot I hit when I'm in Vegas! Breakfast sandwiches seem so simple but they take it to the next level. The OJ there is awesome as well. Make sure if you're in Vegas you stop at eggslut!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TH3rlrOEuutDNwoSfkXnrA.text: It's good but would be even better if you were drunk or hungover. I want to give it three stars but I know it could be so much better if it was hot. My daughter said best time is after midnight also though she usually hit it up after a night out at 2 am. I would be willing to set an alarm because my old as$ is sleeping

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

woZep35MdyWJXaDvPsmH0w.text: Eggslut makes a really good breakfast sandwich. I wouldn't say I found Jesus after eating there, but the sandwich was nice and fresh, and the "Slut" egg dish (poached egg, mashed potatoes, crostini) was tasty. I'd definitely go back again if I was in the area, but only if it has a short line. Good? Yes. Great? I don't think I'd say that.

bXQSBL4lOTEDK79K8LdfaA.text: Eggslut is just as good as it looks! I've seen a ton of people tag this spot in their Instagram stories over the past few months and knew I had to try it for myself. You may have had a breakfast sandwich before, but not like this. After one bite, you'll understand why the line goes around the corner of the store.  When I finished my breakfast Bacon, Egg, & Cheese I really wanted another one and regretted not ordering two from the start. The "warm brioche bun" was actually the star of the sandwich! I don't think I've ever noticed the bun on a breakfast sandwich before, but I definitely noticed this one. It was so soft and flavorful! Can I go back to Vegas just for this sandwich?  As a midwesterner, I wish they served milk with their meals. But I guess you can't have everything. 5-Stars for the sandwich, seriously, it's that good!

JiMgSBoEKGcsN580TU1HZw.text: Overhyped and overpriced.  This is a trendy place with all the social media hype and tatted' up millennials all over it.  Their sandwiches are NOT  better than a mcd's sausage mcmuffin with egg, so get over yourselves.

jIoNHDzJ32x8kcoe-oI7Jg.text: After staying in the cosmopolitan for a for days I witnessed a repeated event; HUGE lines at Eggslut!  I wanted to go each day but the lines were really long and the wait extended past endless it seemed. So, at lunch hour I trekked into a blissful line-less experience. Almost instantly I was ordering and it felt like a dream.  I ordered up the GAUCHO, which per the menu was wagyu steak, over medium egg, chimichurri and red onions in a handsome bun.   I patiently waited an few minutes and selected a table. The seating at the cafe is limited so additional tables are in the main hall area. This area is dressed in a theme resembling Alice n' Wonderland including a chair with giant bunny ears.   In short order the sandwich came and it was tasty, but not rock this world tasty, just tasty.   I would return only when the line is not gargantuan.    Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Couple of good looking sandwiches right there!
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DmweY6pZzAAj5bsj1dmSrg.text: I'd heard good things about Eggslut but was a little apprehensive when I showed up to a long line. First you order your food, then you have to stand around for them to call your name, then hope you can find a seat. Is it worth it? hell yes! I had the Fairfax Sandwich (Cage-free soft scrambled eggs and chives, cheddar cheese, caramelized onions and sriracha mayo in a warm brioche bun) that I added Bacon too. Oh my goodness it was amazing. I never thought I'd be that excited about an egg sandwich. Add in the stylish decor, huge light fixture made from mixer beaters, and some awesome tunes and it was a great place to start our last day in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

35t9HYc1tEEqrZqGjh9TpA.text: Excellent breakfast place.  The slut was surprisingly good, as was the fairfax.  Rather unfortunate name, though - Eggslut? Really?   The line was loooong but it moves pretty quick.

KvXYe7bjvvSwXVR86fLT0A.text: First things first, there is always a long wait outside this place going down the corridor next to it. However, it is about the same as a regular restaurant wait. We arrived about 9am one morning, and still were very far-- but waited roughly 20 minutes to order, which wasn't so bad.   The menu options are simple: bacon egg and cheese, homemade-sausage egg and cheese, a burger, a steak option, and regular egg and cheese. They have an egg over easy dish and biscuits, but neither looked appetizing to me.   Our group ordered a couple bacon egg and cheeses and sausage and cheeses, and WOW. This was really the best breakfast sandwich I've had in a very long time, and possibly ever. The turkey sausage was homemade and very well done. Super flavorful. The bacon egg and cheese had a ketchup type sauce on it that had a good bite. Totally 5 star worthy. The service is pretty fast and kind too.   The only draw back is don't arrive thirsty-- this is Vegas. A bottle of water will cost you $5, and fresh squeezed orange juice is like $5-8. Also, seating gets tight when it gets busy, so consider taking our sandwich on a still on the strip!

EORej-T3d7gYUnPKgjXtzQ.text: Came on a Sunday morning and the line was only about 15 minutes. I had the gaucho burger and the wagyu meat was cooked to medium rare perfection. Unfortunately, the yolk broke early so I didn't get too much yolk in my burger, but the warm brioche bun was easy to bite through and made up for it. None of the ingredients overpowered one another so it was a great balance of flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gaucho - wagyu beef

glN0jz_BLFBmh4ALTSp2Ww.text: I loooove their sausage and bacon breakfast sandwich! This is the only sandwhich place that I know of that has GLUTEN-FREE bread, so I can have it without comsequence. The key for me is to get the eggs soft scrambled, otherwise they will make it runny. The sandwiches are a little overpriced, but it is on the strip inside the Cosmopolitan so that is to be expected.

av1ecgbHe-OXAt3uemSJBg.text: So much hype about this place. We went at about noon for a late breakfast and the place was lined up around the corner. We waited patiently and were so excited to try our breakfasts...but... we were disappointed. It was nothing special. Certainly not worth waiting in line for. About as good as a breakfast sandwich anywhere. Turkey sausage patty was salty and tough to cut through.

A5dOS77djhMOcRt5kJaENw.text: This place is always a hit it is located right outside of the Marquee club in the Cosmo. I love the fresh squeezed OJ they have, the slut is a major hit, and the sausage sandwich on the brioche bun. So to describe what the slut actually is since the name sounds a little sketchy lol it is a coddled egg with mashed potatoes garnished with chives that you spread on freshly toasted sour dough slices I promise u although it sounds so simple it is very delicious a for sure must try. The presentation is also interesting because it comes in a small little jar prepped as you order. There are only a few locations so be sure to take advantage while you are in Vegas. Plus after a night out on the town in Vegas it's guaranteed to hit the spot.

2oj3g3e_kKQzXy2jw4zbig.text: Loved it! Not a huge menu but what they do they do to perfection. Get food was prepared well. The only complaint I could share was if you get there at the wrong time there will be a long line. And that has no bearing on the food

9KHzmksqbyKtZA1FLRBA3Q.text: Totally over rated.  Long lines for sandwiches that are no better than anywhere else.  I think the lines have more to do with the fact that Vegas is lacking in quick breakfast spots than the fact that the food here is amazing.  If no line, go ahead but otherwise not worth it.

zr9_FbWu9F8VL2POBLo3Fw.text: Just shut up and take my money! Eggslut was soo soo good. Luckily there was no line when we went but mind you we came around 4:30pm on Saturday. The fairfax was an awesome sandwich. Add a side of bacon to make it even better.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax w/bacon

K4VxcxRD6clc1gheQDzXOg.text: I had the fair fax and it was delicious. Wait was about 20 minutes. Not too bad. Egg was so fluffy. I asked for it to go when I got my order and the lady was not so nice about it. Have a smile lady, it cost you a star.

dfJNbJs3haHm8JeCWFvIQw.text: We had the slut which was amazing!  If you like creamy mashed potatoes this is a must try!  I also had the steak sandwich (can't remember the name). It had a bit of a kick but was cooked to perfection and had very good flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak sandwich and eggslut.
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggslut

l-0vHvkmCmfDusIjLhKnuA.text: The name alone popped at me. I love eggs so why not try it. Damn I am glad that I did. It's quick service name calling style. The seating area was not the cleanest u guess because of how messy the eggs get. Besides that. Staff was fast with the food and my gosh was it delicious. I had a potato puree mixed with scallions and egg. It was unreal. Very interesting mix. It comes with hard bread to dip into or smear it on. Recommend if you are in the are. Don't go OUT of your way

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty slut ;)
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That Slut
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HU1TJVSQpRmTKPdHPY_TdA.text: THE LINE IS WORTH IT! This was my first time at Eggslut and I admit I was discouraged when I saw the super long line out the door, but I'm glad we waited! I ordered the Slut which is a boiled egg on top of a puree of potatoes in a jar along with a side of baguettes. (I added a side bacon) The boiled egg is cooked to perfection as the yolk is warm and runny. Perfect food after a night of Vegas-ing/drinking! Thank you Eggslut!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut w/ bacon

gQ1QK5xiPbZAZE1u0Emqug.text: This place is very good! Super flavorful, super filling, but you have to wait super long. I waited over an hour just to order the food and we ate it at the lounge that was across from the store.   We tried a little bit of everything, but my favorite was the gaucho sandwich and the slut. The gaucho's meat was prepared and seasoned very well. The slut was interesting. It seemed like a poached egg with mashed potatoes on the bottom, but it was definitely good.   Having 11 people in the party, we ordered around $400 of food and the food came out surprisingly fast. The staff was friendly and tried to accommodate us as best as possible.   Definitely would recommend this place for tourists, but only if they are willing to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Definitely should try the Gaucho!!

N3Xdjw8hYI-zmZsDWFf66Q.text: Great spot.  One of my favorites in Vegas.  The line is long for a reason. The only downside is they close earlier than most restaurants.

nAu7xrHRqG1cMIad4y9Vnw.text: Amazing! Perfect. Now if only they can open one in NY. The glass jar that contains the egg and potatoes is adorable. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omg!  I thought my expectations were way too high based on other reviews but not so. The Slut was amazing. The baguettes were amazing!

LqPZvnFBKnKyHZixEYjU2g.text: #1 Thing you need to know, THE LINE IS WORTH IT! Some lines in Vegas are NOT worth it, this line is worth it. Rookie mistake though, don't get in line without a coffee from somewhere else to hold you over.   #2 I live in NYC - where I like to think the bodega breakfast sandwich reigns supreme, but this spot blew us away! Absolutely divine bread, and the ingredients in between (we tried 3 different sandwiches) were all fresh and high quality! Praying for Eggslut NYC! PLEASE!

_DvbgsEQHS3XkIyh3CFOpw.text: I went to the one in LA last year and wasn't impressed. Decided to give it another try when I saw there was an Eggslutt in Vegas. So glad I did!  I got the eggslutt and the sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich which were both delicious!  Definitely a must try when you're in Vegas. I wish they opened later.

dNuTQOqH-alFHsAJZUVMjg.text: I heard about this place so  I walked 2 miles to try the egg salad.....delicious! Fast and friendly service!  I will return to try the slut next time!

y9VX3jDyME5Xltj9Zs6Fdw.text: My star ratings are (as always) based on the food & the service those things that can be controlled by the business.  So I do hold the nearly 30 minute wait in line on a Tuesday morning @ 0800 against the Eggsult, they were doing the best they could given the amount of customer they had.  All the staff I saw were moving/working fast & efficiently, in fact the cook/prep area seem to function as a well oiled machine the whole time I watched them.   Now the important stuff.....I had the "Fairfax" with bacon and avocado added.  It was the right amount of food for a good breakfast.  I spent about $15..... It nearly blew my mind that I was spending that much on basically an egg sandwich...... BUT, it turned out to be very possibly the absolutely BEST EGG SANDWICH that I have ever eaten! It was nearly egg sandwich perfection. Well worth every penny it cost.   On top of the that, even though they were clearly very busy, the staff was very friendly, helpful, and customer centered.  You could tell that they clearly enjoyed their jobs and like the crowds of customers.    Overall a really great breakfast experience in Vegas.  FYI - the place is a little difficult to find, it is in the shops on the second floor of the Cosmopolitan Casino.

NOXVlODesSEgQWy0e0EeXg.text: Waiting for a conference to start one morning, I was a little early and wanted to find something to eat at the Cosmo.  The wife (M) and I walked by Eggslut and saw a line down the hallway.  "Must be pretty good if people are willing to wait that long for it," M remarked.  We walked around looking for something with a shorter line, but couldn't find anything we really wanted, so we got in line.  30 minutes later, we finally ordered a Slut and a Gaucho. And we weren't disappointed.   I've never been so impressed with a Slut before, but this one had me wishing I could eat Sluts over and over again. My wife just about pushed me out of the way so she could eat my Slut. I begged her to let me take another Slut home, but she said no. Oh well.   Eat a Slut and be happy.

Hdky1ELgJsHV9YlmbjxJ_g.text: 07:15 on a Saturday and there is still a line at Egg Slut. Ordered the Fairfax and it was quite enjoyable. Soft and slightly sweet brioche bread, generous scrambled egg with a nice Sriracha mayo. Would enjoy eating this again but I wouldn't bother if the wait is 30 minutes or more.

ZCvbzInpgOkyEnggPLcHTA.text: all I can say is OMG I NEED one of these in CA OC HB ... SO BADLY!! It was so amazingly delicious.!!

IwuGVTgeNG6WqkdDK7ypKA.text: They will ways have a little bitnof a wait. BUT everything on the menu is worth the wait. My family who was complaining about eating here while we're waiting in line but one Taste of the food it was nothing about praises that I picked this place.. you will love this place

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5omePnrUL3ayZCwcIxWydw.text: For an egg sandwich place you get what you wait for.  The sausage egg cheese sandwich is pretty filling and juicy but if I had to wait 2 hours to get one (like at the DTLA location) I would definitely pass.  Fortunately the vegas location the wait isnt that long.  I arrived at 11am on Friday and was out of there by 1130am.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage egg cheese sandwich

9WoMP3Zml0bdPyy29pplMw.text: Best breakfast sandwiches hands down worth the 30 min wait in line... slut was good too... my favorite was the cookie! I guess I will be eating here more often.

488j1P88yIv714DAHSrIlQ.text: What can I say? We fell for the hype...  We wanted to grab a quick bite to eat before hopping on the plane and while I was in favor of Earl of Sandwich in our hotel, hubby wanted to try out Eggslut as it had been on his list for a while. When we arrived, I ran to secure seats and hubby hopped in the semi-long line which was growing by the minute. I honestly thought the menu was more exhaustive judging by the thousands of pics on Yelp but it was pretty straightforward with about 15 items total (including drinks).  I went for the sausage/egg/cheese, hubby got the cheeseburger, and our friend ordered the Gaucho. Our friend and I agreed that our food was pretty average, especially for the price (pricing is on par with other popular Vegas spots) but hubby was loving his burger... he was committed and was going to hold on to hope. I will say that the medium fried egg and aioli was pretty different for your typical SEC sandwich and the bread was pretty quality. I can't say that I would rush back to this place though. By the way, the beverages are highly upcharged in my opinion - $5 for a can of soda or 12 oz of orange juice is kinda ridiculous.

RcOlcYzrx9Z7zR8yKKk_xg.text: Good, but over hyped in my opinion. They didn't have the salad option due to being out of Arugula, which, I get it that happens. My sandwhich was meh, coffee sizes are small for what you pay. Husband's sandwhich was much better than mine. Customer service kind of had the attitude of we know we're hot right now and don't need to go above and beyond. Not rude, just nothing special. There is a line to order and a wait for food, but we weren't in a hurry so that wasn't a big deal.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My sandwich on the left, hubby&#39;s on the right.

R2k5bR0RbEgLQ9WW_xdAog.text: My husband and I ate here on our honeymoon last week. It was so good we came back the next day for more. We tried the Bacon, egg and cheese sandwich, the buttermilk biscuit and the slut; everything was delicious! I really wish we had one in Boise, ID. We would eat there all the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4qQ6QDBRD0Snvy1Q9SQjGQ.text: so glad they opened up a vegas location so I could finally try this place. get the gaucho-the steak with the chimichurri was so dang good. OJ tasted super fresh and delish. will be coming back for breakfast! line moved fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Gaucho

iRDql6gDmuxDaWnd9FpQLw.text: Ok my husband waited in the long line for me... we got the fairfax with avacado. Really good! I can see what the hype is about

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax with avacado
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu found in the waiting hall

yle1wFzAVmJ6l6dsssGRNg.text: So good! Very simple but it has layers of flavor that is exclusive to this brand of slutting.  Will I return to this place? You bet your ass.

zFcKpv4YZkqN_fP509e7_Q.text: Stopped by Egg Slut on a Saturday morning. There was no wait to order or to receive my order. Very impressed with there service and food!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soo tasty!

mFmQELMrFF3faXksu5gPMQ.text: Stop complaining, and just get in the lineup. It's worth it.  What I love about eggslut is that they're not doing anything particularly complicated. I had the sausage and egg sandwich. Small brioche bun, turkey sausage patty, fried egg and slice of cheese. Honey mustard and butter on the bun. That's it, nothing magic. But what they done is made sure that each of those elements is fantastic. And that's how you make a great breakfast sandwich.

0sKcPuyDZcALKsGwiy9ZSQ.text: Great place to grab a nice sandwich in the morning on the strip. I like the fact that their eggs are organic. Tastes really good! (Even though I don't believe their sandwich are that healthy, cuz it's burger style.) Reasonable price for sandwich/burgers. BTW, their egg slut tastes amazing, too!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese burgers. Tastes sooooo good!

hHI7y-6CdboDzedFsGOkww.text: First time in Vegas and I decided to try this place for lunch. Everywhere is pricey, so I didn't cry when I paid $25 for a side salad, cheeseburger, and water.   I have to say though, damn that burger was sexy. I didn't realize it had an egg on the cheeseburger, but it was perfect. The brioche bun was also fresh and divine. The egg in the burger was cooked with a runny yolk. The side salad was arugula with a very tart vinaigrette.   Be prepared to wait a bit but the food is worth it. Seating is also limited.

58NstdyVknk20te3o9_NAA.text: Sandwiches are made to order with fresh ingredients. Not much of variety for vegetarians but still tasty!! Only issue is seating, there are three bars but those fill up fast after 9am.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggslut Las Vegas,NV

mornVJ-v-S9IPxde0kyoKw.text: Such a wonderful experience in itself here at the Eggslut. Food was good but heavy. Menu was unique in this fun environment. Eggslut was super well made and filling. You have to try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the slut

XLq8YAnSnCOH_GmSlxivng.text: The food is good but it is definitely over price. I order the sausage egg bigger with Avocado and my husband order ordered cheese burger with Avocado, two orange juice and a side salad. The price is about $50.. the most expensive burger I've ever had. Again, the taste is good, environment is nice. If you have a lot of money, you can go and try out. I would only try it once.

UtyIWXMDctbbA5WNxq8n0Q.text: Every time I come to Las Vegas (2nd time) I have to say, eggslut is on the top of my places to visit at least once ! The concept of egg based food items is great, and the slut is my favorite item on the menu. Only downside? It is a bit pricey for what you receive (the Slut was about $10) but I wouldn't pass it up.  Their water is $4 + as well, and they do not offer any tap water to drink from. They're open from 12am on Saturday and it seemed like a great time to come as there was no line at all. I'll be looking to coming back here again !

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut

UOJShaFfuNpe-1BTPRvDNw.text: Eggslut is really awesome! We visited when we were in Vegas in March, and we loved it! It's located in The Cosmopolitan, and it's a rather small spot. You stand in line, order, and wait for your order to come to the pick-up counter. There's not a ton of seating in the actual restaurant, but there is seating around the area within the hotel where you can sit. We lucked out and actually sat inside, but it's a really casual vibe.   Eggslut offers egg sandwiches, specialties, and sides. I opted for The Fairfax, which is soft scrambled eggs and chives, cheddar cheese, caramelized onions and sriracha mayo in a brioche bun. It was seriously one of the best egg sandwiches I've ever had. I highly recommend it!  B got the Cheeseburger, which was a ground Angus beef burger, an over medium egg, caramelized onions, bread and butter pickles, cheddar cheese, and dijonnaise in a brioche bun. I wasn't sure about this one... a cheeseburger, for breakfast? But, I tried a bite and it was really tasty!  If you're in the area and you're looking for a great casual breakfast/brunch spot I definitely recommend Eggslut! It's great!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RgXwePkRbi0QjRUfKILwlg.text: In Vegas and had the opportunity to try Eggslut. Really good breakfast sandwich. I didn't think the hype was worth it tho. Kinda pricey for what you get. I would have been content with a McMuffin.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h6aE7QS6SoJIGAP57xx1ZA.text: Eggs!  Eggslut is a very interesting name.  They are located inside The Cosmopolitan.  It was around 1am and my friend and I were hungry as we just got to Vegas.  Originally we wanted pizza from the Secret Pizza but the line was too long so we settled for Eggslut.  When we got there, there was no line.  They have an ok amount of selections.  I got the bacon and egg sandwich without the cheese.  My friend got the Slut.  The bacon and egg sandwich was pretty good but was kinda small.  I like the sweetness of the sandwich though.  My friend said the slut was salty and not what was expected.  She was hungry but that didn't fill her up.  It's just couple pieces of small breads and small glass jar of egg and potato spread.  The slut is more like a snack than a meal.  Maybe we got the wrong items.  Nothing to rave about.  They weren't up the hype.  Prices are high but it's Vegas.  Services were ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon egg sandwich and Slut
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and egg sandwich without cheese

brdnyKV9VE8RMJpN45XO6A.text: Hmm, I wanted to love this place but it just didn't really hit the spot.  We waited in a huge line for a breakfast sandwich and I was saying to my husband that I hope it's great because of the line but it just missed the mark (and was overpriced IMO).  My husband really didn't like the ketchup on his sandwich and mine had mayo I think which was ok. It was just mediocre and I don't understand the thrill because there are so many good places to eat in Vegas but .

uK6fJ8ndCXnsNAFRsNF6RA.text: Love the name.  Super Solid spot Would eat again and would recommend.   Other than the long line and the value for the price this place is pretty amazing. The only problem for me is honestly I can eat 3 of these to be full and I would say I'm average portion breakfast eater. So the value just isn't there. But if you got the coin go ahead and grab a few. It's Vegas so I guess your going to spend it somewhere anyways.   We got the Bacon, Egg and Cheese and a Fairfax and split them both. While both were good Me and Wifey both agree the Bacon Egg and Cheese is the Clear Winner. Meat over double egg all day. It clearly wasn't a fair fight.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mission Accomplished
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg, and Cheese (Definitely the Way to Go) Look at the Yolk
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sluts

Jlpw9qirdB89MTZcS6fzqQ.text: Great sammy, but on the Gaucho I felt like I did not get the full value of the wagyu because it was pre-cooked and warmed in the oven. The chimichurri was good and the arugula added great flavor. The Bacon, Egg & Cheese was delish, the brioche bun was a perfect match. The price was $29.88 for two sandwiches. Make sure you go early because the line gets super long. #shutthefrontdoor

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hubby Happy!
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aGA_WjRrgD-D268ACixg1w.text: Every time I'm in Vegas I make the trip to Egg Slut.  One of my favorite breakfast food places.  Everything tastes amazing!   I always over order but enjoy every bite.  The slut is my favorite item.  Followed by the Fairfax.  Eggs are my favorite food.  Sloppy scrambled, poached, boiled, just yumm.  I've had everything there.  Some are great to snack on or energize your day.  Others like the burger are perfect for hangovers.  The line always moves fast, so even if it's long don't worry.  The only thing is the price.  I have a hard time justifying the price sometimes.  But it is Vegas so I splurge and love it every time!

MVVKaEoJ7V6esxLbpty4UQ.text: Came here multiple times this trip and even ordered the "slut". Didn't know what to expect from it but it basically reminds me of mash potatoes with egg! Mm. The bread it comes with I can do without, it's too salty for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nJm08dOgVbaB0NpWcRKWPw.text: Eggslut is one of my favorite quick casual breakfast places! Their breakfast sandwich is so simple, yet so delicious. It tastes like home. I love their scrambled egg bowl with arugula, such a healthy and flavorful way to start the day! You can really taste the quality of their ingredients, grab some of their fresh OJ and you are off to a great start of the day!

ckO1WmJWtUAdDJkWg8CYSw.text: 7/10  Pretty nice breakfast sandwich. Not sure i would line up for it though. The wait was about 20 minutes lon at around 11 am. I wish their egg was less cooked so it would be gooey. The turkey sausage was also a bit of a letdown,it wasn't juicy. I prefer sausage egg muffin from mcdonalds haha  Not bad,and i guess if you wanna try something else.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1CMyCUuMzzsmuKAKcgeGGw.text: Eggslut is overhyped!!! You could honestly go to McDonald's and get a McMuffin and be just as satisfied, if not more. I got the sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich. The best part of the sandwich was the bread used. The bread is very moist and light. The eggs were cooked just fine. I was given the option to specify if I wanted it fried hard or wet. Can't go wrong with that. The sausage was very dry but it's turkey and I get it. The sausage was seasoned well and had a nice flavor to it. The cheese was cheese. Again, the sandwich was just okay. I also got a buttermilk biscuit. The biscuit was very dry and hard. It was not flaky or anything like that. It was just a hard biscuit. The best part and what made the biscuit better was the honey butter. It took the biscuit from a 2 to a 7. The butter is quite thick but it's not bad. I personally would never get another biscuit from here again. I think coming here at least once is good for the experience but, I would not go out of my way to return here.

Q3aK4vxTWO-DgC1ufRexUQ.text: Waiting in line expectations just naturally builds. It must be great, it must be good to have this many people wait for it.  Maybe it's the trendy name or so many people want to justify the wait.  The food however just felt and tasted plain. The ratio of bread to filling was too thick and egg was cooked to over hard in their sandwich. Their specialty the "slut" was a tasty for first 2 bites but potatoes and bread lacked other components that could have made great like, something crunchy or salty to keep you going for more.   Glad I was able to see what the hype was about but wouldn't be back again with all the other food choices on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut

E56FDho7VZNSDqMtVLxebQ.text: All I have to say is: order the Fairfax!! The eggs are so fluffy and dreamy. The sriracha mayo adds a tiny kick that gives it such good flavor!   My husband ordered the bacon, egg and cheese but he wasn't all that thrilled - when he took a bite of the Fairfax (what I ordered) he said it was SO much better!

8JLlhE8Yd8idKt_NiOh5HQ.text: If you can find a time to go to Eggslit when it's NOT busy, then it's totally worth it. I came around 11:15 AM which is a prime breakfast time and the line was wrapped way around the corner. The line moved quickly and took about 20 minutes to order, but waiting for food was a different story.  I ordered The Slut which is a potato puree in a jar with and egg on top, served with french bread. Since The Slut was essentially premade, it took literally 2 minutes to receive. My friend on the other hand ordered a burger and sandwich which took another 20 minutes or so to get.  The flavor is definitely 5/5 in the slut, but I found it to be too small of a serving and not worth the wait of the line. Would definitely return if the line was short though!

2A0ALDAZKKapTcA6bwgXUQ.text: WOAH. I've never had a breakfast sandwich like this before. The bread is so fluffy and falls apart in your mouth like a freshly baked donut that is extremely spongy. The eggs are English eggs to die for, super creamy and also fall apart in your mouth.   I ordered the fair fax and added avocado, best choice I ever made. It made the sandwich so much more creamy and fluffy, but the bacon gave it a really great crunch that contrasts all the softness. Onions, if you like them, also a great idea to add texture.   One is pretty big and filling for me but if you have an appetite like my boyfriend, you're probably going to want another one or just do what he did and eat half of mine LOL

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax breakfast sandwich, added avocado
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax breakfast sandwich with avocado, incredible and life-changing!

lQCCeXpMCfJ_499qSG8GGA.text: Came here expecting a long wait but worth the wait due to the high positive reviews.   Line moved quickly however the expectations were a let down. I would never wait in line for this average tasting breakfast. At least I took it off my bucket list

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KM9ravAqqHqGvOH9SYJanA.text: I cannot describe how good the Fairfax sandwich is here.  My wife suggested we get breakfast here on our first day in Vegas, and I am so thankful we did.  At first I was skeptical and thought, how good can an egg sandwich be?  I couldn't have been more wrong.  After my first sandwich, I woke up the next day at 6am craving another.  I sat and waited until they opened to get it again.  They are that good.  I only had the Fairfax, as I couldn't see myself getting something different with how amazing this sandwich was.  The sandwich comes with fluffy scrambled eggs, chives, carmelized onions, cheddar, and siracha mayo.  I added bacon to mine to give it a little more texture the second time and it was even better.  The thing that really puts these sandwiches over the top is the delicious brioche buns they use.  Buttery and fresh, it is just perfect.  It is also a really fun experience to go here and wait for your sandwich.  While it can take some time, you get to watch the assembly line style process that goes into making all of the sandwiches.  I would definitely say this is a must stop for breakfast when in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax.  Amazing!

4hLRGepCUeP_aBU8JUxYzg.text: I was excited to try Eggslut after hearing such good things, but I'm sad to say it was nothing special. I visited on a 4pm Saturday and there was no line. I ordered the bacon egg and cheese sandwich, and the sandwich itself looked picture perfect. The bun was toasted nicely on the outside and soft on the inside. However, the bacon was crispy but did not have much flavor to it. The egg also did not taste freshly cooked but warmed up on the grill. Sadly,  the sandwich was not as filling as I expected and left much to be desired.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese

yLLG_5lgHgDD57Eu-AKhVw.text: If you're in the mood to pay an extra $4 dollars just to eat a sandwich on fancy brioche bun, here's the spot.  Ordered a Classic Bacon Egg and Cheese Sandwich, during late afternoon, there was zero line at the time. The amount of time it takes to get the sandwich you think they are waiting for chicken to hatch the egg 1st.  It's a perfectly fine sandwich and there really isn't much to say about bacon egg and cheese. My only knock on the place was the fact that the bun definitely was past it's prime and started to get that tough outer staleness that bread gets after being out all day.   Nothing crazy, and a cool commodity to a super cool dining hall.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fzZA2c_9-BwEAV23D8GM6A.text: Came in on a Friday 12pm when it was super busy because of a big award show in town. We waited like 15min. It's cool to see how they prepare your food in the back because of the open kitchen. There are also cute egg chairs to sit and enjoy your meal! We had the eggsalad sandwich and thought it was good but could have used more eggsalad filling. The taste was great though. You can tell their ingredients are high quality. The bread bun was not soft either and was a bit dry. We also ordered the eggslut special. I imagined it to be larger but it's really the size of a side dish. But the texture of the potato was so yummy. Overall, I kind of expected more from this place because of all the hype. I don't think I'd be willing to wait in that line again because it wasn't to die for. But if there's a shorter line next time, I'll definitely try out more off their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut

t2HTxZZuAZlmxzhVvFaP5Q.text: The food is good. Fairfax sandwich was to die for. The eggs were tender and tasty. The burger is tasty and not too dry. We also try the egg salad sandwich. It was ok but nothing too special though.   The reason that it got 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the wait! Wow, the line is long, and they only open one register to take order, we wait for about 30 minutes to order, then another 30 minutes to get the food! I wish that they can make things more efficient. The cook is trying their best (we can see the way they cook, there is no way that they can speed things up), they need another one or two grill to cook the sandwich. One grill is simply not enough.   So if you are planning to go, take it easy and wait. The food comes out in batches. Once all the sandwiches in that batches gone, you have to wait for them to cook another batch, and that may take 10 minutes.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QQG1H6hpbFXfgkV-LY5AMg.text: I had heard of Eggslut through some friends on the west coast and just had to give it a shot. I'm so glad I did - what an amazing way to start my day! I went with the fairfax and added turkey sausage with a cold brew. The sandwich was flavorful, served hot, and made me want another one (even though I was stuffed). I can't wait to get back west to try this spot again!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax

-gAAg2tyVOGcLQLVLOQ7Qg.text: A little pricey for what it is, but overall done pretty well.  Enjoyed the fairfax the most despite it being the most simple, please add avocado! Buns are on the sweeter side so some may enjoy it a lot more than others.

pf5N6-7v9SSRXfj1URYn1Q.text: There's definitely a line, even on slower Vegas visits. Came here for some grub after check-in and we waited for 15 mins. Went pretty quick actually. We were chicken and ordered the bacon,egg, & cheese sandwich along with the buttermilk biscuit. CARBS FOREVER!!!! I considered trying the Slut but I was starving and if that was my only choice and I didn't like it, this review could have been much worse.  The sandwich was tasty for sure. The bacon has a little bit of a smoky flavor which I loved and that ketchup was a perfect twist for a breaky sandwich! The biscuits was super dense! Make sure you get something to wash it down with bc it's not to be played with; however, it was good. And the fact that it was so dense let's me know that it was surely handmade! Delicious for sure, but both items could have been hotter. My sandwich was barely luke warm, and the biscuit could have kicked some butt if it was hot.  The "honey butter" really is more butter than honey. A little switch up could be some nice fruit flavored jam or something to mix all the savory with a bit of sweet. Now the orange juice was perfect! Freshly squeezed right out of the orange peel!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That BACON!
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sluts only!

zkcZ4_Pv0wPDhfunhsltoQ.text: Located in the Cosmopolitan hotel, this is a perfect place to grab a quick bite. The first visit I ordered a bacon, egg and cheese sandwich which was quite good. Nothing special about it, but made to order and quite good for breakfast. The second visit I had the slut which was a coddled egg on potato puree which was absolutely delicious. They serve it in a glass jar which I felt was wasteful to the environment with no place to recycle the glass jars... I had a chocolate cookie here which was amazing... they give a lot of paper and plastic with each order. I brought back a bag full of utensils, napkins etc that we never used and the guy said I was the first to ever do that... I'm from Canada and we are heavily into recycling! Love this place, worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zVSk64fYVwFtje5azgDLaw.text: Good, but not a good as I had hoped. Waited about 20 mins to order and about 15 more for the food to be prepared. Had the bacon, egg, and cheese-the ketchup really stood out and was very tasty. The bread was good, but at the end of the day it was basically just really good BEC sammy.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BEC

LYikB105NWF4_hMWSIKYiw.text: Love it .. my favorite is the "SLUT" poached egg with mashed potatoes. The service was great I went at 6PM there was no line at all. They were fast with making my meal. And very polite I recommend this place to everyone.

xPOrhi5aZNy7FAGfpCLAZg.text: This is located inside the Cosmopolitan Hotel. I had seen their location in Los Angeles but had never tried it because there was always a long line. I did not let the long line deter me in Vegas and I'm glad! The line wrapped down the hall but moved surprisingly quickly given how many people were in front of us. You could tell they run things VERY efficiently. I got the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich and even though the menu says the the egg is cooked one way, you can request another. They also put ketchup on it, which I liked because i'm a fan of ketchup on eggs. It is a little messy though. I enjoyed the sandwich and it was very filling.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon egg and cheese

e7GpEH-zUnZiem_AMeDw4A.text: The egg slut, just okay, not a big deal IMO.   The egg is one of my favorite foods so it's pretty possible that I may be more critical about the definition of a perfectly poached egg than most. BUT the egg slut didn't really wow me.  Positives: The idea is somewhat novel and exciting to receive a meal in a little jar and it IS fun to spread potato and egg gooeyness on toast!   The flavor of the potato and egg spread across the top of a crostini was satisfying and not too heavy. I enjoyed the savory and light potato and the mustard aioli.   Negatives: The egg was slightly over done (I thought to myself, this egg slut is NOT slutty ENOUGH!) and this item is overpriced for what it is. I love a beautifully runny and creamy yolk and when you've got something simple like this you have to nail it, which they didn't.   The yolk was just slightly over that threshold of creamy perfection. It was close but no cigar! Maybe if you are not into a runny egg this texture would be considered perfect for you?   Still a fun first time novelty to experience drunkenly out of the club. Maybe next time I will opt for one of the many egg sandwiches before I say that I won't be back, keep an open mind!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg slut spread on toasted baguette
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg slut

cvV3oJ1uXJekRrcKTpsH-w.text: Came here for breakfast last weekend, while in Vegas and I got the Fairfax with bacon and cheeseburger. Anyone comes here need to get the Fairfax because it is the real deal and when compared to the burger (JUST GET THE FAIRFAX) cannot touch the flavor profiles of this sandwich. I wasn't expecting to be blown away by an egg sandwich but I was.  Service - 4 (it's just a long line that moves fast) Food - 3.25 (burger 2.0 and fairfax 4.5) Venue - 4(nice)

_isEXYhJ3fDWLnrSKqakAg.text: Been to the ones in LA but we wanted breakfast and didn't want traditional sit down style so decided to stop by here.  Line was around the corner, maybe 20 people deep or so. Only took about 15 minutes to get to the front.  Got a bacon/egg, a gaucho and a slut with two oj's.  Took about 10 mins to get food, so not bad.  We ate there and everything was great. Tasted just like the other visits in LA.

LnJcC96qGCqHM81WAlSJWg.text: I'm with the minority on this one and think that eggslut should be a pass. thank goodness we did not have to wait in line cause I would be very disappointed if I had to wait in line for this sandwich. My husband and I got the sausage, egg and cheese and decided to add bacon on top. Our total was around 12. I'm not sure what I was expecting, but what I got was a sausage, egg, cheese and bacon sandwich... nothing special, nothing grand, just a sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage, bacon, egg and cheese

FQ8cAz-2JcgAgufz6QhTKw.text: Can I have eggslut everyday?! Honestly I haven't gone a day without thinking about their delicious sandwiches since I got back from Vegas. My friend and I had Eggslut as one of the top spots on our list of places to try while in Vegas.   It does tend to get very long lines but rest assured that lines move fairly quickly. My first visit I went with the fairfax sandwich and added avocado. It was DELICIOUS. Possibly one of the greatest breakfast sandwiches I've ever had. The eggs weren't over cooked at all and it had tons of flavor. That siracha mayo is bomb! Our second visit I went with the sausage, egg, and cheese in a effort to switch it up. While it was still very good it definitely wasn't as delicious as the fairfax.   I have been recommending eggslut to anyone I can, so to all of you on yelp who are reading this...I recommend it to you as well!

nV6oxLaqC-5OD_SXwBGEFQ.text: Yasss to this place! We were looking for a perfect way to end our time in Vegas and breakfast yesterday was the last meal we had there. It was phenomenal!! I had the Fairfax with housemade sausage and my husband had the Gaucho. We would order both again! And the line looked long but they had us through in 20 min. Thanks Eggslut!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax with sausage and Gaucho

wpFmGLsy22LR6hFOleZcig.text: The biscuit was dense, salty and inedible. I can't believe they charged $4 a piece. We ordered 2 for 4 of us to share and each took 1 bite and put it back. I want a refund! The slut was fine, a coddled egg on top of pureed potatoes that you dip toasts with but nothing special. I recommend Juice Standard nearby instead of the orange juice here, pretty sour even though it was apparently fresh squeezed.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2G9WNZNPidTT7Ln_EPq5NA.text: Not sure if it was the name, but there is something compelling about Eggslut that just warrant a visit. The menu is deceptively simple, but everything we had was so delish!   Situated on the second floor of Cosmopolitan Boulevard tower, more precisely next to Momofuku. Immensely popular, I made an effort to get here at 8 a.m. and was greeted with a pretty intimidating line, but thankfully it moves faster than what I had anticipated.    Fairfax: Their signature sandwich for a reason! The egg was fluffy, the seasoning of chives, salt and caramelized onions was well balanced and the buns is definitely the charm for me. It was so pillowy soft and warm. I did add bacon for that extra texture of crispiness. Absolutely scrumptious!   Bacon, Egg & Cheese Sandwich: You cannot go wrong with bacon, egg and cheese - the combination is simply satisfying. The sunny side up melts just right with the buns. I enjoyed the play of flavors and the generous bacon add a good dose of texture.    Slut: The potato puree was creamy soft and seasoned nicely while the egg on top was just a dream. The slut comes with slices of baguette for a lil' bit of crunchy texture on the side. Although, I found the best way to enjoy this dish is to mixed it with the biscuits ($5 a piece) instead.  Overall, I had an egg-cellent first encounter at Eggslut. Beautiful location, delicious and creative execution are some of the reasons the Eggslut worth the try. Will definitely revisit when I'm back in Vegas :)

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

po6LROJ7RMtvcLx5qeZ8ig.text: Amazing ! The food tasted delicious , portions of the mashed potatoes could've been better but the taste makes up for it , definitely worth stopping here . My fiance and I had to come here and trust me never time we come we will stop here again . The service was quick and nice , the food was done quick and everything was done fresh , which is a plus . Definitely recommend .

7S17OtbpGH2_MQYYbvcVRA.text: This spot is super legit! Everything on the menu was great! The staff working behind the counter were hustling and super friendly.

D0RmW2F9X2VI6o-ilh64kQ.text: I really enjoyed the Eggslut. Love the name as well.   This was a good little gem while staying at the Cosmo. I had this place pretty much every morning during my 4-day stay in Vegas. The breakfast burger was always cooked perfect and their service was speedy. I came early when they first opened and saw them prep every thing from start to finish. I think that's what I liked about this place.. everything is cooked fresh. It was a bit pricey but if you're staying at the Cosmo then every place is a bit pricey. Plus your paying for quality food. Nothing sitting under a heat lamp or getting microwaved. I stuck to my breakfast burger for the most part.   I would encourage people to try this place on a weekday if possible. Thursday-Sunday this place gets extremely long lines. During the week I didn't really have to wait in line at all.

EJy7qmlt2evoKXvrs3Ex-g.text: We had the 'SLUT' and the Bacon & Egg & Cheese sandwich. It was a bit salty but tasteful. Worth to try if the line is not too long.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kr_Byc08QLhVzV3AL6_02A.text: In cosmo lobby area. Order at counter and quick service. Plenty of tables in outdoor area.  Tried the egg in jar and a sandwich on brioche. Both delicious. Free coffee refills and pleasant staff. Wished they were conscience of recycling mason jars and there was table service

uSplD8JPyrPRKTArNitviw.text: Decent, wasn't crazy about the wait though. I'd rather have gone to a buffet. Prices are decently high, and if you eat a lot I'd suggest against it. There wasn't really anything in this that wow'ed me which might be due to how much friends had hyped up the place, but also just the richness that I had wanted from the egg slut and the fluffiness of the eggs in the fairfax just weren't really there. The wait time was roughly 35 mins, and wait for food was roughly 15 to 20 since they were behind on egg sluts at the time.   So yeah, I had ordered the egg slut and the fairfax with avocado. I probably should have gotten the spicy mayo on the side to bolster things in retrospect. The fairfax was decent with the avocado, the spicy mayo didn't pop as much as I wanted. The carmelized onion was few and far between in the sammich. Balance thrown out the window for speed. Subbed ketchup eventually instead to curb the taste as a whole. The egg slut was also kinda nifty, but the mash wasn't as rich as I'd like at the bottom.  Overall, not crazy about the place. I'll stick to brunch or a buffet next time I'm in the area and in recovery mode.

_WzRzshrcWO5gqaaOmKgOg.text: First off let me just say that I originally wanted to try this place because 1 my wife and I love breakfast sandwiches and 2 I saw eggslut on first we feast's FB page.  I'm not going to lie the line almost made me change my plans please listen to me the line moves really fast do not be scared I almost effed up royally.  I knew I was going to go with the fair fax because that is the dish I saw Chef Cailan making on Facebook my wife had the egg slut (coddled egg with mashed potato and bread) more on that in a min. Here is the lowdown 1. Fairfax sandwich (had mine with bacon) delicious perfect egg nice cheese amazing bun but really egg sandwiches are either good or not  2. The egg slut OMG this was amazing while I was very happy with my fairfax I was pretty jealous of my wife's mix the egg up with the potato and it makes this custard like sauce to spread over the bread that is so good we went the next day so I could get my own and I will now be trying to make this at home. 3. Orange juice delicious with perfect amount of pulp  Eggslut please please come to my home town of Denver  *pro tip the food court in Caesar's palace has choulula packets smuggled a few over for my slut I'm just saying

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t worry the line moves fast

X1XQSmFC6O_b3SyfzyTjpg.text: Holy crap the line for this place was ridiculous and wrapped around to by the bathroom!  But I was determined to try this fair fax that has eluded me after all these years.  I was so close and just needed to muster enough patience to stand in line as I anxiously inched closer yet so close but seemingly so far.  The decor was pretty cool they had whisks for light fixtures...  Alas! We finally made it to cashier to place our order but now we'd have to wait a bit more to get our food.  Starring at the cooks in their stations piling and assembling orders like clockwork as hungry patrons like myself stand by waiting for our name to be called.  It's packed and you'd be lucky to find a place to sit. We finally get our order.  The fair fax is just a creamy buttery scrambled eggs wedged in between some gooey cheese and bread.  It's immediately devoured.  In hindsight, I should have added a sausage patty, but it was still good nonetheless...

3r1kRYxaA4IRAqTyJzPyPA.text: I read so many good reviews about this place when I was planning on places to visit in LV and had to check it out myself. Believe me , they lived the reputation of awesomeness!!   For breakfast time, of course there's going to be a line, but it moved quick. While you're waiting there's a huge billboard of the menu so you know exactly what you want when you get to the register. My boyfriend and I got the Cheeseburger with Avocado, a slut and bacon egg and cheese. The slut was different, but it was amazing on the toast. I just wished they gave more bread!! LOL The sandwiches were good. Eggs cooked perfect!! I would totally keep going back for breakfast

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger with Avocado

5gV6sJce876jV1k3ogKCDQ.text: Sandwiches were decadent and very popular! Come early, by 9:30 am there was a 50 person line. It takes like 30 minutes to get your food. Very annoying to get to the cosmopolitan/this restaurant unless you're staying there and now the charge parking down at all the hotels and casinos, so be prepared. Maybe uber or use lyft.  Seating is limited so you might want to take it to-go or sit in the areas around the chandelier bar.  The Gaucho was tri tip beef (mid-rare) with chimichurri, an egg, arugula and red onions. For $15 I was happy. It was on a luxurious brioche roll: it was perfect.  My husband liked his burger for $10 but was not that impressed with the quality of the burger.  It's a funny name for a restaurant and when you eat your sandwich, it's quite graphic. The eggs explode while biting into your sandwich which are double-wrapped. Don't wear white. Bring hand wipes.   The coffee is $5 and is gross. I don't know if it's burnt or what, but it's overpriced and not worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ordering/end of the line. Do not get their burnt coffee.
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mid-rare tri-tip in the gaucho. Messy but, so worth it.
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gaucho $15 worth it

GYpShgZO2Bby7Ak4tyAqgw.text: I had a biscuit and a bacon sandwich. Both were incredibly good. The only tough part about this experience was the line was 20-30 people deep, but the wait was completely worth it! Great food, great service!

V71s5LMCruCvtrxYhvqD1Q.text: I ordered the cheeseburger.  The hamburger portion was pretty much non-existent.  It was like eating an undercooked McDonald's burger.  It was more on the raw side and cold.   It was less than 1/4" thick.  Being that thin should not be an issue with cooking.   The egg is listed as over medium.  I'll give them that.  It was done correctly but with zero seasoning.  The bread was actually the saving grace for this sandwich.  Plus the orange juice was quite good.   I will give this place another try in the future and update my review.

MgrgUz1QVy3h3U36-HFEXA.text: Not the egg-sperience I was hoping for. (See what I did there?)  This place has a cult like following but really, in my opinion, it's decidedly average. I can understand the appeal when you're drunk and a sloppy sandwich is just what the doctor ordered.   I got a bacon egg and cheese sandwich ($8) and because we're food tourists we shared their namesake "the slut" ($10) and the salted chocolate chip cookie. ($4.50)  The brioche was stiff and cold and the ketchup on the egg sandwich gave it that oddly distinctive McDonald's flavor.   "the slut" was a disappointment too as it was really just a lot of potatoes. The coddled egg itself was good as was the toast but it didn't save the meal. Great in theory but bad in execution.   Honestly, the real highlight was the cookie. If you're still reading and you've decided that you're still going to eat at Eggslut, get the cookie. It's crunchy and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg and Cheese with chipotle ketchup.  Oddly reminiscent of McDonald&#39;s flavor but the ingredients are obviously far superior.
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;the slut&#34;. Coddled egg over smooth potatoes. Really more of an eggy potato dish than an egg dish. ($10)
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunch salted chocolate chip cookie. It&#39;s legit. ($4.50)

eCcg7EAS7CIqz5CjwjsttQ.text: I was so excited that there was an Eggslut at The Cosmopolitan. I was able to introduce Eggslut to my fellow traveling companions. We actually ate here 2 days back to back.   You can't go wrong with any of the sandwiches. My favorite? The egg salad. Add avocado and bacon! Skip the arugula. Hahaa  The biscuit with the honey and maple syrup is also very tasty. Definitely worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Gaucho, Egg Salad, and the Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese

7STEKEUxPzfThKt0FtXY-w.text: Very good quick and easy breakfast! The line always seems to be pretty long though, so if your pressed for time then this isn't the place for you. I got the Fairfax breakfast sandwich with bacon and my husband got the gaucho breakfast sandwich. My sandwich was very flavorful and yummy. My husband said his was great too. This place is moderately priced for Vegas..but the sandwiches are a little small for how much they cost. It's worth checking out though!

MXv3UgZ_RPNWlqxJ3O0Tqw.text: This place does eggs right - hence the name! I got the Fairfax Sandwich for breakfast here and it was a nice grab and go breakfast. The sandwich itself was a bit spicier then expected with the sriracha which was fine with me, the spicier the better. What I didn't love about it was that the eggs seemed quite greasy which was unexpected. The brioche roll really added to the sandwich as a whole and while you can opt to go sans roll the roll really is a perfect addition. Speaking of additions. You can add on bacon, turkey bacon or avocado to many of the sandwiches, for a cost of course.  I also though that they were really thoughtful and made the atmosphere cohesive with the food served. Whisk light fixture, chicken footprints on the floor, cracked egg chairs and tile resembling chicken wire on the walls all awesome totally appropriate touches for their cuisine. A lot of people seemed to be deterred by the line, but in my experience the line moved quickly. There were roughly 10-15 people ahead of me in line when I arrived around 9am and I made it through the line, ordered and was eating my sandwich within 18 minutes.  Four stars because of the price and getting people with the steep price of add ons as well as the slightly greasy nature of the eggs.

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

00xv4rhQ2ftm34n5lrqgjA.text: Egg slut! Yes please! I come to Vegas twice a year I always stay at the cosmopolitan.  The one thing that was lacking was a amazing breakfast spot.  I was soooo excited when my promoter told me they put egg slut in.   Just so everyone knows these egg sandwiches are a step above traditional. I'm from NY I eat a bacon egg and cheese 2 times a week. The egg sandwiches at egg slut are like a gourmet version. Not sacrificing the speedy service.   Anytime between 8am and 11am there will be a line around the corner. One morning I waited over 30 mins for a sandwich (not joking). There was that many people in line. You can not make reservations or call ahead. I did find out. If you are VIP at the cosmo. They will get your sandwiches for you. Of coarse on the last day.   The menu is not huge. Egg slut only offers a few sandwiches. The eggs are cage free organic from a local farm. So is the bacon. The bacon egg and cheese is $8 this comes on brioche bun and with chipotle ketchup. The fairfax. Is amazing. It's scrambled eggs with chives cheddar cheese caramalizes onions and siracha mayo.  Sooo fricken good. But the simplicity of the menu is what makes them so good. Along with the organically. I'm a huge fan of only a few items because if you do one thing they will come out consistent every time. This place does some business. Turn over is quick.   The only complaints I have. There are only a few seats and there bar style. I wouldn't want to eat in here it's too loud. I would bring it to my room 95% of the people were grabbing here food and leavening. The second issue is after you place your order. You have to walk all the way to the other end to pick the order up. You walk through the restaurant to get to the pick up area. Then you have like no place to stand. There's a bunch of people standing waiting for there food. Blocking other people. It was interesting. The one day it was so crowded in the pick up area. I waited outside the restaurant. Behind the bar seating. I couldent hear the girl calling my name. Some guy asked me if I was josh cause my order was ready. It was kinda funny.   Overall. Egg slut is a much needed addition to the cosmo. I love this place. Great breakfast spot I highly recommend coming here. I will continue coming here every morning I'm at the cosmo. There solid and consistent.

GKIs6a_R1T_WwFoO7VdEnw.text: absolutely love grabbing their "Bacon, Egg, and Cheese Sandwich"before heading to Marquee Dayclub!  It's so tasty! the perfect savory & fatty snack/meal in my opinion.  The eggs are perfectly cooked (over medium eggs)!  The chipotle ketchup and brioche bun make the sandwich unique and extra good. Compared to other burger/sandwich joints, I think the sandwich was really reasonably priced (about $8.90), especially being at a nice hotel.

vpZTc1hQ_Q78WZfI6qzcBQ.text: Late night munchies? Eggslut's got you covered.  My first experience at Eggslut was at the Grand Central Market in LA. I remember not being completely blown away, mainly because of the huge line and the high price for what it is.  Vegas is pretty much no different EXCEPT that it's Vegas and everything is pretty overpriced, so that makes the higher prices of Eggslut kiiiind of okay. We were looking for a quick late night bite, and lucky for us, Eggslut is open at all hours of the night. We arrived around 2AM and were surprised to only find a short line of about 3 people. (We thought the post-club crazies would be everywhere.)  We ordered the bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich and the Fairfax. If I were you, I would go straight for the Fairfax and add some bacon to go along with it. The eggs are super fluffy and perfectly seasoned. The bacon, egg, and cheese is exactly what it sounds like, but I wasn't a huge fan. (Major props to this sandwich for the runny egg porn, though.)  Quick and easy bites, even better if you're craving something late at night or post-clubbing.

zsRM0hD4U87VVLm6p3Y1Uw.text: Amazing bacon egg & cheese! Also the cold brew was so good. The line was crazy long but it moves really fast so don't let that deter you.

25KCl8ou3RjFzmGgUGAZkw.text: Good food.. took a while to stand in the line and wait for the food. I wasn't a big fan of the "fresh orange juice". Felt it was filled with preservatives. The slut was quite delicious although it didn't look too appetizing when it came to me. I would definitely recommend this place if you are not very hungry and wanna grab to go!

jNOd8rUjd3CN-kZ1eKlGDA.text: My husband always goes down from our room and gets this for me before I wake up. We love the cosmo and I really enjoyed the bacon breakfast Sandwich.

TDHddotMlJwnIc4sdCzvWw.text: I thought with an hour wait to grab one of these sandwiches that I would be sent into breakfast bliss... Was I wrong. No flavor and Overpriced. No need for me to come back for seconds.

V8FLHZHzWhGZniTEmdjtNA.text: This place is worth the hype.  I had the fairfax sandwich with bacon. It seemed like the perfect idea. The girl behind the counter seemed delighted I want to order that item. Turns out I was delighted to eat it as well. The scrambled eggs were rich and delicious with fresh chives. The bacon was cooked beautifully. The brioche really seals the deal on excellence. Overall it's a completely delicious sandwich in every way.  Only downside (not the food): 11:30AM on a Friday and the line was something like 30 people deep. So we had to wait a few minutes to order. This isn't a deal breaker but it also isn't my favorite thing. I guess it's the nature of eating in trendy spots.

9L7GQJeNpvYURQmexr1ebw.text: Soft and delish! Orange juice was delish too , the perfect combo. Not heavy at all and  good for a quick pick me up.
