photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m71tqWHZBJzbGgVwduXMIg.text: Couldn't take better advantage of staying at the cosmo then going to eggslut for brunch! Originally discovered in San Francisco as a food truck, this place went big for its Breakfast sandwiches. Located on the 3rd floor of the cosmo, there was a huge line up- 15 min wait, but the line moved quickly. I ordered the fairfax sandwich (5/5 Chipotle mayo, carmelized onions, cheddar cheese and fluffy scrambled eggs served in between brioche buns) I ordered extra avocado to come with- really adds a nice buttery context without the fat. The sandwich was not too heavy- it was perfect actually, eggs were light and the Chipotle mayo was a fine touch. They serve freshly squeezed organ juice as well. My order came out to around 17$.  Worth every cent!

LNMq6ETRjdLCgZdeyZfPCA.text: It's worth the wait.  it's a very tasty egg sando we had a bacon sando and a fairfax scrambled egg sando.   These were great the line want to bad at 0720. But the day before at 0930 it was all the way down the hall. Super busy place worth the wait

oRCl9Zmx81UYKU3cxqPsSQ.text: Great breakfast sandwich for a great price. We assumed that the price would be double than the price of their LOS ANGELES location but the quality AND the price is consistent. Quality and flavors are great!!! We got the turkey sausage sandwich and the bacon egg cheese sandwich + one biscuit. Great food and highly recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U63JCDje7UGghWN5RaFX4A.text: Amazing!! Forget secret pizza go to Eggslut and get their sandwiches. I got the fairfax and a water and paid $20 and thought this better be an orgasm in my mouth for an egg sandwich and it was! That Sirracha on the sandwich was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G5oLStmA7WhJ32Mv8A3lng.text: If you're not already familiar with the brand, you're in for a treat.. as long as you're also willing to brave the inevitable line that comes with it. The long wait to order combined with the pricey menu are the only thing holding me back from awarding that #5 star, but as far as their fare is concerned- 5 star all the way! They also do not have complimentary water; I offset the cost by bringing my own drink so I can't speak to their OJ, but it's very popular.   My boo and I have tried their classic bacon sandwich and the Fairfax, which I now prefer to order with the mayo spread on the side as it can sometimes have too much, overpowering the delicate chives and tender eggs. Avocado is available for sandwiches, but with their perfectly soft scrambled, cheesy eggs I didn't really think it needed another creamy element. The indulgently buttery bread supports the sandwich perfectly and may be the best part in my opinion, but I think next time I am going to try their signature "Slut" to mix it up!   This location is in the Cosmopolitan; walking through the main doors of the Strip, head towards the right staircase and find it on the second floor, near what I can only describe as the back side chandelier bar. If you're parked in their garage, no worries, it will be down a hallway after you exit the elevator on the second floor.. as a matter of fact, you'll know you're in the right place when you see their wraparound line first!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax sandwich and the bacon with soft scrambled eggs instead of fried!

XbbLC0WOEBS1X1FK9ZTzCw.text: Don't be mislead by the long line wrapped around the restaurant, it goes by reasonably fast and it's worth it! I ordered the Fairfax ($8.50) with avocado (+$2). You can also add fresh cut bacon (the guy was literally cutting it right in front of us)for an extra $3. This sandwich hit the spot. I love the fresh brioche bun that it is served with. The chives, caramelized onions, melted cheese, and chipotle mayo all paired well together. I would definitely order this again!

DTz7XRnZ8hiAtl7x4ReVCw.text: Hipster breakfast. The line was long but moved efficiently.  Waiting 20+ minutes for a breakfast sandwich seems a tad excessive if I'm not on vacation.  The "slut" is basically a medium cooked egg over mashed potatoes. Salty and tasty.  Sausage egg and cheese biscuit on brioche bun is a fancy McMuffin.  After tax and tip $27 for breakfast.  Easy seating across from the restaurant.  Coffee is better at Starbucks nearby.

Ll89yH1AFIsmLdIAtVHvxw.text: I had the Fairfax and added bacon, it was delicious!! While it's quite good, I wouldn't wait longer then twenty five minutes for it. That time includes the time I start standing in line until the food is in my hands. Definitely best to go during non-peak times. I went on a Monday around 10:45AM, I waited about 15 minutes before I was able to order but the line moved pretty quickly at that time. While the slut seems like a cool concept I saw a couple people not even eat theirs and leave it behind. All in all can't go wrong with a good ole fashioned egg sandwich of some sort. I'd come back for sure. Pending the line isn't crazy.

3qPBVdG02P1246wGIetWyA.text: I was actually looking forward to this after hearing so many raving reviews about this place... The result? Super overpriced and underseasoned after a long line. Overrated and not worth the wait. The bun is hard and not soft, and the sausage at McDonald has more flavor.

z1OuAVMZJHb2r2XjcL9hqg.text: When you walk up you get a little happy thinking there isn't a line....then you look around the corner and see the lines Vegas is known for.  We came here on a recommendation from a food who said it's the best damn egg sandwich he's every had.  I thought my okay, but as a vegetarian your options are limited.  My meat eater partner said his sandwich was awesome.  Was it worth the line not sure, but you're going to wait for anything in this town

jxTXHP6KX7sE9ZCcV9lLgg.text: Best part of my meal was the bread and the orange juice. The sausage had little flavor. The biscuit was served cold. I would have enjoyed a McDonald's egg McMuffin more. That would at least not cost me $40.

q0RWAK3ylShZG23cGtl1xg.text: Line around the corner, but efficient assembly line kept the wait minimal. 33$ for two sandwiches a soda and an iced coffee is pretty steep- good food, but not worth finding parking or making it to the cosmo if you're not already staying there. One time will prob be my max with soooo many other places to find good breakfast.

s0cnZetybOc6wHki_vv-lQ.text: When We walked up to Eggslut, and they already had a line out the door at 8 am, I knew this place was gonna be good! The menu is limited and it's a simple concept of breakfast sandwiches, but it works! I ordered the bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich and a fresh squeezed orange juice. My sandwich had a pile of bacon, egg, and cheese, with chipotle ketchup on a brioche bun. My fiance got the sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich. His came with a honey mustard aoili (I think!) on the brioche bun. We also got a biscuit with honey butter to split. The brioche rolls are the star of the show. They are able to carry all of the contents of the sandwich without getting soggy. My mouth is watering just thinking about my sandwich. Next time I go back, I would like to try the Eggslut, which is a layer of mashed potatoes with a poached egg on top. It's served with a side of bread dippers. It looks really good too!

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese /Sausage, Egg &amp; Cheese /Fresh Orange Juice /Buttermilk Biscuit

cHigOskLaR60cg3TqS8LIQ.text: Having followed their Instagram for a while and always drooling over the food poem I was excited to find out they had a location in Vegas during a recent visit there.   We waited in line for about 15-20 minutes in the hallway that wrapped around the corner from the restaurant. It moved at a decent clip.   I shimmied up to the counter and my boyfriend and I ordered the fairfax, the gaucho and one slut because of course we had to try the name sake.   Food came out very quickly and we dug right in. Beware the gaucho is MESSY. You are best off eating this one with a fork and knife unless you are ok with runny egg covering your hands. During the first bite when my boyfriend was still using his hands it burst and went everywhere. After he got the mess under control he said he really enjoyed the sandwich. As for me, I loved the fairfax with the addition of the avocado and bacon. I think it would have been a little plain with out. But I swallowed that thing in three minutes flat. As for the slut, I enjoyed it. Was happy to try it but if ordered alone for a breakfast I don't think you'll be satisfied. It makes a great snack or side to share!  Minus one star for counter cleanliness. These guys are doing a ton of business so it's understandable things are hectic but the high top table where we were eating was out of napkins almost as soon as we sat down and there were crumbs everywhere. A quick a rundown on a regular basis would be helpful. Attention to detail would make this place the standout it should be!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fairfax with bacon and a generous helping of avocado. Hit the spot!

TXbdi-QRb34wmx8pwzk-tw.text: Crazy awesome breakfast on the strip! There was a bit of line, which I was prepared for, but it was well worth it. My boyfriend and I ordered the bacon and egg sandwich and the Slut! The sandwiches were awesome, especially with the house made chipotle ketchup and the slut was indescribable. It was almost reminiscent of potato salad but insanely smooth and rich. The baguette pieces added the perfect textural element. In comparison to the other offerings on the Strip, it's definitely great $$ vale too!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nv0OdUdnDKmlFKQQmNnxYA.text: Got the bacon, the sausage, and a slut. This places pretty cool, and the slut is a must try. But given the name of this place, I was expecting bigger, thicker eggs. The slut was cool, but there needs to be more eggs and less potato puree.  Nonetheless, the general experience was nice. Although I do diss the fact that they sell 5 bucks for a small soda, which costs a dollar something in general. So I'm gonna stick with water, which is free from the bar two steps from Eggslut.

5e6n7vVbLRFgarksC3ltVw.text: Whether in Los Angeles or Las Vegas, Eggslut is one of those places that you HAVE to stop at!   This was actually the first time I had stopped by the Vegas location, but just like LA the line was no joke!  Fortunately it moves rather quickly and they get your food to you pretty fast once you order.  I have tried most of their menu(not too many options) and have never been disappointed. My favorite by far is the "Bacon, Egg & Cheese," with or without avocado it is amazing, and they are super generous with the bacon!   The one item on the menu that I have yet to try is the "Slut," I have no idea why but based on all these reviews I will have to try it next time around.

ma2F-9nXQdObM0DUiOD47w.text: Unbelievable breakfast sandwiches and fresh squeezed juice.  You'll wait in a long line that wraps around the place, but it will be worth it.

-N8BriuY8It3_1beAu4JJA.text: Save a slut get the Fairfax ;) I came here at midnight craving something savory and spicy and the Fairfax egg sandwich was my fix. It has soft scrambled eggs, chives, caramelized onions, spicy mayo and cheese but I also add bacon, avocado, and sriracha to make it the best egg sandwich of all time. This place is consistent and has a really fun vibe. The line can be super long but it's worth the wait for the Fairfax. I don't really recommend the slut bc it's so basic. It is like $15 for the Fairfax my way-- expensive but still worth it. The slut is not really worth the price because you can master it at home.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qvitXlqTr5cGbrZNJ-nhRw.text: Food is very good but the negative is that there is almost always a very long line. 45 minute wait on Sunday morning at 8am.

MF9cOmN3Yyf34PgvQM25zw.text: The food was delicious and the lines are long. TBH it does not live up to the hype. Not worth the wait. Portion size are small.

2oX0DsgQPwQU5K_UfKdeYw.text: I am officially obsessed with Eggslut. Serving up delicious egg sandwiches and of course the namesake of the restaurant, the "Slut," this place gets long lines and if you try it, you'll see why.  My favorite sandwich to get here is the Gaucho, which involves wagyu tri-tip and chimichurri sauce. The bread on all of the sandwiches is soft, fluffy and is the perfect breakfast bread. I also love getting the Slut. It's mind-blowingly good. A coddled egg is placed on top of a jar of Robuchon (re: SUPER buttery) mashed potatoes. You mix it all together and the egg kind of cooks in with the potatoes. Spread that on the provided toast and you have a party in your mouth. I like getting the arugula salad to put on top of that.  The only bad thing about Eggslut is you can't really get out of there without spending around $20/person for a grab and go breakfast. Also the line. Just try to go on off-peak times (afternoon, early morning...)  There aren't too many seats, so head to the Chandelier bar nearby if you can't find seating at the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The gaucho sandwich is so good!
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fairfax with bacon
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Array of breakfast sandwiches from Eggslut

hFh7-8Rapv2bcfJyOZJeRA.text: I've been wanting to try Eggslut forever but none of the LA locations were convenient for me. When I saw one opened in the Cosmopolitan I knew I had to try it! Even on a monday morning the line was huge - we waited 30 minutes to place our order. They only had one register open despite the crowd, plus the one register was being worked by a trainee so I am sure that didn't help speed things along.   All three of us went for the sausage, egg and cheese sandwich. I was excited to see the sausage was turkey, it seems like more often than not the sausage is pork. My friend doesn't eat pork so she was actually able to enjoy this sandwich. Once we placed our order, it wasn't too much of a wait until we actually got our sandwiches, thank goodness because we were starving by that time!  The quality of the sandwich was good, the bread was delicious and the yolk was gooey just the way I like it. I enjoyed the sandwich but it wasn't worth a 30 minute wait.

nwWXDJ1dC5AobLPhxPLfzw.text: 2 stars only cause I was hungry... Ordered a plain burger meat and cheese only... They gave me a burger with pickles and mayo slipped on... Either they don't care or they are legally dumb.. I recommend eating somewhere else if you got the munchies

LoY2d-eu51uv45xIwsq9Jw.text: Teased by the Cosmo for almost a year, the long awaited Eggslut has finally opened and...  REALLY?!?  There is nothing wrong with the sandwich.  How can you not like soft scrambled eggs imbued with butter, bacon, caramelized onions, melted cheddar cheese and the warm spicy kick of siracha on a fresh, gently sweetened brioche bun (Fairfax)?  Great combo but come on, $12???  A $3 premium over the LA location.  The bacon, egg & cheese sandwich (fried egg, cheddar cheese, chipotle ketchup on a brioche bun) A-OK.  It's a fried egg sandwich.  Eat it quick or the egg yolk will quickly soak into the bun making a soggy mess.  $8.  Finally the "slut" (coddled egg on a silky smooth potato puree cooked in a jar) is definitely interesting.  Mix it all up to incorporate the salt, chives, and yolk into the potato then spoon.  Basically a pureed breakfast slathered on a piece of toasted baguette.  Sans the baguette, perhaps in my golden years when the dentures hurt but for now, I prefer solid food.  $10.  To their credit, the applewood smoked bacon is well sourced.  Meaty with controlled salinity.  The eggs (cage free) do have a more pronounced yolky flavor.  A fast food restaurant with fast food friendly service.  A little clumsy but this visit was opening day.  It should improve.  In the end, creative food truck grub at astronomical Vegas resort pricing.    To each his own but this slut is not for me.

UNN5YMbQ7v3uhHKBmZMsaA.text: We had breakfast here 2 of the 3 days we were in town. One of my colleagues also had dinner here one of the evenings.  My favorite was fairfax; the eggs were scrambled beautifully.   Coffee was average.

HaysW8tFQP9JacvfFZZDhg.text: So good!! The eggs are super fresh and cooked very well. My fave is the fairfax with avocado and the slut. The lines can get long on the weekend but it moves pretty fast and is definitely worth the wait.

bKVqmGfAkEhzRgpMtUwI5g.text: If you even remotely like eggs and delicious food, this is the place for breakfast in Vegas. Quick service, friendly staff, chill environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SnjHM_OKUjg_dSyrKXUlAg.text: I came by at about 6 pm on a weeknight just to pick up a biscuit and a cookie to try. I wasn't asked if I wanted it for there or to go, so they immediately started heating it. When I corrected them, they didn't hesitate to replace the biscuit and cookie.   Once I tried them, I must say that I was not a fan of the biscuit. It's too buttery and a little too chewy. As for the cookie, it was not bad. I can tell they use high quality chocolate and a lot of it. The cookie was a little harder than a prefer but not terrible. I especially liked the amount of salt they used, but I really love salt.   The prices are high. At $10 for these two items, I can't say I will be buying them again.

DpbO79LPFaUMYKtgpuxrDw.text: Came here I'm my last trip to Vegas after multiple people had recommended it. We got there on a Friday morning around 1030 and the line was around the hall, wait took about 20 minutes to order. My sandwich I got was yummy but messy to eat. There wasn't any seating available so my friends and I sat on a bench together. The reason I gave three stars was because of the lack of seating and wait, for how popular the place is they should invest in more tables .

jDvIrs2p2fofv9Ajd3tf9A.text: OK, the food here is good people.  I will definitely give it that...  But not good enough to stand in line for 30 minutes to an hour as some did.  we walked up and the lone was around the corner into the ladies bathroom hallway!    NOPE, walked over to Holstein amd had a snack, chilled, had a drink.  Walked out and saw...  WHAT???  No line???  Walked in, order my breakfast sandwich and cookie...  Both good, but not OMG I've got to have this again.  Would come back?  Hmmmmm....  Still debating that.

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg, Turkey sausage, cheese breakfast sandwich

QAr2M2Et3iyLLT5azJPbeg.text: Long line but it moves fairly quick.  Reasonably priced considering it's Vegas.  Friendly staff and clean atmosphere.  My only gripe would be is that the seating situation is a bit of a struggle.  It would be cool if staff sat us to make sure the patrons with food have a seat rather than people at the back of the line saving seats for those without food.  Other than that... tasty place and I'll be back!

30ZieT6-8uqBj2V43st7Ig.text: All I can say is the fairfax with sausage is an excellent sandwich.  It's a breakfast sandwich but different than most it has a spicy sauce and runny scrambled eggs rather than an egg that pops.  The eggs with the cheese worked very well and the addition of turkey sausage really worked.  The brioche bun of course is always a plus when doing breakfast.  For $11 the price is steep, especially considering the size.  Quality is there but it just needs to be bigger to more or less be a scrambled egg brunch meal, then worth the price point.  I came at noon on a monday and the line was about 10-15 minutes.  I get a seat immediately though.  The wait time really all depends on if you go during peak breakfast hours or not.  Otherwise it really isn't that much different than a typical restaurant wait.

HsGVXTLAS6v_NqWff-OtkQ.text: No idea where all these terrible reviews keep coming from?!  I almost didn't go because of how many people complained, but I'm really glad I did.  Disregard all previous reviews, I will give you reality.   This place is fantastic! Perfect for weekend late night!   The sandwich I had was the cheese, egg, bacon.   It was delicious, and loaded with bacon.  The egg was cooked perfectly, and the bun was soft and fluffy.   The customer service was friendly, and I was greeted with a smile!   The prices are a bit steep, but cmon man... you're in Las Vegas, on the strip, and in the Cosmo.  Next door are $6 tacos, I think we can all afford to shell out $8 for a damn good egg sandwich!   GET THAT EGG SANDWICH AND THANK ALVIN FOR BLESSING US WITH HIS CREATIONS IN VEGAS.

Ov5_AATVi-lCXO3Zk4TCMg.text: Surprisingly good for a breakfast place, the slut* was a masterpiece and the sandwich was delicious  I will definitely come back for this food

t7iPiE9imPd0r9C7Psxfeg.text: Yum. Just f'ing yum. This place is in the Cosmopolitan in Las Vegas and is my go to for "oh shit I need some food in my belly because I drank like a fish last night"... so here's the run down:  ~ food is amazing  ~ lines is long, but worth wait ~ menu is simple but expansive ~ easy access if you're staying at the Cosmo ~ staff is AMAZINGLY helpful and courteous ~ coffee is good ~ get the bacon, add the avocado. Seriously.  If you go to Vegas and don't eat at the Eggslut you definitely have missed out

Qp_nBBvyPBDk600_1ZCBhg.text: This place is not worth the wait or the price.   The food was ok, but really it's not much better than what you could get from a Starbucks.   Should note that we definitely get the coddled egg, and that's probably a better experience.  But still...  The staff was nice.  Wouldn't go again.

2uH-888KpQFP-Owt--JSgQ.text: Was visiting from Florida on vacation and read and heard great things about this place. There was a HUGE line at around 11 am , but you know what.... it WAS WORTH IT. Best breakfast  sandwich I have EVER HAD.  I ordered the "Fairfax" which is scrambled eggs, chives, sriracha mayo & caramelized onions on a brioche bun. I was speechless when I bit into it. I'm just so mad I had to leave back to Florida after . Will definitely go again, don't let the lines deter you! Worth the wait x100

VEhKkY6xC6NCAE1ziMp2vA.text: Ehhhh...Not really sure what the hype is all about. It's an expensive breakfast sandwich. It was tasty, but not worth standing in line over. Prices are typical of most food items on The Strip (expensive). Orange juice was really good, but again, the food is mediocre at best.

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x2-gwXjsGpHAmyWFJSx3iw.text: Not a lot of options on the menu so this place is not for the picky. It is inside my favorite hotel on the strip, The Cosmopolitan. Be prepared to wait an hour and I would love to say its worth the wait but that's just too long to stand in line for food. If you get there early in the morning maybe you can beat the rush. I got the slut and its on the small side for portion size. So for the price you do not get a lot of food here. After waiting so long I was pretty hungry so it did not meet my needs.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, egg and cheese with the slut

_NULRNkc1DhWPs-HaqqMFw.text: I've been to the one in LA and now here as well and both locations are just as great. Although it can be a little expensive but when you're on vacation it's okay to splurge a little. I may have paid for overpriced foods but their sandwiches are very good! I like the fairfax one but this time I tried their bacon, egg & cheese sandwich and it was just as good! Now I would say the orange juice is just average. They really do overpriced their beverages though. Seriously I pad 5 dollars for my orange juice so I expect it to be a decent size... a little disappointed when he gave me a small. I guess there was just one size?? Anyways if I am ever in Vegas again definitely would stop by again for the foods.   Ps. Bring your own drinks. Seriously, they really do jack you off for a small drink...

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. orange juice... ok.
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R9TIzSRb4x0anURm5iLY5Q.text: I was sorely disappointed after waiting for 45 minutes to eat such a dry old tasting sandwich.  I generally don't mind waiting for food, but the turkey sausage egg sandwich was such a huge disappointment.   The sandwich itself is placed on a huge brioche bun, that wasn't sweet or pleasantly soft AT ALL.  I mean when I bit into it it tasted slightly stale to me, the turkey sausage was disgusting it was so dry and tasteless and didn't have any sausage flavor whatsoever.  The rest of the sandwich was really disappointing.  I would take a McD sandwich over this any day.    I had a bite of my friends fair fax sandwich and perhaps that would warrant 3 stars, but I think eggslut is way overhyped and not worth the price nor the wait.  I can't believe I paid almost $9 for a nasty dry sausage egg sandwich.  It made for a great photo op but I was not satisfied whatsoever, and I am not the pickiest person at all when it comes to food.   Save your time and money and go somewhere else for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry gross turkey sausage no taste
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey sausage

UzgBDi_84AwYDdu_CT9uBg.text: Egg slut has been on my "to try" list for a while now. I've never been able to make it up to Grand Central Market before there's a long line, I made sure I had to try it when I was in Vegas. I made the mistake of going on a Saturday though when there are a lot more tourists in town - annnnnnd especially going at peak hours...  It's located in the Cosmo on the second floor next to Holstein's and right across from the line to enter Marquee Day Club. When I arrived the end of the line was right in front of the restroom in the adjacent hallway. We got to the counter by a few minutes shy of 12:10PM and then got our food around 12:30PM. There's limited seating but it clears up fast, my boyfriend and I were able to grab 2 bar seats at the counter right after we got our food.   We ordered the gaucho, the cheeseburger, and the slut. I had intended to try their breakfast sandwiches, but I'm not a big cheese person so I felt like I wouldn't be doing their food justice ordering the breakfast sandwiches and opting out cheese... so I decided to get the gaucho. It's waygu tri tip with chimichurri sauce, argula, and an over medium egg. The sandwich was decent, my yolk was on the other side of my sandwich so once I bit into it, it squished the sandwich and caused the yolk to pop and exit out of the sandwich into the wrapper... so I didn't get the full experience :-( it was still good, however I could have used a little more seasoning/salt.  I was looking forward to the slut - we were advised to make sure all layers were fully mixed in together before eating it. After it was all mixed up it kind of reminded me of those fake watery mashed potatoes you'd get from the frozen tv dinners.  Egg slut is good, but from everything I've heard I was expecting it to change my life and it didn't. Maybe if the wait wasn't so long I would have enjoyed it more but being in line in a small hallway next to restrooms wasn't exactly the best precursor to a meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The gaucho
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uplJHsO7sOmYanOrIjyYJQ.text: Meh. I don't get the hype. This Cali chain has landed, after much anticipation, on the Vegas Strip in the Cosmopolitan. Sure, it was opening day and they were super busy...30 minute line turned into more of an hour wait because one of the employees messd up a sandwich and had to recreate it; backing up the many orders behind. And the manager just stood there with dear in highlights look. Step in and help the guy out DA! My 3 star rating is not due to the wait or less than stellar service. Day 1 = I'm am a reasonable person after all. ;)  3 stars based solely on food quality, creativeness (lack thereof), and cost. Frankly speaking, the most intriguing thing I found about Eggslut was the interesting name - very befitting for Sin City!   Their signature "Slut" that's cooked and served in a small jar (think maybe twice the size of a baby food one) in water bath sounded very promising, and I liked the fact you get to keep the cute little jar and lid. Could start a collection. Lol. The dish is simply pureed potates, with one egg on top, garnished with chives, "gravy salt" (which I think they forgot) served with a few pieces of EVOO drizzled toasted baguette slices. The egg was completely overcooked - no yolky goodness - and the potatoes were bland. It wasn't horrible, but it's not something I would call phenomenal...by far. It lacked any form of texture (very thankful for the bread) and tasted...well...like baby breakfast food. I bet kids love the "Slut!"  In addition, they must be making a killing on markup of packaging and product. Sells the "Slut" for $10; probably costs them less than 2 bucks to create. Great business model at least...and they do seem to have an obsessive fan base. Anybody want to go in on a franchise? :P  Next time I feel like eating some slutty cuisine,  I'll just cook naked at home with the windows open...no fried foods of course. Happy noshing!  NOTE: The space is really small and has very little counter seating on one wall. There are seating areas scattered close by in the Cosmo though.

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuit...
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overcooked egg...

0_ARieTbXQkSehjtXh8LBg.text: Juicy and refreshing Gaucho sandwich. Not so impressed with their menu selection even though i love eggs.  I think it's a bit overrated and not worth waiting in long line especially at their original location in Grand Central Market.

vAUsZPhlr70_OvmTfobiig.text: The line was long. A 25 min wait just to order.  It's like a factory that churns out mediocre overpriced dishes.   I ordered the slut. A poached egg in a cup over mashed potatoes. It was the consistency of a loogie.   My friend got one of their sandwiches and a biscuit. The thing was dryer than than senior citizen cooch. I mean, you can always lube it up with their sample size honey butter they give you.   I had ordered their "fresh squeezed orange juice" but when I was handed a cup that looked like it was from concentrate and asked about it being advertised as fresh squeezed, the response I got from the man behind the counter was...."we don't squeeze it here, somebody else somewhere else squeezed it. You know, like it says on the bottle 'fresh squeezed'. Tacky ass False advertising.   I'm giving it three stars for the flavor of the loogie and the originality of the idea. I wouldn't go back.

2MRfoWmMX6eVESo8Yr2Xuw.text: While visiting Las Vegas I really didn't want to venture too far outside of the Cosmopolitan for breakfast, luckily Eggslut was located inside my hotel and it quickly became my go to choice for breakfast.  The concept here is simple with a menu focusing on eggs. For both my visits I went with the standard Bacon, Egg & Cheese and the Sausage, Egg & Cheese. Both sandwiches were served on a warm brioche bun and more than enough to satisfy my hunger until lunch. One morning I did also order a Buttermilk Biscuit, which was served with butter and maple syrup however it wasn't the greatest so I just stuck with a sandwich the following morning. Prices here are rather high, however, nothing is cheap in Vegas so that was expected.  My advice is to arrive early as it gets very crowded and might find yourself waiting in a rather long line, however, don't worry as it tends to move pretty fast. All food here is prepared to order so you know you are getting the freshest sandwich. Overall Eggslut is a solid choice if you are staying inside the Cosmopolitan, I am sure other options could be found in other nearby hotels that are just as good.

pSbYNnABcjfou5Ri_a4uZw.text: Scrumptious eggs!!! The wait is normally worth it (I'm talking about the 15-20 minute ones) because the food is delicious. My friends from out of town always come here and I usually tag along to eat as well. I like the egg sandwich that's comes with steak. It is worth the money in a opinion since you are in Las Vegas.  There is something about how they cook their eggs, give it a shot. You won't be disappointed.

N-17Jbe_VIoUq1ugsiVb0Q.text: Cool name? Sure. Lots of hype? Yeah. Good food? Not really.  After hearing a bunch about Eggslut, I decided to give it a shot and was unfortunately disappointed. I had the Fairfax with avocado. While the brioche bun was yummy, the scrambled eggs were actually quite bland which really ruined the sandwich since the avocado and cheese don't provide much flavors on their own either. I was actually enjoying the sausage, egg and cheese until my partner mentioned that it tasted like a glorified Egg McMuffin and I slowly realized they were right. Sure, it was better. But $8 worth of better? Not at all.  Overall really over-hyped. Better breakfast and egg sandwiches can be had elsewhere

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax with avocado. Pretty flavorless

3duA1RZSEQwofqfKONnAwg.text: This place is so overrated by people who must love the dishes here over their normal kale smoothie. The Slut is just a $10 mashed potatoes over a poached egg. It needs more flavor. The breakfast sandwiches are way better. Don't even think about getting a biscuit. It was made off site by someone who has never been to the South. Totally not worth the line. I've had better breakfasts at a buffet.

ZBkL0retOpdTtQ5K50mAww.text: Yes, the line is long but it moves quickly. It wrapped around into the hallway, but we were in line for maybe 15 minutes. I had the sausage, egg, and cheese on brioche and I loved it. The sausage was a little spicy and the egg, perfectly runny (a thicker runny which I like). By the time we were able to order, there were seats that opened up, which was good because they're limited.   For those who haven't been, just know this is more breakfast sandwich than a sit down place with lots of options. But if you want a filling bite to eat before starting the day, this is a good place to try. It's on a floor in the Cosmopolitan which actually is like a trendy food court/alcove with all the places to eat. Yeah, it's all the rage and sometimes that ruins expectations, but I was satisfied.

JYEoTh4X03gOpwjonoHzJg.text: Decided to finally give this place a try and it was just OK. It was good, just nothing to write home about, and definitely not worth the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fFeYt92XgQuPZ3SvA9lIvQ.text: Located in the Cosmopolitan Hotel Eggslut was every bit as crowded as it's LA counterpart but not nearly as good.   Unfortunately the bacon egg and cheese breakfast sandwiches were overcooked and lacked the gooey yolky goodness that I have come to expect out of my sandwiches.  All in all a nice place to visit but somewhat of a letdown.

qq5WGQAn5gQDGJsazkr3cQ.text: Expected good food because the line was so long. I had the cheeseburger and my wife had the sausage egg and cheese sandwich. They were able to replace medium egg for scrambled and leave off the mustard aioli for my wife despite the long line. Good service.   Pickles were really good in the burger. My over medium egg was perfect. Both of us thoroughly enjoyed out quick breakfast. Maybe a couple dollars overpriced but what expected given location in Cosmo.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage egg and cheese $8, cheeseburger $10, coffee $4.50.

q40qtb9pH86FZQlcR95Bjg.text: Eggcellent breakfast to start a day full of Vegas adventures. I had the "slut" which was different and delicious. Just the right portion so I didn't feel too full. My hubby had the burger with an egg on top and loved it, super flavorful with the bacon. We went about 10:30 and the line was about 10 deep, but that was to be expected. Check out this dirty lil breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OwVNt72Zn2m2szZT48HyEg.text: Ok so there's a huge line and it's pretty expensive but...omg, it's delicious. I'm rarely on the strip for breakfast, or ever really, but this is worth a trip and a wait in line. The line moves pretty quickly btw. There's not a lot of seating so grab a chair as soon as one opens up. The eggslut was delicious and my husbands sandwich was also really good. I do recommend this place for visitors who are already on the strip and ask for breakfast ideas.

jYkhMvmkeNdTc37Zrhb9FQ.text: Came on a Saturday night around dinner time and there was barely a line. I was able to sit my group of 8ish at their bar seating. I ordered the Gaucho, which had wagyu beef in it!!!  The combination of the steak, egg, and arugula was truly drool-worthy. I literally inhaled the thing. A great way to soak up all that alcohol that I had been guzzling all day. Yum.

gwGRBFVyraMoZwVplZPwFw.text: We have been here a few times now, and every time we leave happy and satisfied. It's worth the wait in the super long lines (the line was not bad this morning) the people are so friendly and the food come out fast, it's a little pricey but so worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zMC65aKjLFuSXvzgcFOwJQ.text: My husband and I came here on a Tuesday around 2pm, and there wasn't a line at all. We each ordered a fairfax, and I got a fresh-squeezed orange juice, while he got a coffee. The sandwiches were rather yummy but a little too greasy for my taste. I thought that everything was a bit overpriced. I understand that it's Vegas, but it didn't quite seem worth all of the hype and money. It is nice, however, that it is a reliable breakfast stop when you're not in the mood to have lunch food in the afternoon and don't want to sit somewhere for too long.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RHTA3_XpRO-BLVsoQKq5YA.text: We were looking for some local breakfast and Eggslut was on the top of many lists. We waited in the queue and were excited to try some of their creative options. All sandwiches are on a brioche bun which is one of my favorites. I got the bacon egg and cheese sandwich and Gary got the sausage. Mine was decent, but nothing I couldn't make at home. Gary couldn't stand his. His egg was too soft for a medium fried and the sausage had a really weird flavor.   I regret not trying their namesake menu item which is a coddled egg and potatoes puree poached in a jar with grey salt with baguette slices. It might have improved our experience.   They used local farmers and despite the line they move quick. Hence the two stars.

hlCDEv-mlb4AGOynEMM_9A.text: Nothing special. We payed $20 per two burgers medium sized without any drinks. Overpriced since they have so much competition in Vegas and still keep it to good standards. They have good service, when we came there both times was no queue at all. Very Limited seating area so take to go don't risks if u will not have seat.Just in case

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. inside
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. egg sandwich too spicyyyyyyy

DatKv2QOpkbeIxdeX5ztpw.text: Everything was simply delicious. The food tasted fresh and without the extra chemicals. You feel good afterwards. We ordered the most popular dishes and all was simply perfect.

gO7AwGgPfCGCFZbUDHjmRg.text: I LOVE being surprised by a breakfast item that I have never had before! Not only that, but to have something so decadently flavorful, almost mind blowing! No wonder this unique dish is named after the eatery itself, Eggslut. A petite glass jar filled with a savory potato puree and poached egg, topped with grey sea salt and minced chives. Served with perfectly toasted baguette (ask for extra!), this dish elevates breakfast to a whole new level.   You will find Eggslut across Marquee night club in the Cosmopolitan Hotel. We are so excited to have this most welcomed addition to our favorite Vegas resort which we stay at 4-5 times a year. As I write this review I am already salivating for my next delicious jar tomorrow morning, or perhaps late tonight ;-)  Also noteworthy, orange juice is freshly squeezed (love), bacon is thin, crispy and slightly peppered. Egg sandwiches were really tasty, but I highly recommend their specialty. Service is friendly and accommodating, so don't be deterred by the long line (moves fairly quick). It's worth it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggslut--heaven in a jar!! Soooooo amazing!
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg and bacon sandwich
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggslut

7l9vitAdBzvW0eDHU6R-yg.text: GET HERE EARLY... the line was super long.... we waited at least 30 minutes.... Ordered the egg sandwich..... great sandwich but the egg was over easy... make sure you order the egg the way you like or they make it the way thru want (RUNNY).... other than that sandwich was good...

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LgCR38PTyncyhex8uElNtA.text: This was an ok place for breakfast, 2.4 star, maybe I had high expectations. I had a breakfast sandwich on a gluten free bun. The bun was pretty good. Sadly I found out after the fact the bacon had nitrates and they didn't have syrup there at a breakfast place, when I ordered a side of bacon that I didn't eat. Also the egg on my sandwich was very under-cooked, I wish they cooked the egg at least to a medium/hard Yoke, or asked. And of the eateries in the Cosmo most/all seem health oriented or try/make it look like they are.

_G89eHckvSs6vNKCREabeQ.text: Had a breakfast here right before Christmas. The wait was like half an hour until we got the order. We had two sluts and one orange juice. The sluts tasted good, especially when paired with the bread. The orange juice was overrated. 4 stars for the taste and 1 star for creativity.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WR_-mYBiX9lciwwgsPh3QA.text: Eggslut...May be a slut, but she's not quick and easy.  The reviews hyped this place up to be something so fantastic and worth the wait.  Not worth the wait in my opinion.  This place is on the 2nd floor of the Cosmopolitan casino.  It's a walk-up, fast food style restaurant with no seating.  The eggslut is pureed potatoes with a poached in a glass jar egg. Concept and flavor is good, don't get me wrong, but it's not worthy of being considered breakfast.  It's more of a five or six bite appetizer.  We waited in line for 45 minutes at 9:30 a.m. and then about another 10 minutes to get our eggslut jars.  Each eggslut was $10.50!! Way over priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pRHsWokDGzDt2p4In5j2tA.text: Great food, great service all around an outstanding place. My husband and I look forward to traveling to Vegas just so we can come here!

4KgUgJdwOt51ForfUeishw.text: Everything about this place great except for the 35 min wait. And the lack of seating. And the price. But besides that its the best! To be fair the price is what you'd expect for the Cosmo hotel. About $10 for an egg sandwich. But a damn good egg sandwich!

1z1fN7Af3Bd58azMWl4ftQ.text: Other than the wait.... which is inevitable, this place is worth the price. Their food is fresh and clean which is important since the last thing you want to eat after a night of drinking is grimey fast food. Lol truth be told this is one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas after hours ;)   Seating: limited in the restaurant but there is a bar across that has ample seating.   Drinks. Coffee, fresh squeezed orange juice.   Recommendations: I don't eat meat so the eggSLUT and the Fairfax Sandwitch are my gotos.   Try it - u won't regret it :)

J2SKKIKhLRR6ztaD5q3z_A.text: One of the best breakfast sandwiches I've had in a very long time! Anything here is bomb really!

tp3wya0d7Ey7d47LE2V9oA.text: The eggslut, something akin to coddled egg over mashed potato is a great concept. The execution of it on my visit didn't quite arrive as advertised. The egg was cooked perfectly well. I had to maneuver my way back to the cook station for salt and pepper. The chives and salt were missing from my order, salt and pepper were not on the tables. ??? Eggslut is a really busy place so I wasn't too happy working my way back through the crowd. The mashed potato:good flavor if watery. The fresh orange juice didn't taste fresh. I said to my companion that the flavor was exactly the same as a well-known frozen orange juice concentrate. ??? My friend liked her Gaucho Sandwich order.  I'd definitely go again. Next time I'll double check my order before sitting down to enjoy breakfast.  4 stars for the concept, up vibe, great people-loving staff. Short on execution and price.

9N1PaFHb-f4YBxlo9zvHXg.text: Finally got to try this place after having my friends rave about this place. They are fast and efficient but lines are long! We had them as a before dinner snack and it was satisfying. The "slut" is a poached egg in a glass jar with potato puree and cheese, the baguette slices were nice and crispy. It was a nice little snack and I saw other items on the menu that I wanted to try too. Lines are very long in the morning, after 12 pm, there's no line at all. Definite must when I come back to Vegas.

QRXE8Auxo4345Evv8FbsiA.text: I was so absolutely thrilled that this was located in the cosmo where we staying in! I've been eyeing this place down and soo happy we got to taste it.  Though the lines are long they move pretty quickly and are very efficient with what they do. We made a bulk order for a group of 7 to bring back up to our rooms and didn't have to wait long at all. I ordered "the slut" and it was complete heaven!!!! The perfectly poached egg and baguette was absolutely delicious! I loved how it was filled with mash potato on the bottom as a surprise, this meal definitely fills you up! Not to mention the oh so great buttermilk biscuits and butter. Wow, it is SO big and the butter pairs perfectly with it.  Top it off with iced coffee and it made the perfect breakfast for us. A great place to pick up brunch or breakfast for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut

9oZAs86ROnYSzn-rByUoxQ.text: Delicious egg sandwiches! I had the sausage, egg, and cheese. The sausage was perfectly cooked and the egg was cooked over medium. Cooking an egg over medium can be difficult but this place did it perfectly! It all comes together on the brioche bun which really makes the sandwich a delicious choice for any time of day! The menu is a little limited and the coffee is very pricy but the egg sandwiches are really amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WMtQ3iTnpCudHMfKkwNFcA.text: SO DANG DELICIOUS! You will want to wait in the line for their meals. This is the perfect hangover cure. They have community seating so you may have to wait for a bit to snatch a seat. I had their chesseburger as it was much needed the morning after. It was so good I basically inhaled it. One of my faves when I visit the Cosmo.

mRjPB-AqpMwJfOIMKPW59A.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast places in vegas. Everytime I vacation here, I make a stop, try something new, and am never disappointed. Give this place a try!

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, egg, &amp; cheese

O60OTJLOP8tQoxFLWNKYWg.text: Unique idea, even though it's kinda ordinary.  The Eggslut is basically an over easy egg mixed with mashed potatoes, super tasty with the baguette.  Husband got the bacon and over easy sandwich was great.  May not be enough food if you're hungry.  I love how egg sluts compostable containers, and remember to return the glass from the Eggslut to them as they reuse them.

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0zGE5O71jRErkUXhaEzsKg.text: Fast service. Definitely much faster than the one in DTLA in my opinion. I ordered everything as takeout as well, but you can totally enjoy the meal at all the seating area near the restaurant. Fair warning, it does get crowded in the morning obviously, so seating may be limited.   I ordered the Slut and several egg sandwiches: Gaucho, Bacon, and Sausage.  The menu is simple enough for you to know exactly what you want. I honestly don't think you can go wrong with any of the dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the sandwiches! Gaucho, Sausage, Egg &amp; Cheese, Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut

Z60B63vE3Fgs7Q1_ovAOGQ.text: Long line at 8am for the popular Eggslut breakfast. The roll looks like a heavy bread but is more croissant than a bun! They make those sluts fast and it was pretty tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fair fax with bacon
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

toQip17PXXYfIoT4cDF28w.text: The food here is pretty great tasting. I had the egg salad sandwich and wow it was great. My gf got the fairfax and added bacon and avocado and it was good too, but 5$ extra to add those two things was ridiculous. Especially with the sandwiches already being expensive. I can't believe it costs that much to add some meat and avo. And understandably in Vegas the line was atrocious. It took about 30 min to finally get up and order and get food. I would love to eat there again but I will never wait in that line again.

3owAdyxWktXCm5vSM0iGYg.text: Pricey $8-9 for a bacon and egg sandwich, $10.75 for a hamburger. It doesn't taste anything special and nothing at all. It is expensive because it is located at the strip!

pLybojoiKm7sCL9qKaegVw.text: On our last day in Vegas we tried this lovely little spot.I've been wanting to try it since so many people seem to be obsessed with it.Well let me tell you guys....this place was ssoooo amazing!!!!My boyfriend and I halved a cheeseburger which we shouldn't have done because it was so good I wanted my own to devour lol I'm not too big of a fan of having an egg in my sandwiches but I even left that on and ate it! The bread was so soft and buttery just like croissant. Everyone else seemed to love their food.One of our friend accidentally dropped his biscuit and contemplated about eating it anyways.That's how good it was lol Only downside I would say is the line.It wrapped around the corner but it moved pretty fast so it wasn't too bad. I would go back forsure!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5tis-XLvSCObypD7jEwzXw.text: It may only be because I was starving once I got there but the "Slut" gave me life!  Good if you want breakfast but want to try something new. Just make sure you stir it up before you eat it and eat it while it's hot (not the same experience if it's like warm)

MYBA6vR13Y2c5lYsc6nNwg.text: Tried two things here: Fairfax w/bacon and the Gaucho. Fairfax was great, think I'll try to ask for crisper bacon next time. Soft cooked eggs were perfectly done with good flavor. Definitely will try that again.  Gaucho, hmm. Wagyu beef, I would challenge that, it did not have that butteryness like Wagyu beef normally has. Cilantro spread on bun ruined it for me because I hate cilantro. One bite had me cringing. I think using regular iceberg lettuce instead of the arugula would be better too. My opinion. Won't order that again. The bun was superb for both, soft, tasty and easy to eat. It even helps to soak up the juicy flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu on the wall!

heDEOzNSUiUdjbeOXGLulQ.text: I got there at 9:30 ish and the line was pretty long but move quickly. I got the egg, sausage and Cheese sandwich. Three napkin, over easy runny egg with a sausage patty on a brioche roll.  It was pretty delicious.  I also got the biscuits which had honey butter which were also solid.  I would have given them 5 stars but I deducted 1 star because of the $5 coffee which was ok and a small cup.  Food was spot on and for Vegas "relatively" inexpensive.

1nWnmHWnIDg_Eqm1KzfOEg.text: It's really good!! The line is always so long but it moves very fast... there's 2 menus and one is located around the corner so don't worry about looking at the menu in the front, just stand in line and there's a menu in the back. We took out time looking at the menu in the front and lots of people beat us to the line. We didn't realize there was a menu in the back were the line started.   We tried the slut which is bread and a jar filled with pureed potatoes and egg on the top. It's really filling. I got this and he fairfax sandwich and I couldn't finish it because it was too heavy! So share with someone. The sandwiches look small on picture but they are pretty damn big. My boyfriend got the biscuit which was $5. It was just ok. I think I would have been better with either side honey, jelly or maybe even syrup cause it was kinda bland for my taste.   Me and my boyfriend order 4 things off the menu, 2 sides and 2 sandwiches. Total was $43 something. It was pricey than I realized. Not something I would buy every morning but worth the money to try.   It's a cute place to eat for breakfast. They have tables right outside of the area. It can fit big groups too! This place is definitely a must try especially if your a foodie or a breakfast lover. I'm not a breakfast person but I'd come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YMP-6feK89cXHPq75BKtOw.text: So the infamous Eggslut had to be a stop during our visit to Las Vegas. As an avid egg lover, I wanted to see and experience all the hype. The first call out is that the Cosmopolitan is such a sexy hotel and you will find this place on the second Floor by Momofuku.   So I was going to order it's namesake, but the reviews were too mixed for me to dive in. So we ended up going with the burger and the Fairfax with bacon. The Burger was decent and pretty on par. Nothing out of this world that I would say sets it apart from most. So if you want meat, it's a safe bet.   The highlight though was actually the Fairfax. It's built around medium scrambled eggs with chives, caramelized onions, spicy mayo, and bacon to top it off as an add on. The flavors were on point and delicious. Honestly though...you can very easily make it on your own at home. It's more for the experience than the wow factor.   Overall, the price was hefty, but it's on par with most Vegas joints. Service was slow, but keep in mind that the wait times can get long especially in the morning. Definitely recommend trying off peak times for faster service and speed. Worst case scenario, you can do it at home for a fourth of the costs, but I think still an enjoyable experience in the great setting of the Cosmopolitan Hotel!

PfMouVTplIBvfVRiOtlZXw.text: This egg haven is located in the Cosmopolitan. I remember getting something slutty, but I just chat remember. Oh wait! I got the slut. There's nothing better than bread and some dipping of majestical egg goodness.   This was a fantastic stop after all of the walking and drinking around. The Cosmopolitan is really big and has all sorts of cool things, but nothing as slutty as this one.  The food was delicious and so tasty I had to get another one to go. I enjoyed all the jokes and names of the food and the people of the establishment are super nice!  Awesome place to go, especially for those who take their egging seriously.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut

viRQYPFLe6y6DuU3qGCSBA.text: This is a great place to get an egg sandwich. There are a lot of options and the line moves very quick. The wait time for food is short after ordering also. It's very convenient when staying in the Cosmopolitan. I ordered the Fairfax add Avo, which was really good. The brioche bun was perfect. Would definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax add Avo

ygFbZbofnfAmbxGCWGpl5Q.text: I've been wanting to try eggslut for a LONG time, and finally did! I was very lucky and didn't have to wait in line at all, but in the past I've seen and heard of very long lines (though supposedly it moves fast). The breakfast sandwiches are excellent and they're generous with ingredients. They're also very good about customizations, especially since everything is cooked made to order. I've had the bacon and egg sandwich, the Fairfax (plus turkey sausage) and the Slut and would recommend any of them!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The slut - very tasty though a little salty! You&#39;ll need more bread than they give you

HVd1JM1Eg8H8EqiwLYLxkg.text: There is no better place to get an egg sandwich that tastes so wonderful that Eggslut in Vegas. The line proves that it is worth the wait. I did have to stand in line this morning for a sandwich, but that's ok; I have the time. Plus, for eggs done perfect then the wait is so worth it!  Now jus let getting to the front of the line; anticipation growing too. The cashier was very friendly and took my order with ease. After paying and getting the receipt I waited for the cooks to do their magic. The smells that tickle my nose are so amazing. The cook was busy and making the guests food. It was the cashier that runs the register and the front counter that placed my food in the bag and handed it to me. With this establishment so busy you would think that they could run two cashiers. Just a suggestion.  With the bag now in my hands I took it to eat in the car since I'm running behind. I had this time around the Eggslut with bacon, egg, and cheese. Yes it is fantastic and messy. It gets all over the place, but that is more of it to enjoy! If I could I would eat all my egg meals here.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and egg sandwich

nz0Vlc9hH2j_VGqdya5NeA.text: If you like egg sandwiches, this is the mother. Fairfax to pop your cherry then you can order something else. Coddled egg is a must along with their biscuits.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax

pr9rzFWndFVc3zVY8QY5hw.text: It's okay not worth the wait or cost for a mediocre sandwich. Took about 15 min to order and another 10 to get it... got the cheeseburger which was mediocre at best.

FDbqY_apBt1GPtxKVP6ZIA.text: We happened to be at the strip at the opening day of this place and there was a line of people wrapped around waiting to get some. Se I knew it was a big deal. Anyway we finally went last night to see what it was all about.  I ordered the Fairfax with sausage, sauce on the side. My wife ordered the egg salad sandwich and she loved it. She also got one of their salted chocolate cookie. I tried some of that and it was dang good.  They forgot to give me my sauce and it was a little pricey for what you are getting. They also don't have water cups and make you buy a $4 smart water which is so stupid to me. Those things stop me from giving a 5 star.

HULc1elvysQevlhxtEUq4Q.text: We waited in line for an egg sandwich. It was good but not very filling. In my opinion not quite worth the wait or price but they have a good gig going.

ZpvejrUVwb0UEcf62w0Fug.text: Great food for a fitness walk, "modified", that is.  Friendly staff, smiles all around.

G-ZDcu_th57yI7kxsDtu8g.text: Went here around noon on a Sunday and line was surprisingly short (about 10-15 minute wait).  Girlfriend and I both got the Fairfax with bacon because they were unfortunately out of sausage, as well as a biscuit and two salted chocolate chip cookies.  Fairfax was very delicious and bacon was top notch, but my girlfriends egg may have been slightly undercooked.  The biscuit was average, but the cookies were heavenly and had to hold myself back from getting more when I saw the line had cleared towards the end of the day.    Overall.  Great quality food that may be slightly overpriced for what it is, but it's Vegas and in the Cosmo so it's to be expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eueYSDGugy0NA7F6StP4Uw.text: It's more the hype than anything else. Its a breakfast sandwich, nothing big. I've had better in Chicago and much cheaper. The price is a little much for the portions. My husband and I spent $25 on two egg sandwiches and let me tell you we had to go somewhere else to eat after because we were still hungry. It's a good fast food type of breakfast place but it's not worth the line nor the money.

aJitzMcbGA4VHpv0esZj2A.text: Very good egg sandwich. Line was about 40 mins long  a bit much for me. Coffee was very good as well. Thank goodness everyone enjoyed breakfast otherwise I would've been in trouble....

vHKycd3jJUihCNW9TwjVWg.text: Yep, the hype is worth it. There was a line, but the employees were very efficient and moved it along quickly. I was iffy on having ketchup on a breakfast sandwich, but it definitely complemented the sandwich well and was very happy I ordered the bacon and egg sandwich without modifications. There was also a generous amount of bacon which made my morning. Definitely a must if staying at the Cosmo. Also, the newly added seating area outside the restaurant/Chandelier Bar came in handy.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l8O-BkvAPZDXLL8uiqGsnQ.text: Really great service quick in and out food was great definitely going back wish we had one in Baltimore

ZJ4MDybA9XhOs9rlqkFxYg.text: Eggslut for after clubbing, Eggslut for waking up on the strip hungover, Eggslut for a quick study break, Eggslut because I was in the the neighborhood. Breakfast food all day.  Having had the original Eggslut in LA, I can tell you it's just as good. Don't expect anything fancy, it's just an egg sandwich. But it will be a really, really good egg sandwich. If you don't know anything about the restaurant you'll probably order the Slut, but don't. It's more expensive than anything else on the menu and the portion is really small. But don't get me wrong, it's pretty freakin good.  I like the Fairfax, but pay extra to add meat. The Bacon, egg and cheese is just as good though so if you spent too much in the club, maybe stick to that.  Park in the West side elevators- direct access to Eggslut!

7RTDMhxh9kkgvvFiT45APQ.text: Yes.... I am an Eggslut ! Our first morning we were still on Detroit time so we hit the new Eggslut location just after opening, no wait for some excellent breakfast dining.  We shared a Fairfax with bacon and the Egg and Turkey sausage sandwich. Both excellent.  Filled us for the day. We were going to repeat on our last morning, a little later wake up time and the line was way way long.  Excellent addition to the resort

l05L53i_sZzna6f2bycPaQ.text: Hmmm I have always wanted to go to the LA location because...it's the Eggslut. Why else? I just happened to be in the area so I dropped by this location after finding out this location existed. And of course, I ordered the signature Slut! I have been known to go all sorts of places in LA to try different interesting restaurants. Eggslut was going to be no different. Yet, it was also sort of disappointing. The slut I ordered was exceptionally salty and despite mixing it fairly well, the egg flavor stuck to the top and the bottom tasted more like the potato puree. Not very well balanced. And the salt just dehydrates you especially if you come here after clubbing at Marquee. It's a bit annoying. My friends got the burgers and were less than impressed. Would I ever go out of my way to eat here? No way.  But it was well worth trying.

ER6hb2pjm0AnDLxdfQIhGw.text: INSANE! Such delicious & delicate well cooked eggs in a variety of sampling's. I had the brioche bun & turkey sausage and by far the tastiest breakfast sandwich I have had. Truly put care into cooking and the service is great. Awesome design & location in Vegas! #nomswithdoms

mRtddRfb_SevAtgOlNDfrw.text: Vegas - Sin city . . .  Fancy hotels, casinos, nightclubs and . . . sluts.  Yeah - back in Vegas a mere two months from the last trip.  But this time it wasn't business - it was for pleasure (well I had a wedding to attend).    So where did I find myself - Eggsluts.  Not once, but twice.  Oh the shame . . . paying for Sluts twice in one weekend.    At least what happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas . . .

b6ZTNcbTZOmh7GMSD1Yi1g.text: They had me at the name, honestly.   Super sexy restaurant in the super sexy Cosmopolitan, situated across from the gorgeous Chandelier bar.  Hell yeah.  We were only in Vegas and we came here twice for the signature slut - a jar containing potato puree and an egg that is then boiled.  You stir the egg into the potato and then smear it on toast. So. Freakin. Good.  Especially if you order a side of bacon and crumble some of that in there too.  Or be truly disgusting and just smear the slut directly on to the bacon.  Hoping this chain makes its way to Denver ASAP.  I'm just disappointed that they were out of T-shirts in my size.

JcwvKN3QMz6ps08RIwtQDA.text: After waiting an hour in a half for my order every second of that was well worth it. Although we have an Egg slut here in LA I've never really had the chance to try it. This was the best breakfast I've had in Vegas. You will definitely be full for the entire day. My boyfriend had the egg, bacon with cheese sandwich and I had the bacon sausage cheese and egg sandwich. I will for sure go to the LA location.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage bacon cheese egg sandwich and bacon egg cheese sandwich. Amazing!

rveVcMN6Dw3RkxtsRFuiKw.text: Finally tried this place out and I can see why there's so much hype around it but it doesn't do much for me. Avoid the lines by going mid afternoon after 2pm. It's Vegas so you should be just getting up around that time anyway. It'll hit the spot if you're looking for a greasy breakfast sandwich and fresh oj but I'd rather go to a mom and pop breakfast place any day.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aoh89Ic_zMt9Cc0OmEmhWQ.text: I came and conquered the eggslut and it was egg-cellent. The wait wasn't terrible - maybe 20 minutes. But you order/pay and walk through the line while you watch the cooks make all the beautiful little slut sandwiches so you don't realize time is flying. Be careful when you take your first bite though because it can get messy (see picture). I can make some rated R comments here but I will refrain.   The only downside is that there are no potato options on the menu (i.e. hashbrowns, potatoes, fries, etc) and I really miss it. Breakfast just doesn't seem complete without it. But other than that it was delicious and I will be back for more.

_Be2QX73IQEkVW6pQkGgig.text: Yummy! Very popular breakfast spot, it was busy but the line went fast . Had the fair fax breakfast sandwich with avocado on the side, was really good.

6z2Kg5zeYQ_A_BStt2J6uw.text: I've always wanted to try the food but the location in downtown Los Angeles always has a long line. It was my lucky day because this location didn't have anyone in line. I ordered the cheeseburger sandwich, it took about 5 minutes to get my food. Once I took a look at my sandwich I knew I would enjoy it, the first bite had me in heaven, really good food. Now I want to try the other items on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get slutty

bSK2vt3J_myGCGXdDf-18g.text: Honestly I came here because of the name, which I'm sure many, many, many others do based upon the line that formed before and after me. What solidified my coming here was the photos and the menu posted online.  Situated on the 2nd level of the Cosmopolitan on the strip, if you're coming from the Planet Hollywood walkway you'll need to come around the Chandelier bar as it is situated behind it. This is not a sit down restaurant,  you'll need to order at the counter and your name will be called, options are "for here" or "to go". Seating is available at the perimeter of the space but also across the walkway in an Alice in Wonderland theme space.   My first experience here was the Gaucho, a wagyu tri-tip steak served with a fried egg, served with chimichurri,  red onions, arugula on a brioche bun. The brioche adds a bit of sweet to the savory of the sandwich but the arugula adds a nice bite that finishes the sandwich. I also had housemade buttermilk biscuit which comes with honey butter. It is actually two biscuits. There isnt much to this, it's a buttery-salty biscuit.  But wow, I should have left this as a one hit wonder (I dropped a star). I came back a 2nd time for the Slut, a coddled egg over potato puree, garnished with grey salt and chives. Its served with some toasted baguette.  This was a disappointing experience,  I had ordered a side of bacon which I watched plated and set aside minutes before my Slut was ready, by the time I got the order the bacon was room temperature and loosing its crispness that I like. And although I grabbed my dish right away the baguette was cold! Who wants crusty cold, seemingly stale bread. At least the potato puree had flavor, I mixed egg and puree together to dip my bread into however eventually used a spoon to slather it on.   Overall the name is enticement,  I'd say come here for the fun and be prepared to stand in line. They work pretty quickly so it's not a long wait, but when in Vegas have some fun, be an eggslut.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon!

lSVXvMNjSKmDbRyUVTTyhQ.text: I think over $8 (tax included) for a brioche bun with some egg salad on it is quite expensive. I wasn't impressed. Flavors were good but I wouldn't pick this again.  This Eggslut is inside the Cosmopolitan on level 2. There was no line at all when I arrived on a Saturday afternoon. Staff was friendly, and I received my egg salad sandwich very quickly. Even it was calm, the tables were gross, someone needs to wipe them down badly. Everyone raves about this place and I can see it as a fun spot especially Down the Rabbit Hole seating across is cool, but I won't be back and rather try a new spot.

ADzwmOoA5XB1q5FURphp4g.text: This is a great spot inside the Cosmopolitan Hotel.    The fresh squeezed orange juice was great!  The Fairfax sandwich was cooked great, a bit sloppy with the scrambled egg on a sandwich, but delicious.    Now, the wait in line.  It actually went by fast, lasting just 23 minutes.  I think it's worth the wait, the first time might not be worth it every time.    Check it out on your visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax

6dKQAeXINzAAq3qh1eSRIg.text: This is a great place to grab breakfast if you happen to be nearby. The lines are usually long but it goes quick. We waiting for about 15-20 mins before ordering.   We got the bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich, fairfax sandwich, one of their specialty called slut, and salted chocolate chip cookie. The slut is an egg in a glass jar with their own homemade potatoes puree with several slices of baguette. This was decently good but probably something we will only order once to try out. The fairfax sandwich was also good but the bacon, egg, and cheese was absolutely delicious! They give you a lot of bacon! The salted chocolate chip cookie was also good. They warmed it up for you and had a nice chewy texture to it.   Overall, I would come here again. Service was phenomenal and it didn't take long for your food. As busy as it was, we had no problem finding a seat after getting our food.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign

hz4OOks0DCnwdMmsLVUNIg.text: Stopped by here because of the interesting name and all the rave reviews. Was it hype? Maybe a little. It's a couple notches above fast food but it sure was delicious.   We got a cheeseburger and a bacon-egg-cheese. The brioche buns were perfectly flaky, croissant-like almost. The oozing yolk from the egg helped bring everything together. So good! One thing I'd change about the cheeseburger is to not the use the sweet kind of pickle.   Midweek line stretched around the corner into the hallway around lunch, but it went super quick. Kitchen staff was efficient as heck so we got our food quick. Only problem was we came in hungry and left still hungry! An excuse to come back and try other menu items I suppose

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It was difficult to resist the temptation of taking a second bite before taking the pic
