Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmm that brioche buns is so flaky good...

d4CTpFMyf65pMp7U5HRBcA.text: Try it all while in Vegas. My favorite is the turkey sausage sandwich, but I suggest you try one of each and see what your favorite one is. Lines become extremely long on the weekends and in fact on week days as well. Located near chandelier bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thirsty?

RnCiz5am1I4MJHCBGz7E4g.text: It was EGGcellent! There's something about a "soft scrambled egg with chives" which caught my attention with egg slut. The long line was worth waiting. I ordered a sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich but opted for the soft scrambled egg instead. Hands down, DE-Licious! I will say, after my first bite, I was a little sad that my sausage consisted of turkey instead of pork. It almost felt like I was eating a turkey burger but that feeling went away quickly.   I think the winner winner here is that soft scrambled egg (how many times did I type this) with the aioli. Drool. As I type this, I want another one. Matter of fact, I'm in line waiting to order!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage, Egg &amp; Cheese with soft scrambled eggs

1L899bfEGZZ32vSlz7cF7A.text: Lines were long here, that by the time I got my food, my expectations were high. We for their bacon, egg & cheese sandwich and the slut. They have some bar seats, and also another eating area right in front.  Their bread is super light and fluffy. Doesn't have a lot of that buttery flavor. It's a preference thing, but I prefer a denser bread. Not sure if it was an off day, but my bread was a bit dry. I thought the egg was cooked great, the bacon was nice and crispy and the cheese complemented well.   Given the hype about this place, I was expecting a lot more. I thought my sandwich was good, but not worth the long wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese

YPgYX9TtvitN_h9AIVNxyQ.text: Walking towards this place I thought the line was short but then I saw that it curved around the back!!! Thankfully though the line moved really quick! We ordered the gaucho, fairfax and a biscuit. There is lots of seating opposite it and you might have to wait a bit to grab a spot. The gaucho was delicious!! Loved the wagyu in it!!! The fairfax was excellent too! I just wish they had some salt because I need salt on my eggs! The biscuit itself was average but the butter with it was good!I highly recommend this place. I want to try their egg salad sandwich next!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Fairfax!
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SCRUMPTIOUS gaucho, with wagyu steak!!
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuit was ok, butter was good!

64bAT0SKDiu_376NO2a0BQ.text: I'll have some explaining to do for sure.  How am I going to get a receipt from this restaurant approved on my business expense report?!?!  Thoroughly impressed by the perfectly soft curdled eggs, not a second too late off the heat, with spiced Turkey Sausage and a still melting slice of cheese on buttery pillowy brioche bun.  Each bite just melts so much so that you almost forget to chew, that there is actually food in your mouth.  It might lack for a little salt and pepper but that's an issue that's easily remedied especially when the sandwich is served piping hot.  One by one, these gorgeous beauties came out looking just as pretty as the last one as I wait for my name to be called.  Once in my possession, at 4am in the morning, this is one sandwich that is hard to put down.    Now if anyone has any ideas how I can get this one past those pesky corporate expense accountants,... yikes.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;m not sure what else to say about the name,....  this is Vegas,..
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fairfax - Scrambled Egg with Turkey Sausage

RDHPalf9b0sVQSm8KNuS0A.text: Stop at eggslut to grab a bite with my friend. Unfortunatly nothing vegan or vegetarian here. My friend got a sandwich and ask for water. NO TAP WATER. It is not the law to provide free water, but an establishment who serve food or alcohol in Nevada should provide free water. I am against this rip-off tactic who will force you to buy a bottle of water. I guess the sandwich was Ok for $16 ( cannot really complain about the price since we are in a casino and you know what to expect). But please serve tap water, this will not make you broke.

YaK88IvqE-AA6uuUn8B8cA.text: I visited one hour before the closing time, so there was no line.  I tried a cheeseburger. The combination of beef patty and egg was delicious. As far as I know, over-easy egg is not familiar in US.  The buns were crispy outside and fluffy inside. The taste was really nice.  It might be better if it was served with fries or something. It was just a cheeseburger with $10. In addition, a small bottled Pepsi was $5.  Nevertheless, I feel satisfied after eating. That may mean the taste was so good.  I'm not sure whether I could feel similar if there was a long line.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i7AekGcmPriyO9HfqH-2Yg.text: Aria was the sweetest! She went above and beyond to heat up my cookie which tasted awesome. I am giving this place a four star instead of five because they ran out of "the slut" which is one of the most popular things I was meaning to try. I was extremely disappointed. We had to settle for the fairfax and the egg salad sandwiches. They were both really good. I'm having hardcore FOMO for the slut. Hopefully I get to try it when I'm back in Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dark choc cookie
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fairfax and the egg salad

KvdbWxGHUxpJAVpomnKdew.text: The line was WRAPPING AROUND the tiny storefront. I almost aborted the mission but I am glad we stuck it out and tried the place. It's well-known and I would have kicked myself for not giving it a chance.  I got the Fairfax with greens instead of a bun and it was a comforting and semi-healthy delicious breakfast. The eggs were out of this world delicious however when the menu says "caramelized onions" I am expecting more than ONE. Seriously? Look at the picture.  He got the Bacon, Egg, and Cheese and was happy with it. He said the bacon was of great quality.  The cashier was so friendly, but the woman calling out orders was useless because she wasn't doing her one job-calling out orders. She was talking to a friend while everyone's orders sat under heat lamps. I was able to easily identify our order because mine was the only one without a bun. I gave her a few minutes and when I saw she wasn't going to call my order, I just walked over and said "can I just take this then?"  Her response: "oh yeah. Go ahead."  Useless. And during a breakfast rush, no less.  Naturally, the items weren't hot (do you see the cheese in mine LOL) and, again, what is up with my complete lack of onions? For $34?  I tried it but I don't think I'd return.   If you go, watch your order like a hawk and grab it before it shrivels up under the heat lamps so the employee can laugh it up with her friend and get paid for doing nothing.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax, no bun
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Egg and Cheese

ZHBDw30lMvrCJbTx8tlphQ.text: Finally got to try Eggslut and see what the hype is about. The line was long when I got there around 11 am at the cosmopolitan. It stretched to the bathroom but it didn't feel too long of a wait.   I ordered the bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich. It seems pretty basic (possibly a little pricey but cheaper than most places in Vegas) but everything was done so well. I'm not even the type to like ketchup in my sandwiches (and totally missed that part in the menu) but it blended in with everything. I actually didn't notice it until the end. The bread was so soft. Overall, the meal was flavorful and fulfilling.   There's a huge long communal table in egg slut but across there's some other tables and seats (Alice in wonderland theme?? and some egg seats!). Check this place out at least once during your stay!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rkMHm2jcIQjd4xyoHYEO3g.text: I had been waiting almost a year to give this a shot. My friend was visiting & we were in the Cosmopolitan showing him around town. That was when we decided to check it out. The line was only 3 deep; unheard of I know. Lol.   We ordered a few things. The only reason why I'm giving 4 star & not 5 is the overall service. They forgot my bacon on my sandwich and gave it to me in the side. I think that is huge lack of service when you are expecting this place to be the best of the best.   I got The Fairfax Sandwich & the Biscuit with delicious honey butter. My buddy got sausage egg cheese. The bread in general is absolutely to die for. The overall food, good, but not worth the $40 price tag. I thought that was a bit much even inside a Hotel to be honest.   Im glad I gave it a shot as it was definitely an overall good experience. Not sure how fast I'll return however I appreciate the tasty, creamy delicious flavors.   Thanks Team Eggslut

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fairfax
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JFYyMhsTu4ZbbAbpIQEmYA.text: Holy cow.  You have to try this place!    I woke up hubby after a very long night (it is Vegas right) and told him that I vaguely remember passing this coming back to our room.   We looked at the menu and I saw that they had gf bread for a dollar extra. SOLD. I was going to come here no matter what.   We went down around 8am and there was a line of about 6 people. It did move fast though.   I went with the bacon and egg on gf bread. My husband got the Fairfax with sausage. He had a cold brew and I did the orange juice. I had a bottle of champagne in our room that I wanted to make mimosas with, so that worked out well   The bill was around 30, which was super affordable.    The best part?  The food was amazing. It was so flavorful and filling. I've already told my husband that we have to come back for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eating our food back at our room!

ffZ2FJhG5p7mhthe0p4AYg.text: Delicious. We knew to expect a line. Got here at 8:30a on a Monday. Excited to see it looking not busy but didn't anticipate the line BEHIND the restaurant.  Got in line because it's on our "list" It was pretty fast considering there was a line. We waited maybe 35 mins to order our food. Ordered the cookies and fairfax, bacon & sausage sandwiches.  Very good and the bread was amazing. The cookie was still melting and so worth it.  Got 6 sandwiches and juice (which was so fresh squeezed) and it was about $80 which is a little pricey but expected.  We will definitely be back but early!

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sandwiches
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menú

NDMj_iZtZmH_DFxfkAA6bQ.text: I hate these experiences.  It's a catchy name and gets u excited for some creative , great tasting food.  Well I ordered a cheeseburger w bacon  I don't wanna b mean but this just sucked. It was wierd. As the bun was fresh, pickles were on point. Everything about this burger was great except the patty; and that is in fact the burger.  This meat was so over cooked and dry.  I was chocking. The patty was thinner than a Mc Donald's cheeseburger patty??? How's that possible???   I'm not saying this is a bad place.  I haven't tried other items.  I am saying the cheeseburger sucked.  Sometimes unfortunately a restaurant has a great name and location w no pride in what they serve.  I get it. They'll still make $ off the tourist.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger w Bacon
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The worlds smallest burnt piece of meat.

2i_46MvpTTVQkEVPc8LVRg.text: It sometimes pays to be slutty, especially in Vegas, am I right?  Well..the only slutty I was getting on during my quick Vegas trip out was having some yolk porn ooze all down my face from Eggslut's sandwich.    Even though I went to bed late (for me, I'm a youngish mom to an almost 2 year old after all) I couldn't sleep more than 5-6 hours, so I decided to head to Eggslut after 7ish.  There were only a few people waiting for their orders, it was early after all plus a Thursday morning.  I couldn't decide between the Slut, which was a coddled egg with potato puree served in a glass jar with baguette slices or the Bacon + Egg + Cheese sandwich.  Tough choice, but you rarely can go wrong with bacon and a yolky egg, so I went with the latter.  After a few minutes my order was ready.    Instead of eating it on the table tops there I went to the seating near by since The Cosmo is so awesomely aesthetic.  The bacon was nice and crisp, and the egg, cooked perfectly where the yolk bursted when I bit into it.  The cheddar cheese was a nice accompaniment but wish it was melted a bit.  I didn't really notice much flavor in the chipotle ketchup.  I saw the cook warming up the brioche bun on the flattop but honestly it could've used some butter or some kind of spread to liven it up.  The brioche itself didn't feel very warm and it was just too heavy.  I was tempted to get it bunless as they do offer that as an option at no extra cost, but with the over medium egg, it would get super messy, so I decided to skip.  It was a hearty sandwich that kept me going until I finally got home around 4pm and was under $10.  A steal for the Cosmo.  Happy I finally got to try Eggslut.  I'll definitely be back next time I'm on the Strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EE_fdnjcaSEEdHi8NHRjHg.text: I'm always up for a good egg sandwich for breakfast.  As such, the wife and I had to give Eggslut a try.  We arrived around 10AM on a Monday morning.  There was a short line, but it moved fast since the menu was very concise, there weren't many customization options to consider, orders were taken efficiently, and the kitchen pumped out food at very steady pace.  The wife and I shared a Fairfax ($8, soft scrambled eggs and chives, cheddar cheese, caramelized onions, and sriracha mayo in a brioche bun) w/bacon (add $3) and a Slut ($10), a coddled egg on top of potato puree cooked in a small Mason jar topped with chives and served with a toasted baguette slices.  Our Fairfax was hot, fresh, and satisfying, but messy and somewhat difficult to eat trying to keep it all together.  The light, airy brioche bun was the True star of the sandwich.  The Slut was simple, yet delicious.  Honestly, it outshined the Fairfax by a country mile.  Was Eggslut a bit overpriced?  Perhaps, but I thought their use of fresh, quality ingredients justified the price.  Is Eggslut a horrible name for restaurant?  I'm no prude, but it may be off-putting to some, which would be a shame since Egglut is easily the best place for breakfast at the Cosmo.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Please recycle
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Slut

PN0Tjah_kEZlwYEAVskzPQ.text: Heaven knows everybody in Las Vegas needs the greasy cheesy eggy carb breakfast to help settle the stomach of its "night before" contents. Eggslut fits the bill, with super soft brioche buns, cheesy eggs, and fatty meats. Before 8am is super fast service. Even long lines move quickly, but for coffee, visit the smoothie shop down the way. $4.00 for an 8 oz coffee is more than I wanted to pay, and the coffee wasn't exceptional OR strong.  My friend had the eggslut cup, which is basically mashed potatoes with a coddled (soft-cooked, almost raw) egg on top. She enjoyed it, but the look of the running yolk didn't do me any 8am favors.   The line got long on Saturday morning about 8:15 and it took about 15 minutes to order after being wrapped down the hallway, but only 5 minutes for my food. Don't order this via room service, or it will take an hour!   Try the Fairfax with bacon and avocado.  Next time: the burger.

MWhKzLxbjSNmI0yuHl7f5g.text: Excellent, very good food.  We had the sausage egg sandwich and the slut.  The slut was good, but a pretty small portion for the price.  The sandwich was nice and hot off the grill, the bun was very good.

vBMIQzmAXsjvKdrdVYu2xA.text: This place was a recommendation from friends and it was good. The line was long but moved pretty fast and it only took us about 20 mins to get to the front. The food was good but a little overpriced for what it is. I ordered the Fairfax with avacado and while it was good they forgot to put the caramelized onion. Seating area is limited as well and tables are also very tiny. Its worth trying but I probably will not go again

lf3NqUcMq7eByqPb2s-rVA.text: Enjoyed learning about  the companies beginnings as food truck in LA, on Cosmopolitans room channel, so was our first choice for breakfast.  We got here around 1pm a bit of a line but it moved fast.   We noticed not much seating in the place itself, so I went and found a couch to sit on near the bar.  I got the Sausage, egg and cheese sandwich with a orange juice and my husband got the Bacon, egg and cheese, orange juice and a cookie. Juice was cool and fresh.  I enjoyed my husbands sandwich more than mine.  Chocolate cookie was divine.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage, egg &amp; cheese  sandwich, with a fresh squeezed orange juice

lFVf49Hc2UlA6gEgXYV47Q.text: Worth the line !!!! Drinks aren't cheap, I recommend grabbing a beer from CVS and bringing it with

DMXtEPEv3QPF1NRTixOo4Q.text: The fresh OJ was good. Long line sucked but i understand everyone wanted to try this place. A lot of tourists mostly. There was an eating area in front of the place too, If you were fast enough to get the seat. Overall, the food made up the time for the wait.

IX-Z3-LKS5N9vAvfbW7y8w.text: We love breakfast but were disappointed by the breakfast sandwiches that Eggslut had to offer. I can understand the long wait-there aren't a ton of breakfast places in the Cosmo. That being said, we won't be back.

wYBIKv5vJRTipCO3k-Gc0g.text: In the words of Mr. Peabody, adequate but hardly extraordinary.   I did relish placing my order with the cashier, "I'll have a slut please." Too easy, I know. I kept a straight face. After picking it up I found one of the few seats remaining and sat down. Across from me were three rotund black women, all enjoying their own breakfasts as well. The lady in the middle asked me what I was eating?   "A slut," I answered.   "I bet you didn't know you was gonna eat one," and she began to laugh. As did I. She had me there.   Ok, this is fast food done reasonably well. You can ignore all the reviews about it costing too much. Tell me something that doesn't in this town. You come here to have fun; never mind the cost. Having said this, Eggslut might have opted for the small Mason jar instead of the teeny-weenie size. But they are selling plenty of them so don't imagine they will be upsizing anytime soon.  Or maybe a larger jar would require two eggs to get the egg-potato ratio just right. So then charge more (not that I know anything about the restaurant business).  The slut doesn't seem to be mashed potatoes with a soft boiled egg, but rather just potatoes cooked right, pureed, chives and salt added. Potatoes could have been a little warmer. Egg properly coddled. All in all, it was good enough.   Did also have the biscuits--okay but not perfect. But you might like them.   Not sure I'd go out of my way for Eggslut, but in the neighborhood? Sure.

KcWRxqdkms51KYvkzzZWaw.text: If you want an over priced breakfast sandwich with half a tub of mayo come here. The line is way too long and the menu isn't even that extensive or great. I love breakfast and sandwiches and was deeply disappointed, I couldn't even finish it because of the amount of mayo that's all I could taste.

ayCK3T_xgzOe4UUNGjc9Kg.text: The wait was only about 15min at noon on a Friday. I would probably go back. Friendly service, too. I ordered two egg sandwiches and thought they were very good (I had the scrambled egg one and my husband had the over easy egg one with bacon). Kind of wish I'd tried the egg slut in the jar. Next time!?

BFivku7v5AvPaOp-x2AsIQ.text: We just visited from Denver, and EggSlut was the only place we ate at more than once. The signature Slut is awesome, that's a given, but make sure you let your wife get that and you get yourself a "Gaucho" sandwich (and add bacon to that, it's a must!). Tender, perfectly cooked meat on a great brioche bun. And the staff was a blast, we enjoyed the laughs. And decent prices considering it's on Strip in the Cosmo  My only requests: 1) you guys should bust out an in-house made hot sauce. I mean you're serving egg sandwiches, right? Blow our minds with a little homemade zip. 2) I'd love a little more on the salad. It was a delicious dressing, tasty cheese, arugula... but that was it. Another ingredient or 2 would be fabulous.   Thanks much! We'll be back again for sure.

fWbdXery-u9eiUPSFAsEcg.text: The food here was very savory but really pricey (that's vegas). Seating was very limited.

fy75bSPk-u9WVymUw-Og-A.text: Slut was a disappointment. I was basically eating mash potatoes with bread. However, the fairfax was delicious. One if the best breakfast sandwiches I had.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KxM24dRMe0IxOarKFwY4_Q.text: Very long line but you have time to review the menu before ordering. The food was amazing and the delivery was quick. However, finding seats to eat is impossible. He had to walk back to our room and eat there. Overall, a very good breakfast spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu while you wait in line

jwb8X80ksuVqcAxkqIp5Eg.text: Went here for brunch. I have to say I think this place is a little overhyped. The line was very long (at least 30 minutes) and the food was expensive!  I got the Gaucho sandwich. The meat was really tasty and you could tell it was high quality. The brioche bun was nice and crunchy. The other components were not as successful. The egg was not as runny as I would have liked it to be. The biggest buzzkill for me was the amount of arugula on the sandwich (admittedly arugula isn't my favorite). The sandwich was overloaded with it and the flavor overwhelmed the rest of the components flavors. Overall I don't think I'd come back. The line was too long and the food was not cheap. Seating was also a little cramped and we had to fight for a spot.

9bsrnVKNqbCSeRSa4ePrBQ.text: I'm a sucker for great breakfast, & it's rare I find a place that can make breaky better than me :) But man, eggslut does it UP! I highly recommend the classic "slut". I am definitely going to try to recreate this at home. A poached egg floating inside of the creamiest whipped potatoes I've ever laid tongue on. Served with baguette. The line moves fast, & this seems to be pretty unanimous opinion among other yelpers. The coffee is actually outstanding, and dont skip the cookie or the biscuit with honey butter either. The breakfast sandwich was also baller. I recommend to a friend. :)

HzYztup80X-wivcKRIuRrw.text: You want to start your day right? Definitely a good place to choose. If you love eggs, you will enjoy this place. It's always pretty busy and it's obvious why. Simply, they make a bacon egg and cheese the way it should be. Biscuits are really good, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t4CoaT0GF5wllvgIkfV-qA.text: Ooooh my! So yummy! I had the Fairfax and my husband and son both had the Goliath. We all enjoyed every bite. So fresh and the combination of flavors is perfection. The line was super long, but it moves quick. We found a cute table...(some of the chairs are shaped like eggs! Fun!)and our order was out in a jiff! May have to try the "slut" one day. That looked pretty good too. Eggcellent breakfast experience!

VCFuZDgaksBeZwL6Ogw9jQ.text: Low stars are for low value.   Basic egg sandwiches.  They come in a brioche bun but other than that not much to say.  5 dollars for a biscuit, 5 dollars for small oj, no tap water only 5 dollar water bottles.  The food is good, but 30 bucks for two people and all we are were egg freaking sandwiches.  I used to eat a lot of egg sandwiches in college, so I know they are usually right there with the grilled cheese at about 3-6 bucks. 10 bucks is just overpriced for basic.  I would only go again if forced.  If you love eggs go otherwise pick one of the million other options.

Fx_waXYqxXTl7kJ9C4AaMA.text: I live in Los Angeles and have heard rave reviews about this restaurant for many years. This was the first opportunity that I had to experience it and it will absolutely be my last. I do not have a problem paying premium prices for a premium experience, however I paid $10 for a brioche bun, one egg, a slice of cheese and a turkey sausage patty that was literally so tough I could not chew it. Had I ordered my sandwich at the location and eaten it there I would have taken it back to the counter and asked them to make me another one without the turkey sausage, it was so tough. That being said I totally understand that this is Las Vegas and prices are through the roof, but I expected more and I definitely didn't get it. There was nothing special about the sandwich, not for the price.

Nw2PcYCfgLFmE8M08QixEA.text: Located inside the Cosmopolitan hotel, it was a convenient location to grab a breakfast sandwich before the morning flight home. I was afraid there might be a long line for the morning breakfast rush but was surprised when we arrived to no lines at 6 am. I had a bacon and egg sandwich. The egg yolk was runny and the entire sandwich tasted fresh. Overall it was a good quality breakfast sandwich, though not good enough to wait more than 15 minutes or so in line for.

2CbV97hOspWW9xc_1bb_mQ.text: Eggslut is one of those places where all your millennial fiends tell you "you HAVE to try it".  YES eggslut was good. They didn't have my dairy free buns for an egg sandwich, but they accommodated with a plate of bacon and eggs.  We waited about 40 minutes to get our food... a bit much for a bacon egg and cheese.  My recommendation-- if you come here and there's a long line, skip it and go somewhere else! It's just a (pricey)!bacon egg and cheese!

ERZggix3_3aRJWDLjt4mgQ.text: The line drives a lot of people away.  while standing in it, around the corner, I would watch people come up, look around, then leave.  the reality is the line moves quickly.  it took 15 minutes to get to the order, in what looked like a 45 minute line.  seating is limited, but this is finger food!  take it with you!  the Fairfax is the premier, really tasty, not over done with the sauces.

9hkpz4HwQLfYbKhiYATqKg.text: For years I've been seeing Eggslut on social media and I have always been like I need to try it. I got the chance to a couple months ago the last time I was in Vegas. Honestly it exceeded my expectations and was absolutely delicious. I got it 3 times that trip! As a lover of breakfast foods I can really appreciate the simplicity yet care that goes into their sandwiches. I got the Fairfax with no cheese, consisting of scrambled eggs, bacon, carmelized onions, and their special sauce. The brioche bun is the perfect vehicle for the contents of the sandwich and I haven't been able to stop thinking about it since that trip. I will be back for you one day Eggslut.

Al77IHmV5nGDodchsdokxg.text: Being locals we don't make it to the strip very often but when we did for a staycation I definitely had this place on my list.  We arrived to a line but I wasn't surprised after reading the reviews.  The line went fairly fast maybe 20 minutes but I have to say it was worth it.  I ordered the slut and my husband ordered the sausage, egg and cheese sandwich. 5/5 for both! And fresh oj  Flavor: right on!  Sandwich had a honey mustard type sauce that complimented the perfectly cooked runny yolk egg.  The sluts puree potato tickled my tongue to perfect delight.   Value: slut $10.50 sandwich $8.50 fresh oj $5  great value especially on the strip and at the cosmo   Service: A : line moved fast.  Assembly line for the food appeared organized and overall staff keeping the place clean.  I was pleased especially for how busy they were.   I would definitely return and recommend others to not be scared off by the line.  It moves fast and it's worth it.

OApI0e70C40zldixAVdr8w.text: I loved egg slut. The actual egg slut is the best thing on the menu. Basically it's an egg on top of incredible mashed potatoes and you mix it all up in a little glass jar and they give you toasted French bread to eat it on. It is absurdly amazing! Their breakfast sandwiches were good too- I would recommend the scrambled egg spicy one because that was the best.

YovH_H-tbkJtOUbXVIMNTw.text: My advice is to get a breakfast sandwich here and come early to save yourself from the lines that form at opening.  Fresh eggs and delicious bread makes this a light and tasty treat.

ENThPwzztW-AG1rQ7kQ1tA.text: Once you've queued up for 45-1 hour and then another 15 mins after placing your order, if you're still hungry the food is yum! Being British I can say don't bother with the special buttermilk biscuit it is basically an overpriced scone with butter on the side to dip. Honestly, don't waste your money on the latter. Five stars dropped to 4, as the wait probably wasn't worth the end product. But if there's a shorter queue definitely go for it!

9TNQKJaoPRNuDNxcQTD8Ag.text: Ok. My husband was dying to find this place he read the sandwiches were amazing. When we arrived the line was about 50 people deep and I gave him the wifely death stare but we had walked so far - I wasn't turning around at this point.   I ordered the Fairfax and he ordered the Sausage egg and cheese. What makes the sandwiches are the fresh backed bread and fresh ingredients. So tasty!  So, don't hesitate because of the line or the name - well worth the wait.

a3_m3h-pn_HCJWes5dBNfQ.text: Amazing!! We were hesitant to wait in the line (maybe 20 min or less) but it was well worth it! If you like breakfast sandwiches this is the place to go!!!

RuXIgAXSu4BmwRzh-w9WLQ.text: This place is awesome! Food is amazing , our server was hand down oh my god the best service I've ever had in my life, I will be coming back to see Mikah! She made the bustle of the busy rush seem non important. It was so busy in there but she didn't ignore us, came by and checked on us every time she walked by, best service we've received in Vegas so far!! We love you mikah!

Clck1_-71iWvFVW6AnCAhw.text: I initially thought this would be a basic place that has been widely over hyped. I was very wrong. I got probably the most simple dish on the menu I though but it was definitely the best eggs I've had in my life. I got the classic slut which was a potato puree topped with a poached egg served with a baguette. So simple but it was perfectly prepared. The texture and flavors were so spot on and worked so well together. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X0NGccFuB5OvZUJU5v_1EQ.text: Great for breakfast.  I visited Eggslut twice in the last month and enjoyed my experience each time. The staff is friendly and attentive and the wait, even with a line, is not long.   The location inside of the Cosmo is well decorated and the furniture perfectly serves the location. This restaurant would more than likely be successful off the Strip as well because the the name recognition and good food. The prices were inflated because of the Strip crowd but that is to be expected.   Hidden gem of a menu item is the biscuit with honey butter. A great compliment to any order.

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f8cJnsfvltZDi4lRoLsSaA.text: The wait for Eggslut was long but worth the wait. The menu was shorter but offered a variety of breakfast like sandwiches.   We originally wanted the slut but they were out. We ended up ordering the bacon, cheese, and egg sandwich with an order of a biscuit on the side. The sandwich was very good but on the smaller side.   Located on the second floor of the cosmopolitan hotel. If you are not there when they open, expect a line. Seating is limited at the Eggslut but they're open spots to sit on the second floor of the cosmopolitan.   I will definitely be back. And I look forward to trying the gaucho sandwich. It has the chimichurri sauce that I love so much. Can't wait.

_NGbRupEO8FS3hxm3J1TVA.text: $10.50 for a "Slut?" The yoke's on you! Fool me once, shame on me for buying a jar of runny mashed potatoes with one rawish egg in it. I was directed to stir these ingredients into something like a spread, and to use it on the 3 small slices of baguette that made the dish edible.  I can only guess this is some import from France where it might be a hangover cure. As such, I admit it was easy on the stomach, and effective. As breakfast? Never.

2xGH9M4lc1vi8nTDUMUEJg.text: I ordered the fair fax breakfast sandwich with avocado and turkey sausage. They never gave me my avocado and the turkey sausage wasn't it for me but the scrambled eggs were delicious. They charge 5$ for orange juice that taste like lipstick and the cup is so small

ArTKZwmqfIudhaxhPF8Imw.text: This place is the best place to eat breakfast.  Good good customer service, Very fast paced. Everything is very organized.  and sandwiches, and the bun, the egg... just melts in your mouth!  It's a must if you are in Vegas!  love this place! I'll definitely be back!

mQEkvUB4x7-ixAaV-UtLdg.text: Heard a lot of good things about this place and people said it was a "must try" sorta spot so decided to check it out w the bf since it was conveniently located inside the hotel we were staying at. We got there around 10am and there was a long line. It moved kinda fast though. We got to the front maybe 35 mins later. We got the..  Sausage, egg & cheese sandwich - $8.50 Cheeseburger (added bacon) - $13.50 Gaucho sandwich - $15 Slut - $10.50  When we picked up our food, the lady asked if it was our first time. For the "slut," she told us to break the yolk and mix it around. This particular item was pretty good & unique (coddled egg, potato puree, chives & gray salt) but I felt like the other items were just average tasting. There was nothing special about the sandwiches & burger. Service and everything was fine but pretty pricey and a bit overrated in my opinion.
