A2ZNpm30IkvneM9h1mQGig.text: Huge fan of Eggslut for their product and business expansion. They've selected great locations to expand their business from grand central market in DTLA.   I always get The fairfax- it's delicious! They pair their sauces so well with eggs and condiments.   Downside of Eggslut: there's a line to place your order and also picking up your order.   I think the hype is real and the food is great-it's a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Lbz2iXkGWngy4WQOlDYJdQ.text: I've been a fan since they first opened their spot at Grand Central Market in DTLA. It helps that I love breakfast foods! Plenty filling and the quality has always been consistently amazing.   I've been here 3 times while visiting Las Vegas for a convention. Tuesday and Wednesday @ 11am theres was no wait but on Sunday there was a line wrapped down the hallway to the restrooms and a wait time of about 40 minutes.  After a late Las Vegas night, an egg, cheese & bacon sandwich and a coffee and I'm brought back to life. And as I've said the quality is always consistent. I've even seen the cook throw away an egg that was overcooked and not runny in the middle as it should be.  Best breakfast spot in Vegas, worth the trek from other hotels and worth the wait.

iCnlKY1r6-ETe5hjovPXcg.text: Be prepared for a long line! The plain biscuit and the Slut was the best. The sandwiches are okay and hit the spot. No plans for a second visit but it was worth a try.

6paKgtQv7ZH2FNNc_5ZPbg.text: I had never heard of this franchise before but my Cousin steered me in the right direction here!  Everything was cooked perfectly!  No grease, it was extremely fresh!  I would suggest sticking to the brioche bun instead of their biscuit.  The Chipotle ketchup wasn't as spicy which was perfect!  Definitely stop here!

6iYi0l-yZ2f4hcIOKhtWFA.text: BEST EGGS IN VEGAS HANDS DOWN! I dont even like eggs but needed a good protein-fueled breakfast after a long plane ride.

22wPajqm9geSBY2q-qyxBg.text: I loved The Slut! Who would've thought that an over medium egg and pureed potatoes (AKA mashed potatoes) would pair so well together?!  The 20 min line was well worth it. The (turkey) sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich was amazing too. The chipotle mayo was perfect along with the brioche bun. I would definitely recommend this place, but order 1-2 items as 1 probably won't be enough.

cltdx-BdR5q56VxjWtzEkg.text: There was a lot of hype behind this place. Pretty simple menu but presented in a very unique way. The Fairfax sandwich was great and the signature slut was so creative yet so simple. Really hit the spot and was very nostalgic of childhood days sipping soldiers into a soft boiled yolk. Prepare yourself for a decent wait so worth getting a coffee from Milk Bar around the corner before joining the line

Lfjknz_PMyiq1uWMClYj9Q.text: I'm normally not a fan of egg sandwiches, but I was in Las Vegas staying at the Cosmopolitan, and my girl friend and I decided to check it out. I had the egg salad sandwich and she had the Fairfax. We tried to get some biscuits, but they'd sold out, so we had to get there the next time super early, and let me tell you, those sandwiches and biscuits are LIFE. The egg salad is creamier than I'm used to, and they give you a lot of it, so have napkins on your lap. I went back twice for biscuits, which are as big as your palm. Will definitely be going there again.  Heads up - the line gets long pretty fast, so if you're an early bird, it's best to get there around 7-8am if you want a biscuit. They'll be sold out by 11am. Trust me. They close at 7pm and reopen at midnight, so if you're coming in from a night of partying and want a bite, this is perfect.

3a06EXe6SqVisoWzgICSKg.text: Bomb ass sandwich, simple and to the point. Got the Fairfax and it was everything you want an egg sandwich to be. Worth a trip if you're nearby or it's late at night with no line. Not sure it's worth going out of your way for or waiting on some crazy line. Just a solid egg sandwich with fresh ingredients

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax. Delish!

7ffBDyQdh08dqQM4q858Bg.text: Had a bite for breakfast one morning after getting up fairly early to beat the crazy lines.  In the 3 days we stayed at the Cosmo the line for this spot is 30 people deep after 8am.  Overall it was ok.  Had the bacon egg and cheese.  I can get a better version in Jersey in any corner deli.  It was all bread. The brioche can't handle the runny egg and bacon grease.  This thing disintegrated in my hands at first bite.  Not the best crafted sandwich.  I think the idea behind the spot along with the marketing is better than the end product.

-4FdKl0_9419tYC_KOpC2g.text: I would definitely suggest going to Eggslut if you are going to Vegas!  My husband I got their early around 8-8:30 and there were only a couple people in line.  As we sat there eating our food the line kept getting longer and longer so I would suggest getting there early if you don't feel like waiting.  They are pretty quick so the line moves fast.  I got the bacon, egg and cheese and my husband got the sausage egg and cheese.  The sandwiches were delicious!! We also both got the fresh squeeze orange juice which I wasn't a huge fan of but my husband really liked it.  Eggslut is a must try if you are going to Vegas and in need of breakfast!

RXOfVkhYQMdoz898VnyWow.text: I think this place is mainly all hype due to its name and it being all trendy. My fiance and I were referred to this place and didn't realize how long the lines were. Expecting it to be decent considering the "rave", all we got was just an average egg sandwich.   My fiance got the Fairfax and I got the Slut since those two were suppose to be their popular offerings.  Both were just OK at best and really overpriced. I'm not sure waiting in line for 30 mins would be worth it especially the cost. The drawback isn't mainly due to cost, but the cost for what you're getting. I can't value an egg sandwich that is just average to cost this much -- just as you probably won't spend $20 on a McMuffin if it were to cost that much.   If you haven't have to wait in a long line and it was cheaper, then I can recommend it if you're craving an egg breakfast sandwich, otherwise I wouldn't recommend.    If you absolutely have to try it, then by all means do so. Just understand that it's just a hip and trendy establishment.

GRyr918fRAQ-KUHYif1tLQ.text: It is genius to have this place open up at midnight every day. When the clubheads leave Marquee they come out and see delicious sandwiches and sluts being prepared.  The namesake "Slut" is a coddled egg on top of potato puree, with chives and sea salt. It's served in a glass jar because that's what foodies/hipsters love and makes their IG pic look delicious AF. Luckily, it's just as tasty as any filter would make it look. My only complaint would be that I wish I had more baguettes to eat it with. Make sure to use the spoon before eating to break the egg and mix it throughout with the potato puree.  I've also had both the sausage, egg, and cheddar sandwich along with the bacon and egg sandwich. These are both good deals for the price (~$8), and I suggest a full meal would be one slut and one sandwich (two sandwiches and a slut if two are dining).  There are long lines in the morning, as I've waitied up to 45 minutes, so ask yourself if it's worth the wait. Shorter lines at night if you're looking for some drunk food. Eggslut has definitely been added to my rotation.

h7TjA3OWCYDaz_oqXWtikA.text: Came for brunch at 11:00 today. The line was wrapped around to the side hallway where the bathrooms were! A couple behind me asked an employee walking out of the side door about how long it would take to get to the front.. He responded an hour (a few minutes later the couple left the line). To my surprise the line moved quickly and only took 30 minutes to get to the front. I got the "slut" and my husband got the cheeseburger. Both cooked to perfection and full of flavor. Well worth it! Don't let the line scare you away.

LUX5WB4da3dKENMiN5aLEg.text: All I can say is yumm. It may just be a simple egg sandwich, but it was a delicious simple egg sandwich. I had the bacon egg and cheese no ketchup. Again...Yumm...

d7QUujWl8PUb_qaxoVpjZg.text: Long line but worth it. Tried the Eggslut. Not a fan of the mashed potato while others raved about it, but the egg is cooked perfectly.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3ou7OYi04I9z18yKN4UAYQ.text: Since we came in the morning around prime breakfast time on a Sunday, we had to wait in the long line for about 20 minutes before we could order but it was pretty worth it! I ordered the slut which was not a sandwich but like nothing I had ever seen before. I loved the idea of dipping bread into a cup of mashed potato and gooey eggy goodness. The olive oil on the bread was a yummy touch. I wish it came with a few more slices of bread since it wasn't too filling but it was still extremely delicious!

rnAQJ6HH1iSxxrtpQT56kw.text: Came here to try the slut specifically and we were not disappointed. It was really, really good. Also had the fairfax sandwich which was great. There can be a bit of a line here if you're coming for breakfast but it's worth the wait. Highly recommended.

1t6BiCwekCPnoxkYcvi_cg.text: This place is very fun and energetic. The food is delicious and the orange juice is fresh and tastes awesome! However, seating is a problem and the line can get very long. The staff definitely makes an effort and tries to move the line as quick as they can!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qa6yiRxVh--OVDPiQrwNiA.text: Based on the name alone this place belongs in Vegas. I'm from the East Coast and have never heard of Eggslut. I'm glad we tried it.  First the GOOD: We found the quality and taste of our meals to be very, very good. I had the Slut (I had to write that once) which is basically an egg over easy on top of potato puree in a small glass jar with slices of a bagugette. It was hot and smelled wonderful. The flavors together were so good. My friends each had the egg and cheese sandwich with turkey sausage. They loved the flavor and how hardy it was. There is some seating or you can mosey on over to the Chandelier Bar and have a couch seat (they didn't seem to mind).   Now for the NOT SO GOOD: We went at 9am on a Thursday morning. The line was 45+ minutes which we expected. After about 10 minutes I walked to the front of the line just to see what was going on. The assembly line of cooks and food prep people was being run well, like a military line. The problem seemed to be the ONE person taking the orders. There were 2 stations to take orders but only one employee. He was very nice but slow and if someone ordered a drink, he would have to stop what he was doing and make their drink! Operationally, they need to have someone else (a kitchen person) making the drinks so he doesn't have to stop taking orders. I would also suggest they have an employee walk down the line taking some orders on paper to make the transactions quicker when they get to the register.  Also - I wasn't going to clean my glass jar and take it back to New York but I felt badly just throwing it out. They need a recycle bin for these jars next to the garbage cans.  Overall - I can't wait to dine here again when I'm back in Vegas. Maybe I'll get lucky and Eggslut will open in New York City. No joke necessary!

iQ4JTYKdszEgOV1WuvL7MA.text: Love egg slut! Lines are always super long so be prepared. Great hangover food cure. Love egg slut! Lines are always super long so be prepared. Great hangover food cure.

6V0ybuNqKvYcUsLIGwExnA.text: It's all hype! Just another " hipster" place that people flock too. I was so unimpressed. The line was curving around the building and I thought I was in for a treat. WRONG! Other than the brioche bun and the "special" ketchup in my sandwich it was it was so average. The bun was just way to thick for what I was eating, the bacon was fatty (had to remove a bunch from my sandwich) and the egg was nothing special just an over medium egg.   The side of butter milk biscuit was so disappointing  in the texture.  We ended up paying $35 dollars for 2 sandwiches a biscuit to split and two iced coffees.   Pass!!   Bye Felicia!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YAezl61XF3nar10Lv397qA.text: One of the best breakfast sandwiches ever. It's hard to explain other than...amazing. I love their whole menu and it's the perfect Vegas hang over food.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t miss this warm gooey chocolate chip cookie!
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bacon, egg and cheese sandwich. Or heaven on bread.
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deliciousness in a tiny package.

1B4IUKBskOnjL5ecOBH8UA.text: Tried "the slut" ($10) - It was SOO GOOD!  Essentially it's a poached egg on top of a smooth potato puree in a glass jar topped with salt and chives, served with slices of baguette. Before you eat it you have to mix all the ingredients in the jar to ensure all the flavor blends in together. Love it. Love the flavor, love the texture, and acts as a perfect dip to go with the baguette. Even though it looks tiny, it does get quite filling.  I wish I could have tried their other items! All their menu items just sounded so convincingly good - especially their egg sandwiches.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The slut

Mn4rnlBxSmjZozOZxeIC3A.text: My friends and I stopped by here to grab a quick bite before our long drive back home. It's located on the second floor of the Cosmopolitan, and you can self-park in the hotel garage. The first hour is free and it's about $7 after that. Be prepared for a long line!! Everything is made to order, so it's understandable that it would take time, and luckily the line goes by pretty fast.   I ordered the sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich, and it was pretty good! My only complaint is that the sausage had a pretty strong herbal (sage? basil?) taste that didn't really pair super well with the rest of the flavors. I had a bite of my boyfriend's Fairfax with bacon and that was really good! Perfectly cooked soft scrambled eggs are a lot less messy than an over easy egg, and I thought the bacon was the better tasting protein option.

gmsS4OHgy1vDJGcgDV0o7g.text: I had "Eggslut" for the first time when I was in Las Vegas. My girlfriend has been wanting to take me for breakfast. The line was huge, but they quickly took orders and we were ordering within a couple minutes. Staff was very friendly. Sometimes food in a hotel can be "less appetizing" but Eggslut in the Cosmopolitan was great! Fresh eggs, bacon, and avocado on my breakfast sandwich definitely hit the spot!  My ONLY complaint is the smell of old egg on the counter tops. I'm personally not a fan of the smell of eggs if they have not been properly cleaned off a counter top. It's usually the over easy eggs when the yolk doesn't get properly cleaned up. For this reason, my girlfriend and I had to find a table away from Eggslut. Other than that, this place was great and definitely worth the hype!

rLDqD_iSUN9x7zsmQJtYkQ.text: Conveniently located in the Cosmopolitan hotel.  Few seating available inside the restaurant.  Outside seating available nearby.  Line formed during early breakfast/brunch but moved quickly.  Menu is limited and straightforward.  Bacon was soggy despite request for crispy. The egg salad was seasoned just right.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg salad sandwich with arugula no bread

MbNN0foAGuQmJSgkCWGxxA.text: This is probably the best sausage egg and cheese sandwich. Just wow for house-made turkey sausage, cage-free over medium egg, cheddar cheese and honey mustard aioli in a warm brioche bun. Line was quick. Greeted by name! On point.   Washed down with Fresh OJ and Cold Brew Coffee.

EPPXfxlTMZx7uaCh13MLCg.text: I was really excited when I found out there was an Egg Slut in cosmo! We went there before heading to a day party at Marquee. The wait was longer than I expected even though the line was not THAT long. They take a while to make your food. The food is above average but not as great as I was expecting based on all the good things I had heard about the place. I guess it's overhyped.   "The Slut"- It has a cage free poached egg on potato puree. It's served in a glass jar, topped with chives, and comes with slices of baguette bread.  It was good, but I wish the potato puree had more flavor to it. Could've used a tad more salt.   Sausage, Egg, Cheese sandwich - the sausage is a turkey sausage. Meh. Would be better if it was juicy pork. Haha. It includes an over medium egg on a warm brioche bun. Decent breakfast sandwich but nothing mind blowing.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The slut
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The slut with egg on potato purée
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon egg and cheese

qEqA5nUgkjjE6U6RekM6Og.text: Here's one that you'd probably never guess. What came first the Turkey or the Egg? Apparently at Eggslut, they came together...in one dry bun and with there favorite friends, American Cheese and Honey Mustard. All and all the sausage sandwich hit the spot, but them buns are dry. Even at 7am when you first open your wings, them buns should be perfectly fresh, that's the least I expect from a place with the line around the corner.  Otherwise, it's worth the wait. The sandwich is light and not to heavy. If you want to filler up, I suggest you get a sandwich and an additional item to make it complete. By the way, that OJ tasted glorious. Cool vibes of your average food slut.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

21gGIezEczLwvMgBbjvxcA.text: So delicious!! My advice, get here early because the line gets long. I waited with my fiance just this morning, for 35 minutes. Totally worth the wait, but I wish we would have arrived sooner.

ztwy2_0utRihKzxeCN6RXw.text: If you from east coast you need to try this. This is truly west coast eats. The sandwich i ordered was the fairfax and i added turkey sausage and avocado to my sandwich for an additional $5. The sandwiches are little in size however the taste is out of this world. The sandwich is made right in front of you and done in 5 mins.  No long lines. Great flavor. Organized clean location. Id order two to really be filled if you are very hungry. They dont have any fries or side orders at this place. Overall spent $14.61 for this.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r7tj24HLj8oNmHxkUDtYCw.text: Came here when they opened at 7am after my morning run and you'll be surprised by the line! I was hoping it would be a quick transaction but nope. Who wakes up this early as a traveler?!   I ordered the Fairfax sandwich and the egg salad sandwich. The egg salad was pre-made, like tuna fish in a can, and scooped onto a toasted bun with arugula on top. I usually never eat egg salad because of the amount of mayo but this egg salad wasn't over bearing. Not something I would recommend for a list try. As for the Fairfax sandwich, it's hard to go wrong with the taste of eggs. The flavor wasn't anything spectacular and the bun were just toasted buns.   What's with all the hype about this joint? There are better breakfast joints around.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfox and egg salad
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pBzU1lCPRo42hhxVlnufDA.text: Delicious egg sandwich place in Las Vegas! We visited around 10:30 on a Friday and it only took 20ish minutes to get to the front of the line and then an additional 10 minutes to receive our food. I ordered the Fairfax sandwich with turkey sausage which was delicious! The flavors worked together really well, especially the caramelized onions and sriracha mayo, and the sandwich was plenty big for me to feel full but not stuffed. The downside is that the sandwich was very messy, making it difficult to eat. What made it even harder was that there isn't enough seating for everyone, so my friends and I sat on a couch and had to eat the sandwiches in our laps. While Eggslut may be trying to market as more of a grab and go place, I don't think egg sandwiches would taste as good cold. Therefore, I recommend they add some more seating in order to get that 5 star review! Another con is that they don't serve cups of water so I had to buy a Smartwater for $4.50. With a $11.50 sandwich and a $4.50 Smartwater, the price of a quick breakfast really adds up!  Food - 4.5 stars Price - 3.5 stars Service - 3.5 stars Atmosphere - 3 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fairfax with turkey sausage!

ZVUkEU9LymVo6BUyYFij7w.text: I came to eggslut in a Wednesday morning thinking there wouldn't be much of a line. After all, it was a mid week day in the winter. Wrong! There was about a 20 minute wait, which wasn't too bad because the line moves quickly.  We tried the sausage egg and cheese and the fairfax! Both were good. We wanted to try the slut, but they ran out of bread for it. Given the wait and the volume of food they have to make, I was really impressed by how quickly the food came out!  Overall, eggslut is worth trying at least once. But if you're tired and hungover and want food ASAP - go somewhere else. I think a McDonalds breakfast sandwich would have tasted just as good in the moment. Eggslut's wait is not worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage, egg, and cheese

gwZylMauhskHlPcyrtWgSQ.text: Had a midnight snack at eggslut in the Cosmo, and I ordered the potato puree and poached egg in a glass jar and it was the perfectly sized snack for me.   The potato puree went so well with the egg, really surprising at how good those two went together. It was topped with chives and some sea salt. My only complaint is that there was a bit too much salt, and I had already mixed it all in. I wish there was an option to add shredded bacon to it, that is the only way it could've been improved upon.   It also came with three or four small slices of toasted and buttered baguette. So good!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;The slut&#34;

Oek3zItjOmSh09YO6_VD2g.text: Long line.  Eggs are good but kinda expensive. Good experience but don't think it's worth the hype.

tdU-LTys6D0fb6iuILm_bA.text: Overpriced McD Bacon, Egg, Cheese sandwich. Coffee was terrible for $5.50. Been there Done that but wouldn't recommend waiting in line for it.

WHOR9jH08VlHunkaWuyxOg.text: Came here after a night out per the suggestion of a friend. It was 11 am on a Friday and I was wondering how this line was even this long. It was well worth the wait though.   I ordered the gaucho sandwich and a slut. Gaucho was on point with the tender steak and the freshness of the arugula, tied together by the yolk of the egg - mmmmmmmmm!   Now for the slut , I was curious about the name. I'm sure there is a history on it, but I'm not sure why they would name it that. Regardless, it was surprisingly pretty good! Such a simple idea, mashed potatoes and an egg coddled.  Mix it together and you get this smooth flavorful spread for toast.   I would say a definite must visit place when in vegas. Starts your morning off right!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sluts cooking

1MwYLBRfyVo5rsDw50xgaA.text: GET YOUR COFFEE SOMEPLACE ELSE BEFORE YOU GET IN LINE!!  Ok, you know you're going to pay for being held hostage on the strip, but actually the food was worth it!  I had a Fairfax with bacon. The flavor combination was fantastic   HOWEVER, since there is no coffee in your room, you have to come out of your room for that "first" cup of coffee!  Then, after waiting over 30 minutes in line, you only have one size option for coffee. Ok, I understand that it helps move the line along ( I'd hate to see their line get any slower!), but for $5, I was very disappointed to get a very small cup of coffee. That alone, cost them two stars.   So, get your coffee someplace else before you get in line.

yd-f5HvXeSS5O3Yl6s4IQg.text: This is located 2nd floor of the Cosmopolitan.  Absolutely nothing special.  The name Egg Slut catches everyone's eyes, but in reality an egg sandwich is an egg sandwich - $10 - $15 for an egg sandwich is pretty expensive.  Slut - is their specialty item - $10 for a shot of steamed egg and mashed potatoes - for a shot that doesn't come with liquor - now I call that expensive!  Seating are also limited.  It's really hard to eat a runny egg sandwich standing.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage, egg and cheese
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the one with Tri tip in there

szqoJsMQ3kgD76Fzy3BAyA.text: Overhyped and overpriced - a real letdown. The biscuits are extremely salty and heavy, and the description is honestly misleading. Ordered 5 of these only to realize a party of 6 can't even get through 2 of them. Ugh. And no maple syrup... just that the butter has maple syrup whipped into it? Maybe to offset the extreme saltiness? The Fairfax was decent...the cheddar is not great combo- would have been amazing with American cheese tbh. The cheeseburger is actually quite good, the relish pickles made this probably the best thing in the menu! The biggest letdown?? The slut. Seriously, what a waste of money. Def not worth the wait, energy and money.

qLy4nxPnTl5P35FnmnYQVQ.text: I got their burger with avocado and we got an egg slut to split. So the egg was spot on - nice runny yolk and the bun was fluffy and soft and flavorful. The burger patty was extremely dry and underwhelming. The egg slut was pretty tasty. I think my first bite had all of the salt and seasoning on it. So delicious though! 5/5 for their famous dish and 1/5 for their turd burger.

kV1dzUv1nJnODi6rPBKt5A.text: I AM A SLUT...Well an Egg Slut or at least a slut for Egg Slut !!! Las Vegas is known for a lot of things and yes people come for the gambling, shows and food. And it is sooooo worth it to come to Egg Slut... Every time I come I try a different menu item and have yet to be disappointed. Its just sooo good and after a night of party fun Egg Slut gets you back on your feet. XOXOXO to all us Egg Sluts male and FEMALE !

Mo9EQN1_TTlWim-NuFEu2w.text: My partner and I were excited to try out the menu yesterday because of the name of the restaurant, alone. The menu sealed the deal, and was at a fair price for the strip. We had prompt, accurate service. The food was good. We had the bacon and egg sandwich, which I enjoyed, although the chipotle ketchup was a little on the heavy-handed side, and was only in one side of the sandwich. The Slut was phenomenal. The potatoes were delicious, and I loved how the yolk brought it all together with the crunch of the crostini. The dining counter was definitely in need of a good wipe-down, which definitely took away from the experience.

EPdUfKsPp0wdFo2gYMGjeQ.text: I'm sorry, but fast food breakfast is not worth a 45 to 60 minute wait in line  Stood in line for about 25 minutes and never got within sight of the cashier before walking away.  I thought no I moved six spots during this time   Go somewhere else

dYlo1POjWLc-sEHZf_Tzsw.text: Such a great breakfast sandwich! Also the eggslut in a shot glass spread over toasted bread was amazing!

EFfYPWoiPQOkFj0MczCLuw.text: One of the newer places I've eaten in Vegas and it didn't not disappoint the line was a bit long (probably because it was EDC week) but well worth the wait from the music playing over the speakers to the helpful and friendly staff! Will recommend to everyone who comes

sp_il1iqSrgW-DSZCtwM6g.text: This was a delicious breakfast sandwich. There was a line, but it moved very fast.  Easy to find in the Cosmopolitan, which isnt True of all restaurants inside casinos in LV.  I had the bacon sandwich and loved it.  My sister enjoyed the sausage one. She did not care for the meat used. I think it was flavored with sage, which was over powering, but otherwise, yummy.  Did not try the slut itself, but it looked odd and I dont know if i could eat it.  But, next time I am in Vegas, I will definitely be back here.

gabvxFvP-fdU6iIl3UVI8w.text: When I saw a restaurant called 'Eggslut' I knew I needed to go there. Needless to say, the next morning my friend and I found ourselves in a long line waiting for our eggslut treats! I had debated getting their (possibly signature) dish that features an egg inside a glass jar with potato puree BUT talked myself out of it at the last minute and got their breakfast sandwich with bacon, an over medium egg, and some caramelized onions. Lucky for us, my friend and I got a free egg sandwich coupon while we stood in line, so we each only paid about 5$ ( can't complain about that). The sandwiches, however, were a little disappointing. They make all of their eggs ongoing in anticipation of people ordering them and then they assemble the sandwiches as they are ordered. This would be fine, except the sandwiches are never heated through again, leaving the premade eggs/bacon/ etc to be cold with the cheese not even being melted on the sandwich. What a bummer. I think the flavor of the food was good, but it needed to be thrown under their salamander for a minute to get the gooey melty cheese goodness that is essential to a great egg sandwich (IMO). Also...they had no salt and pepper out....so weird for an egg place. I would still consider a return visit, maybe they'll work these kinks out as the restaurant gets older.

2ONTKAdV4aQVuMMFLy2bRw.text: Looked for a place for breakfast and it was about a 10 minute walk from our hotel.  I had the "Slut" and my wife had the bacon sandwich.  The Slut was incredible, and with the baguettes it came with, was actually a nice little breakfast.  The bacon sandwich was also great.  The wait was about 10 minutes at about 8 am and the line moved pretty fast.  Everyone there seemed to really enjoy their breakfast...we'll be back tomorrow.

egHVt3O7afE88SY5WgIoXQ.text: Really great food but also long lines and on the pricier side. Being from manhattan, the price is comparable to what I'm used to, but I can see how other people could be deterred by it. $8 breakfast sandwiches and $5 regular coffee. However, the sandwiches are delicious and fresh and while you wait in line you get to listen to old school hip hop and rap and watch them make your food (which is impressive). Also really good fresh squeezed oj. Fun experience overall and great breakfast if you have a few extra minutes and are willing to pay for it.

Esf9Ipa2eHD3Oab_aqLUEw.text: To compare this food to a theme park food is realistic. It's over priced and salty. $4 for a 20oz bottle of smart water and $4.50 for a 10oz cup of simple coffee? Not even Starbucks charges that much. They make the food prior to you ordering it and just assemble it up request so you get a rather cold breakfast sandwich. Totally not worth it. I had the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich. Seriously, I could have paid a fraction of the price for something similar at a donut shop. The only difference is the ciabatta bun and sauce they put on it, which wasn't anything special. I think the worst part of my experience was my husbands sandwich. He ordered the Fairfax sandwich. First thing he noticed was a big fat hair sticking out of his sandwich. I went to the cashier and requested a fresh sandwich. She literally turned around another premade sandwich. So, no I don't recommend this place to anyone.

RWgQTUbzRy9YYmVUnIOKJQ.text: It's good but it's basically you can get this at any bodega/deli in New York City. But maybe that's exactly the appeal? The line is tremendous WTF! Hence the 3 stars.

rXJ8etENva_eg0jDXV1iGA.text: Worth waiting around for The Slut! I'm not sure what the line is like on the weekend. We waited about 30 mins from the time we got in line (which was going down the hallway) until we got our food. The line might be long, but once you place your order, it doesn't take long. Recommend it even with long lines!

-YoE_iYCMyTaMaB3Lp1QGw.text: Line was ridiculous! And a bit pricey for small sandwiches but what else is new in Vegas. Not enough seating for the rush hour. But the food was good for what it was. And the orange juice was super sweet!

By4vH6QvwH8De-NCLKPmLw.text: On a Saturday morning you have to wait in a 15-20 minute line just to order. I'm not complaining about that because typically that means the food is good. I ordered the Fairfax with bacon and avocado. It was good, I especially enjoyed the spice from the chipotle aioli sauce. My only gripe would be paying $15 for the breakfast sandwich.

hw1wyEMBPiGEXxYUdr9-8g.text: Stumbled upon this place during a very early (and rare) morning walk through the Cosmo.  I got the Gaucho-  ive never had a breakfast quite like this.  It was excellent.  My friend simply got the bacon egg and cheese.  Very very good.  If you are a breakfast buff and love this meal you have to try this place at some point.  I will definitely be back

S9i9wZ5u6vSe7cHEuk99KA.text: If I could evaluate service and flavor separate service would have received 5 stars and food only 3.  Everyone at egg slut was extremely helpful and very accommodating for all my needs going as far to make a special dish for me! But the flavor was lacking for me but that is personal preference.

UxDl815CQewPU4qmsJ8lxg.text: Great concept, but waited way too long for an overpriced pretty delicious egg sandwich. We hit it at one of its busiest times, Sunday morning around 10am. The line was long but was moving fast so we decided to wait. The line itself only took 10 mins to put our order in, but took an hour to actually get our sandwiches. We ordered the Farifax one with bacon and one with sausage (the bacon was better). Their whole process seemed very well done at first, but since we were standing their for an hour we really got to see a lot. I would say they need a better way to actually get the sandwiches out to the customers. Meaning your order should have a number not a name. People with the same name were getting confused. All together a number would be nice to give you an idea of how much longer till you get your own order. I would say to some it all up, if it's not too busy than try it it really is a tasty sandwich, but If it's slammed better to keep walking.

1fZYY2sbj7b3ajG0LBs1-w.text: Simple food required greater skillset to prepare.  This is by far one of the masters in preparing egg sandwiches and i highly recommend anyone to give it a try when you're around Vegas strip.

6aGveV_eRlAEuYB3aV6LZQ.text: Past couple years the lines at this place have swayed us away due to lack of time. This year we made sure to leave plenty of time and there was a wait but worth the wait! The food was yummy and we will definitely be making time in the future for some brunch!

UESv3qrC-91Bnph5TeXzYQ.text: ~~~The SLUT and Me, It Was Meant To Be~~~  Finally, a second chance for the SLUT. I had an opportunity several years ago to experience the SLUT in DTLA. I took one look at the SLUT and said, 'No Thank You.' I needed something that was going to  satisfy my hunger pang after battling LA's infamous 110 fwy traffic into DTLA. I settled for the Fairfax with Arugula Salad. It was pretty tasty but not awesome enough to deal with the traffic and updated parking fees. Oh yeah, and another reason I flaked out on the SLUT was because I knew if I didn't like it, I'd be extremely upset, also considering the price tags on these babies.   Whoever said it wasn't busy in the morning was Completely Off. It was Hella Busy with a Long ASS line on a Monday morning. Was it worth waiting 20 mins for their famous SLUT? Is it worth waiting that long in the single rider line for Radiator Springs Racer at Disneyland? Hellz Yeeeah!!   If you happen to be in the Cosmopolitan Hotel, definitely try the SLUT @ EGGSLUT. Be sure to ask for extra baguette, they'll hook you up at no additional charge. As for their pricing on regular coffee, $4.50?? We decided to take our SLUTS down the escalator into Starbucks. Remember to show your players card for Identity Points (5pts per dollar spent).  Mmmm, I really enjoyed the SLUT. If you're a fan of grits, arroz caldo, and runny egg, you might be in for a nice surprise. The coddled egg sitting on top of hot pureed potato, sprinkled with chives with 5 slices of toasted baguettes drizzled with olive oil. Imo, Amazing! I'd definitely stop by this location whenever I'm back in Vegas. Maybe even make my way into DTLA.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SLUT x 2, ask for extra baguette. This was surprisingly very good and one order was enough to curve my appetite. :)

zTNr7NTojuaIUUAWUxsIkw.text: Customer service here is crap. Came in about 20 mins ago and the girl at the register (on the right) decided to have a good minute long conversation with the other girl at the register about a coworker of theirs. So then when I of course am not engaging in her bs conversation she tries to make it up with "I hope your morning gets better. Umm my morning would have been just fine if you would do your job instead of trying to chit chat with your coworkers. But their "excellent" customer service doesn't end there. No then as we're waiting for our food we notice that 4-5 people who ordered after us received their food and we were still waiting on ours. My husband noticed a bag just sitting on the counter that had been there for a few minutes. He goes to ask the girl calling out orders and she says yeah yours is right here. He told her he saw her set it done and not call out any name. She just says "oh sorry." First and last time coming here. McDonald's down the road has better service than this place. We ordered a Fairfax + turkey sausage and the sausage egg & cheese. The food is greasy, falls apart and isn't even worth $5. It's really just hyped up.

BnrQbmOUxkR-urDBuR9ghw.text: 100000% worth the wait! Line is always long but wait it out. Sandwiches are good but kinda high in sodium. Coffee has free refills (not coldbrew) my husband ordered two sandwiches just bc he didn't want to wait in line again if he wanted more. He ate 1.5. Get the chocolate cookie for later! Has salt on top & is to die for. Worth $4.50.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3DBWH6YwO171ID8RFSstoA.text: The food is delicious.  You'll more than likely stand in a really long line.  Don't fret, it goes by pretty quick. Get the eggslut--it's the best thing on the menu.  Sandwiches are good, too.  Although a bit in the pricey side, I'd go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bbeGlp3DGpzQ6HlPYe0mZw.text: Delicious! Being a dairy whore, I knew I was gonna enjoy a placed called egg slut and it didn't disappoint. Can't wait to try something different next time.

H69Bn4CSbP14MFVLNFS-8w.text: Yummy egg sandwich! I had Fairfax sandwich and I can confess that my sandwich was the most amazing egg sandwich that I ever had. Biroche bun toasted perfectly and scrambled egg was so soft and creamy! I literally chewed each bite twice as much as I normally chew so I could enjoy the extreme delicious taste and aroma of spices.   I wish the portion of sandwich was a little bit bigger so I could have enjoyed more of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax Sandwich!

J1VYo_Lfl95B4uZnu7gILw.text: The turkey sausage, cheese, and egg was tasty.  Brioche bun was super soft!  Breakfast sandwich was good, but I'm from New Orleans and my taste buds need a kick...some spice of hot sauce or a sausage with a kick.  The fresh orange juice was delicious, but not worth $5.  Line moved quickly took about 15 minutes and they played some old school rap so the time flew by.  Definitely check them out!

6iNMIQlA0_ouQu8V-TSMQQ.text: Coming to Vegas I had heard a lot of things regarding Eggslut.  We came out of the Marque day club around 4 in the afternoon on a Saturday. The line was about 20 minutes long for starters, the cashier rushing myself and the group we went with to order.   Overlooking the menu, their item choice was sub par for what is supposed to be a culinary ride in Las Vegas. The seating was crowded, the tables taking most of the small space as we sat after ordering. A slut for me, as the restaurants specialty item, and a 15 minute wait.   The food was disappointing when coming out, three stale biscuits with a small preservative jar and filled with an overheated poached egg on a small cardboard tray. The meal was messy, not filling or appetizing, and honestly underwhelming for the huge hype that followed.   For $10 I would not suggest it and would avoid Eggslut entirely for service.

z24tr9DogpRV5v2k8reqrg.text: Still debating if the 25 min wait in line was worth it...  because I got it to go and I think you really need to enjoy it right there!!!  But pretty darn good!

j442NZt1R81DYuzLRxydxQ.text: So good!!!! Been here a bunch of times and had about everything on the menu- bacon egg and cheese perfect to aid the hangover! The Slut is perfect for a small breakfast

0rDXzjFoH5VfhhjZodCobQ.text: Pretty good breakfast sandwich but nothing mind-blowing here. My wife's sandwich was slathered in so much ketchup that I had to go back and exchange it which the staff made a very easy process.

jEYjbcOCrnZQO1CXAiLfcw.text: Eat here.  Breakfast is my favorite meal.  This place got it right.  I ordered the Slut which is an egg or two over a mashed potato puree (and chives) cooked in a jar.  Divine.  Because I'm addicted to carbs, I also tried one of their biscuits.  I grew up in the south, so I wasn't expecting anyone in Las Vegas/Los Angeles East to be able to make a decent biscuit--glad I was wrong.  The Slut, the biscuit and an iced coffee were about $20ish.  I will definitely eat here again.  This place isn't fancy, by any stretch of the imagination, but the food is very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut.  Love sluts.

SIIn5-1sxYkG1FNUCSx0Gg.text: It's a taste of NY in Las Vegas. Only thing that sucks about this place is the line of people it generates from the Cosmopolitan. All the food is delicious, but lines suck and this is no exception. If you've never had it, stand in line, otherwise NY is where it's at for the real deal.

U8ub4hwUFCEoGLBnOt9Cyg.text: If you love eggs and you're looking for breakfast/brunch on the strip, then Egglsut is the place for you.   Weekend morning lines can be long (down the hallway and practically funneling into the nearby bathrooms). To avoid the weekend line & still enjoy your morning Eggslut...set an alarm and head here early (came by on a Sunday morning and ordered without a wait).  The Slut :A coddled egg on top of smooth potato puree, cooked in a glass jar topped with gray salt and chives, served with slices of baguette. It's a glorified mashed potato dish.  Playful presentation in a glass jar, but I probably wouldn't order again.  The Fairfax: scrambled eggs, carmelized onions, cheddar, chives and sriracha mayo sandwiched in a soft brioche bun. I believe this is the best egg sandwich Egglsut offers. Can be a bit messy to eat, but they serve it with a fork for a reason. . Bacon, Egg, and Cheese Sandwich: Hardwood smoked bacon, cage-free over medium egg, cheddar cheese and chipotle ketchup in a warm brioche bun. Just a basic breakfast sandwich, nothing extraordinary about it.   Salted chocolate chip cookie: Dark chocolate chip cookie, topped with gray salt. Nice combination of crunchy, sweet, and salty. Not worth $4.50, but a decent choice if you need a sweet bite after your meal.  *Buy your drinks elsewhere. Their cups are TINY.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The slut, Fairfax sandwich, bacon egg and cheese sandwich, and a cookie

1im2H7ew0MEOClO1YkxjHQ.text: Came here for breakfast during our trip to LV. Heard good things about this place.  It's in the cosmopolitan hotel.  Easy to find after you park.   Quite crowded.  And glad we came here.  Surely the food did not disappoint.  Ordered a "slut" and sausage egg cheese sandwich   The slut was tasty.  Lightly salted bread dipped into a jar of egg and mashed potato.  Quite innovative and tasty. The sausage egg cheese is like an upscale egg mcmuffin, pretty good too.  You will definitely be fulfilled.     I recommend getting here early. The line can be long. But overall a decent breakfast experience. Will return if we are in town again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;slut&#34;
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E8UXsW1WhoEdm9vNWmTg8g.text: What a amazing experience and great attention to detail. Love the music hip hop all day keeps you upbeat and happy while waiting in line. They have a person responsible for each part of the experience from the person ringing you up and taking order to the egg guy, the meat guy, the bun guy and then you get to eat it. Hot and wishing your order double because it so good. Egg slut thank you for what you do and how you do it.

gDH14p7PokTy-Jjyqn0AXg.text: The Slut is the bomb! I love how it's got the egg and potato puree... sooo delicious! Even though they give you 3 or 4 pieces of bread, you can always ask them for more bread without charging you, which I really appreciate.  I also tried the Gaucho sandwich, and it was really good, too!! I love the strips of steak, egg and arugula! Best breakfast sandwich ever!  Highly recommend coming here and you gotta try the Slut and Gaucho sandwich!

rgePHaL3rRFH33wSofLQ_Q.text: This place, man.   The name is a bit of a turnoff, but the food has overcome my aversion. It's just so dang good.   Doesn't matter what you order--the Bacon Egg and Cheese, the Fairfax, the Slut--it's going to be eggy, and it's going to be good.   The bread they use for the sandwiches is fantastic, but if you're not a bread eater you can sub salad.   Don't miss the biscuits and the chocolate chip sea salt cookie--both mouth-wateringly delicious. Bonus points if you can get the cookie while it's warm!  It seems like the line is always long, but it moves pretty quickly, and these eggs are totally worth the wait.

AqJ7oMCL7j8fCJmatSKvEA.text: Nothing special. Had the Sausage sandwich. Was over cooked. Seems like it's the "thing du jour". Way overpriced for what you get combined with the insane long wait.

zZD8tGoPocBDCf2d1reLbw.text: No Slut Shaming  I finally received the opportunity to try the highly anticipated, obsessively over hyped, also known for its extremely long  lines (especially after a night of twerking in 5 inch heels at Marquee) since opening in Las Vegas 2016, alleged best egg sandwich in LA "E G G S L U T..."  I'm not a fan of poached eggs so I passed on the specialty slut but the Fairfax was right up my Pescatarian alley! For nearly $9 bucks this vegetarian egg sandwich consist of cage-free soft scrambled eggs and chives, cheddar cheese, caramelized onions and sriracha mayo in a warm brioche bun. As delicious as this sandwich is... honestly its just an egg sandwich! Would I order it a gain absolutely! Would I wait in line 1 1/2 hours... absolutely not!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax ($8.50) cage-free soft scrambled eggs and chives, cheddar cheese, caramelized onions and sriracha mayo in a warm brioche bun
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Where the magic happens!
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Recycle!

b75c-q2-JqeuXegkUJSJhQ.text: Egg-cellent breakfast sandwiches!! There was a long but quick moving line when I arrived with a few friends. I ordered a bacon, egg and cheese sandwich on a gluten free bun. The kitchen is in sight so I saw them making my sandwich and was very pleased with what I saw. The same person handled my sandwich from start to finish, he had gloves on and everything was on a tray and kept separate from all the other bread items. It was a fairly large sandwich for breakfast and it was awesome!! Everyone else in my party had the gluten-y versions and they were all very happy too. I will definitely be back any time that I'm in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, egg &amp; cheese gluten free sandwich

mE9dTUCqLf7dfn_aLsX9pw.text: Easy to order.   Not an overly large menu.   Food comes out fast and fresh.   I don't like paying $5:25 for a 12 oz cup of coffee. But the food was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon egg sandwich
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant name

cdwEN_GhiXteS2M1ucMSyg.text: Eh, wasn't that impressed despite having heard a lot about Eggslut. I was definitely a little disappointed. I ordered the "Slut," the coddled egg and potato puree in a jar. The portion size was small and the egg itself was small. The coddled egg was prepared well, but most of the jar was the potato puree, so I felt like I was paying $10-$11 for pretentious mashed potatoes that didn't taste like anything special. Probably would have been better off with one of their breakfast sandwiches.   Taste | 3.5 Atmosphere | 3.5 Presentation | 3.5 Service | 3 OVERALL | 3-3.5

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y6wdjk70fMj3fvwmSZQqAQ.text: Inside the Cosmopolitan Hotel Egg Slut is a fast casual chef driven concept that prides itself on having fresh, quality egg centered food. The food is made to order and just what you need if you're looking for a quick delicious breakfast sandwich or if you love eggs. I arrived a few minutes before they open at 7am to beat the breakfast rush. I read reviews about the slut and really wanted to try it. I can definitely say that you can taste and see the quality and freshness of the food. Although the slut wasn't exactly my jam it was good. The bacon, egg and cheese sandwich was excellent.

SiSBmCZXVE_Vpq6X81Vr_A.text: Amazing. That's all I have to say. The line may be long, but it moves rather quickly. Grab a drink and chill while your order is being cooked. The biscuits are amazing too. The mimosas they have come in a can and different flavors. They also have cold brew coffee which was pretty good. Got the sausage egg sandwich and the bacon egg sandwich. Both delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y6Cdc0lsiVMKu9eNaUAqOg.text: Boyfriend made it a point to come here when we were in LV. It's tucked inside the Cosmo hotel and casino and the line was no joke! they ran out of the slut which was a disappointment but we ended up getting the house made butter biscuit. and a sausage egg and cheese and a bacon egg and cheese. the butter for the biscuit was SO hard. i broke a knife trying to spread it on! aside from that it was very good! same goes for the sandwiches.   the only downside was that they ran out of the slut. they also got really packed and finding seats were kinda difficult. but we lucked out as a couple had just finished when we got our food.

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iyVopcOBMYe8PqtH5JX-jw.text: The line is long in the mornings and can take atleast 30 minutes. There are limited seatings but you can find once since most people take it to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two sandwiches with the slut

507GmOgCe9vWdcLkJtu7FQ.text: The lines are ridiculously long during breakfast hour and I have to admit, it's seriously not worth the wait.   I've been to multiple slut locations and I don't understand what the hype is about. Under-satisfying breakfast at outrageous prices. I tried their sausage & egg with a side of slut and I seriously prefer McD's breakfast over here any day. Dry sausage & egg sandwiched between two flavorless bread. The slut seriously tastes like barf.   Save your time and money and dine elsewhere for breakfast, unless you're just here for a pic on the gram.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The slut
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gaucho sandwich - wagyu tri-tip sandwich, cage-free medium egg, chimichurri sauce, red onions, dressed arugula &amp; warm bun!
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ep5lr0FBKH72hgWpZlNSTg.text: I first heard about Eggslut in LA but never got around to trying it. This location is inside the Cosmopolitan Hotel on the second floor. It is pretty easy to find - just look for the long line! It does move relatively quick - My friend and I  went around 10am on a Friday and we waited about 20min or so. I imagine at peak times, the wait could easily be 30-40min.   I ordered the sausage egg & cheese sandwich while my friend got the Gaucho on a salad (instead of the brioche bun).  We also got the SLUT to share because it seemed like it was must try item. Honestly, it looked really small and not worth it but somehow it works! I kind of wish there were a few more baguette slices to dip into it though. You are suppose to return the jar for recycling / reuse but I suppose you could keep it as a little souvenir?   There is limited seating but the turnaround is pretty quick - it feels more like a more a grab & go or a quick bite type of place.   Overall, it's a pricey breakfast sandwich place but I feel like the quality justifies it. We also really did enjoy the SLUT and would go back just to have that again.   Side note: There was no free (tap) water...then again not many things are in Vegas! We couldn't justify spending $4.50 on bottled water so we just got beer at Walgreens afterwards haha. Only in Vegas...get that party started :D

JjScR9ozlsvOVoXOmY252g.text: First stop In the morning after flying into Vegas. Since my friend and I were on Chicago time we were up bright eyed and bushy tailed. My friend suggested we check it eggslut so we made our way over from Planet Hollywood to the cosmo. We didn't know anything about this place so we were surprised to see it was a little stand where you order and pick up food. We were also pleasantly surprised there was no line (like I said we were up early because of the time difference) we ordered the slut and the gaucho to split along with some juice and cold brew.   Everything was super good! We should have gotten one more item to share because the portions were pretty small. I definitely suggest checking this place out it's quick, delicious, small portions so you can either fill up or have a light breakfast and very laid back. Perfect morning pick me up to get the day going in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SjeHCFZi7MLArc2ARtQr7g.text: I had the hard boiled egg salad with arugula salad on the side and avocado. Great healthy option for those not looking to eat bread. There was a line at 8am on a Saturday morning but it went quick, maybe 10 minutes and an order for 4 people was out in 2 minutes. Overall not a bad wait time.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg sandwich salad with no bun just salad on the side plus avocado
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_gapnXXrCiCndPbIZOEPRg.text: Been wanting to try Eggslut for awhile now. I ordered the The Fairfax, which is scrambled eggs, chives, caramelized onion, and cheese with sauce all on a brioche bun. WOW was it good. The soft scrambled eggs were so creamy and really lived up to their name. My husband got The Gaucho and he really enjoyed it as well. I was most blown away by the biscuit and the HONEY BUTTER, what??? I've never even heard of honey butter, but it was so amazing. I need to know where to buy it. Orange was good but not worth the 5 dollars! Overall when we entered the line it was all the way to the back by the bathrooms. We waited a total of about 35 minutes (to order and get our food). Not bad at all. Line moves fast so definitely give this place a try if you're by The Cosmopolitan.

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange juice

HCFMXwl8cy0SfBQM4yp1vA.text: If you love eggs, this place is a must-try. It's inside the Cosmo hotel and compared to the one in LA, this one is a breeze to get your food!   I tried the egg salad and it was yummmm. Simpler than the other options, but if you like egg salad then you'll like the combo of it with their toasted buns.   We also tried The Slut- yes, the actual name of it lol. And it was a perfectly poached egg on top of a scoop of mashed potatoes. They give you a few slices of toasted bread to dip it with.   Their hours are a little odd, so be sure to check their info box!

yQASqDzBXcc7wad8X3c3JQ.text: One of the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had! I came here almost everyday during our vacation to Vegas. They have a couple different spots, thankfully one was right in our hotel. It's a little expensive but the best money I have ever spent on sausage egg and cheese sandwich. If u have a chance to stop in, its definitely worth a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MPYUJnf0R336sPE3sJUDMw.text: Not worth the hype! Between the 4 of us we had the Fairfax (add turkey sausage), the slut, and the gaucho. The ratio of bread to egg was too much and everything tasted kind of plain. The bread also didn't taste fresh. Luckily we went on a Monday afternoon and there was no line up. Would not come back again with so many other great options on the strip.

UfrxCoYHLOXe2V_kWi1h0g.text: Was a first time customer and it was so delicious that we went back again for seconds the next day. The line looked long, but it goes by pretty fast. We got the slut with bacon ( I didn't know the slut was made with mashed potatoes mixed with the half done egg), the slut was very good but a bit pricey for the small portion ( we ended up $65 for just 4 items). We also got the Wagyu steak burger, that was very very yummy. Definitely recommend trying both of these items

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EHT65BAnN5KsMyl7b9ih9g.text: Heard about this place from friends and thought I'd give it a try. The line is pretty long so be prepared to wait at least like 40 mins. I ordered the Bacon, Egg, and cheese and it's pretty basic. It didn't really have any wow factor to it. The bacon is crispy and the egg was supposed to have runny yolk but it was overcooked. I think I won't be going back for a next time. This place was definitely overhyped and pricey breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Hbq4mHvSxxdXZe1nzlgqOw.text: The line was basically to the end of the hall because the food is delicious and pretty cheap for what it is. The brioche is really fresh and fluffy and the egg was perfectly runny. The side salad was really light and refreshing too. Definitely worth the wait. Also has any name for anything ever been better than EGGSLUT??

Fwm35WBimaPJPzNwjlPgeg.text: Definitely need to try this when you come to Vegas!  Best place ever!  Even though the lines are never ending long, But it is worth it in the end!  Got the Gaucho burger and the egg slut, and a chocolate   Love the burger and special taste to the egg slut!  I will come back

L5gRTQE4QSOGIa5ldSBezw.text: When you're looking for a late night drunk food/ on the go breakfast this is the spot!  After a long night of gambling and drinking we walked over to the cosmo to try out this highly talked about spot and i have absolutely no regrets! The food was "hit the spot" comforting food.   The line looked long as it wrapped into the hall around the corner, but the service is so quick that it only took us around 10 minutes to get to the front and an additional 5 to get the food.   I would def recommend this spot to anyone looking for a quick bite on the go or even drunk food for them late nights!

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MPWD4nA3_qwv1lnSP1i0Qg.text: We waited about ten minutes to place our order on a Tuesday morning at 8:30 AM. Took about five minutes to get our food. Delicious as always, my reason for docking a star is that it seems like the sandwiches were made haphazardly. My Fairfax had all the avocado in one chunk on one side and all the caramelized onion was on another side,  whereas I would've preferred they be evenly distributed across the sandwich.   OJ and cookie are both great!   Restro is located on the second floor near a number of other eateries and right next to the Chandelier Bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In my belly

BfDfghfVSErmkffBubuhfg.text: fast service, no wait around 6pm.  Ordered the egg slut and bacon cheese egg sandwich. The poached egg  over puree was good, but the 3 slices of bread were over salted. The bacon cheese egg sandwich was good but nothing particularly memorable. Overall, the poached egg puree was the best thing to order but everything was pretty overpriced for what it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. egg slut, bacon cheese sandwich

UlY-sSW7hUG3fbyvu8i5Qw.text: Came early in the morning and there was already a line wrapped around the shop.  Got the "slut". Yes. That's the name of the dish. . Poached egg over purees potato served with thin and crispy sliced baguette with salt pellets. Delicious although salty at times. I liked the potato since I like starch for carbs.  Hubby got the gaucho sandwich: beef with egg and arugula. I had a bite. But the hubby liked it enough to to come back the next day for another one so it was very delicious. Definitely worth it.

ZIZq_R95vSAmR0Tu5K8Rew.text: I headed over to the Cosmopolitan Hotel to try out Eggslut and when I arrived, there was a wrap around line for those waiting to place an order. I said to myself, if there's a long line, this place must be promising! Fortunately, the line cut down fairly quickly. I waited roughly 15 minutes before placing my order.  I ordered the Sausage egg and cheese sandwich which is a turkey sausage patty served in a warm brioche bun. The best part of the breakfast sandwich was the honey mustard aioli sauce, I can't stress how flavorful and creamy this sauce was. It definitely brought the sandwich together. Each sandwich is paired with a house specialty sauce so I'd be interested in trying out the other sandwiches as well.  The workers were very friendly and you can't beat the classy atmosphere of the Cosmopolitan Hotel. I look forward to returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage, Egg &amp; Cheese

5c1SEQjsBRDeQOeRMxcT9w.text: Yum yum and more yumsss for this breakfast cheeseburger! The bun is soo soft with the perfect amount of sweet/salty balance and hugs the burger and egg so well!! I may never eat another breakfast sandwich without a brioche bun! The yolk was runny creating a beautiful sauce for the burger. The burger itself was the perfect size for a breakfast sandwich with a wonderful sear that really made everything shine. The burger held together well with the toppings which is always a plus! Will definitely be back for this burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vqKr6PcExPnj_S4BExSajA.text: Heard the hype, worth the wait?  To begin with, I was in Las Vegas for the the Labor Day weekend. Yes, I was getting roasted like a sweet potato throughout my stay.... how do people get used to the 100+ degree weather?! Anyways, my girlfriend and I decided to escape the heat and grab food. I knew Eggslut was located in the Cosmopolitan, and my friends spoke about how great it was-- so there we went!  Thankfully, the line wasn't too long. I believe I only waited about 10 minutes to order my food. Anyways, I went with the Bacon, Egg, & Cheese sandwich and the Slut. To begin with, I started with the Slut since that's what the place is named after. I did enjoy the coddled egg and the yolk mixing with the creamy potatoes on the bottom- all of which was well seasoned. The mixture of the two created a nice mouthfeel and the textural contrast with the baguette slices worked very well here. I do wish a couple more pieces of bread were given here as I was left with a fair amount of potatoes/egg without baguette slices remaining.  For the sandwich, I was extremely underwhelmed. I should have gone with a different sandwich as this one is so simple and can be easily done at home. In my opinion, the best part was the brioche bun as its buttery and fluffy texture provided the ideal vessel for its contents. I do think the inclusion of the chipotle ketchup doesn't work here as it overpowers the other components of the sandwich.  Overall, I think the food provided was just run of the mill and would not be worth the 30+ minute wait that this location can have. The Slut was good and a different experience, but it didn't blow me away. The Bacon, Egg, and Cheese sandwich was not good. Regardless, I would still like to try other menu items down the line to see if I had just picked the wrong items. Until next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slut (left) and Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese (right)

n_-xNmGtfzdmFznWURCsng.text: #36 for 2019  The line is long. To avoid the line get here really early.  We waited about 30 min.  after getting there 10ish in the morning.   If you do if you do end up waiting in line and it goes around the corner there is a menu in the hallway that you can peruse to decide what to order. Consisting  mainly sandwiches  there are six different kinds that range from $8 to $15.  There is a a couple special, Eggslut and  House-made Buttermilk Biscuit.    The slut is a steamed egg on top of mashed potatoes with chives.   The specials is what we ordered.  You have to know you are LV.  Things are going to be pricey if you're coming into hotels on the main strip.  With that said.  I did not find the Eggslut special neither the Biscuits.  I love breakfast.  They're the best meal of the day for me.  These just didn't have what I liked.  They were prepared well.  Cooked well.  Tasted good too.   Maybe if I tried something else other than their specials.  I'll try again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n_dS-lJfedoqOJTNJOX-mQ.text: Eggslut is excellent! I am not even a large egg breakfast sandwich fan and I loved it. I had been wanting to try Eggslut for a while during visits in Los Angeles, and never had the opportunity. After seeing one was near my hotel in Vegas, I immediately knew I needed to try.   I went around 8:30 am on a Wednesday, and probably waited in line for 10 minutes (while the line may look long it moves pretty quickly). Almost as soon as you walk over to the pick up counter, your order is ready.   The sandwich itself is excellent - the bun is very fresh while the sausage itself is very flavorful. The sauce truly ties it all together. Overall, definitely try when you're in Vegas as the lines will be much longer in LA.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage, Egg &amp; Cheese

v4KZDpwtCeoPTbzzzZ57fw.text: I've been hearing lots of hype about Eggslut so when I found out there was one in the Cosmopolitan, I decided to go there to give it a try. Located on the second floor, this place was pretty easy to find. When we got there at 8 am, there was already a line formed. They have a menu in the hallway where you wait, so you'll be able to decide what you want before you get to the register.   We ordered the Fairfax Sandwich and the Sausage, Egg & Cheese. It was a short wait before the food was ready. There's a handful of counter seating at Eggslut but there were also some tables and comfy seating nearby. It's an Alice in Wonderland theme called "Down the Rabbit Hole".   I have to admit, the sandwiches were a lot smaller than I expected. The Fairfax Sandwich was pretty tasty. The soft scrambled eggs was cooked just the right amount where it was still a little wet, but not overcooked. The Sausage, Egg & Cheese had the over medium egg which got gooey as soon as you bit into it. For both, the brioche bun was very fluffy, but it was a bit dry for my taste.   Overall, the food wasn't too bad. The wait to order the food was a bit long. If it's a long line, I don't think it's worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fairfax and the Sausage, Egg &amp; Cheese
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fairfax Sandwich
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggslut

tc70q1f0S4mlBBSZG1iyvQ.text: I heard about this place recently and had to bookmark for a future trip.. I'm so glad I did .. we landed in LV and headed straight for this place .. we walked right past the stairs leading upstairs but we eventually found a sign with directions   We found the place .. open concept kitchen where you can see and smell what they're cooking .. we stood in line 15-20min and then another 10min wait  for our sandwiches   I had the sausage, egg, mustard aioli (minus the cheese) the bread was soft and smelled amazing.. the egg was perfectly cooked and runny .. the sausage was well seasoned  The bf had the bacon, egg & cheese and the giant cookie ..the cookie has gray salt on top .. delicious   I will see you on my next trip to Vegas!

5caHBkDud6Tl5h1as-85UQ.text: Finally, got to try this Infamous L.A. Chain. Definitely meet the hype. The best fluffy breakfast sandwich that I ever had. This was not your average breakfast sandwich. The process was smooth from ordering to getting the items. It was definitely worth every penny. You should try for yourself.
