I wouldn't wait longer than 30 minutes if you are a good judge of line movement. I was in line for probably about 15 minutes and waited only about 5 minutes to receive my food. Not bad at all.   I ordered the egg salad sandwich and my husband ordered the sausage/egg/cheese sandwich. I would recommend either of these sandwiches. I usually love a good bacon/egg/cheese but I wasn't in the mood for that heavy of a breakfast sandwich. The egg salad sandwich definitely hit the spot. Perfect quantity and great seasoning. I also ordered a salted chocolate chip cookie. Not really worth the price but my husband is a fanatic for cookies so it was my treat.   Seating can be an issue because it is not an enclosed restaurant and only few seats available. While I stood in line to order my husband stalked to seat scene for us. But the food comes out quick so previous diners usually move quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted chocolate chip cookie
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg salad
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg salad

UoVoKPxGl9WQk1WnsjC2CA.text: This place is my boyfriend's and my favorite place for breakfast in Vegas. We usually come here at least twice while we are vacationing here. I love the Fairfax sandwich with its fluffy scrambled eggs, chives, cheddar cheese, caramelized onions and sriracha mayo. Equally delicious is the golden brioche bun that the sandwich comes on. My boyfriend's favorite is the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich. We usually like to come early, but even this past time (at 7:45 am), there was already a line wrapped around the place. As seating is limited, I would suggest getting here when they first open at 7am, or otherwise have a late breakfast here to avoid the longer wait. But even if you do have to wait in line, these delicious breakfast sandwiches are worth the wait!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My heavenly Fairfax sandwich.

aNypDflrprnhxs6Tj6kHFQ.text: This is one of the places I was excited to try while in Vegas because I've been following the brand for quite some time now and I love supporting Filipino-owned businesses (I'm not sure if this location is corporate-owned or franchised, but the person that started it all is Filipino!)   After a long night on the Strip, I convinced my group to take an Uber here as we were all hungry and I thought some egg sandwiches could maybe alleviate their pending hangovers.   We ordered a bacon, egg & cheese sandwich, 2 Sluts and 2 Gaucho sandwiches. The sandwiches were unfortunately bland and too dry. The buns were a bit stale. At $15 a pop, I expected the Gaucho to be exquisite (they use tri-tip wagyu), but the meat was chewy and severely lacked seasoning. I think some kind of sauce or aioli would've elevated the sandwiches more, but alas they just fell short of my expectations. I didn't get to try the Slut because my mates inhaled it, but that at least indicated its deliciousness.   I may try it again the next time I'm in Vegas or maybe visit one of the other locations in CA.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Jto5xpFlnFgm-iVGrZ2-TQ.text: I swear this phase better pass soon because I hate standing in line for these amazing mouthwatering egg creations and sandwiches. Of course the perks of staying at the cosmo you get Eggslut in the same hotel as you. What's a better way to wake up with a hang over than to surprise your body with these perfectly cooked overpriced egg sandwiches?!   Although it may sound like I'm dissing Eggslut, I'm not, I'm simply a hater that I have no will power to say "no" to that ridiculous line. Time and time again Eggslut never fails with their amazing sandwiches. I ordered "The slut" and the "Fairfax", and I swear the Fairfax tasted better at the Las Vegas location over the La location. The bread was toasty and soft, the special sauce creation was spicy and savory, the eggs were fluffy and delightful and cheese oosy and melted, over all the best way to start your day.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fs6A-B2axeFad4O1lvYRIA.text: Cool little spot on the second floor of the cosmopolitan that attracts quite the hungover flock of Vegas partiers. I ordered the slut.. cause ya know, "while in Vegas", but it was delicious. In simple terms, it's a poached egg sitting in some mashed potatoes. Different than any classic breakfast but it was very tasty! Slightly on the small side but it did the job.  The line on a Monday at 10 am was wrapped around the corner so I wouldn't be surprised with HUGE wait times on weekends. The line did move pretty quick and my food was done within minutes of ordering.

nBtaJnkSEsjCUeDnDRWJEA.text: Always has a long line but definitely worth the wait.  I always go for a freshly squeezed OJ the signature "Slut" and a Bloody Mary from the can.  The signature is quite possibly one of my favorite things since I am a huge fan of pommels puree (aka mashed taters) and when you add a lightly poached egg on top = heaven.  The nice salt crystals add just the right amount of flavor with a bit of crunch to liven up the velvety goodness.  The line may be long but it's the perfect cure for a late night in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Slut - signature dish and yummy to boot!
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Have to have a sense of humor!

AIIqs7L3m2oDrsjoH8qGnQ.text: Solid breakfast sandwiches, not worth waiting in line more than 20 minutes. Eggslut seems to have a cultish following- but don't get too distracted by the hype. I tried the slut- a coddled egg over potato puree with chives and their unappealing sounding "grey salt" served with crispy bread. It was delicious and simple- served artfully in a small glass jar with the bread beside it. It tastes like a perfectly runny yolk mixed with rich mashed potatoes- which really functions to complement the texture of the yolk. Delicious! We also tried the sausage breakfast sandwich. The brioche buns are perfectly golden and buttery, and the egg is of the ideal runny consistency- but it is just a breakfast sandwich.   Great spot for breakfast, but don't get tricked into waiting for an hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The EggSlut

c_3mDsMgcwhAzMLBB0guNQ.text: So this place is everything you need after a night of debauchery in Las Vegas ! BACON EGG & CHEESE. This location is not the first but it is the first in Las Vegas and it's inside of the Cosmo upstairs passing the Chandeliers. They're is a small menu by the register and you order there! They have different options but they're mostly Breakfast options. I recommend this for a quick bite to refuel. I ordered the Fairfax and Bacon Egg and Cheese sandwhich! They have OJ but for 5 dollars I'll buy a drink from a convenient casino store before I buy a 16 oz OJ from Eggslut. This place was packed and it was late in the afternoon. The food took a while To come out but when it did it was gone in 5 minutes. The sandwiches were really great  I would love to grab one again and sit in the egg shaped chairs they have in front of the store!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The whisk chandelier

tMrnqZZMGebCazIsKuSDSw.text: Got here early on Sunday to beat the line. Our order came out but they never called my name. I had to go and ask if it was mine since it just sat there. Someone else's order came out and they were shouting until they came...ok. -1.   Ordered the fairfax and bacon egg n cheese w/orange juice. Eggs were good, bacon was thick n crispy, and the bun was warm n soft but plain.   Plenty of seating across the restaurant. I wouldn't wait more than 30 mins to eat here though.

_eb2F3RxQsTsOKUNNG7D2A.text: While visiting Vegas for another CES show, my wife texted me and urged me to try Eggslut (is she working for you guys, Eggslut?). So before heading to Sands, I *finally* stopped by (located the second floor of the Cosmo). As expected, there was a relatively long line but we got through the line in less than 15 minutes (though I always find it amusing that people who wait haven't decided by the time they're up at the register - they have two wall mounted menus before you make it to the register).   I made up my mind in the first 2 minutes - the Fairfax with turkey bacon and avocado, and accompanied by fresh OJ. The sandwich is solid, including scrambled eggs, chives, cheddar, and a slightly spicy sriracha mayo. Overall, the sandwich hit the spot and fueled my subsequent 25K steps at Sands and LVCC!   Look forward to stopping by again!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-QiDi2F6CLDgroDOVg7CHA.text: I love their breakfast sandwiches! I pretty much come here every time I'm in Vegas and the line in the morning never gets any shorter.  Once you've paid there's still a good 15-20 min wait before the staff calls your name. I've had their gaucho, turkey sausage + egg, their slut and their cookie... all delicious! Next time I may have to get their biscuits, but I never have enough stomach space after the sandwich (ok I lied, I always walk over to milk bar and get the cereal milk soft serve right after...)! Price is relatively reasonable considering they're on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7Y4EI-hSgYoAq8U9lDR9AQ.text: The food is good, I really like the slut. But the wait is long and it is not a very relaxing place to sit down and enjoy my breakfast!. But worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax sandwich with turkey sausage
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jme8gqj068B-donrIwRVxQ.text: We liked Eggslut so much we got it twice for breakfast on our 3 day Vegas vacation. We were staying at the Cosmo and the line was so long every time we walked by, that we ended up getting up early both days so we could be in line around 7am. It's a pretty inexpensive breakfast for eating on the strip and we were able to try both the sausage breakfast sandwich and the Fairfax + sausage. We also got a biscuit one day to share and we both really enjoyed that with the maple syrup.  My only complaint is that they use turkey sausage, great health wise but it always seemed to be a little dry. Also my husband wasn't a huge fan of the coffee, he said the roast was darker than he liked. We both loved the orange juice, and while $5 for 12 ounces of orange juice seems a little on the high side, I only wished they sold it in a larger cup!!

AkL4IOaywx9396-FmcaqfA.text: Long wait, but so worth it! I ordered the Slut - it was delicious, and so fun to get breakfast in a jar! I will definitely order again. Hubby ordered the Bacon, Egg and Cheese breakfast sandwich.  You can't go wrong with anything here.

ICSau1G1Of5AASxogS6zwA.text: Another overhyped place you can ignore. Too many cons (i.e. long line, very limited seating area, overpriced menu, and dirty eating area.) Food doesn't compensate the cons at all. I've had some of the more popular items on the  menu and nothing stood out. I've tried the cheeseburger, fairfax, slut, biscuit, salted chip, and (not)fresh orange juice, seriously tasted like cheap bottled OJ.

tBJkq1w_f99nK3pUUCVB0Q.text: Yes.  Yes.  Yes, please.    We stood in line for 15 minutes and got one egg slut, two breakfast sammiches, and a coffee and a juice.  2 bites into the egg slut, Boyfriend gets up, and immediately stands in line for another eggslut.    The sammiches were yummy, but could've used a bit more salt.  I like salty breakfasts.  But that eggslut.  Oh man, I have dreams about it.  The most perfectly coddled egg, silky potatoes, yummy salt.  Heck yes.  Do yourself a favor and order your two right off the bat.   Only complaint for the place--little seating and uncomfortable seats to boot.

Brh0WYb9hBKe6czreci3XA.text: All hype.   It had the potential to be good but missed the mark. Ordered 2 sandwiches (added bacon to both, avo to one) and a biscuit and cost $36. A little pricey for simple sandwiches.  The line to pay was about a 10 min wait, to get the food it was another 30+.   I ordered the fairfax which has sriracha mayo & grilled onions. Didn't taste either. So much bread & not enough spread inside. I love grilled onions which is why I chose that over the slut but, meh, there weren't enough to make a difference. My husband is easily pleased by simple food. He didn't complain about his burger but didn't rave about it either. The bacon was good. The biscuit was good. Nothing special.   I think if this was less expensive and less of a hassle to order (they don't take call ahead orders either!) then maybe I would come again? I think a side of mayo & some salt packets could've maybe helped but i didn't want to go ask the poor girl at the counter. She was working so hard to get orders out while 30 people intensely stared at her.   Cute concept. Great menu. Just missed the mark.

Pk8cNABo_KGayD51AdfvDg.text: Went at 12am so luckily we didn't wait in any lines. We had the slut and Fairfax. Both equally delicious but slut is definitely the item to get if you're not sure. I'm glad we got to try it but not sure if it's something I'd be craving to go back to. But it's pretty fun eating an egg sandwich watching the drunk people go by.

PXFgmzuV1pc4FIOUsSjh1g.text: Been dying to try this place since it started in LA but the lines are insane. Since they just opened Venice and soon to be Glendale, things should be better. But luckily I stayed at the Cosmo and woomp, there it is. I did not have the most recommended sandwich but the egg salad sandwich since those are my favorite. And so glad I did. So so so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My food Instagram account @ayspyfood is why I took the picture like this. :)

1tflQNPXCQ6lEhVP5tNl6Q.text: Three stars might even be generous...totally underwhelming. I do not understand the hype over this place. The buttermilk biscuit was bland. I will say, the maple butter that came with it was very tasty. I wouldn't have eaten as much of the biscuit as I had without it. I also got the Fairfax as did my husband as well as the Slut. The Slut was the best item but even that was underwhelming and pretty bland, not to mention small. The siracha mayo on the Fairfax was tasty but I could've made this sandwich at home. In my opinion, this place is not worth the hype or the price.

uDk8P1YYETy_csaX4h-m4Q.text: Amazing! Loved everything we ordered "the slut" & the egg salad sandwich. Everything was delicious and I appreciated that this is one of the few restaurants that aren't "sit down" or "fast food" but somewhere in between..... which is hard to find on the strip!  The wait to order was about 15 minutes but once u order the food comes quickly!

lcQm9ZI_5NcoI7xnK_OcZg.text: Delicious! LA is home to Eggslut and Eggslut is HUGE there so I am glad I was able to finally try it while I was in Vegas. I'm a huge fan of breakfast sandwiches and Eggslut basically has your slightly more glamorized version of your typical breakfast sandwiches. The line is usually long and there are only a few seats in the actual restaurant so we had to find some seats around the Cosmopolitan. There are only a few items on the menu but they do what they do well. I ordered the gaucho which is a $15 breakfast sandwich with wagyu beef. I opted to add turkey sausage for an extra $3. If I'm paying #18 for a sandwich it better be the best sandwich in the world. The egg was cooked perfectly. The wagyu beef was so juicy and tender. The arugula and chimichurri added a different texture and a nice contrast of taste. The flavors blended together really well. I love that they use a brioche bun for all their sandwiches - it definitely ups their game. If you don't want the bun, you can opt for a salad...but let's be real - who wants to eat salad for breakfast?

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The slut
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Gaucho with turkey sausage added

xJr-aFDFdURO2G00j8ndMQ.text: Having never been able to weather the line for Eggslut in Grand Central Market every time we're in LA, we were happy to know there was an Eggslut in Vegas and made it a point to stop by. The line went pretty quickly, and it's inside the Cosmo which is one of the higher end hotels on the strip. We ordered the Fairfax with bacon and the sandwich was good, even if it didn't quite live up to our expectations. The eggs are cooked really well and the bun is pillowy soft. Adding bacon was a good idea as it added a bit of needed saltiness with the creaminess of the eggs. I couldn't really taste the cheese, and we forgot all about the sriracha mayo and caramelized onions until the last few bites, where it all seemed to have gotten concentrated. All the prices are slightly higher than the LA locations, which isn't a dealbreaker but makes it difficult to justify a Fairfax with bacon and avocado for around $15.

sAS4iM2RARCYsr4OjjnrkA.text: So Good!   I don't even like egg sandwiches but my husband really wanted to eat here and let me say I ate almost every bite of mine.

MG0twbpGDdhTGmlfZhGVUw.text: My boyfriend and I were in Vegas for the weekend and decided to get a late breakfast, we saw that there was an Eggslut at the Cosmopolitan. We got there around 2pm and the line was pretty long, but it did move fast. I ordered the Fairfax and my boyfriend ordered the Gaucho, and we both got an orange juice. We ended up paying about $40 for those items and although it is a bit pricey, we both loved our food. The eggs were so soft it almost felt like they melted in my mouth. My boyfriend also really loved the Gaucho. He said the steak was delicious and cooked to a perfect medium rare. It was a good experience, and if you're looking for really good breakfast food I definitely recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fairfax with bacon and freshly squeezed orange juice

mYsX5c6B8z_-NvC6RAOFMQ.text: True breakfast delight. Line will be long but worth the wait and moves somewhat at a decent speed. We waited about 10-15 minutes to order I would say. Interesting concept and the slut was delectable. I should've gotten two though - they are a little on the smaller side if you have a big appetite.  Also, it's hard to find a seat so we had to find seats elsewhere in the lobby to sit and eat. I want to learn how to make sluts at home now.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They&#39;re so good I should&#39;ve gotten two!
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu shot

w4qJcSJWRQF0prhi7lzNVg.text: Got the Fairfax with added sausage and it was bomb  There was a little bit of a wait but well worth it.

O8wzATsqNqvZ76xJ_7NSPQ.text: Ordered the cheeseburger. They forgot my caramelized onions which made me sad, seeing as how I love me some caramelized onions, but it wasn't a deal breaker. The burger itself was well cooked and all the ingredients complimented each other well. The lightly salted patty/bun worked well with the bread and butter pickles.  We came here around 9:00 AM on a Wednesday and there still was a line which speaks of the quality of food here.  Order up.

3OirK2vQEMHu5166yfOi2Q.text: Wow! Great concept. Menu was simple and offered high quality ingredients. Food was fantastic! I got the Fairifax with added turkey sausage and avocado. Easily the best breakfast sandwich I have ever had. Loved that they offered turkey sauage instead of pig (I don't eat mammals, so it was amazing to be able to eat sausage out.) Kitchen was fast, efficient and very clean. Staff was helpful and friendly even under the stress of serving a high volume of guests. I will be dreaming of my Eggslut sandwich and can't wait to return for more on my next trip to Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fairifax with added turkey sausage and avocado. One of the best sandwiches I have ever had

_iH8FHcXqPIuQ5H_7JmiDA.text: Not bad per se, but underwhelming after hearing all the hype. Line up was about 20 mins around lunch time on a weekday. My bacon egg cheese sandwich tasted predominantly of ketchup. The egg yolk was pretty much entirely absorbed into the wrapper instead of into my mouth.

abFzrQgM2nhkXj3SDA9sPg.text: Located in the Cosmopolitan Hotel. We had the delicious bacon,egg,cheese sandwich on the brioche bun.  So worth the long line. The cage free egg leaked onto the sandwich and the aioli sauce was the perfect combination of savory/sweet. Will definitely come back for more in the future Vegas visits.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon,egg,cheese sandwhich.
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4kQsAuMH1uEaz-bF1JUuOQ.text: I love eggs so the name itself caught my attention. Located next to the Marquee Club. I was suprised with the music, the old school hip hop playing on the speakers was jammin! Get a guacho burger and the slut, you won't be dissappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UtrS1kH3NIBSCJwph_uKkg.text: Great breakfast sandwich, I had the fairfax with bacon. Pretty pricey for our taste, nearly $30 for 2 sandwiches and 2 waters, but delicious all the same. Small, but I honestly probably couldn't eat a second one. Would highly recommend trying it at least once since there are so few that exist.

fayAZZkIa-r-drxwxwo0JA.text: Meh. Good but not worth the crazy long wait. I just had the sausage, egg and cheese. Maybe some of the other sandwiches are better but this one just average.

giImzq5gbBbPaOQ-rHzqew.text: For the type of place they are and the food they serve they are at the top.   I came I at what I would call an off hour, there was no line. There were only two other customers in the facility. Very pleasant.   I decided to try the egg slut, even though I was very apprehensive at first. At first sight I thought they were kidding me after I sat down. It was delicious I had only one disappointment they didn't have Tabasco sauce. I do like almost every thing spicy.   Thanks for reading.

G_zBmdQZz366WTph2NKaew.text: Plan ahead, get there early enough because there's been a line the two times we've gone in the AM. Also, we tried to go by there at around 3pm in the afternoon on a Friday and they were all sold out of the Eggslut. About the Eggslut itself, we enjoyed it because we love mashed potatoes and runny eggs. You mix it up in the jar with the chives, and spread it on the toasted baguette slices, and it's a good breakfast to start your day. We also tried the Egg and Bacon sandwich, if you LOVE bacon and don't mind the pile of saltiness, then go for it. For some, there can be such a thing as too much bacon. We also tried the egg and sausage sandwich on our second trip, and that was more to my tasting -- but to each their own. There is limited seating, but I think the timing is just right between folks waiting for their order, and those rotating out when done eating. There's also the couches nearby (I think a part of the Chandelier lounge/bar?).

auG87IVgKCRngAmDKG5Msw.text: This place was amazing!!! I would recommended to anyone that is coming to the las vegas strip. There is only two minor downfalls to this place. One would be the waiting time. I was waiting in line for about 25 minutes. Its not ridiculously bad but when your in vacation mode an all the time helps. Secondly, i think they should squeeze in a couple extra chairs as there is limited seating. But besides those two things this place is awesome!!! Definitely a must for a vegas newbie!

nKr4715zaEDKccjm4sqmEQ.text: Sooooo good!!! Go early--there was a line at 730am but it's so worth it! I had the mason jar egg over mashed taters. Delicious delicious delicious. Make a stop when in Vegas!

x8HzGTuvuER_9_MGA0tyKQ.text: Delicious. You should expect a line when you get here, but it moves quickly and is worth the wait. Try the orange juice and the biscuits!

RNsinj4e8vvQ77FLyZGpHg.text: Eggslut-A bun filled with bacon and an over easy egg! The bun was delicious, yet definitely way too expensive! $10+ each.

TAONhOlmo-xvbBW1kVaooQ.text: Best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. Ok. That is too short for my review but it's True.  Bread was perfect. Eggs and preparation was perfect. The only huge issue is how busy they are. That line gets LONG!  Fairfax and add Avocado. Yup. Or just go with the Slut and enjoy that little.jar of creamy goodness.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax w/ Avocado
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage Egg &amp; Cheese

HnwRQqE8usnMtSNEZ8419w.text: Omg this place had a really long lone but real talk the like was worth it. I had the slut egg: an over east egg laying ontop of a potato and cheese puree in a small mason jar along with 3 baguettes lightly buttered. I ordered a side of turkey sausage for 3.99  because I'm accustomed to have some type of meat for breakfast. The orange juice was freshly squeezed and everything was delicious.I would most definitely return here

qeSBX8hbGRIMx72bhVSOmA.text: The rave is TRUE!! The SLUT WAS AH-MAZING!! It's creamy texture paired with the baguette were perfect partners. Some say there could have been an extra slice of baguette, but for me.... I almost ate it all without the baguette. Damn it. It was so delicious with simple yet complex flavor profiles.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

21On4qLcGgoXOAqyKKjSZA.text: It's an ok place, seems disorganized and orders are skipped.  The SLUT is just that a slut, seems exciting but all it is a slut.

LEkM1l4AGEotvAZkBBWNkQ.text: Located inside Cosmo, next to Marquee. The line was very long, wrapping down the hallway to the bathroom. It took us about 40 minutes to order and another 15-20 to get our food. There isn't a huge seating area either but sandwiches can be easily eaten on the go.   GAUCHO sandwich ($14) - my absolute favorite! The waygu tri-tip was so flavorful and seared to perfection with chimichurri sauce. The arugula, red onions, cage-free over medium egg and warm brioche bun complemented the entire sandwich. It's a tad bit small for the price, but I would definitely order it again!   SAUSAGE, EGG & CHEESE sandwich ($8) - pass. Just an average sandwich.   SLUT ($10) - pass. Served in a cute little glass bottle was potato puree with an egg on top and a few slices of baguette on the side. This was definitely NOT worth it and was my least favorite item. I felt like I could just make mashed potatoes and add an egg on top. I was told to mix the potato puree and egg together well before consuming. It did not taste unique, but was rather plain.   I am however, a huge fan of the GAUCHO sandwich and will only order that next time I come back (if the line isn't so darn long).

wYQ0LVWBk8X0cXD3W2ZwsQ.text: I have been dying to try this place for months! And it didn't disappoint. The eggs are super fluffy and the onions and spicy sauce are the perfect additions. The pretzel bun is soft and buttery, making it the perfect bite. I think it needs some crunch though! Each sandwich is hand made and the eggs are all made individually. But it's not super fast and there is always a line! So make sure you have time! Also it is pricy. A eggs sandwich is about $9 each.

mZIX88y7rXC82wDJNvgdqw.text: The gaucho and biscuit were worth the money, but the egg salad was a mess and the line was a bit lengthy for what you're getting.  Also $5 cans of soda are downright obnoxious.

ZcoJN1URdlQtzaHIuaCWeQ.text: Such Yummy place! Must try the Fairfax as that thing was awesome! I purchased it with Avocado and it was AMAZING! The biscuits were also good and just a little on the saltier side so make sure to add honey or sweet butter.

tcK2-wcva6ldEiU0jD5h5w.text: I didn't run into the long lines that other reviewers wrote about, but I got to Eggslut around 8 in the morning.  Still, it took about 20 minutes to get my food.  The breakfast sandwich was good and the egg was cooked perfectly. The biscuit was also awesome, but the coffee was terrible.  There were a couple of big downsides here. The seating area was small and filthy, they should have somebody to clean up. I cannot imagine how bad it must be later in the day. Also, the food and drinks are really expensive: $8 for a small breakfast sandwich, $5 for a biscuit, and $5 for crummy coffee.    It was ok, I won't be back, and don't think I'll be visiting their Los Angeles location either.

GRBEB9PZLJI0LEZQHTt2-Q.text: If it wasn't for the inefficient set up and process , it would get a full 5 stars ... but the lines are always so long and they are obviously understaff to meet the demands and crowds ... patience is the key at this place

ZfBKZG6q7Bua_oIIAey-EQ.text: Sampled egg bacon and cheese Sammie on brioche bun - delish! $8  Line is off putting but moves along. Need more vigilance on wiping off counter - sticky from syrup.

O-P9_ytGm_i07T0AA4nRwg.text: I don't get the hype. The original is located back home in LA at the Grand Central Market and is known to have horrendous lines, which is why I've never bothered going. Since we were at the Cosmo (we'd just finish eating over at Secret Pizza), we decided to stop by.  I ordered the Bacon, Egg & Cheese for the 5 of us to share since we were so full. We all took 2+ bites, so it was a pretty large sandwich. It came out looking picture perfect for Instagram, so I was already skeptical of it's taste. Food that looks that good rarely tastes just as good. I was semi-correct. Although it was tasty, it was heavy and I'm not sure it was worth $8. You could get two Sausage McMuffins for less and feel just as satisfied.  Don't get me wrong -- it was good, but I don't think it's worth the wait at all. I mean, beezies at home are waiting an hour for a sandwich from here. Unless you're in the mood for breakfast, go to Secret Pizza.

ewVVSpa8mX8bzI_K425DGQ.text: This is one busy place.  You are going to wait.  The line does not move as fast as you would think.  I had an egg sandwich and It was good.  The tables were so dirty though.  It felt like a viral illness was coming because 500 other people had eaten at the same spot I was.  If cleaner and not a 30 minute wait it would have been 4 stars.  The boss had eaten the slut (insert joke here).  This is really served different.  She had not found this appealing.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg with sausage
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The slut

r0jha02Jy7pA0YQED3atQQ.text: EGG SLUT! You're my SLUT! Located in the Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas. Came here after a night of partying and definitely didn't disappoint! There was a bit of a wait around 7am on a Sunday morning. Opted for the cheeseburger this time around with that delicious, runny egg dripping all over the place! Took it upstairs to my room and enjoyed it on the balcony overlooking the view of the strip! Definitely will be back to try more options when I'm in the hood!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That cheeseburger in heaven overlooking the strip of Las Vegas!

fi0xw3597lAnoNlzdMvepQ.text: First time I tried Eggslut was at the Los Angeles location. Their sandwiches just melt in your mouth. Everything is cooked just right. I like how the brioche bread is soft and buttered. I got really excited when I yelped restaurants in Las Vegas and saw Eggslut at the Cosmo.  I took my husband and kids there on a Tuesday close to noontime. The line was not as long as people say it is. We waited for at least 20 mins. Line was slow because there was only 1 girl working the register.  I don't know what was going on. I don't know how the orders go to the cooks. She was writing stuff a paper bag. I don't know how hard it is to take an order there. Their menu is so limited. I don't know if she was new. She just seemed like she didn't know what she was doing.  We got to the register and the girl switched places with another worker which was male. My husband clearly ordered 2 Fairfax sandwiches both with bacon and other stuff.  When they called our order, one of the sandwiches didn't have bacon.  My husband went back and told them there wasn't any bacon in it. The man behind the counter said that we ordered a double order of bacon on one of the Fairfax. Anyway they were nice enough to just put bacon in it.  For sure they messed up the order because they blast the music so loud there you need to yell out your order to the worker. Another complaint is that there are not too many tables or seats. Just one long table with 7-8 seats on both sides. Just be ready to stand neat. We got lucky and I had my kids sit to save us seats.  Other than that, I love that place and it's worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax with bacon. Yummy!

jLaKMFqe2U8BG1jdAysJFg.text: Great breakfast spot tucked away from the strip. Line can get long but they move pretty quick to get you fed. Small but good menu. Will be back!

OrsCNjmVlt0DM6-q-WxGdQ.text: Pretty good. First time here 2 yr ago was awesome. Went down in quality but still good.

lJ2CqzvgNvWrz7tuLlr6Og.text: Went here expecting just a so-so egg sandwich but boy was I proven wrong. Got the Fairfax with added bacon and it was AMAZING. The bread, the sauce, the eggs, all of it was a wonderful combination. Highly recommend!!! Only downside is you have to wait in line which can get lengthy, but it moves decently. Definitely try this place out if you're in Vegas!

PE5fdALl2rCTRgxdNR9luQ.text: This place is well worth the wait in line. We only went based on the name and it ended up being the best breakfast we had in Vegas. Everything tasted so fresh, food was fantastic!

2EqCge22Olnqujd-iLSsbA.text: Good place for a quick breakfast sandwich. Inside the Cosmopolitan.  Clean and line goes quick.

lCPCJttxZQP9DtZkVXUFMg.text: Ordered the Fairfax, said it comes with caramelized onions and spicy mayo and chives and I could not taste any of those 3 flavors. It got over powered by the egg and cheese. :( but my boyfriend ordered the one with the gaucho which was 15 dollars and that was amazing!

1pgdPJx7PqyXcjcr0yHNww.text: DON'T BELIEVE THE HYPE!   Tiny portions!!! Expensive prices!   Visiting Vegas for the first time and relying on yelp brought me to this place.   I love a good breakfast/brunch place, being from the UK and visiting the US regularly, I always expect good food to be in large portions.. this place was not that!   We arrived at Egg slut around 11:30am, the line was huge, as expected..   I had already decided I was going to get 'the slut' as it was famous on the menu.. however during our wait in the line I noticed how small the portion size was as I looked at others eating.. I was shocked that this was nearly $15 and could be consumed by the average person in less than a minute... you get a little jar of eggs and a slice of bread on the side in a cardboard container... I was shocked and disappointed, and then decided to change my choice on the menu..   I ordered the sausage egg and cheese sandwich.. this was $12 I expected it to be a decent size.. however I was left disappointed when the food arrived.. it tasted good, but the size wasn't great.. I could have eaten at least 2 of these before being content..   Our total bill was $25 for two sandwiches.. stupidly expensive for a simple sandwich/batch/roll..  I seriously don't see this big hype..

10kZvDOM76r36i8yLPJaCg.text: I probably came here at the wrong time, I was hanging around the strip at 2 am and we got hungry and spotted this place.  Worst customer service ever, they treated everyone with contempt.  It seems like either they don't get paid enough or something else is going on.  Besides the service being bad, the gaucho sandwich just tastes like something is missing because when you bite into it the Tri tip is so dry and it needs some kind of sauce or tomato to lubricate it.

X2p4RUqKt3LZF0SPo6eg1A.text: Not as good as the one in LA. I got the fairfax with avocado, and while the egg was very soft and delicious, it wasn't hot! It was lukewarm. It's also pretty pricey for what it is. Line wasn't too long though I waited about 5-8 minutes for my sandwich. Pretty flavorful, but I was disappointed that it was just lukewarm.

EMOk50BWoTTeF3iwDpo1YA.text: Worst place in Vegas they ran out of the best sandwich on the menu. If you want to drink water, instead of coffee or juice, you have to buy it or go to the next store and buy it cheaper. Also, there is no place to sit. You have to go to the bar next to them to find a seat. Those guys are not prepared for Vegas. More like Ehhslut.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A long line to find out they ran out of most of the sandwiches on the menu.

R_EHmcMEyb09TDjpc76PbQ.text: Im a frequent slut in L.A. So I was super excited for it to finally be coming to Vegas. Its located on the second floor of the Cosmo next to holstiens ans across of marquee. The line is super long and wraps around so be ready to wait a while.   I typically order the slut which comes in a glass jar with a potato puree, chives n salt. $10 with 3 slices of baguettes. My slut must have been made by a mad person cuz it was hella salty!!! (see what I did there Lol)  The reason I gave 3 stars is cuz they really need to hire a cleaner. People are nasty and I get tourists are lazy and on vaca but its a mess. They have counter seating and its all sticky n gross. There's jars all over cuz people don't know if they should return it or throw it away so they just leave em.

yNaEBB7MMqwb5IR-Le7Ucg.text: The line waiting to order just just an indication of how yummy this place is - had plenty of selections to make all 3 of us happy for a quick informal breakfast.  The only drawback is the price - very high but very yummy.

9ruOFtOhsfc64xDrAGSPbA.text: That egg in the cup deal was life changing. The other sandwiches were all very good. Yes, I did order one of everything to take back to the room for the family. Got there at like 6:30am so there was no wait. Makes me want to go to Vegas right now actually.

ccWR2OMcZD9pkcif0hNMgA.text: Place is right of the elevator from parking spot and it is what it's called Eggslut. Delicious but yet messy be ready to get messy don't get so confident with the sandwich. My wife child and myself got all egged up messy. But definitely a good breakfast sandwich it could be amazing or fabulous except for the messy part.

4IMohx-p8k2DislMW4O7cg.text: The slut is a cool, unique item.  It's probably a 4/5 in taste, but it's not a big portion.   Overall, I'm glad I tried it, but it's not a place I'll be rushing back to.

t7Yz7i-mVpLRN2U6LeQvdw.text: I went there on a Saturday morning after a long night out on the strip since I desperately needed some breakfast food. Pretty good place, but expensive for what it is.  Let's start with accessibility. Easy to get there, and easy parking at the Cosmopolitan. It's on the strip, so take 15 and you're there!  I ordered the Gaucho sandwich. For $14, you basically get a rather small but pretty good sandwich. The menu there is unfortunately rather limited with only a very few other options. There are basically only 8 main options in total which is very little...  I would say that this is a pretty good place, but I would advise you to go only if you are already in the area and really craving some rather simple breakfast sandwiches. Feel free to message me for any additional details that you may need!

UOMqxvMVhhEMlVcdCinV8g.text: waited half an hour around noon, and register lady said they've been out of sluts for an hour already. decided to order a sandwich instead. while i was waiting for my order, a worker with thick black rimmed glasses and maybe shoulder length hair told me that a batch of sluts came out. he replaced the sandwich with a slut, no problem. i didn't get his name, but what an unsung hero of the day. give him a promotion.

4BC_UIy8MS-2u7mNs1GuLQ.text: We ordered a slut, a gaucho sandwich, and a fairfax (with turkey sausage)  Were they delicious?  Yea.  Everything was really good. Were they so delicious that the memory of eating them will stay with me for the rest of my years?  No. Was it worth waiting in what I think was ~30-40m line?  No. Was it worth the price (about $40 for those 3 items)?  No. Would I come back here again?  If the line is short and I'm in the area, sure.  I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here though.

mJz9UkA4t9KfwhYdTN7nHQ.text: This place is definitely a must! I'm a HUGE fan of eggs and just breakfast in general. They ran out of eggsluts when I was there last time but the sandwiches were just as delicious. The "slut" is a soft boiled egg in a cute mini jar with toast served on the side.  It was very busy during the breakfast time, but we went a little bit after lunch hour and it was not busy at all. There won't be many places to sit if it's busy as the seating is limited. The line moves very fast though even when it is busy.   It is located in the Cosmopolitan Hotel!

JNFFcDAK2aDhN7HwQAYrtQ.text: Amazing sandwiches. Be sure to be ready for a wait. The line is deceiving as it wraps behind the store.

g25rdXhigvpSMSxGQbK_EA.text: Wishing a there was an Eggslut on the east coast! I got the Fairfax Sandwich! Probably the tastiest breakfast sandwich I've ever had. The line wrapped around the hallway and the waited for about 15-20 minutes, which just shows how how popular they are! The food is cooked to order, which I appreciate.

Ih1Kj9Wp-jaqJag_6cfSPw.text: Line for lunch was about 30 minutes. If you just get the sandwhich, you won't be full, but I think the slut is overrated. It's basically an egg on mashed potatoes and toasted bread. The fair fax sandwhich was pretty good as it the egg sandwhich was a bit spicy, I enjoyed that. Tried the orange juice, it was fine and and not worth it IMO.

n6CoszRw9UKUXkehlto2Cg.text: Im not fan or runny eggs so I skipped out on their namesake dish. I heard it was sinfully delicious though. The mix of mashed potatoes, runny egg goodness and lots of salty and savory flavors. I went with the Fairfax. It was a step above your normal egg sandwich. It had scrambled eggs and chives with cheddar cheese and caramelized onions. It packed a nice kick with sriracha mayo which was the best part for me. The line for this one gets pretty long but it's an order and pick up sort of spot so it goes by fast.

F2YLKyKouarsZSIsTZKkHQ.text: Truthfully, it is very overrated. I think it gets the attention that it does due to its name. Our egg sandwiches had one, room temp egg on a bun way too large with ketchup on it. Which they don't tell you about. It was definitely not worth all the hype of waiting in line for 45 minutes. If you're looking for a good, warm egg sandwich on a homemade biscuit we found District in Cosmo's food hall to be outstanding!!!

C7aTG0Cm4iMu17sLzf5yeA.text: Hands down this is definitely the spot!   This egg sandwich is king to all other egg sandwiches with its cooked just right eggs and its fluffy brioche bun. I ordered the egg,bacon and cheese sounds simple but with great flavor. The egg was cage free cooked medium, flavorful bacon and cheddar. I would have loved to try the others and might go back before we head out of town.   Price wise you can't beat it. My sandwich was around $8 bucks and when you compare prices this is still the cheaper better option.

pjF57-wD80Aa1MdgrU5tIQ.text: This place has the longest line every time I visit Vegas.  I ordered the sausage, egg and cheese and hubby ordered the Fairfax.  The best thing about this sandwich is the brioche bun and the eggs of course. It is not easy making the perfect egg but I think they have mastered it. I will definitely be back to order the Slut.

H7nQsTXMV0PMu-EBGhV-_Q.text: So good. So good. So good!  I am so glad this opened up in the cosmopolitan. I was super bummed for missing out on this in LA on my last trip. Thank the lord I did not have to wait on a huge line. We hit up the joint around noon and was able to get a seat at the table while waiting for our food. The food came out pretty quick.  One strange/awkward thing I wanted to mention. After placing my order and paying the receipt gives an option for tip. Now this place is not a sit down and get served restaurant. It's a self service place... you pay then pick-up your food when they call your name. I always feel so awkward then these type of places ask for  tip because you're put in the spot. To be honest you don't need to give any kind of extra tip here.  The menu is semi-limited in options but still have great choices. I tried the sausage, egg & cheese sandwich (substituted the mustard aioli for the chipotle ketchup). The sandwich was huge and delicious. It kind of reminded me of a McDonald breakfast sausage sandwich but way bigger and a bit healthier. Haha no shade.  The sandwiches here are comparable to the egg shop in NYC. We did not get a drink because the juice and coffee were $5. So cray.  I highly recommend the sandwiches for breakfast or lunch. So delicious and will fill you up.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sluts 4 lyfe

qDggLKSpCgITytmzyccRuA.text: Came here for a quick breakfast, and decided to have had the bacon cheeseburger. The bun itself was delicious and the rest of the burger was pretty good. However I don't know if it was worth the hype or the 20 mins that we had to wait just to order. Would definitely try a more breakfasty item next time.

HHdoJO8WD1RRR3uWhZ2cZw.text: This place is a gem! It's a tiny spot with not enough seating and the line is always ridiculous, BUT totally worth it! The brioche buns are toasted perfectly and is the perfect match for the farm fresh egg and bacon or sage sausage. Highly recommend this place and don't let the line detour you!

ZEVzpg61st0UTfR4Pf8zew.text: The line is always long but it moves fast.  They are playing early 00s hip hop songs which I love.  I had the bacon, egg, and cheese and it hit the spot.  MY husband had the cheeseburger   I would go back but after I try other places in Vegas.

TBOLi_R2GW-JiHkwDhwqFA.text: Food was ok and interesting.... kinda pricey tho.... eggslut, cheeseburger and a small cold brew coffee was abt $30. I would recommend to get only the eggslut cuz it's different and pretty yummies..... :)

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggslut - pretty yummy
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger - okie....

LpE3E1wNhGDGafV8QrpUuQ.text: Really disappointed in their customer service. Contacted them a month ago and i was ignored.its been almost two months and no one has contacted me

ejRmmjxJ-IMmeo_M8n5iVw.text: This was probably the best egg sandwich I have ever had. When I first read the menu nothing popped out to me based on its description. So I went with an option that I was hesitant would fit my taste since I was feeling adventurous. Surprisingly,  a bunch of things I normally dont care for were cooked into the egg and made for a delicious meal. I will definitely be a repeat customer

HVIrTDCYcuzBJqeK9jnKGQ.text: Good, quality ingredients. Food is good. Line was long but moved quickly. I didn't give 5 stars because it's Very expensive for what you get. Sandwich prices weren't too bad but $5 for a tiny cup of OJ is ridiculous. We spent $37 on breakfast for 2. Worth a try but definitely couldn't make it a habit for the price.

agTZvrX4-CXW_AiPLPZjRw.text: Eggslut was great where in Las Vegas staying at the Cosmopolitan and had a chance to eat there two days in a row two sandwiches were wonderful

VX06ZVKDPwv5GqmwwZVXGQ.text: I'm really torn on what kind of rating to give this place because the sandwich was amazing. I'm from NJ, home of taylor ham egg and cheese (or pork roll, whatever) so I'm very thick-skulled when it comes to breakfast sandwiches and I was convinced no one outside of the state knew how to make a good one. Until now. It was bomb.   The line didn't look that long initially but ended up taking ~25 mins. There is also very limited seating and every single napkin dispenser in the restaurant was empty. The sandwiches are messy so this was extremely inconvenient. People were running wild with hands covered in egg yolk. Not cute or sanitary.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gpB1KLM3Yrd34okrIQmq2Q.text: I'm visiting Vegas, from NYC and I guess burgers are all right (not a big fan). I've tried a variety of burgers before and LET ME TELL YOU, the Gaucho sandwich was deliciously yummy. The taste of the Wagyu with everything else was just so perfect. This burger also felt healthy and the bun didn't feel too dense, the food did not have a heavy greasy feeling. Everything felt so balanced and amazing. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5Ld178OLMDdBGfYV9slH5w.text: Eggslut is on 2nd Floor inside the Cosmopolitan casino & Hotel. It wasn't bad but it was very over priced for just egg added items. My Auntie who is over 80 years old refused to eat there because the menu was so simple, however the prices were outrageous.  Bacon, Egg & Cheese Sandwich $8.75. Or Sausage, Egg Cheese Sandwich $8.75.  Slut Specialty...eggs on top of homemade potatoes in a glass jar with chives served on banquet $10.75 Hubby ordered the cheeseburger with bacon. Angus beef, sunny side up egg, carmalized onions, pickles, cheddar cheese & dijonnaise on a brioche Bun. $10.75. Add bacon was $3.00 for 3pcs I had the same without the bread and bacon. I had to ask for cutlery and napkins. They don't give you anything that you don't ask for. It was packed. The line was out and around the corner when we got in it. It stayed that way the entire time we were there. It's really booming.  Try it but it's not a cheap it. You're in Vegas tho,

M8Y5SqR1htKgJwL2l6KcDw.text: Perfect spot for breakfast. Came in and there was a long line but it flowed quickly. The bacon,egg and cheese & the fairfax hit the spot. Make sure you get the biscuits too

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Domaine Chandon &amp; some oj

8uxQC7pBcF7Raic-Y1FqaQ.text: The fairfax sandwich here is the absolute bomb! I like it both with the sausage and the bacon, best when warm and fresh out of the kitchen! The egg just melts in your mouth and is super fluffy and soft. I'm drooling as I'm typing this D:  We tried the slut as well, which was interesting... kinda like a mashed potato with a soft boiled egg? It wasn't bad, but probably not something I'd order again.

8QLXwhy1eo5Lqelnlv-HfA.text: First off, don't be discouraged by the line, it moves fast and you can still be in and out under an hour so you don't get charged for parking! Cosmo has done a great job bringing in great dining options representative of spots across the country- Eggslut (from LA) is known for their breakfast sandwiches and oozy eggs. Expect a 10-20 minute line to place your order, but good comes out pretty quick and you'll down it fast.  I've come by a handful of times and the consistency is a bit off. I know they're busy and working fast, but the eggs have been cooked over hard on half of my sandwiches, which is a bummer. On the bright side, despite the high prices (just under $10 with tax), they're not stingy with toppings- my bacon, egg, and cheese is usually stuffed with several strips of bacon, and friends have reported the same results when adding ($3) it to the Fairfax.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_8zhxyXqIMulGgM6qjHQMg.text: I waited in line for 45 minutes and I'd do it again! The fairfax with bacon was CRAAZZYY GOOD ! The fluffiest eggs I've ever had, perfectly crisped bun, perfectly seasoned. Literally perfection. YUUUMMMMM!

uLVT0dZdcbi8YTR8M5HakA.text: I just had to stop here before leaving.  So much hype around it.  Very cool name and inside a great hotel. (Cosmopolitan). Thankfully the line and wait wasn't long at all.    I had the bacon egg and cheese sandwich.  It was good but not something I must revisit for.  I do want to go back to try the other menu items.    Unfortunately I tried to eat this in the car and totally forgot about the egg yolk.  Silly me ended up with a big stain on my pants.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside the Cosmo hotel, 2nd floor
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg yolk stain from the sandwich

QyseRkAnWbG0As9WaypLKg.text: Man I love me some eggslut! I've been a fan of this place since the first location opened in down Los Angeles and they deliver that same taste to Las Vegas. What's been awesome to see that Eggslut has grown to multiple Los Angeles locations, Vegas and also in Beruit! Great to see them grow cause it's delicious  So when I knew I can get an eggslut sandwich, I was so excited. One of my go too's is the Turkey sausage egg and cheese. Something about that Turkey sausage that I absolutely love! I heard they make the sausage in house and they blend it with some great flavors that I can really explain, but trust me it's some of the best sausage I've ever had. Man of the sandwichs are on a brioche bun which is always soft and compliments the breakfast sandwich. They add a nice mayo with mustard seed to give a little pop to the sandwich with a perfectly cooked egg that oozes out yoke everywhere. Add the nice cheddar cheese to it, perfection!!   I didn't order it this time around but they also have biscuits that you can substitute the brioche bun. Now those biscuits take the sandwich to a whole new level. Nice flaky biscuit that tastes just like they are fresh baked. Love them!!   Anytime you want a delicious breakfast sandwich while at the Cosmopolitan, Eggslut is the place to to. Soooooo good!!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage, egg and cheese. Perfection on a bun!

-o3VjUtQ4o8ZkrZhYHqUsQ.text: The best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. The eggs are cooked perfectly (soft scrambled for the Fairfax) and all the other fundamentals are done so well.  Really trendy venue with a great staff!  Just make sure to find a good time to come otherwise you'll be waiting in a huge line that wraps around the corner!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fairfax with bacon
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kitchen

q6VwC04PpZvZ_D8PTlP87w.text: This place was on the list to try because of the name, obviously.  I do have to say, even though the food was good, you could find somewhere less expensive and get 10x fuller. I think they are very overpriced for what you get.  I think I spent like $15 for a basic egg and sausage sandwich and a small sized orange juice.  We came in the morning pretty early around 7:30 am and there was a short line. I know the line can get pretty long at peak breakfast hour.  Overall, pretty good but go somewhere else where you get your money's worth!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Adn_W1i6cq1Qj2Fv9w-H0g.text: Sort of hard to rate this fairly. Is it OMG this was worth the 15 minute line good? Kinda. Maybe.   I got the Fairfax with bacon and it certainly had that creamy egg thing going well. Brioche bun with not heavy. And bacon was crispy without being overlooked. No oscar Meyer cheap stuff here.   And yet $5 for a small coffee that was meh? And a line that grows?  It's certainly a fun breakfast. Great music but it's a small shop. Limited seating.   Worth the hype? Again, sorta. Maybe.

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fairfax. With bacon.
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The kitchen
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

oiynxdxf6y4G-1Q453nAnw.text: YUMMM! I saw this place and then saw how long the line gets so I rushed over right after they opened (about 7:15a) to surprisingly only see about 4 people in line. I ordered The Slut (when in Vegas, amiright?) which was even more decadent than it looked! So much flavor for such a little jar- but that's where it lacks a star. It was so little. It was nice as a light snack, but not what I would call breakfast. I chased it with their cold brew, which was perfect black! Just sweet enough but not bitter- that I also wish came in more than a small (Starbucks at my hotel wasn't cutting it for me). There is plenty of seating all around and the menu is pretty small (you'd hope the line would go fast), but it was delicious. Next time I would probably order the same and add a sandwich (what? I get hangry), but I definitely see why this place gets around...har har

UPRt2ggXffqax5lzJtZzcg.text: I was very egg-cited to try Egg Slut and even waited to go right after they opened at midnight! It's Las Vegas!!! No time for sleep with all these great eats! Hours of operation vary like 7AM to 7PM or midnight to 7PM so check before you go!   This is the 'slut' - a coddled egg over potato puree garnished with chives and gray salt. It was served with slices of toasted baguette. I ordered this to go and wasn't how they were going to package my coddled egg but it came in a cute jar that you get to keep!  The potato puree was so smooth and tasty as you mix in the yolk of that coddled egg. All you need to do is dip your toast in all that deliciousness! So simple but so perfect! It was pricey for $10.50 but it was a great late night snack. Other people I'm sure agree because usually there's a line all around the corner to the bathroom! You can peer right into the kitchen and see them make everything fresh. The coddled eggs are all sitting in their sous vide bath ready to go!   Pro foodie tip:  If you are waiting you have time to drop by Milk Bar grab a few cookies and crack pie to go!   I would come back and try other menu items. My brothers tried their sausage egg and cheese sandwich for $8.50 and was pretty happy with that! Go at opening aka midnight to avoid those long lines!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#39;Slut&#39; - a coddled egg over potato purée garnished with chives and gray salt served with slices of toasted baguette @shelbyfoodadventure

H1gQRugqvO5WH1eB4Xx5Xg.text: You know it's good when there is a big ol line!!  Once we stood in that line they were was no freaking way turning back or changing our minds. I had to try this egg bacon sandwich. Ooohhh and it was so worth it in the end. The egg was so runny with one bite and the bacon was so crispy  and the soft buttered bun damn those buns. Mouth watery just thinking about it. The Perfect snack after drinking or a snack before going out for drinking in Vegas.   I'll be back Eggslut!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o1sYu4ArUES7R__Cd3mmCA.text: First off, so worth the hype, when there's no line. I came here twice. First time, there was no line and walked up to the register. Cashier was really nice and gave me awesome recommendations! But the second time I went, it was really crowded and the line went around the restroom corridor. That time, it was not worth the wait.   But either way, I will still visit again next time I go back to Vegas.

rO0U-GGEl7ObN3rgKD_qXg.text: There always seems to be a line at Eggslut but I wouldn't be too discouraged. Sure, the line may wrap around the corner but it moves pretty quickly since there are only a handful of options on the menu. With a simple menu, it makes ordering a breeze.  I've been to the LA location at Grand Central Market and this location isn't the same. But I mean, who doesn't love all-day breakfast? It's funny how the sandwiches are so simple, yet people are willing to pay $9 for a bacon, egg and cheese sandwich. And I'm one of those people!   The bacon, egg and cheese sandwich is a staple at Eggslut and I believe the warm brioche bun makes the sandwich what it is. The bacon strips are crispy but I wish the cheese was melted in the sandwich a little better. The cheese was barely melted and felt like an afterthought. The yolk on my egg was not runny at all, which leads me to believe the egg was overcooked.   I've had better experiences at Eggslut. Not sure if it was the chef that day but my sandwich wasn't what I remembered!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, Egg &amp; Cheese

iY-KGjhrgnBQUMIn-q3-SA.text: I hate waiting for food, but Eggslut may have changed my mind. Trekked here on a weekend morning and was faced with the infamous line wrapped around the corner and stretching down the hall. Yelp assured me the line moves quickly, and I'm pretty singleminded, so I got in line while my boyfriend ran off to get a coffee.   The line was long, but did indeed move pretty fast - we got to the front in about 30-40 minutes. I ordered the Fairfax sandwich with bacon, the slut, and biscuit with honey butter. The biscuit can be skipped, but the sandwich and slut were some of the best things I had in Vegas that weekend.   So yum!

k32uDa3Dqz81i5dJNUtAPg.text: Soooo good. We were a little concerned about the line, we were staying in the Cosmopolitan and took the elevator down to grab a sandwich and the line was wrapped around the corner and down the hallway. Good news, it moved much faster than expected!   Sandwiches were delicious. Crispy bacon, perfectly cooked egg, melted cheese, toasted bun and just enough brightness from the chipotle ketchup to keep it from being too rich.  Hoping to get downstairs early tomorrow to try the homemade biscuits, which are only available while they last, and the namesake slut is on my menu for tomorrow!

photos.caption: Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Couldn&#39;t wait... Bacon, egg and cheese on brioche

P0y826leZjt0zpP1fymUGg.text: Breakfast eggy heaven! I have been to the LA location before so when I heard there was a location in Vegas, I knew exactly where I wanted to go for breakfast. They are known for their egg sandwiches. Why? Their eggs with a hint of chive are just so fluffy!  I got the Fairfax breakfast sandwich and the Slut. The Fairfax breakfast sandwich was worth the long line. I added bacon to mine and it was an adventure for my taste buds. The eggs and chives, sweet caramelized onions, sriracha mayo and bacon was an awesome start o my day.  The Slut tasted unexpected, its simply egg on top of mashed potatoes. Although it looks fancy, I didn't see it as anything special. The break that you dip into the jar is crispy. Meh, wouldn't get this again. tasted like baby-food because the mashed potatoes were pureed.  Over all a good experience because the line was efficient and that egg sandwich was out of this world.  Solid 4 start from me!

N7VriVpq-5hvlM3amKtIlw.text: The soft scrambled eggs in the Fairfax sandwich were amazing!! The line looks daunting but the food comes out quickly once you order. My sister got the Gaucho which was also delicious. The steak was so tender. Would definitely go again on my next trip back to Vegas.

-Kv3HZypHp1uiDveCFaABQ.text: Really good..::price very reasonable.   Long long lines   Hope they bring one to Orange County

oq3dc7ns9_4nXOrjIPc0BQ.text: When dining at Eggslut, you MUST order the Fairfax sandwich!  We fell in love with Eggslut at the original location in Los Angeles, and are happy to say we weren't disappointed with their Vegas location.  We came early on a Saturday morning, and waited about 15 minutes in line.  The Fairfax was just as amazing as I remembered in LA- soft scrambled eggs with chives, cheddar cheese, caramelized onions, and sriracha mayo within a brioche bun.  SO freaking good (so good that I've been Youtubing copy cat recipes all day)!  The eggs are so buttery and smooth, and I love how the sweetness of the onion balances with the sriracha mayo.  My brother recently visited Vegas, and said the Fairfax sandwich was the best meal he had while on his trip.  Order the Fairfax- you won't regret it!

xPIGbXNn9JMV0trqT5YqAQ.text: We walked over a mile to get here and waited in line for 30 minutes but it was all worth it!  The egg sandwich was delicious-gooey without being gross and the coffee was hot and strong. It's an egg sandwich-granted very delicious but def something which could be replicated. I think the name makes it a novelty and if you're in Vegas def add it to the list!

Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angelic singing
Photo of Eggslut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eOUBpytW0FB0GTkedtfmVg.text: We came on Saturday morning around 10am and there was a long line. Fortunately, it moved quickly. Service was friendly and pretty efficient. We got a bacon egg and cheese sandwich (without the chipotle ketchup), biscuit and The Slut. Bacon was thick, crisp and well-seasoned. The biscuit was crisp on the outside and dense and soft on the inside. It went well with the honey butter. The Slut was delicious and stayed hot the entire time while eating. I ran over to District (the donut place) to get coffee while waiting in line. They definitely have their egg dishes perfected. There was plenty of seating outside of the store in the mall to eat our meal, plus there was some counter seating at the store.
